title: A second visit and as good as the first
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Pleasure
review: This was our second visit to New York and we stayed in the Washington Square again.  Not much has changed since 2012, including the fake plants on the landings...  The room was small and for the price, not great. When you are paying north of £300 per night, I think that one could expect something more comfortable than a single hard chair in the room. But, the rooms are small, so there's not much room to put anything more comfortable.  The windows have been replaced since our last visit, so the room was quieter.  The included breakfast was just fine for us although paid for extras are available.  The staff in the bar in the evening were excellent.  If we were ever to visit New York again, we would probably try somewhere else, despite the excellent location of the WSH.

title: I Always Return to the Washington Square
review: Come to NY once a year and always stay at WSH. It is convenient, friendly and a great value. I love this place and would not stay anywhere else. Close to subways and buses, great central Village location in the midst of wonderful restaurants and performing arts venues.

title: Lovely hotel great location
review: I'm a frequent traveler, and I rarely stay at the same hotel twice.  I make an exception for the Washington Square Hotel.  It is the best value in NYC (especially for family trips or girls trips - they have several double-room options).  The location is excellent - very charming West Village neighborhood close to shops, bars, restaurants, and the subway.  The rooms are not ultra-luxurious, but they are clean, the beds are comfortable, and they have newly upgraded marble bathrooms.  And, the hotel serves a complimentary continental breakfast.  We always receive a warm welcome by the doorman and the front desk staff.  Couldn't be happier with this hotel.

title: Historic and classy old school hotel in the heart of Greenwich Village
review: Stayed here 5 nights in October.  Its a lovely hotel.  Believe all the nice things said about it here. I would have given a 5 star but for the size of the room which is very small.  Everything else was really great. From the friendliness of all the staff to the great breakfast included in the price. You just wont beat the Washington for value and location.

title: Wonderful hotel
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Great hotel in great location!
review: We spent six nights at this hotel and loved it. The location is perfect and the hotel is an old, beautiful Art Deco hotel. Ronnie, the Concierge, was a wonderful source of information and was always friendly and smiling. We would choose this hotel again.

title: Great Location
review: Very happy with our hotel. Location is great, very close to Washington Square Park and subway station. Decor is very appealing, hotel room was very clean with a nice sized bathroom. Good shower with good water pressure. Temp controls are perfect. Price was very reasonable for New York. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Great Hotel in Greenwich Village
review: Hotel is perfectly situated in the Village, in walking distance to many restaurants, a Chase bank, a CVS and of course the park.  Housekeeping is on point with cleanliness and plenty of towels.  Front desk was friendly and accommodating to store my luggage until my room was available as well as for a slightly later check out in the end.  Continental breakfast is standard bread products, yogurt and fruit.  The hotel gym is packed, perhaps a bit too much, with equipment, so there isn't much space to do free weights or floor work/yoga though I was the only using it each time so an area was found. The actual rooms vary greatly in quality, though.  First room I checked into was quite small.  There were two beds that took up the whole space; don't even know how two people could…

title: Great location!
review: We stayed at the Washington Square Hotel for a few days that went by way too quickly.  The location is excellent and the attention to details that has been clearly put into the hotel is evident. The staff are friendly and helpful and make you feel most welcome.    We hope to return soon.

title: A gem in the Village
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Washington Square Hotel review
review: This is an historic little hotel strategically situated on the west end of Washington Square Park in Greenwich Village, within easy walking distance of at least 100 excellent restaurants, numerous clubs and bars and in the heart of the NYU campus (if NYU could be said to have a campus!) It is somewhat less expensive than some of the other hotels in the neighborhood. It is small, but well maintained and nicely decorated - great old movie star pictures in every room...nice restaurant and lounge. The staff is friendly and helpful. The history of the place, which dates back to the beginning of the last century, is fascinating, to say nothing of the previous guest list - the Stones, Dylan, Baez, the list goes on. The story goes that Nora Jones was "discovered" doing karaoke in the…

title: Love the WSH
review: Hello jmcclure46,  Thank you for sharing your experience with us.  It greatly warms us to know your time with us was memorable.  We look forward to your future visits, and hope to see you soon!

title: Great location, executive rooms are huge
review: This hotel is in a great location in the West Village. Very comfortable room and bathroom, with coffee maker in the room. Very friendly and helpful staff. Nice bar (not much atmosphere in the bar, but good bartender); very good breakfast. Reasonably priced.

title: Location,location,location!
review: Hello RVATraveler2014,  Thank you for the perfect review!  We look forward to your future visits.

title: Great location, pleasant stay
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. title: I love staying at this hotel
review: Smallish room as expected in NYC. No view on this stay, but on a previous stay I had a room with a view. Very pleasant and helpful staff. Very interesting neighborhood, easy walk to west and east village, SOHO etc.

title: Family wedding
review: Hello Graham,  Thank you for sharing your experience with us.  We hope to see you again soon, and will definitely try to assign one of our deluxe rooms for you!

title: Quaint NYC Hotel!
review: The Washington square hotel does not pretend to be anything other than what it is - well located in a cool neighbourhood, comfortable-but not pretentious, friendly and value for money in expensive New York. If that is what you are after, then definitely stay here.

title: A little Haven
review: Hello Jane,  Thank you for the perfect review!  We look forward to your next visit.

title: Location location
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. title: Loved It!
review: We stayed at the WSH for 6 nights in September. Hotel was great, stayed in room 702. Great room, spacious with good views of Washington Square Park. Staff were amazing, couldn’t do enough to help. The hotel is situated close to McDougall st and the heart of Greenwich Village meaning restaurants cafes bars and entertainment were right at our doorstep. I would definitely stay at the WSH again. Highly recommend

title: Perfect location, comfortable, friendly and good value
review: Hello 516kerryk,  Thank you for the perfect review!  We sincerely appreciate you sharing your experience with all of your friends, and hope to see you again soon!

title: My favorite hotel in Manhattan!
review: Stayed here for seven nights arriving 4 September 2019. Our first trip to USA. We were in room 217 which gave us a view of the street and Washington Square Park. We had booked a deluxe as we'd noted other room grades might mean no view. Staff were delightful during our stay. Enjoyed the breakfast, included in room price, and paid extra on one morning for a cooked option. Staff overcharged us, but rectified and apologised immediately this was pointed out. Bed very comfortable. Good bathroom with lots of hot water for the tub. In room safe a nice bonus. On our last night we were awajkened by a phonecall at 05:00 AM asking if we still wanted our airport transfer? We'd actually booked this for 4:30 PM, so receptionist apologised. Then got an alarm call at 06:00 AM which we hadn't…

title: No Window
review: Hello Andrew,  We greatly appreciate your feedback regarding your stay with us.  We are thrilled to know that you had a great experience despite some bumps, which we sincerely apologize for.  We look forward to your next visit, and promise to take great care to prevent any lapses in service.

title: 5th Time at WSH
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. title: Not a good experience
review: Consistently an excellent experience. Very friendly and helpful staff, from the front desk to those keeping the coffee warm and (particularly good) orange juice fresh..and the muffins stocked! Room was pleasant - and when made reservation requested a room with light and while that's usually my request, not all hotels grant it.  Highly recommend.

title: The perfect hotel in the perfect location
review: Hello Elizabeth,  Thank you for the perfect review!  We appreciate you sharing your feedback, and letting us know we have been consistent.  We look forward to your next stay!

title: Consistently Good
review: I travel to this part of New York very often for work and have been trying a few new hotel options. For this 2 night visit I opted for the Washington Square Hotel based on some good reviews, proximity to the office/local amenities and I like supporting independents rather than chains.  Sadly it has made me want to go back to the soulless but consistent chain down the road which actually works out cheaper.  Arrival Simple check in, they took my card info but never presented costs or paperwork just a slip for me to sign. It was ready on time. The door/security staff were super friendly and a saving grace for the whole stay to be honest. I felt safe as a lone female traveller knowing there was someone downstairs.  Main Room The room on the 8th floor was fairly small but I didn’t…

title: Greatest Location Old fashioned style and decoration
review: A beautiful restored Art Deco hotel across from the square.  They maintained all the great features when modernizing and it is truly a unique hotel.  The rooms are average size for New York and they are in process of updating all of them...ours was already done and was very nice.  Here is what makes it perfect...8 subways to catch within 2 blocks...some truly awesome restaurants including Michelin starred within 3 blocks...not the hustle and bustle of Chelsea or midtown etc...busy but calm....and the staff was great...all helpful and very pleasant.

title: Great Location for Pride Visit July 2019
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Our favorite place to stay in NYC
review: Washington Square Hotel was an excellent pick as it was within walking distance to a lot of the Pride activity locations, namely the Stonewall Inn!  There were many restaurants and bars nearby to choose from.  The hotel was clean and our room was immaculate and big by NYC standards although the bathroom was a bit outdated.  The airconditioner worked great and boy was it ever needed as the temp outside reached 99!  The only disappointment came in the hotel bar: they didn't have Baccardi Rum. We would definately stay there again!

title: Great location!
review: Hello  Zzzubzzzub,  Thank you for the great review!  We sincerely appreciate your feedback, and apologize if the bathroom decor marred your visit in any way.  We are still in the process of renovating, and expect to be completed soon.  We look forward to your next visit!

title: Excellent Value
review: This hotel just does everything right, from the friendly staff that greets you to the room amenities that are always kept restocked and the delicious complementary continental breakfast with your choice of self serve or being served in their restaurant.  The ice machines are convenient in the lobby.  The place is kept spotless.  Nice to have a widely acclaimed restaurant and bar (North Square) - a long time favorite of our friends who live in Greenwich Village.  They accommodated our room request.  Just a warm, friendly place that “gets it” in all aspects of hospitality and comfort.  The central location to all things New York and proximity to beautiful Washington Square Park is a particular bonus.  We will be back!

title: Great spot for a short stay in Greenwich Village
review: Hello Jim,  We sincerely appreciate the rave review!  We promise to be consistent, and provide another first rate stay when you return.  We look forward to your next visit!

title: Convenient for NYU
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. title: The best
review: Booked this hotel as I wanted to be closer to NYU.   Rooms are fairly small which is expected for NYC.   There isn't much natural light though as there is a wall next to the window, and rooms look outdated but kept nice and clean.   However, the location is superb if you have things to do in NYU and you'll be spoiled for choices of restaurants - casual to fine dining.   Soho is also at walkable distance.   The doormen were great, especially Ronnie.   Front desk staff could use some customer service lessons from doormen/concierge.   The included breakfast isn't much (cereal or muffins or fruit & yogurt) but again there are so many options close by that it wasn't a big deal.  Didn't use subway during this visit but there's a subway station closeby.

title: Great staff
review: This was my third stay here and it is always enjoyable. The location is the best close to nice neighborhoods and lot’s of nice restaurants. The staff is friendly and the service really good. The rooms are not really big but clean and nice with comfortable beds. Breakfast is included wich is unusual for NYC. Will definitly stay here again and again and again.

title: Excellent hotel and location
review: Hello Mia,  Thank you for choosing us again!  We greatly appreciate the perfect review, and we are so happy to know we have consistently provided excellent, and friendly service.  We look forward to your next visit!

title: Great location, helpful staff, good experience
review: We stayed here overnight celebrating a girls weekend. Lovely hotel, nice staff, clean, comfortable and amazing location right next to the park. They very kindly stored our bags a few hours before our check-in and a few hours after we had to check out, which was a big load off. Would stay again!

title: Excellent
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. title: Excellent Hotel
review: Loved this hotel , small but comfortable in a great location in Greenwich village close to great bars , restaurants , cafes and music venues ... ask Ronnie the concierge for more information he knows his stuff ! Guys in the bar do great cocktails and the breakfast was great with plenty to choose from , price isn’t to bad considering the location of this hotel. Will definitely return!!

title: Charming Oasis in Greenwich Village
review: Hello Paul,  Thank you for the stellar review!  We promise to make your next stay just as amazing!

title: Fantastic hotel
review: Really lovely hotel in an excellent location.  Good clean rooms and lovely staff who are knowledgeable and willing to answer any queries.  Breakfast was included in our stay and was good food well presented.  A cooked breakfast could also be purchased.  Situated near the subway for up or downtown travel.

title: Glad we found this boutique hotel!
review: Hello PW123456PW,  Thank you for the perfect review!  We sincerely appreciate your feedback, and look forward to your next visit!

title: Amazing hotel!
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. title: Friendly Stay
review: We stayed here for my husbands 50th birthday trip to see a Yankee vs Red Sox game.  I cant say enough good things about this hotel.  I emailed in advance and found a bottle of champagne waiting for us in our room! Room was very clean and spacious for NY.  We were on 3rd floor facing Waverly St in a deluxe Queen room.  People watching was great from the room.  Staff was wonderful, especially Ronnie the doorman, and he overnight doorman. Wish I had gotten his name.  Location is perfect. Quiet street, but just steps away from everything you need.  Subway, coffee shops, CVS, and restaurants, restaurants and more restaurants.  This was our first trip to NYC, but wont be our last.  We will definitely always stay here when we come to NYC.

title: Excellent place to stay
review: Hello Laura,  Thank you for the amazing review!  We were so happy to be a part of such an important celebration, and we appreciate you sharing your experience with us.  We look forward to seeing you again soon!

title: Great stay
review: Clean hotel with friendly staff. Breakfast items were always well stocked. Clean rooms and common areas. Rooms are a bit small, but it is NYC. Close to public transportation options, restaurants nearby, and Washington Square Park is just up the block.

title: Great Hotel
review: Hello Susan,  Thank you for the perfect review!  We look forward to your next visit!

title: Great Spot...feels very safe.
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Great place to stay
review: Last  week I spent a few nights at this hotel with my 14-year-old granddaughter celebrating our birthdays. We were only in the lobby for five minutes and when we said it was our birthdays, Ron, who works there came out with baseball caps for us and gave us a birthday gift! Who does that? Then Tatiana, at the desk was more than friendly and helped us check in. The room was nice and tidy and the continental breakfast was more than I expected. The neighborhood feel safe, and there a re many restaurants in the area. We happened to hit a heat wave so we did not do a lot of walking in the area but there are loads of jazz bars and the park is beautiful. I highly recommend this place to stay and it certainly will give you a feel of old New York with it’s art deco look.

title: In Greenwich District
review: Loved staying here.  Great place to stay.  Loved the shower.  Rooms are small but the decor and atmosphere here makes up for it.  Great bagels and scones.  We stayed here six nights in Room 322.  Loved visiting with the pretty lady from Poland.  She was really nice and helpful.  Highly recommend it.  My husband and I stayed here 6 nights.  We would stay here again.

title: My gf and i stayed here for a week
review: Located on the edge on Washington Square and over summer period many activities take place.Easy walking to subway or Bus  The rooms clean and tidy set out. Dinning room for all meals located on the lower ground floor.  Continental breakfast include in tariff. Choice of food for dinner was pleasing and enjoyable. You can be assured that the meals offered are excellent when a fair proportion of the guests dinning are locals living around the Hotel The only problem I en counted was from the 3 nights we stay was a lack of laundry service or in house facilities. You had to take your own laundry to a laundry company located in streets near by. My final comment is care needs to be taken if walking at night due to homeless on the streets

title: We loved it!
review: My gf and i stayed here for a week and it was Fantastic. Clean, beautiful room, nice continental breakfast, a few feet from the park, fast and reliable wifi. What more could anyone ask? The staff was friendly and kind, and responded to requests swiftly. Highly recommend and would stay here again, no question

title: great NYC location
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Well-priced and great location
review: This hotel is right off of Washington Square Park.  The location is great--lots to walk to and the subway is nearby to get you everywhere.  The hotel is clean and the staff very friendly and always helpful.  This is a typical older building so rooms and bath are on the small side, but it had everything we needed and was very clean. Free continental breakfast and its location was great.

title: Glad we gave the WSH another chance
review: Hotel rooms in NYC are tiny and expensive, but not here. I also prepaid to save even more. Breakfast is included although there's not much on offer, and the coffee is not the best. But overall I must recommend this hotel. The staff are friendly and it's located close to quite a few subway stations - we never had any issues getting to where we needed to go. Washington Square Park, which is right across the street, is also a nice place to sit and relax.  There were times when I was awoken by traffic or people outside but that is normal for a city this big. Unfortunately, the hugely inconsiderate idiot in the room above us who threw their shoes on the floor every night (or dropped large boulders) is not excused from this.  When you are spending time in Manhattan, you must stay at…

title: Perfect Hotel near NYU
review: In January I wrote a review about the WSH which was very critical, with good reason.  Sonny, the manager, contacted me directly and invited my husband and I to come back.  We visited NYC in June and stayed at the WSH, which is in Greenwich Village convenient to our activities.  Our room and bathroom were very comfortable and a good size for NYC.  All of the staff were super attentive and pleasant.  The complimentary continental breakfast was really all we needed to start the day. Also, we ate dinner one night at the attached North Square restaurant and the food was very good.  At first the ambience appears dated but you get the feel that all the locals eating there like it just like it is. We would definitely stay at the WSH again. Thanks to Sonny and staff.

title: Stay at Washington Square Hotel
review: It’s not the ritz but don’t have any complaints about this hotel. Friendly staff. Great Location only 2 blocks from NYU. Great restaurants within walking distance and the subway is only one block away.

title: Excellent lodging and location
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Excellent stay!
review: The Washington Square Hotel is conveniently located in Greenwich Village. All pictures of the hotel show window AC’s in every room, which is not the case. (They really need an updated photo!) Our room, sort of overlooking Washington Square Park, did have a non functioning window AC unit. The hotel is on central AC which cools beautifully. Our room was NY small, but very functional for the little time that were in it.  The beds and pillows were extremely comfortable! The staff was very friendly and helpful. I would definitely book this hotel if I go back to NYC.

title: Excellent hotel with a great vibe
review: We loved the personalized treatment from the doorman and front desk; the free breakfast (till 11:00am!); and the coffee in the room. Great location - near the West 4th & Christopher Street subway stations. Nice to be there in pride month steps from the Stonewall Inn. Will definitely be back.

title: Favorite NYC Hotel!
review: Stumbled upon this fantastic little hotel and was not disappointed. Staff welcomes you like family from the minute you come through the doors.  Loved the history of the place and the tile art throughout. The rooms are clean and comfortable. We will definitely return.

title: Just too cramped in a room that was supposed to be for 4 people
review: We booked 2 rooms for ourselves and sons, 16 and 22, while visiting NYU.  Location cannot be beat, and the decor is so cool.  Bathroom was awesome with a huge shower, and the king bed was great.   Mr. Ronnie is incredible and made us feel right at home.  Love the old style of it and the quirky halls connecting the 3 buildings.  Will definitely stay here again.

title: Miss
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Best hotel I've stayed at in NYC!
review: I cannot say enough good things about this place, of course you have the location, in the heart of Greenwich Village, with a view of Washington Square, Park, surrounded by NYU, and a walk to the Highline etc. etc. etc., but the Decour and old time small-town quaint historical feel; I don’t think you can get in any other hotel in the city… The hotel staff went above and beyond my expectations, the rooms are very posh with an antique Decour, yet all the modern amenities ... there isn’t anything that the staff would not do to make you have a more pleasant stay. I really feel like I took a trip through time, I cannot say enough good things about this hotel, please make it a point to stay here during  your next visit to New York City!

title: Excellent boutique hotel
review: We have been searching many years for the perfect nyc hotel that we can stay at each time we go and not have to search and read reviews anymore. I'm glad to say this hotel is it. Perfectly located in neighborhoods and not tourism central, walkable and bikeable to everywhere, the citibike rack is a 10 second walk from the front door and THE cleanest hotel I have probably ever stayed in.   There wasn't carpet in our room but rather wood laminate floors which were squeaky clean, I loved not having to think about nasty carpet under my feet.  There was plenty of floor space and area for keeping suitcases in our room (#310) did not feel cramped as other city hotel rooms I've stayed in.  Extremely quiet, no sirens or car horns, no hallway or elevator noise, no noise of any kind.…

title: Excellent little hotel, perfect location
review: We've stayed here twice before and really like this hotel. It's a bit quirky and very different to most NYC hotels which tend to be quite anonymous. The decor is very Art Deco and the rooms very comfortable, if not terribly spacious. The "free" breakfast is very good though basic. Excellent coffee, fresh fruit and OJ, bagels, croissants, etc. The staff were all great and very eager to please.   The main plus point for us is the location right in the heart of Greenwich Village, our favourite part of Manhattan. The buzz of 6/7 Avenues is a stones throw away and the subway (A train) literally at the end of the block. You may not get the excitement of mid-town but this is by far the most characterful part of town.

title: nyc
review: Hello,  Thank you for the excellent review!  We greatly appreciate your feedback, as well as your continued patronage.  The Village is definitely unique in the best of ways.  We sincerely look forward to your future visits!

title: Great location for NYU business
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. title: Comfortable hotel in a great location
review: The Washington Square Hotel rooms are large but they are clean, nicely appointed, and comfy.  The location can't be beat if you are doing anything at NYU, and it's close to the subway stop and the PATH station if you are coming in from New Jersey/EWR

title: Great little hotel in great location
review: Hello Jim,  Thank you for the excellent review!  We appreciate your feedback, and look forward to improving your experience next time.  We hope to see you again soon!

title: Delightful hotel
review: The hotel is perfectly located--right across from Wash Sq Park, in the fabulous Greenwich Village. The room was about the same size as all other regular rooms in NYC, It was nicely appointed, comfortable bed, spic and span, and nice bathroom. It was also very, very quiet. And it was a great price! Couldn't ask for more.

title: Great, great, great!
review: I stayed in a twin room with my teenage son. The room was a little small with beds very close together and had no real place to store bags or clothes but the room was nice and clean.   Location is terrific. The hotel is across the street from Washington Square Park and the area so so lively and close to lots of restaurants. It was a short walk to the nearest subway station (W 4th) and lots of lines went through.  The hotel also provided a great free breakfast and we went to the lounge a couple of times - there was a huge selection of wines to choose from.  My only complaint was having to always ask for the coffee pods to be replaced as you only got 1 or 2 each day.

title: Beautiful Hotel, great location
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Best of New York
review: Service was second to none, the staff were very helpful and friendly (hello Ronnie!). The room was slightly smaller than we expected but the decor, location and amenities more than made up for this.The food and service in the restaurant were also very good. Added bonus a minutes walk to bars, restaurants and music venues in a nice relaxed area...whats not to like?

title: Great Boutique Hotel in fantastic neighbourhood
review: Hello Nathan,  Thank you for the wonderful review!  We sincerely appreciate all of your helpful tips, and we are happy to know you enjoyed your stay with us.  We look forward to your next visit!

title: Small and quiet
review: Washington Square Hotel is a beautiful hotel in the heart of the village.  The facility is beautiful and unique.  The staff are second to none.  I have stayed twice and it does not disappoint.  It is easy to walk to Soho from the hotel.  The subway is on the same block.

title: Old charm and excellent location
review: Hello Tzehe,  Thank you for the perfect review!  We appreciate your feedback regarding your experience with the facilities, as well as our staff.  We hope to see you again soon!

title: Wonderful old place in a perfect location with a fantastic staff
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. title: Anniversary
review: We couldn’t have been happier with our stay at the Washington Square hotel. We have stayed Midtown and uptown many times but we will never do that again now that we have stayed at the Washington Square hotel. It is charming and old world. The staff is incredibly helpful with everything and super friendly. The location is amazing right at Washington Square, Park and one can work anywhere from there. Plus it’s also very handy to subway stations that will take you anywhere in New York.

title: Charming, perfect location!
review: Hello,  Thank you for the great review!  We sincerely appreciate you sharing your experience with us, and it warms us to know that you plan on returning.  We look forward to your next visit, and promise to provide the same level of service you experienced the first time.  We hope to see you soon!

title: It was like staying with family/friends.
review: Love this Hotel! Nice staff, good breakfast and the best location. This was the second stay here and we’ll be back❤️ The only problem was trying to get in contact with the Hotel. We tried to Mail in different ways but didn’t succeed. Now I hope we’ve got the correct contact information.

title: Art Deco Meets The Village
review: Hello,  Thank you for the great review!  We apologize for any troubles communicating with us.  You can always reach us at frontdesk@wshotel.com!  We look forward to your future visits!

title: Neighbourhood Hotel
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Another Great Stay
review: Hotel is in an excellent location just off Washington Square. The hotel itself is in an old building and the lifts are as you would expect in a building of this age. The rooms are small (again as expected) but clean and the beds were comfortable. The shower was good even if you had to wait a while for the hot water to come through. The staff were friendly and very helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Avoid room 331 and the front desk
review: I decided to come back after my first visit for two reasons. The first time was impeccable, and I wanted to see if it was a fluke. It was not. Sure the rooms aren’t exactly sprawling, but who comes to New York to lay down? The staff are still great, and most importantly genuine. I am recommending it to all my friends and colleagues.

title: Charming, friendly 'old world' hotel in Greenwich Village
review: The bellmen and cleaning staff were absolutely lovely, great location, and was pleasantly surprised by the breakfast.   Unfortunately, the room and the front desk staff left much to be desired. After getting off of an 8 hour, international flight, we came to the hotel. It was too early to check in, but in my experience, it's sometimes possible to check-in a bit early. Since it was nearly 3:00, I asked the front desk and the gentleman met me with such disbelief that you would have thought I asked to kill his cat. We left and came back after 4 and asked to check in and was met with "I'll see if the room is ready".   The next morning we were awoken to the smell of gas (propane?). The window was open, so we closed it and left for the day. The same thing happened that evening, so we…

title: Good location but found lacking
review: I highly recommend this hotel. It is well located close to all the north south subway lines. There are many restaurants and of course Washington Square Park nearby. I have been staying in this hotel since 1993 and look forward to staying there later this year;.  I stayed for a week in a deluxe king with a lovely view of the Park. The breakfasts are good and I had lunch and dinner in the downstairs restaurant a number of times. The lunch and dinners were excellent and staff were very friendly. A continental breakfast is included with your nightly rate.  I like that the hotel is more than 100 years ago so the building had it charms.  The staff were also friendly and welcoming every time I was in the lobby.

title: NYU College Visit
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Fantastic location / Nice rooms / Friendly Staff
review: Great hotel, perfect location and reasonably priced!  The rooms are small but super clean and beds are comfortable.  The staff is very friendly and accommodating.  The free breakfast was a great perk.  Highly recommend!

title: Very enjoyable stay!
review: Located adjacent to Washington Square this is a smaller boutique type hotel on the edge of Greenwich Village.  Very quiet area, lots of retaurants nearby as well as the 4th St subway station (go anywhere in the city from here).  Small rooms (not a big surprise for NYC), clean, with all the basic amenities.  The elevator is small and slow, so if you're the impatient type get a room on the 2nd or 3rd floor and just take the stairs.  The price and location make this hotel a standout.  No hesitation about staying here again.

title: Good deal for NYC
review: The hotel is located in a great location next to Washington Square.  The hotel is on the small side and with seven floors.  It is quiet and comfortable and has a very nice small restaurant called North Square.  We enjoyed a very nice and updated room that was spacious and had and outstanding, well lit bathroom.  It was the best hotel experience all around that we have had in NYC.  The staff were friendly and helpful.

title: Staff, Facilities and Location Were All Wonderful — Above and Beyond
review: We were very happy with our stay. Small room, as expected for New York and not new, but clean, well located and with very friendly staff. Even the complimentary continental breakfast was better than I am used to seeing in NYC. I heard other customers commenting that this was a great deal too. The doormen were all extremely friendly and one everyday would bring a gift to my kid.

title: Charming Hotel in Perfect Location
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Charming hotel in the Village
review: This was my third or fourth stay at the Washington Square.  I've never been disappointed by this quaint yet modern place.  The staff is very friendly and helpful, the room is clean and well appointed.  And, for this last visit, the new shower system was just amazing.  Highly recommended for the perfect combination of value, location and charm.

title: My favorite place to stay in NYC
review: Hello KB,  Thank you for your continued loyalty!  We greatly appreciate your feedback (those new showers are awesome!), and we look forward to your future visits.  We hope to see you soon!

title: great location very charming
review: Hotel is old world but clean, charming, and updated bathroom/shower. Excellent location in the Village right off Washington Square Park, and only a block from a commonly needed subway station. The staff are very friendly and helpful with their information. There’s a great restaurant for dinner and a nice lounge for happy hour. If the rates don’t go up too much (New York is exorbitant) we would definitely stay there again. We had a wonderful week.

title: Great location and lovely historic hotel
review: Hello Richard,  Thank you for the great review!  We are so happy to know you enjoyed your stay, and a had a wonderful experience with us.  We hope to see you again soon!

title: Wonderful service
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. title: Best hotel in the best neighborhood in NYC
review: This hotel is quaint and located perfectly next to Washington Square Park.  The staff was exceptional!  The doorman even gave my friends son a NY hat!  They even stored our luggage very professionally until it was time to check in.

title: Excellent location
review: Hello Marie,  Thank you for the wonderful review!  We sincerely appreciate the positive feedback, and look forward to welcoming you back soon!

title: A bit dated but location can't be beat
review: Sure, this isn’t a luxury five star hotel, but it is a fabulous comfortable and clean hotel perfectly situated in one of NYCs best neighborhoods. The value can’t be beat, the staff is friendly and the free breakfast is a nice bonus. We stay there frequently and will do so again and again. Love the WSH!

title: Good location for NYU
review: Hello,  Thank you for your continued support, and for your commitment to stay with us!  We sincerely appreciate your loyalty, and we promise to provide the same level of service for every visit.  We hope to see you again soon!

title: Great find
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Good... maybe great!
review: My husband, teenage daughter and I stayed here during a recent visit to New York for some college tours. Greenwich village was such a calm respite from the rest of the city, and this hotel was centrally located to great restaurants, bodegas, the subway...we felt right at home. The rooms are a decent size, we had one room for the three of us with two double beds and were quite comfortable for the three nights.

title: Lovely Extended Stay
review: VALUE FOR MONEY & LOCATION...Very good location - depends if one likes Greenwich village, NYU area... 20-30 mins to most areas... and a GREAT Washington Sq nearby. Quaint well maintained typical old & fresh feeling together. Front desk is welcoming..overnight parking good... plenty of famous NYC street food ...

title: really enjoyable stay
review: Washington Square Hotel is a hidden gem!  We originally booked for 3 nights and were upgraded to the King Executive room.  Probably the biggest room we have ever stayed in while visiting NYC.   Its not very often that you get a double sink and a view of Washington Square Park at such a value.   The beds were very comfy and we had no problem falling asleep each night.  No noise from the street below.   Our room was actually right next to the elevator, and never had a problem with noise.   Every single staff member we came into contact with was extremely nice.  Check In and out was quick and dropping our bags off was easy.   We were always greeted by at least 3 employees whenever we walked in or out.   Breakfast is included and they have an express breakfast on the lobby level, or…

title: Room and hotel were perfect!
review: I stayed there for four nights this month. The service was perfect, always smiling and accommodating. The room was also nice with a comfy bed and a large enough bathroom. There was also a continental breakfast offered in the morning (with small but enough choice). The location is superb to visit Greenwich village, Noho, West and East village, TriBeCa and even downtown manhattan (if you like walking a bit, like I do). I was there for a business trip at NYU, which is located less than 10 minutes by walking from this nice hotel. The hotel is basically touching Washington square park where a lot of activities happen during the day. The cost was also reasonable for New York (about $165 a night), but it may be due to the room booking from a US federal agency.  Definitely a place I…

title: Winter weekend in the Village
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Best kept secret
review: Everything about our stay was delightful. Because of the time of year, we were lucky enough to be able to check in early; when we went out to wander the Village some more after check-out, they graciously, and safely, secured our bags for the day. Dinner in their restaurant was delicious, and we met the most interesting locals, who know the neighborhood, yet choose to eat here! Our room was small, but clean, comfortable, and quiet. 'To go' materials were provided at the Continental Breakfast so we could take our breakfast either across the street to the park, or up to our room. When we returned after a day exploring, fresh baked chocolate chip cookies and hot tea and coffee were waiting - delightful! We will be back!

title: Nice spot but did not get what I was promised
review: Hello Christine,  Thank you for the amazing review!  We are so happy to know you enjoyed your stay, and found your room to be comfortable.  We sincerely appreciate your commitment to return, and look forward to seeing you again soon!

title: Another Excellent Stay
review: I do not want to give too glowing a review for fear of giving away my chances of getting a room next time I travel to NYC. Incrdeibly friendly staff. Good sized room (for NYC). comfortable bed, great amenities and a delicious breakfast experience.

title: Small but superb room near NYU
review: I booked a Penthouse King room for 2 nights.  The website says the room has "sweeping views of the park and city."  It did not.  There was a glimpse of the park from the corner of one window and a partial view of the Empire State Building from another.  Nothing sweeping about it.   The room itself was a decent size, as was the bathroom.  To get to it we had to meander down some narrow hallways.    Staff seemed friendly.  Continental breakfast (included) was fine - fruit, yogurt, granola, bagels and pastries in a small room off the lobby.  The location is fantastic.  All the great cultural, shopping, dining and drinking experiences of Greenwich Village are within walking distance and the subway stop is just a block away.

title: Love this hotel
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Friendly staff Amazing location near NYU
review: This is my second visit to the Washington Square hotel. The accommodations and the staff are wonderful. Most of the rooms have been newly updated and are always very clean. The staff goes above and beyond to accommodate their guest. There is a restaurant in the  hotel and they offer a continental breakfast. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the West Village area  as it is close to the subway and has many fine  restaurants within walking distance.

title: B.Fazio
review: This hotel has an incredibly warm and inviting staff.  The location is excellent just a block away from the A C E line on the subway for easy access to Times Square uptown and World Trade Center area downtown.   Just a block from NYU.   Only down side with our room was no exterior windows -- so no natural light, but was not a deal breaker for me.   Nice free continental breakfast -- and you could also go to the restaurant and have anything on the continental menu for free while your companion eats from the menu if they want something heartier.   Also, a great diner right up the street near the subway --The Waverly Restaurant.

title: Wonderful long weekend in Greenwich Village
review: Hello Liz,  We sincerely appreciate the wonderful review!  We are pleased to know that our staff made your experience memorable.  We hope to see you again soon!

title: I Should Keep This A Secret
review: Washington Square Hotel is not only in one of the best locations in the city, the accommodations so clean and price is great! The staff are so helpful friendly and professional! My husband and I stay every time we visit NYC. Looking forward to our next trip! 👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼❤️

title: Another Warm and Welcoming Stay
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Outstanding experience from check in to check out
review: I have stayed at The Washington Square Hotel before and would absolutely stay there again.  The location is superb for transport links and comedy clubs, music venues and great restaurants.   The warmth of the welcome from all members of staff - who really seem to care that you will enjoy your stay - is outstanding.  My room had a recently refurbished shower room which was excellent.

title: The Washington Square Hotel literally left us out in the cold!!!
review: I have stayed at this hotel multiple times in the past 6 years and I have consistently experienced outstanding service from check in to check out.  I’ve also noticed familiar faces over the years which tells me they care for their staff as well.  Warm and welcoming environment!  Highly recommend!

title: STAY HERE if you can!!
review: This is a story of outrageous treatment and poor follow-up customer service. I booked this hotel because it is a short walk to the venue where we were to attend a very important family event the night of Dec 8th.  Our flight was delayed coming in but we arrived at the hotel in time to get to our room, freshen up, change our clothes and take the short walk to the event.  It was pretty cold so we were glad to get inside to check-in.  I gave our name to the desk receptionist and he immediately told us that unfortunately the room being held for us had a plumping problem.  I thought he was going to tell us they were working on it or that he was going to upgrade us to another type room.  But no!!!  He told us he had booked us a room at the Chelsea Holiday Inn and would pay for a cab…

title: NYE stay
review: On behalf of Washington Square Hotel, I want to extend my sincerest apologies for the negative experience  and the way it was handled. I understand your frustration and disappointment on such a great day for your son. I regret not getting back to you as promised and that  added more to your disappointment .We pride ourselves on giving our 100% every day to ensure that our customers’ needs are being met. I know that we have let you down, and for that we are very sorry. We do our best to train each of our representatives on how to properly handle our customers’ issues, including how to escalate problems that they are unable to assist with. Your concern was not handled properly, and we are going to take steps to ensure that this situation does not repeat itself  Thank you very much for accepting our offer to return to our hotel. We look forward to serving you.  Have a wonderful 2019.

title: Lovely stay
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Definitely made the right choice
review: Stayed for 4 nights the week before Christmas and had a lovely stay. Clean and comfortable and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Get to know Ronnie for us the very soul of the hotel. If you want to know anything about Manhattan he's the man to ask. Will definitely be back to New York and I will stay here. Close amenities. Supermarket, pharmacy and most importantly the subway by far the best way to get around Manhattan. Love the history of this hotel also. You won't be disappointed

title: If you want a decent hotel in Greenwich Village
review: Hello,  Thank you for the wonderful feedback!  We appreciate your review, and thank you for your commitment to stay with us again.    We look forward to seeing you soon!

title: New York Jazz Trip
review: After several years of wanting to make a Christmastime trip to New York City, I finally got to do that in early December. I chose the Washington Square based on reviews I read here, and am glad I did. As other reviewers pointed out, the rooms are on the smaller side, owing to the fact that it is an older building, but they are totally comfortable. I slept great all three nights. Except for the occasional distant siren, it was very quiet. The bathroom was spotless and had everything I needed. The folks at the front desk were friendly and helpful. They assisted me with printing out my boarding pass for my return flight, and there was no hassle checking my bag for the final day when had time to go out and explore some more before heading to the airport.  Aside from all of that, it…

title: Art Deco hotel
review: Hello,  Thank you for sharing your experience with us.  We sincerely appreciate the wonderful review!  We are so pleased to hear you enjoyed your stay with us, and we look forward to your next visit!

title: Best little secret
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. title: Great location
review: Enjoyed our stay again this year at Washington Square Hotel.  It's a great little hotel in the best part of town.  There is a part of me that doesn't want to let this secret out, but I want others to have a positive experience in my favorite city.  The location was great for us . . . we were going to a show at the Blue Note.  There are plenty of restaurants nearby, the room was clean, the beds were comfortable, breakfast in the restaurant downstairs was convenient and good, staff was professional and very accommodating.  No complaints here!  Thank you WSH for a wonderful weekend!

title: Great Place; Nearly a 5 star
review: We spent 5 nights at the Washington square hotel,  Pro’s - The staff were superb and the hotel location is perfect for exploring both uptown and downtown Manhattan with a subway station 200 yards from the hotel, breakfast was ok with the usual croissants, toast cereal, fruit juice, coffee etc, Ronnie the doorman will give you all the information you need and they will allow you to leave your cases at the hotel on your leaving day, they also arranged transport back to the airport for us at $60 Con’s - The rooms and particularly the corridors need updating - artex walls from the seventies and chipped paintwork on the corridors, some mould on the window sills, and rust on the shower curtain, not much but enough to make you think they are in need of decorating or replacing  Having…

title: Nice place to stay; great staff!!
review: Hello Sheffield,  We sincerely appreciate you sharing your experience with us!  We apologize there were some minor issues with your accommodations, but we are very glad to hear they did not mar your time with us too much.  We value your feedback, and promise to make the necessary improvements.  We hope to see you again!

title: Washington Square Hotel
review: This is an older hotel with possibly the narrowest hallways I've ever seen in a hotel. Nonetheless, it is very well cared for, the rooms are small, but nice,the staff is helpful and depending on your plans, the location is good with excellent subway access, My deal included a Continental breakfast.  By New York standards, the price was reasonable.I'd stay there again.Parking is available nearby, half a block away at around $24 per 24 hours which seems fairly standard.

title: Don't stay here
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Amazing boutique hotel
review: I have stayed at this hotel a handful of times.  It has been close to things I needed, but it has delivered everything else poorly.  It is quaint, but that also means SMALL beds, among other items.   It has separate HVAC controllers in the room, but they don't actually function.  It has air or heat pushed by the hotel.  This last week, I stayed in two rooms, and both were extremely hot.  Also, the windows don't lock.  We were placed on the first floor the first night, and requested to move for our security. The hotel moved us to the third floor, but the window didn't lock in that room either. Lastly, USE the SAFE every time you leave the room. In my haste one morning, I left earring out on the desk, only to have them stolen.

title: Lovely Hotel
review: Dear Peggy k,  I regret the loss of your earrings during your stay.  We took our time to diligently investigate and interrogate the room lock before contacting you.  Regretfully, the earrings were  not turned into our Lost and Found Department.  I have personally checked our Lost and Found log and the security locker. We have also interviewed the room attendant who serviced your room and she has consistently maintained that she did not see a pair of earrings.  I sincerely regret this occurrence and have exhausted all the resources we have to locating the missing item. We will continue to search and investigate on our side; meanwhile you may file a police report. With a report number we can initiate an insurance claim.

title: Clean, Spartan, Friendly
review: We have just returned from a 6 night stay in this beautiful hotel in the heart of the trendy Greenwich village neighbourhood.   The lobby is welcoming and staff very friendly, especially the concierge who goes out of his way to chat and make local recommendations.   Nothing is too much trouble for the staff. Rooms are small but spotless, as are the lobby and breakfast/afternoon tea room.    Staying here, apart from lovely complimentary continental breakfast, loctation and great staff, there is a tranquillity here you don't get mid and uptown but a 2 minute walk to subway and 5 minutes in you are in the heart of Times Square etc.   We loved the peace of this area, but still surrounded by fabulous bars and restaurants.  Would absolutely stay here again and highly recommend.

title: Excellent hotel, restaurant and location!
review: This historic boutique hotel in an incredible location is all anyone really needs in NYC. Sure, there are more sumptuous spots, but Washington Square Hotel has charm, warmth, and all of the essentials and then some - such as a very nice included continental breakfast. Our room was small (like most NYC rooms) yet exceedingly well appointed and comfortable. I liked that our room had a bathtub; many renovated and new hotels are foregoing tubs - but there's nothing like a good soak after hiking miles and miles through Manhattan's streets. We were thoroughly charmed by this lovely hotel and its friendly staff and will return. Loved the holiday twinkle-lit bedecked front entrance and Christmas tree in the lobby.

title: Is this a joke ? What a nightmare.
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Nice place to stay.
review: From what we start ? Let’s start from the room. This place has old furniture and very old room.  Inside the room it was still dirty from the guest before in fact i found coffee residues  in the drawer under the coffee machine Room very basic and dark inside.  It’s unbelievable that they charge more than 200$ for this room. Completely disappoint.  The staff wasn’t helpful at all.  Breakfast supppose to be included instead I had to pay 15$  In the bathroom there is rust in the shower.  Completely disappointed.  My suggestion is don’t waste your money in this place. For the same price, even cheaper, you can find way better than this horrible place

title: All Round Lovely!
review: Very clean, very friendly staff, always available to assist in any way. Good location. Good restaurant   on premises. Breakfast was enough to start the day.  Very quiet. We have stayed at this hotel several times and have never been dissapointed.   .

title: Another great stay at WSH!
review: Hello Renata,  Thank you for continuing to stay with us over the years!  Your patronage is greatly appreciated, and we are glad to know that you have enjoyed, and experienced a consistent level of service throughout your stays.  We look forward to your next visit!

title: Excellent Hotel in beautiful location
review: WSH had great service even before I arrived in NYC. The front desk was super helpful and gave me great tips on how to get around NYC. Continental breakfast was great and the room was lovely and quaint. The location was perfectly easy to access via subway or bus. The hotel overlooks Washington square park which is great plus the street totally comes alive over the weekend with all kinds of pop-up shops which I totally did not expect but loved. I definitely recommend!

title: Great location but room was not so great.
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. title: Washington Square Hotel
review: Firstly, this hotel is in such a great location. Very central and close to a subway.  The hotel itself is lovely and well presented. The gentlemen on the doors were very very welcoming. Check in was easy, but the young lady who checked us in did not look happy. She didn't smile or make us feel welcome. Our room was on the 2nd floor. It was OK in size, clean and comfortable. The bathroom was also clean and stocked with all essentials.  The downside, the only window looked out to a brick wall which meant the room was in complete darkness 24 hrs a day. It may not seem like a big deal, but as an international traveler staying for a full week, it makes you very disorientated as you can never tell what time of day it is and your body clock is confused.  Overall, a great hotel in a…

title: Cozy Gem in the Village
review: Hello,   We sincerely appreciate your feedback, and apologize you were unhappy with your room.  We offer several different room types, designed for different wants/needs.  While superior rooms do not have views, they offer unparalleled quiet in a city that is active at all hours of the day.  Our deluxe rooms offer unobstructed views, and with that the possibility of street noise.  If you are ever unhappy with the room type you reserve, we will always try our best to accommodate your preference, usually the same day.

title: NYC BOUTIQUE HOTEL AT IT'S BEST
review: We stay at the Washington Square Hotel every time we come to New York City because it is adjacent to NYU where my daughter is a freshman student. The unfortunate thing is the hotel property does not offer any substantial student our family discount so it can get quite expensive staying there! That being said, the location still can’t be beat as it is across the street from the NYU and adjacent to Washington Square Park and Arch. The waitstaff is very attentive with the doorman opening the door and greeting each guest upon arrival and departure. A daily breakfast is served in the downstairs restaurant area, while a ‘grab and go’ version is available off the hotel lobby on the main floor. The hotel also has a nice happy hour with reasonably priced items - including $1 oysters -…

title: Wonderful
review: I was in NYC to visit my son who lives in the Village. The Washington Square Hotel was the perfect spot overlooking the park and near many intimate restaurants. The room was very comfortable and clean with a remodeled bathroom. The complimentary breakfast was easy to access and just enough to start my day. Friendly staff too! Highly recommend!

title: Great place to stay
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. title: AMAZING!
review: Fantastic location in the village, good rooms, tasty breakfasts and friendly staff, there is not much more that you can ask for at the price!  We loved our stay here and can’t wait to return as soon as we can.

title: Best Hotel in NYC!
review: Hello Julius,  Thank you for the perfect review!  We are so happy you loved your stay, and have committed to stay with us again.  We look forward to your next visit!

title: Great Hotel!!!
review: I genuinely don’t think I would stay anywhere else in NYC... the whole experience has been amazing from start to finish.   The staff are incredible... each and every one has been happy, chatty, interested and just lovely! oh, and extremely knowledgable and helpful; pointing us in the right direction to make the most of our time, as well as making local suggestions and reservations on our behalf.   The hotel is in an incredible location right next to Washington Square, yet it’s so quiet! The hotel and room were spotlessly clean, and the bedding and towels were just lush!   Coffee and tea for the room restocked every day and the express breakfast was just fab; had something for everyone (yoghurt, fruit pots, bagels, toast, and pastries) and was always well stocked. The coffee was…

title: Best hotel in best location
review: Hello Rachael,  We are incredibly happy you enjoyed your time with us, and had an amazing experience. We strive to provide the highest level of service for all of our guests, and we thank you for sharing your feedback with us.  Thank you for the fantastic review! We hope to see you again soon!

title: Excellent location, quiet at night, good service, everything as presented
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. title: Beautiful hotel is great location in NYC.
review: The hotel is located in the NW corner of Washington Square Park, There are three stations for several major subway lines nearby. Broadway is a stone cast away. Around the hotel there are e.g. lots of nice restaurants. It's a decent walk to Highline at Meatpacking District by the Hudson River, to SoHo, Union Square etc. The neighborhood of the hotel is characterized by the strong presence of NYU.   The hotel personnel was very attentive, polite and helpful. The rooms are rather modest and smallish, yet do their job well and the cleanliness was excellent. The beds were comfortable. The free WiFi was excellent. You do not travel to NYC to stay in your room, don't you?  The continental breakfast offered in the room price was very good and the service in the breakfast room was…

title: Excellent hotel in quiet central location
review: Hello Timo,  We sincerely appreciate you sharing your experience with us!  We are happy to know you enjoyed your stay, as well as the overall atmosphere.  Thank you for the great review, and we hope to see you again!

title: Wonderful stay
review: Room is quaint and functional, comfortable bed and complimentary breakfast a real treat to energize one for the sites of NYC.  Staff very friendly and helpful.  Added plus is an on site very good bar and an adjoining wonderful restaurant "North".  Would definitely stay here again if the opportunity to return to NY arises.  Highly recommend the neighborhood  While traffic in NYC is a nightmare, and you can actually walk faster than taxies or Uber, there is a close by subway which works great for long treks, along with buses.  Take the time to learn it, you will save much time, even if $$ is not an issue for you. Stay here, you won't regret it.

title: Very friendly staff
review: Hello,  Thank you for the great review!  We sincerely appreciate you sharing your experience with us, and we are thrilled you enjoyed your stay.  We hope to see you again soon!

title: Great location
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. title: Pleasantly surprised
review: We stayed five nights at the Washington Square Hotel. It's a great location just off Washington Square Park, close to 6th Avenue, the subway and the rest of Greenwich Village. It's an easy walk to Bleecker Street, The High Line and Chelsea Market. The staff were very helpful, especially the concierge. The rooms were fine - clean, small but perfectly-formed bathroom, safe, aircon, TV etc. The attached restaurant serves a good breakfast, and the dinner we had on the first night was nice too. There was also a free self-service coffee/water area available all day. Would recommend if you want to be in 'The Village' or near to NYU.

title: Good mid range hotel
review: Hello Bill,  Thank you for sharing your experience!  We are so happy you enjoyed your stay!  Thank you for the great review, and we hope to see you again soon.

title: Wonderful as always
review: Our first visit to NYC as a family flying from England staying in a Queen room and cot/crib for our 11month old son. The reviews were an accurate reflection of the accommodation and I was pleasantly surprised and overall happy.  The hotel is conveniently positioned in a nice neighbourhood close to a subway stop just one block away (2-3min walk). Local amenities are in close proximity to pick up the odd essentials. The Washington Square Park is an attractive and cultural/diverse place, and also has nice views of the World Trade Centre.  The rooms were clean and presentable. The interior is a little dated in appearance though has aged well giving off some character. The beds are comfy and there is very hot water on demand. The bedroom we stayed in overlooking the rear courtyard is…

title: A timeless experience of Village life.
review: Hello Dean,  Thank you for the amazing review!  We greatly appreciate the wonderful feedback, and all the fantastic suggestions and tips.  We look forward to helping you celebrate your birthday again!

title: Checks all the boxes
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. title: Nice hotel, good location
review: The WSH provides everything you expect from a hotel, and it even has bonuses: a historic connection to Bob Dylan and Joan Baez, art deco designs (by the owner's mother I think), a strategic location near great jazz venues and Public Theatre.

title: Cool but small
review: Hello Deanie,  Thank you for the great review!  We are so happy you enjoyed your stay, and a had a great experience.  We look forward to your next visit!

title: Wonderful stay: welcoming staff and excellent breakfast!
review: My wife and I spent four nights at the Washington Square Hotel.  During past trips to New York we have stayed near Times Square, but we decided to get away from the huge crowds in that area this time.  We were so happy with this hotel's location in the Greenwich Village area.  Washington Square park is just across the street.  A subway station is just around the corner, so you can get anywhere in the city quickly.  There are many nice cafes and small restaurants in the area within walking distance if you don't feel like taking the subway.  Everywhere in New York is busy, but this area is easier to get around in without the crush of people in the high tourist areas.    We stayed in the penthouse king, room 912.  Even though this is the most expensive room in the hotel it is very…

title: Warm, Friendly, Homely
review: Hello Jab,  Thank you for the wonderful review!  We sincerely appreciate you sharing your experience with us, and for all the great tips and suggestions.  We are incredibly happy you have already committed to stay with us again, and hope to see you soon!

title: Lovely, clean, and comfortable hotel in a great location
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born.
