title: So glad we stayed here!
review: I greatly enjoyed my stay at Washington Square Hotel and wish I could have stayed longer -- and that's not usually how I feel when I visit New York. The hotel was very clean and comfortable, the staff were so kind and helpful, and the location was perfect. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in the Greenwich Village area.

title: We loved it!
review: Hello Sarah,  Thank you for the great review!  We appreciate you sharing your experience with us, and for recommending us!  We hope to see you on your next visit, and look forward to providing another great stay.

title: Great hotel in a great part of NYC!!
review: WSH is the perfect location for this area of Manhattan. Subway access is easy but it really is nice to be able to walk most anywhere within a mile (Gramercy Tavern, Flatiron, Chelsea Market & Highline, Balthazar, and more). Our room (2 doubles, top floor) was spacious for NYC and the bathroom was roomy as well. Both were very clean and comfortable. The amenities were top quality and the complimentary continental breakfast in the North Restaurant was a great way to start the day. We felt very welcome from the beginning to the end of our visit.

title: What a great place
review: Hello Susie,  Thank you for sharing your feedback with us!  We are so pleased you had a wonderful experience.  We look forward to welcoming you once more, and hope to see you soon!

title: Small yet adequate.
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. title: Greta Garbo enjoyed here - so did I!
review: This hotel is in a fun location- right off Washington Square Park. The Park felt very safe as it’s busy with neighbors and NYU students all the time. Our room was modest in size but comfortable. We appreciate the Keurig coffee service, the lovely lavender & peppermint toiletries in the bathroom and the very comfortable bed. Our one complaint was that we came back to our room just before 5 pm and the room had not been made up. So we had to wait for 15 min in the lobby.

title: Quiet clean historical boutique hotel
review: Hello,  Thank you for sharing your experience with us!  We are truly sorry there was a delay getting back to your room, and for any inconvenience it caused.  We sincerely appreciate your feedback, and will definitely use it to improve where we must.  We hope to see you again, and look forward to delivering a smooth, memorable stay!

title: Ideal location good breakfast
review: Great location next to Greenwich Village. Lot of restaurants and easygoing, gay-friendly area nearby. Hotel was wonderful with nice breakfast! Room was quite small but stylish and cozy. Very friendly and helpful doormen with big smile :) You feel very welcomed here!

title: Great location with great employees!
review: Hello Sari,  We are so happy you enjoyed your stay with us!  We definitely want everyone to feel welcome, and appreciated.  Thank you for the excellent review, and we hope to see you again soon!

title: Fabulously Friendly
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. title: Friendly staff, very clean hotel
review: Just got back from our third stay at the Washington Square Hotel.  We live this little gem in the heart of Greenwich Village.  The staff absolutely make this hotel.  Look out for the wonderful Ronnie.  Warm, funny and an oracle on all things New York.  We can’t wait to return.

title: Great location but the hotel could be better!
review: I can't say enough about the friendly and helpful staff. The lobby staff especially so, even shared a favorite recipe with me. So patient and familiar. The basic rooms are very small, but very clean. As I used to travel for work I always check a room thoroughly, even under the mattress, and this room was immaculate. Immaculate. The complimentary included continental breakfast is very good. On the last day of our stay, we enjoyed some delicious fresh whole wheat Blueberry pancakes in the downstairs Cafe, at a very reasonable price. I would love to return.

title: Ok
review: Stayed a week at this hotel. The rooms are newly renovated and comfortable with good A/C and a large bathroom with good lighting. We were on the 8th floor and at the rear of the hotel and it was very quiet. The down side from the room restorations was that the mattresses on the beds were not replaced and in need of retirement. Consequently sleep quality was poor. We had 2 singles and the side that you enter the bed on was low and you could feel the tendency to roll to that side when sleeping. Secondly, I cannot comprehend how you can completely renovate a bathroom and reinstall the old make up mirror that is rusted from top to bottom on one side? The continental breakfast, we had read about and knew it was not elaborate was a disappointment. One morning we overheard an older…

title: Excellent Downtown location on Washington Square
review: Great location and a hotel with history. Asked for a room change when we arrived as, there was no extractor in the bathroom and we could smell damp . We were very disappointed . We were moved to another room on the same floor which was much better. If you book this hotel , please ask for a room which doesn't face onto a brick wall. It didn't really mattter to us as we were out all day, but it would be good to have more light in the room. Breakfast was very basic. The only hot thing was drinks and anything which could go in the toaster. The breakfast area was very small indeed. Not qeven sure why the milk was not kept on the hot drinks table.

title: Loved it!
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. title: Washington Square hotel is charming
review: Loved the location close to subway and Washington square park! Requested quiet rooms and got them on high floors and a special birthday surprise in both rooms,  Thankyou! Hotel has a wonderful history and we loved it but if you want modern spotless anonymity it’s not for you! Ronnie was awesome and so helpful and wonderful with our kids, always with a smile! We were directed to express breakfast and I enquirer about gluten free options for my son and was told just the blueberry muffins, I was disappointed as I had checked website menu and it had gf toast and cereal too! The breakfast guy could have mentioned we could go to the full restaurant downstairs and get more there. My 12 year old ate a lot of blueberry muffins and fruit and we bought our own bread to toast! Maybe the guy…

title: Good Value
review: Utterly charming beautifully renovated hotel in the heart of Greenwich Village. Fantastic staff. Warm greetings every time we walked into the lobby. Wonderful service. Lovely breakfast included. My favorite hotel in all of Manhattan.

title: Excellent Stay!
review: We paid nearly£1400 for 6 nights with Agodo and was expecting more than we got . We arrived and was given a room which was at the back of the hotel and not that clean. The brown carpets were depressing as hell and the room was fairly poor .We were massively disappointed so complained to reception who then changed our room for a better one. The room though was very dated and not that great when you consider the money spent but this is NewYork and we should of known that the usual standard we expect is probably north of three hundred dollars a night. The staff are good, the breakfast is a welcome bonus and we had some great food served by great staff. All receptionists were friendly , efficient and courteous . The door guys are very knowledgable and go out their way to help. The…

title: Honeymoon
review: Have just returned from a five night stay at The Washington Square Hotel. The staff here are really friendly and always happy to help. Ron on front of house is a great asset and his knowledge of the local area was excellent. What a lovely person. Cheers Ron. If you wish to experience the real culture of Greenwhich Village everything is on your door step, Jazz Clubs, music venues, cafes & bars. Subway near-by and easy to use.  The Hotel is part of this areas history and culture and we would love to go back there in the future.

title: Cute and Comfortable
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. title: 2nd visit. Disappointed.
review: This was our first trip to NYC. I always wanted to stay in Greenwich village area and this is the perfect spot. The area was away from the hectic noise of Times Square. The hotel was clean, the room was cold during hot summer days, and breakfast was included. We will book this place again!

title: Pleasant stay for Thanksgiving week-end
review: Hello V,  Thank you for the fantastic review!  We sincerely appreciate your commitment to stay with us again, and we look forward to delivering another great experience. We hope you visit soon!

title: nice staff, convenient location, small rooms
review: As much as I liked this hotel when I 1s visited it years ago, this time I was checked into another section of the hotel and it was so noisy.  room 229.  I can hear all the whereabout of the visitor above us, coming back at night late, walking around in his room, when he removed his shoes, and when he turns in his bed we could hear him... Our bed was cracking too!  In the middle of the night last night there was such a huge noise I thought it was the fire alarm and woke up my daughter, to realize it was only water from the flushed bathroom above, old pipes! People coming back late could be heard through doors.  The room is too small, It should be discounted.  Plus I believe we had access to more TV channels from Cancun Mexico than this hotel.  We had access to only a few…

title: Very pleasant stay
review: Great location and friendly, knowledgeable and helpful staff.  Several good late night snacking and entertainment places within walking distance.  I would recommend Washington Square Hotel.  Subways within an easy walk.

title: Great hotel!
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Pleasant stay
review: We stayed in a quad room for 6 nights - the room was small and a bit of a squash for 4 people, but it was perfectly clean and tidy.   The location is perfect, close to west 4th subway which will pretty much get you anywhere, and lots of cafes, bars and restaurants in close walking distance.   The staff were all really helpful and friendly- special shout out to our new friend Ronnie- he is an absolute LEGEND! Always made us feel so welcome and had lots of ideas for where to go and what to do.   This was my 7th visit to NYC  and I’d absolutely choose this hotel for my future visits.

title: I would give it 10 starts if I could!!!
review: We only stayed here one night before flying home.  Our room was clean, modern  and comfortable, although the corridors looked a bit tired and the breakfast was good enough to keep us full until we got on the plane. The hotel is well situated for excellent restaurants and the subway station. Staff were pleasant enough and we had no complaints.

title: Outstanding stay at Washington Square
review: Hello Paula,  We are so happy you enjoyed your night with us!  We greatly appreciate your feedback, and thank you for taking the time to share with us.  We hope to see you again!

title: Stale
review: I travel the world. I was super impressed with this hotel. A staple of older NYC apartment building brilliantly transformed into a wonderful hotel. Across from Washington Square Park. All of the restaurants, clubs, places to see, people watching all right there. Clean rooms! Perfect location. Clean and well kept bathrooms. Hotel staff ALWAYS had a smile and a welcome for us whatever time of the night or morning we returned or left. The doorman or greeter (sorry cannot remember his name - shame on me) made the stay even better if that was possible. You are not going to get a skyscraper view. You get an authentic NYC Greenwich Village view from windows (which they are updating). I know I lived there 40-60 years ago! Continental Breakfast every morning,

title: Unique  location
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. title: Fabulous position
review: We were visiting NYC for a wedding, and this was the hotel which the wedding party was staying. Location is everything and this hotel has it ,convenient to the wonderful Washington Square Park which you can visit to to relax and do some people watching. The hotel's location is also convenient to a  subway stop, so it's easy to grab a Subway and head out to tour NYC. This hotel is quiet ,but you do hear a good bit of Street noise from the windows however they are doing some upgrading of the windows to cut down on the street noise. the room in which we stayed was small but adequate the bathroom was wonderful the shower was excellent, the beds were comfortable as well. We stayed on the first floor and it was very convenient to the lobby. We have no complaints about the room. When…

title: very friendly and comfortable place to stay...
review: Hello Carl,  Thank you for the amazing review!  We sincerely appreciate you sharing your experience with us, and for all the wonderful feedback.  We hope you visit us again soon!

title: Great location, Relation price/quality is ok, but need improves!
review: Staff amazing. Breakfast lovely.  Clean and comfortable room.  Park beautiful across the road, which is rare in New York. Subway less than 150 meters.   Short walk to wonderful restaurants and shops.  Great atmosphere, very relaxing

title: Charming spot in a great neighborhood
review: Hello Simians,  Thank you for the perfect review!  We sincerely appreciate you sharing your experience with us, as well as the wonderful tips for future guests.  We are very happy to know that you were relaxed during your stay, and we hope to see you again soon!

title: Not bad
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Great hotel with fantastic location!
review: Stayed one night in this lovely B&B in the heart of North Beach. Very nice accommodations, small European style but nicely done. I got there just in time for the wine and cheese at 5, which was well done. Rather a minimalist continental breakfast, croissants,, boiled eggs, and toast with jam, but all fresh and tasty. Besides, there must be 30 restaurants in walking distance, mainly Italian but some nice bakeries as well. A very nice place to spend the night.

title: Decent standard, good location
review: We had a great stay at this hotel and found it to be a wonderful location for shopping in Soho and walking around Greenwich Village. It was very conveniently located to be able to take the subway to Dumbo. The area is really great, with the Comedy Cellar and Blue Note just a couple of blocks away. The rooms are very small with some of them having more recent renovations, but the main reason for staying here is the location and it’s very clean with great decor. The breakfast is included although limited, but very good.

title: Not more than average
review: Hello Cam,  Thank you for the perfect review!  We are very happy you enjoyed your stay with us, and we hope to see you again soon!

title: Lovely
review: Easy reach from the Subway for all connections. Located just off Washington Square Park, close enough to all the local amenities including the bars and eateries of Bleecker Street. Also nice to be away from the immediate hustle and bustle of many other areas of the city, which helped make it more relaxing. Couple of nearby small supermarkets which were handy 5th and 6th Avenues were a short walk either side of the square too giving bus route options as well as the Subway. Check -in hassle free and welcoming, lovely decorative lobby area. Room practical and decent standard. Nice to have a good coffee machine and safe. One or two nice extra touches like slippers, umbrella if needed. As with the coffee making items the (quality local) toiletries were excellent and always replaced…

title: A quiet hotel; great location
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Great Location
review: We had a wonderful stay at the WSH. The hotel was clean, quiet, comfortable and a perfect location for our needs. The location was next to Washington Square Park which was ideal for a quiet morning walk; convenient to the subway; close to shops, sites and wonderful restaurants. Highly recommend!!

title: A good little hotel
review: Hello Susie,  Thank you for the wonderful review!  We greatly appreciate you sharing your experience with us, and for all the wonderful tips.  We hope to see you again soon!

title: Only hotel you want to stay in Greenwich Village
review: As a graduate of NYU I must have walked by this place 1000 times without noticing. Now, years later, it has provided me with a comfortable, restful, reasonably priced venue in the heart of the village. Staff was friendly and the Deco-ish room was clean. The free breakfast area got crowded early and the adjacent restaurant was convenient and adequate. Not five star in an area with tons of competition, but satisfactory nonetheless. Will probably stay here regularly now.

title: Great little hotel with character!
review: Hello Jeff,  Thank you for stopping by, and giving us a try!  We greatly appreciate you sharing your positive experience with us, and thank you for your commitment to stay with us again.  We hope to see you soon!

title: Wonderful hotel and will return
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. title: Loved WSH!!
review: Had an amazing stay at this hotel. The location was perfect for us, loved the village atmosphere and park. The staff at the hotel are so friendly and helpful, especially Ronny. He’s amazing and makes the guests feel special. Room was bigger than expected and the bathroom was large and up to date as well. Restaurant in the hotel was excellent as well. Nothing but good things to say!

title: Good small & Quaint hotel
review: Hello Yvette,  Thank you for the wonderful review!  We are so glad everything was to your liking, and that you found our staff to be friendly and helpful.  We look forward to your next stay with us!

title: WSH has Location and Modern Style
review: We stayed at WSH while we were in NYC for the Belmont Stakes. We were a group of 4 and stayed in a 2 double bed deluxe room; it was a little tight, but it NYC and was very comfortable and worked well for us. The front desk was very helpful and quick to respond to an issue with our door lock. They also offered great suggestions and made us feel very welcome.  We had the complimentary breakfast each morning and were very happy with the offerings.   The location is perfect, close to several subway lines and terrific areas to explore are very close by (east village, Greenwich village). Lots of great food and drinks nearby, as was a cvs. We all agreed this is our fav hotel and location in NYC, we will not look elsewhere for return trips!

title: Love this hotel
review: Hello Elane,  We greatly appreciate you sharing your experience!  We are very happy to be your favorite hotel in New York, and we promise to make your next stay just as memorable.  We look forward to seeing you all again soon!

title: 1st trip to the big apple
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. title: Great stay, great location, great staff, great breakfast.
review: This is a great location to stay, the staff were very helpful and friendly, it was away from the hustle and bustle of uptown.  With it being central with the use of the subway, nowhere was too hard to get to, there is a stop at the end of the steet. There are plenty of bars, restaurants , food carts, deli’s right on the door step, the park is just across the street. Would we return? Yes we would 👌🏼 Thanks

title: Fantastic Location, Great Vibe
review: Hello Paul,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us for your first trip to New York!  We are overjoyed your experience was a memorable one, and we look forward to making your second trip just as great.  Please come back soon!

title: Love this park!
review: My wife and I stayed here for 6 days. The location is perfect. We had several options, took this one and didn't regret it. The room was spacious, bathroom clean, and we had a breakfast included. Breakfast was very nice, at the hotel restaurant which accommodates external diners as well.  They had a little misunderstanding when we checked-in which they quickly sorted out. The staff was very helpful, always welcoming and cheerful, gave us tips about where to go and what the quickest way is, they were exceptional.  When checking out and heading to the airport, I recommend asking for their help. They got us a reliable ride for a good price. The rate is not cheap but this hotel is worth every penny.

title: Great location and excellent service
review: Hello Haramachi,  Thank you for the wonderful review!  We are glad to know you had a fantastic experience, with only one minor issue that was quickly resolved.  We appreciate you choosing us, and we hope to see you again!

title: Great Location/Expensive/Needs Work
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. title: Great location, very very nice hotel.
review: PROS: 1. The location. It is great for visiting NYU as it is walking distance to dorms and many NYU buildings. Close to many subway stations. Greenwich Village is a great area. 2. Friendly doorman. 3. Good response to the issues we had while staying there. Broken hair dryer was replaced right away and an in room hot water issue was fixed but not before I had a cold shower! An adjustment was needed in our room after a hotel wide hot water shut off.   CONS: 1. EXTREMELY small room - maybe 2 feet on either side of a double bed and 3 ft from foot of the bed to the wall. Room and bathroom were dark and old. One tiny window that faced an outside wall in the room and one frosted window in the bathroom. Tiny TV. 2. Very limited seating in the lobby. This was a huge problem as we took…

title: Great location
review: The WSH was a perfect location for a long weekend visit to the city. The hotel is comfortable and clean. The rooms have all one needs-although they are on the smallish side-expected in NYC. Rates are reasonable, breakfast included. A wonderful history to the hotel. Staff were lovely.  What more can you ask. I hope to come back in the fall.

title: Fabulous hotel in great location
review: Hello J,  Thank you for the amazing review!  We are incredibly happy you enjoyed your stay, and had a memorable experience.  We look forward to seeing you again!

title: Can't find anything bad to say...
review: The best part of this hotel was the great location and the super friendly staff. The rooms were small and in our case, not updated. Our family had another room with a newer bathroom. For NYC it’s a good value and again, great location

title: Great & Super Clean
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Not bad
review: Stayed on the 6th floor and felt right at home.  For NYC, the rooms are good size - about 3 feet clearance on one side of the bed, 4 feet on the other side and at the end of the bed.  The bathroom was an okay size too - it even had a tub.  It was very clean.  The towels were great as was the shower.  The shampoo and lotions are nice - they’re from the Bigelow pharmacy that’s nearby. This pharmacy makes its own line of scented things with lots of other scents - go check it out!  Also, Babbo restaurant is across the street (loved it) and Washington Square Park is out the front door.  One more thing - the doormen are awesome.  I’d stay here again in a heartbeat.

title: Great Room & Best Shower Ever!
review: Hello West,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with all of us!  We sincerely appreciate your commitment to stay with us again.  We promise to make your second stay just as fantastic!

title: Wonderful hotel in a great location.
review: I like this hotel better than some of the other reviewers. It is true that the rooms were dated. Really dated. But I liked the old fashioned charm of the hotel. I really liked the lobby. More importantly to me, my daughter is a student at NYU, and this hotel is literally on campus. It’s less than a 5 minutes walk from many of the freshman dorms. Even if you are not visiting NYU, there is a ton to do and see I this neighborhood.

title: Good sized room, excellent location
review: Hello Margaret,  We sincerely appreciate your feedback.  We apologize if some of the rooms detracted from the historical charm for you, but we want you to know that room renovations are nearly complete!  We hope you notice the difference when move-in begins this August.  We look forward to seeing you again soon!

title: NYU Graduation!
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. title: Cozy Hotel in a Great Location
review: Stayed here for 5 nights as we were attending our daughters graduation ceremony at NYU. The hotel is in a great location. Perfect for our stay. The rooms are on the small side but having said that they are perfectly adequate.  The bathroom is large.  Breakfast is included in the room cost which is a bonus. Perfect location to explore the Village and lower side of Manhattan. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will be recommending to others.

title: Super friendly staff and great location!
review: Hello Em,  Thank you for sharing your experience with us, as well as with others.  We are so happy you enjoyed your stay, and allowed us to be part of such an important family milestone.  Congratulations to your daughters!  We hope to see you all again soon!

title: Charming Hotel
review: Although I've stayed at the hotel before, my most recent trip was to meet some friends who were visiting New York, and they were staying at the hotel.  As always, the hotel was comfortable, very clean, had great service, and a really good restaurant (great menu and reasonable prices).  My room this time was on the 9th floor with nice views of downtown and Washington Square Park. The location is convenient to everything in the village and just a few blocks from the 6th Avenue subway for trips uptown. It's a lovely hotel. Also, the friends i was visiting with  love the hotel.  They stay there whenever they're in New York.  Their room, with a king sized bed, was very large with a beautiful, roomy bathroom.

title: Graduation at NYU
review: Hello JHilley,  Thank you for the amazing review!  We are very grateful for the positive feedback, and it warms our hearts to know that you and your friends had a fantastic stay.  We hope to see you all again soon!

title: Motel or hotel?
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Atmosphere and Quality
review: Upon entering, the lobby looks sheek and gives you the idea that the rooms will follow. False advertising . We had a standard room on a lower floor and as soon as we walked in we got hit with a strong chemical smell. Seemed like it was coming from the bathroom and we had to air it out because it was so bad. Makes me wonder what they were cleaning that they had to drown it in bleach ? Not a good first impression. Room was small which was to be expected , however the bed was terrible. Rock solid. I’ve stayed at hotels all over the country and world and this was the absolute worst. Layout of the room was not thought out, bed rock hard, bathroom was stuck in a time warp and gave a creepy feel almost like you were in a prison or hospital? Very strange. Needs renovation . Definitely…

title: Great Staff
review: I just stayed at the Washington Square Hotel for the second time and will do so again, during my frequent business trips to the City.  The atmosphere of the hotel is gives you the sense of taking a step back in time, to a NYC art nouveau building with character.  There is quality of  service, room amenities, and a free breakfast!  The staff make you realize that you are not staying at a large chain hotel, through their friendliness and warmth.  Highly recommend the hotel, but perhaps, not too much.  I want to make sure I can still find a room!

title: Great location
review: Hello Susan,  Thank you for recommending us!  We sincerely appreciate all the wonderful feedback, and for sharing your experience with everyone.  We hope business brings you back the city soon.  We promise we will have a room for you!

title: Love this hotel
review: The hotel is small and somewhat not like most modern hotels as it relates to amenities , look, features ect.  Buy for its price point and location it was ok.   The rooms were small but comfortable and the beds are really comfortable. The staff are always willing to help and are always welcoming. I will definitely stay here again.

title: Great location!
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. title: Exceptional across-the-board
review: We have loved this hotel ever since our first stay in 2006 and have been back several times. In particular, the location at a corner of Washington Square Park, is a real plus, with access not only to the park (always something entertaining and interesting ongoing) but also fascinating and funky neighborhoods.  An easy walk, for example, to the Whitney Museum of American Art, and many, many very good restaurants. The hotel itself if of historical interest and the ambiance is art deco.  There is lovely tile work and accents throughout.  Rooms are small, as often the case in NYC, but well appointed. Rooms toward the back on the McDougal Street side may be a bit larger, and certainly quieter. And a real plus is the complimentary breakfast in the adjoining North Square restaurant.…

title: Great Location for NYU!
review: Hello Professor,  We sincerely appreciate your patronage, and loyalty over the years.  We are all overjoyed knowing that the level of service, and comfort of your stays have been consistently memorable.  Thank you for sharing those wonderful tips, and for sharing your experience with us.  We look forward to your next visit!

title: Grade A Awesome
review: We had such an exceptional stay at the Washington Square hotel. I’m adventurous and love to try new things, so I almost never stay at the same hotel twice even if I had a good experience. But my husband and I will decidedly be back to New York City and agreed without a doubt to stay at the Washington Square hotel again when we return. Your staff was above and beyond kind to us. They held our bags on several occasions, noticed when I had coffee in my hand and ran to open the front doors for me, constantly greeted us with warm welcome, and were just exceptional across the board. Thank you for making us feel so at home. I will strongly recommend this hotel to all of my friends.

title: My first NYC trip
review: Hello Sarah,  Thank you for the rave review!  We sincerely appreciate the kind words, and heartwarming feedback.  We try our best to make every guest feel at home when they stay with us, and provide everyone with warm, genuine service.  We are greatly looking forward to your next stay, and we hope to meet some of your friends.  We promise to deliver another exceptional experience!

title: Friendly staff, clean hotel, bigger rooms than I expected
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. title: If you could take this hotel on your travels you would.
review: The sheets were fresh, the soaps were fragrant, the room was clean, and the best thing of all is the staff at the WSH.  Ronnie, one of the Door Men, took great care of our mothers as they stepped from cabs and into the hotel.  Ronnie treated these two women like royalty.  The hotel is on one edge of the lovely Washington Square Park - I never heard any noise from the park, though.  The complimentary continental breakfast is SO GOOD, especially liked the homemade muffins and blueberry yogurt.  Would stay again if Greenwich Village is my destination!!

title: Good and not so good
review: Hello Mark and Cindy,  Thank you so much for the heartwarming review, we sincerely appreciate your feedback.  We try our best to make every guest feel special, and we are so happy to know we successfully connected with you.  We look forward to your next stay, and hope to see you again soon!

title: Incompetent staff
review: Our first time at this hotel and it had pretty much everything. Situated in Greenwich Village on the corner of Washington Square it boasts many famous guests - too many to list here.   The rooms are clean and well serviced - with ironing board, safe, bath robes etc. We had a Queen room in April for $212 plus taxes a night which included breakfast. There is a restaurant in the evening and a small bar, as well as coffee lounge free for guests. It is surprisingly quiet roundabouts so sleep arrives easily and stays the night. (Only one criticism for me which is common to many mid-priced hotels is door closing late at night and early morning. Surely a polite reminder is not too much to expect)  Star turn in the lobby is Ronnie who knows pretty much everything about the area and…

title: A great hotel!
review: Hello Marc,  Thank you for the amazing review!  We greatly appreciate you sharing all those wonderful and helpful tips.  The Village is definitely a magical place, and we are truly happy you enjoyed the experience.  We look forward to your next visit!

title: Third time also a charm
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. title: Great part of town, average hotel.
review: We were in room 224 again. We like low floors. This had a view of the park and a window that opens. This hotel has a very nice self-serve continental breakfast. Our room looked updated. The only funny thing is the labyrinthine halls, but we figured it out quickly. The dog runs in the park are a hoot.

title: Great place to stay when touring NYU
review: Hello LT,  Thank you for the wonderful review!  We are incredibly happy you enjoyed your room, as well as the continental breakfast in the morning.  We sincerely appreciate your loyalty, and look forward to your future stays!

title: Good location and helpful staff
review: A reasonable price for a good location.  Rooms, common areas, and staff are all just a little bit off from what you expect in most hotels in the city.  From here you can get to lots of great parks, restaurants, and shopping.

title: NYC Business and Pleasure
review: Hello,  We sincerely apologize for the experience you had while staying with us.  We will definitely look into what happened, and determine what adjustments need to be made so this does not happen again.  We greatly appreciate your feedback, and for helping us improve in a meaningful way.  We promise to be better next time.

title: Good Value
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. title: Comfortable hotel, right next to NYU
review: First time travellers to New York invariably choose to stay midtown to enjoy the brashness of times square.My friends and i decided on Greenwich Village because of its ambience and amenities such as restaurants and fascinating bars and shops.The Washington Square hotel is perfectly located next to an entrance to Washington Square Park.As in the case of virtually all New York Hotels the rooms are small,however they are nicely done out with attractive bathrooms the restaurant and bar area are very appealing and the staff are just terrific.On my next trip to New York i would certainly choose this hotel.

title: Tired, good price, nice location
review: Hello Kelvin,  Thank you for sharing your experience with us, we are thrilled to know you found our staff to be terrific, and the neighborhood charming.  We sincerely appreciate you committing to stay with us again on your next trip to New York.  For your next stay we want you to know that we offer several different room types, some of which offer more space.  Please feel free to contact us at any time to explore what options are available.  We hope to see you again soon!

title: Built in 1902 & just as elegant today, Friendly Staff
review: I've stayed at this hotel a few times when visiting NYU.  The location is terrific for access to the university -- couldn't be closer!  Tons of restaurants in the area, especially just south of the Square.  Rooms are comfortable if not a little small, but that is typical for NYC.  Bathrooms are large compared to the rooms, with good water pressure.  Breakfast is included; it's good, if not a little on the light side, especially if you are there for a few days.  Overall, though, I will definitely keep returning.

title: Cozy hotel in fantastic location!
review: Hello,  Thank you for your continued patronage over the years, we sincerely appreciate your loyalty!  We promise to maintain the level of service you have come to expect when you stay with us.  We hope to see you again soon!

title: NYU visit
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. title: A perfect choice !
review: My son and I arrived on a red eye from San Francisco to the hotel hours before check in. We were warmly received by the staff who held our bags for us and directed us to the complimentary breakfast in the lobby. The dining area was clean and lively while the bagels were fresh and coffee was hot.  We checked in after a school tour and lunch. Our room was clean and well appointed.  The beds were very comfortable and we slept well. The location is perfect for visiting NYU. The proximity to the subway station is also a plus. I would highly recommend staying here.

title: Back for another great stay
review: Hello Michele,  Thank you for choosing us as your home while exploring the city, as well as the university.  We are so happy to know you enjoyed your stay, and found everything to be just right.  We wish your son the best of luck on his academic journey, and hope to see you again!

title: Wonderful stay and hope to return.
review: We came for a few days family tourism with my elederly mum and liked everything about this lovely boutique hotel : the location in a quiet street close to beautiful sites and well connected by subway, the rooms (small but confortable and well heated, great beds, nice shower), and above all the staff, who were all pleasant and helpful (special note for Leodi at the bar). Not overpriced. We strongy recommend !

title: NYC TRIP
review: Hello Stephanie,  Thank you so much for the wonderful review!  We are thrilled to know you enjoyed your accommodations, as well as our pleasant and helpful staff.  We look forward to seeing you again!

title: Favorite NYC Hotel
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Great location in Chelsea and Soho-area
review: We have stayed at the WSH a few times over the last year and a half.  It has become our "go to" NYC  hotel. The staff is wonderful--polite and helpful--and the accommodations are comfortable.  The hotel is family owned and operated, and it feels that way.  Small and cozy, with touches that make a difference.  On the last visit (Jan. 25-29, 2018), there were hot apple cider and fresh baked chocolate chips cookies in the lobby lounge in the afternoon--just what was needed after trudging around on a cold January day. We stayed at the WSH during Christmas week (2016), and had a wonderful experience, too. Breakfast at North Square Restaurant or in the lobby lounge is included and substantial. In addition, ala carte items on the breakfast menu are very reasonably priced.  Restaurant…

title: A Nice Friendly Place in the Heart of the Village!
review: Hello Janie,  Thank you for taking the time to write an amazing, extensive review.  We sincerely appreciate you sharing your experience with us!  We are grateful for your continued loyalty, and look forward to your future visits!

title: Lovely and friendly
review: What an excellent hotel! We are staying for 4 days, but the location of this hotel is perfect for the lower part of Manhattan.  The full breakfast in the basement of the hotel is really nice, and the service is good. The rooms are clean and has everything you need. The gym is ok.  The staff at the front desk are polite and nice. Would definitely come back. Great value!!

title: Love this place
review: Hello Marit,  Thank you so much for the excellent review!  We are positively elated you enjoyed your stay, and happy to know there were no lapses in service.  We look forward to your next stay!

title: Will Stay Here Again
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Great location and staff. Old but nice.
review: This hotel is in a great location in the Village. The staff is friendly and helpful. When I needed a couple of things for the room, they were delivered in about 5 minutes.  They have a continental breakfast with coffee, OJ, fruit and yogurt and offer fresh baked chocolate chip cookies during the day. The room was clean with plenty of storage. A great experience.

title: Quaint and reasonably priced hotel in a great part of Manhattan.
review: Hello Karen,  Thank you for the fantastic review!  We sincerely appreciate the positive feedback, and look forward to consistently providing the best service we can.  We hope to see you again soon!

title: NEW YORK
review: Washington Square Hotel is an old hotel, so if boutique hotels are your thing don't bother. Besides that, everything else is nice. The staff is very friendly and are always willing to help. Ronnie Jenkins, the doorman, is a character! We got a simple queen bed room and it was more than enought for us. Despite being old, everything seemed to work fine. Continental breakfast is...well, you know. Don't expect much. Few but good option. Location is great if you like lower Manhattan! Me and my wife HATE Times Square, Midtown, etc, so this is a nice place to stay, close to SoHo, Village, etc. Lots of great restaurantes, fewer crazy people walking around, nice parks. I recommend. Gave it 3 stars but it is not average, I'd say it's "good".

title: Thank you!
review: I liked this place. There is no such thing as a cheap Manhattan Hotel, but this was reasonably priced. The staff are charming and helpful and the location is magic. One complaint only - the mattresses seem to be very hot! Are they latex or something that doesn't air? I felt like I had an electric blanket on, when I didn't.

title: Nice balance of spiced up with its old identity
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Quiet, clean, old-fashioned hotel on Washington Square
review: I used to live across the street from the Washington Square Hotel which no doubt biases my judgment. But i'd book it again and again.  Location comes first, but the remodeled hotel is actually pretty high quality, albeit with a lot of variation in rooms (some are very small). The bar and restaurant are both excellent. And hey! This is Greenwich Village! I really laughed at the Trip Adviser query about whether it offered a golf course!  What it offers is a decent place to stay in walking distance to the Blue Note (and a number of other things, though the neighborhood is increasingly just the NYU campus).

title: over priced closet size room
review: Hello Craig,  Thank you for sharing your wonderful experience with us!  Your loyalty and continued patronage means the world to us, and we look forward to your next stay!

title: College visit FilmAt 11
review: A quiet, clean, old-fashioned hotel with a wonderful location on Washington Square in the Village. Quick walk to the subway, cute local shops and restaurants. Room are reasonably sized for New York, staff are friendly and helpful, good (free) wifi, and continental breakfast included. If you're hungry and don't feel like going out, you can get a really good hot breakfast, or plan for dinner, in the downstairs restaurant, which is light and airy and full of flowers.

title: Great stay at Washington Square Hotel
review: Hello Norma,  Thank you for your review!  We greatly appreciate the positive feedback, and tips for any prospective guests.  We hope to see you again soon, and look forward to making your next stay just as wonderful!

title: Better than we expected
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. title: Greenwich Boutique Hotel
review: This hotel was better than we expected.  We typically stay at large hotels in the middle of midtown, but we were going to the Blue Note to see a show and the location was better for us -- and actually the whole experience was better for us!  The beds were comfortable, the rooms were quiet, staff was friendly and the location was perfect.  There is a part of me that doesn't want to let this little secret out, but I love NYC so much, having a little gem like this makes the visit so much more enjoyable.  Thanks Washington Square Hotel!!!!

title: Sweetheart of a hotel
review: Hello Mary,  We could not be happier to know that we exceeded your expectations!  We greatly appreciate you taking the time to share your experience with everyone.  It was our pleasure to serve you, and we look forward to your next stay with us.  We wish you a happy New Year!

title: Another Love Letter To WSH
review: Excellent location one block from the subway. Good breakfast included. Pfofessional staff. For the city and area fair prices. Great restaurants in the area. Easy to get to Broadway theaters via subway.

title: Cosy Boutique Hotel
review: Hello William,  Thank you for the 5-star review!  We're so happy you found everything to your liking.  We hope to see you again soon!

title: Great small hotel on Washington Square
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. title: NYC Christmas 2017
review: We liked this hotel a lot. The room was small but very clean and quiet. The location on the northwest corner of the square was great for walking around Greenwich Village. The hotel bistro served an excellent lunch.

title: Centrally located boutique hotel
review: Hello Peter,  Thank you for sharing your experience with us, we are very pleased you enjoyed your stay!  We wish you a safe, and happy New Year!

title: Great Hotel
review: Great hotel, convenient and friendly staff. Excellent breakfast to start a busy day touring Holiday Markets. Close to transit, many restaurants and shops. Room spacious, bed comfortable. Closet small.

title: Wonderful Stay
review: Hello,  Thank you for the five star review!  We look forward to seeing you in the new year!

title: Good Location & Value, but....
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Highly recommend!
review: This is a lovely little hotel, in a lovely part of the city, and offers good value. The staff are generally very friendly and helpful (especially the doormen!). It is quite old however, and feels it, it is quite noisey, and it's not the cleanest. Breakfast isn't bad, but options are quite limited, so you may want to consider some of the cafés and diners nearby.  I would have given it three stars, except for house keeping staff vacuuming at 9.30 on a Sunday morning right outside my room! If check out is 12 noon, don't use such under-hand methods to get me (or anyone else) out earlier!  I would stay again.

title: Great location, Great staff, lovely room despite small size
review: We stayed here for 6 nights and would absolutely recommend this hotel. Like all big cities, you pay a lot for a very small space but that's New York! We had a twin room; small but very clean and comfortable. Coffee in the room and free wifi. They offer a continental breakfast in the lobby which is a fantastic way to start the day; coffee, tea, bagels, fruit and yogurt. All of the staff were very nice and Ronny in particular is great with directions! What we really enjoyed was the neighbourhood; very relaxed and friendly. Washington Park across the street. Subway station down the street. Within walking distance to Chelsea market, Soho, Union Square, east village. Felt very safe walking at night.

title: NYC Christmas
review: We usually end up in Midown when we visit but this time opted for the less crowded and less hurried area in and around The Village and are so glad that we did. The Washington Square Hotel is in a great location, on a relatively quite street and easy walks to restaurants, etc. The staff (especially Ronald) were very friendly and helpful and clearly enjoy working there and know the area well. The room we had was down some narrow corridors but was perhaps the quietest room we have ever enjoyed in NYC; room was small (not unusual in NYC) but clean and comfortable with a nice bathroom and good shower; pillow choices and a pillow topped mattress that made for a good night's sleep. and that is why we all stay on hotels, motels, etc ...to get a nice night sleep. Washington Square met…

title: Nice hotel, nice staff, nice location
review: Hello David,  Thank you for sharing your experience with us!  We appreciate you giving the village, and us a try, it truly is a special place.  We look forward to seeing you again soon!

title: A must visit!
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Nice little hotel
review: Spent a good few hours just relaxing in the Park. So much to see and such a history to hear about.  A lady who knows about and promotes the Park kindly gave us a (free) comprehensive resume on the Park. She was obviously proud of the area, rightly so.   A fine area to spend a relaxing time in, loads of artistry, artisans and such a fabulous place just to meander through.   Take a seat and enjoy the ambiance. Don’t miss it.

title: I just keep coming back
review: Location is central to NYU, the desk staff were helpful and knowledgeable about local restaurants and running routes. The rooms were small but clean, bed was comfy. I give them an average because I had 3 hiccups with them. 1) they mixed up our reservation, booking 1 room for 2 nights instead of 2 rooms for 1 night 2) when I did check out, they checked me out of the wrong room. They did quickly issue a refund. 3) A mysterious charge appeared on my card that they initially they had no record of. It took a few calls, but eventually it was 'found' and they issued a refund.  Everyone was nice and tried to be helpful, but it was not the smoothest stay.

title: Great stay in the heart of Manhattan
review: I have been staying at the Washington Square hotel for the past 12 year. Sometimes i even stay twice a year. I love coming back, it´s like a home away from home. The staff is super nice and welcoming, the rooms are clean and well looked after. And the location in the Village is the best. I can´t recommend this hotel enough. I just love It.

title: Great breakfast
review: Hello,  We sincerely appreciate your review, and for your continued patronage over the years.  To be a home away from home for you is one of the highest compliments we can receive, and we look forward to maintaining the level of service you are accustomed to.  We hope to see you again soon!

title: Central Location
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Wonderful "Village" Experience
review: The Washington Square Hotel was the perfect base for walking NYC.  We were a short distance from the 9/11 Memorial and Battery Park to the South and Equal distance to Time Square, The Plaza, and Broadway.  The Staff is courteous and kind.    The local area is vibrant with plenty of shops and great restaurants.  We enjoyed the flare of Washington Square Park which provides plenty of free entertainment.    Our room was a Deluxe Twin - perfect for my Aunt and me.   We highly recommend this hotel.

title: Hidden gem
review: Hello,  We sincerely appreciate your kind review, and for recommending us to others.  We are incredibly happy you found your accommodations to be perfect, and the staff courteous.  We look forward to seeing you soon!

title: Very nice hotel with excellent location
review: This 'boutique" hotel is great, we stayed here 4 nights. The location, "kiddie corner" from Washington Square is a great location. Staying in the "Village" is a real neighborhood experience. The staff was helpful and courteous. The room was clean and comfortable. We slept like babies in the queen bed. The TV is up high on the wall so it is easier to watch while laying in bed. There wasn't a view of anything but other buildings, but we did not expect a view. Breakfast was included in the price of the room if one stayed on the left side of the menu. We really liked the bartender, Salvatore, he is a wonderful mixologist. He made us a special drink on our last night there. There are lots of restaurants, bars and nightclubs within easy walking distance.

title: perfect location
review: Hello Randy,  Thank you for letting us know you had such a wonderful time with us.  We greatly appreciate you sharing your experience with us, and for pointing out the highlights of your stay.  We hope you come to visit us again soon!

title: I'll Never Stay Anywhere Else in NYC!
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Nice hotel in a great location
review: I've been to New York many times and had resigned myself to either staying somewhere inconvenient or having a room the size of a closet for around $300 a night.  But now I finally know that there is a place that is perfect for me and this is it.  It couldn't possibly be more convenient for all I like to do, and near many subway stops.  For about $250 a night we had what for any big city was a very large room.  There was a big closet and lots of drawers and shelves, really enough for two people's stuff for a week or more.  Great lighting, windows that open, a big bathroom with a bathtub as well as a shower, seating for two, nice decor, and a thermostat and heating that were accurate and worked well, good pillows and bedding, soft towels, nice toiletries.  The restaurant is good…

title: Disappointed in service
review: Hello Sfexile,  Thank you for the amazing review!  Finding a place to stay that is perfect is no easy task, and we are ecstatic we can be that for you. We sincerely look forward to your next stay with us, and aim to make your experience just as memorable!

title: NYU campus visit
review: The Washington Square Hotel is located in Greenwich Village, next to Washington Square and not far from a subway station. The hotel is located between 5th and 6th Avenue on Waverly Place in Lower Manhattan.  It is also close to the NYU campus and there appeared to be parents of staying here. The Washington Square Hotel has been home to writers, artists and visitors to Greenwich Village for more than a century. It was even home to Bob Dylan and Joan Baez back in the day (for a short time).   I stayed here with my wife for 2 nights in mid-August and generally thought the hotel was nice and I loved its great location. Our room was small and came with an undersized queen sized bed. While every room was non-smoking I thought our room had a strange smell (kind of a wet towel like…

title: Perfect hotel in the perfect location
review: Hello Rocky,  Thank you very much for the positive review!  We are so happy you found the staff, as well as the neighborhood enjoyable.  With regards to your room, we apologize if you felt the bed was undersized, and if there was an odor in the room.  August was very humid, and unfortunately that can sometimes have effects on certain parts of the building.  We are in the process of an expansive renovation, and are improving where we can.  We hope to see you again, and look forward to showing you our renovated rooms!

title: Another wonderful stay at WSH!
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Washington Square Hotel
review: We've just got back from NYC and another wonderful stay at the Washington Square Hotel. In a great location by the park with many good local eating places and local shops, yet with the convenience of nearby subway stations connecting you easily to the rest of the city.  The hotel staff are professional and friendly and nothing is too much trouble. A historic hotel that retains many art deco  features.  The rooms are clean with high quality mattresses and bed linen, plenty of complimentary toiletries and coffee machine. Will definitely stay again on my next New York trip.

title: Great Location, clean, well maintained but slightly musty room, adequate breakfast, excellent restaurant, great location
review: Hello Sasha,  We are so happy you enjoyed your stay with us!  We aim to make your next experience just as memorable as the first.  We hope to see you soon!

title: A Wonderful Hotel In a Perfect Location!
review: This hotel has vintage charm mixed with modern amenities. Although not spacious, my room was squeaky clean with luxury linens and a comfortable bed. The location is fabulous, right on the famed Washington Square, and within walking distance of great restaurants, SoHo, and many other Greenwich Village attractions.

title: Nice Little Indie
review: Located a short walk from several subway stations, in midst of NYU, very close to numerous late night food options typical around many college campuses. We felt safe walking the neighborhood at all hours, and the lovely Washington Square Park is only steps from the hotel entrance. Furthermore, the hotel restaurant is exceptional, at least for dinner.  Our room (710) was small, clean, has a nice size bathroom and a well designed shower tub...meaning the shower head worked well, the tub drains promptly, there were plenty of places to put stuff. The windows in bath and main room open easily, but not far, and there is a small desk. Two caveats: 1) The room consistently had a slight, but distinct, musty odor which was minimized, but not eliminated, by leaving the windows open while…

title: Nice plays to go
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. title: A Wonderful Surprise in Greenwich Village
review: Well located place to go. The breakfast was quite nice, you can choose to go to the restaurant, where is a service or to café where you have a bufet. The staff is very helpful too and there is a wifi in the hotel available.

title: Super Hotel
review: We stayed here for a six night trip to visit our daughter and grandson.  We usually stay in the urban canyons of Midtown and found this location to be delightful.  It was an easy way to our daughter's apartment and the neighborhood is fantastic and a great change of pace from the hustle and bustle of Midtown.  Babbo Ristorante is right across the street and is a must stop place. We were worried about the size of the room given other reviews and when we first arrived we were concerned about the lack of space.  The room worked out well for us.  It is well laid out with ample closet space, a small desk and chair and a single chair for sitting. The two twin beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was outstanding, with a large walk-in shower and incredible shower heads and water…

title: Perfect NYU location!
review: Hello,  Thank you for the amazing review!  We greatly appreciate the positive feedback, and aim to improve our service even further.  We look forward to your return in February!

title: An amazing hotel
review: Great, safe location.  Walked to Greenwich Village, Little Italy, and Chinatown.  Close to the subway for other sites. Super friendly and knowledgeable front desk.  The gentleman in the lobby who helped with our luggage was an invaluable source of knowledge on what to see and exactly how to get there.  Great restaurant.

title: great location...hotel could use some TLC
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Washington Square Hotel
review: Great location in the Village...that says a lot. The hotel is always busy, this was my second visit, and I think the staff was overwhelmed. It's not a swanky place, I knew that, but it seemed a bit run down. They ran out of coffee cups one morning, housekeeping is incredibly slow--they don't arrive until ten and sometimes our room was still unmade at 4:00.I heard other guests complaining about that, too. The front desk does as best it can, but aren't well informed as to restaurants in the area. By the way, Babbo is across the street!!! Stellar spot.  Book it in advance. The Knickerbocker is a Village landmark, but no one at the desk knew that or if they did , they didn't offer it as a suggestion.  The whole place seems tired. If you decide to stay there, make sure you book a…

title: Excellent Hotel, Perfect Location
review: Hello,  We sincerely apologize for the experience you had during your stay with us.  We always strive to be the best we can be, but clearly the ball was dropped.  It is our hope that we can discuss what happened, and find a way to make it up to you.  We appreciate your feedback, and we promise to be better next time.

title: Small room but great staff and great location
review: A well location Hotel right in the middle of Manhattan with a cafe attached below open for breakfasts. Our room was small but we only needed it for sleeping at night which was fine and for a Hotel right in Greenwich Village, it was affordable.

title: Great!
review: Hello Mark,  Thank you for the positive review!  We appreciate you sharing your experience with us.  We look forward to seeing you again soon.

title: We enjoyed our visit to NY and our stay in Washington SQuare hotel was great
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood.
