When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Pleasant stay but rooms could use a refresh
review: we had a great experience. Room was comfortable, breakfast great, location was fine, and customer service excellent. We will be back. We always comeback to this hotel when we come to visit NY. Front desk is friendly and helpful.

title: Great location, and great stay!
review: Hello Fernando,  Thank you for the wonderful review!  We appreciate the positive feedback, and are thankful for your continued patronage.  We hope to see you again soon!

title: Great location, UNCOMFORTABLE bed!
review: Washington Square Hotel is a fine boutique hotel in a prime location in the heart of Greenwich Village.  The building has some history, but you're not really staying here for that.  You're not particularly staying room size or amenities either, which, to be honest, are both a bit lacking at this price point.  Of course, what you're staying here for is the location, which for Greenwich Village, is about as good as it gets.  Having everything within easy striking distance, and one of the finest parks in NYC at your doorstep to boot, is truly wonderful.  We stayed for 10 nights in July and despite the rooms' limitations ($265/night and no in-room fridge ... seriously?), we nevertheless had quite a pleasant stay. Hotel staff and management in general are very good, and they make you…

title: Best place honestly ever
review: We were in NYC just for a weekend, and the Washington Square Hotel was actually booked for us by our hosts. The location can't be beat. So nice to be steps away from the park! And the staff was absolutely lovely - friendly, helpful, and accommodating! Rooms are small, but this is to be expected in the city, where square footage is at a premium. However, the bed was super comfortable, and the shower had great water pressure. Thanks for the great stay!

title: Absolutely super location, Absolutely Average Hotel.
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Excellent, if it wasn't for the carpet
review: This is a super location to be in if you are visiting New York. This area had tons of restaurant options, the area was lively with a great fun atmosphere. One of the best neighborhoods in New York and only a block away from the subway makes this ideal for getting anywhere around the city during your stay. Just in case you need to know it is really close to NYU, so if you need to visit the school, this would be a perfect choice.   The hotel on the other hand was not as glamorous as the area. The hotel felt old. The rooms were small, the bathroom was small, towels were average. I was challenged to find outlets for my phone and computer.  The lobby area felt dirty, even though I know it absolutely wasn't. It probably is more aesthetics. Check in was great, staff was extremely…

title: Great location. Lovely hotel👍
review: Good location next to Washington square, the very nice Greenwich area is all within walking distance and metro station as well. We had an executive double which was very spacious, even for non New York standards. Comfortable beds, friendly service and OK breakfast. The hotel is a bit dated which has its charm but our room had a carpet which smelled like a bad burger joint. They tried to clean it after we reported but with little success. We got some money back but if you check into one of these rooms don't assume the smell is from a next door restaurant and will go away because it doesn't. Needs some maintenance.

title: Great Location!  Great Hotel!
review: We were so happy with our stay here. The accommodations were  lovely. The Restaurant, north square, was delicious! This is situated in a great location....right across from the park. Staff very friendly and accommodating. Will stay here again for sure!

title: A great NY base
review: We had a great stay at The WSH!  Very close to NYU and Washington Square!  Easy to get to all things NYC and Brooklyn.  The staff was very helpful and accommodating.  Great amenities in the room.  Very clean. The daily breakfast was just perfect.  Great way to start our day!  Highly recommend!

title: Location, location, location
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: My home away from home.
review: This is a wonderful choice for a stay in NYC.  It is on Washington Square right next to NYU.  The price is excellent for NYC.  The staff is extremely friendly.  There is a small breakfast buffet each morning with bakery items, coffee, yogurt and fruit which is included with the room.  The rooms are small but that is typical of NYC.  I would definitely recommend this hotel

title: Exceed Expectations!
review: Hello Doreen,  Thank you for choosing to recommend us!  We are happy you enjoyed your stay, and found the staff to be extremely friendly.  We sincerely look forward to your future stays with us.

title: Good location, comfortable room
review: I stay here every time I'm in NYC if rooms are available. I just stayed there nine nights and they make me feel like family. Everyone from the maintenance, cleaning, front desk, and restaurant staff made my stay quite enjoyable. I have a custom motorcycle that I parked on the street and the staff were very watchful of it to which I appreciated.   I have to mention my man Ronnie...he greets you as you walk in and greets you as you leave. He is a great ambassador to not only the hotel ..but to NYC. I love this guy, he is what makes staying in a boutique so special.

title: Friendly and best location
review: Hello,  Thank you for continuing to choose us as your second home when visiting New York, and for sharing your kind words.  We are thankful for the fantastic review, and look forward to your next stay with us!

title: Comfortable, convenient, clean, and courteous NYC digs
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Great Hotel
review: Enjoyed a lovely 2-night stay here recently.  I booked a room through an on-line booking service which only registered as a 1-night reservation in the hotel's system.  No worries, there were rooms available for the 2nd night--and at a better rate!  Ended up being upgraded to an upper floor room with views of the park and uptown, and a nice bathroom window too.  They secured my laptop for me (giving me the key to the locker)and stored my luggage in advance of check-in time and after check-out as well.  Nice address. Nice service. Clean and comfortable.  And decent coffee served with the complimentary continental breakfast.  You can't go wrong here!

title: Great place!
review: Hello Jacaha,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us.  We are glad to know that we have provided you with a high level of service, and that you enjoyed your time.  We look forward to your future stays with us!

title: A great stay and a great location
review: We stayed here for our first anniversary in July of 2016. The Penthouse suite was roomy, very clean, and had wonderful views. The hotel even had an iced bottle of wine waiting with a note that said Happy Anniversary. The bed was very comfortable, and I absolutely loved the Shampoo ect. I have since purchased them from the store on 106th. I would have liked a bath tub in our room, and the additional shower sprayers had a bit too much pressure. Other than that we had a wonderful stay and have recommended it to friends.

title: Brilliant as always
review: Hello Amanda,  Thank you for letting us be a part of such a special occasion!  We are thrilled to know you enjoyed your stay with us, and have passed your recommendation along to friends.  We hope to help you celebrate your second anniversary!

title: Don't touch the telephone
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Amazing stay at Washington Square Hotel
review: This is an excellent hotel, perfectly located, and with a fabulous restaurant attached to it. But they still maintain the fiction that long distance calls should be charged as though we are still in the 1950s.  $180 for a ten minute call to Dublin in order to resolve a problem with a bank card is ludicrous and leaves a very taste about the experience as a whole.

title: Another wonderful stay
review: Hello,  We are sorry to hear about the unfortunate surprise regarding the telephone and how it marred your overall experience.  We would greatly appreciate it if you contacted us directly to discuss how we can rectify what happened, and make up for it on your next stay with us.

title: SUCH AN AMAZING, AFFORDABLE HOTEL!!!!!!
review: We stayed in Washington Square Hotel for a little less than a week and we had the most amazing time. Greenwhich Village is in my opinion the best part of New York and the hotel staff made the hotel feel like our home away from home.  They helped us with wonderful recommendations on restaurants, shopping, what to see and what to do. And Ronny, the guy working in the reception, felt like an old family friend by the end of our stay and it felt sad to leave. Be sure we will be back!

title: ASK FOR BLACK OUT CURTAINS
review: Hello Vilde,  We agree!  The Village is the best part of New York, and we are happy to be your home away from home.  We sincerely look forward to your next stay with us!

title: Great Location, quaint and pretty.
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Great location but a bit used
review: Stayed here 3 times summer of 2016. Efficient rooms, smaller sized, outside facing a must, lobby, and staff were welcoming. Breakfast included. Two steps from Washington Square Park, rental bikes close by. Just walk out and stay in the neighborhood with plenty to do, no subway necessary.

title: Great Value!
review: Hello,  Thank you for recommending us on TripAdvisor!  We are glad to know you enjoyed your stays with us, and hope to see you three more times this Summer!

title: Perfect for a Mother-Daughter trip to NYC
review: 2th visit in 10 year at this hotel. I choose it because I had a 2 night stay in NYC where I know that I would not use the hotel facilities at all. When that is said…  The check in at the hotel went nice and easy.. we arrived at 1 o’clock at night.  The room was really really small (Even for NYC standards) and the window was facing an elevator shaft! So if you opened the window it was all smelly and dark outside. When I booked the room this was not stated. The smell was really stuffy. The decoration of the room and the hotel in general is very out dated. So outdated that it is not even nice or fun anymore. The closet was really old. The doors could hardly be closed and  The bathroom is of a newer date. And worked well.   Had the quick breakfast in the hotel. But no need to do…

title: The Power Of A Friendly Atmosphere!
review: Hello,  We sincerely apologize for the experience you had during your stay with us, and for the miscommunication about the room type.  We would like to find out about how you made the reservation to identify and fix any future mistakes.  We do have a variety of room types suited for different wants and needs, and we are sorry your expectations were not met.  We would very much like the opportunity to discuss any future stays when you visit New York, and deliver an enjoyable, memorable trip.

title: Great location!
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: the most exceptionally helpful staff I have encountered in any hotel.
review: Was in the area recently for business and stayed here for two nights. I think the price is very reasonable, especially for such a great location. When I'm next in town for leisure, I will seriously consider staying here again. The hotel staff was very friendly. The restaurant (North Square) less so. Service at breakfast was very slow and the meal itself was not great (try OatMeals a couple of blocks away for something tasty and healthy). My room had one of those infamous interior views to nowhere, but that was OK. Mattress was very comfortable and firm. Room was impeccably clean. Bathroom quite roomy (by NYC standards). Loved the C.O. Bigelow goodies. My major quibbles are the thin carpeting on the floors:  If they just added thicker carpeting, it would eliminate the noise from…

title: Great experience
review: Hello Sewah,  We apologize for the lapse in service you encountered at our restaurant.  That is definitely not standard practice, and we will make some adjustments to prevent any repeats.  We appreciate you sharing your feedback with regards to the carpeting, and want you to know that the hotel is in the process of an on-going renovation.  You can request a renovated room, and we will do our best to assign one of those rooms if available.  We sincerely look forward to your next stay with us, and hope the improvements are made visible.

title: Perfect location in the West Village
review: The hotel is beautiful with original mosaics throughout. Staff was very helpful in offering advice on transportation and entertainment.   The continental breakfast was excellent.  The location was phenomenal.

title: Great updates from several years ago's stay
review: Hello,  Thank you for the gracious compliment!  We definitely aim to provide the highest level of service we can for every guest, and we appreciate you sharing your experience with us.  We look forward to making your next stay just as memorable.

title: Terribly Rude Bell Hop
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: A gem of a small European style hotel in Greenwich Village
review: From the moment I walked in, the bellhop was rude and the front desk staff offered no assistance. He was short and abrasive and set a terrible tone for my stay here. The grout is dirty. The ironing board was disgusting.  I would definitely look elsewhere for my next trip to New York. Hopefully you never go here to begin with.

title: Classic New York charm
review: Hello Travis,  Thank you for letting us know about your experience with us.  We sincerely apologize for that initial contact, and first impression that should have been warm and gracious.  We will look directly into what happened, and take steps to ensure that it does not happen again.

title: Wonderful boutique hotel on Wahington Square
review: I stayed here with 3 friends who were coming together from all parts of the world to reconnect.  We all absolutely enjoyed everything about this hotel. If you don't like small rooms, this will not be the place for you but the location, staff, comfortable beds and immaculate condition are the qualities I choose everytime.

title: Quaint and comfy
review: Hello,  Thank you for sharing your story with us!  We are thankful to have played a role in reuniting you and your friends, and are thrilled that you all enjoyed everything.  We hope to see you all again next year!

title: Always a great stay!
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Home away from home
review: Conveniently located across from Washington Square Park and NYU. Easy to get to the subway and walk to Soho, Noho, Greenwich, Battery, and Meat packing district. Nothing fancy but definitely worthy of 4 stars.

title: Lovely hotel
review: Hello Helen,  Thank you for the review!  We hope to see you again soon.

title: Location couldn't be better
review: Its the second time I've stayed at the WSH and frankly I wont bother looking to stay anywhere else. We had an extended 9 night stay in May and once again enjoyed the hotel, the public areas, the low rise ambiance, the staff, the location and the breakfasts! The hotel is in a lovely tree lined street, minutes to the very well connected W4th subway, foot steps to the park and totally surrounded by great restaurants and bars and excellent blues and jazz clubs. Compared to the madness of much of New York, the Village setting is a welcome reprieve. Highly recommend the hotel if you like modest comfort, warm greetings and a terrific location. We will be back!

title: Four night visit
review: Hello Louise,  Thank you for sharing your experience with us.  The Village is truly a wonderful place, and undoubtedly one of a kind.  We look forward to your future stays, and promise to provide the exceptional experience you have come to expect.

title: Home away from home in NYC
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: My little home in the Village
review: Full of history, attractive decor, excellent service, comfortable rooms, perfect location at the entrance to Washing Square Park and close to NYU, good restaurants and the Village. I never stay anywhere else.

title: superb
review: Hello Rosie,  Thank you for continued patronage over the years.  We sincerely appreciate you sharing your experience with everyone, and look forward to your future stays with us!

title: Lovely place to stay
review: I love staying at the Washington Square Hotel, for its coziness, personal attention, and fabulous location. The rooms are a little small but always comfortable and clean. Its old-fashioned style feels homey to me. There's a tasty sit-down, table-service continental breakfast included with the room price, but you can add a la carte selections from the menu at extra cost. Best of all is the location: Right on Washington Square Park in Greenwich Village, just a block or two away from the subway, and perfect for strolling the charming old streets of the Village or wandering into Soho or the East Village or up to Union Square. It's in the very midst of the NYU campus and an easy walk to the High Line, the Whitney Museum, and unlimited bars, clubs, and restaurants, both cheap and…

title: Run Don't Walk to Washington Square Hotel
review: Hello Patricia,  Thank you for the superb review!  Your experience means everything to us, and we will try our best to ensure an amazing time during every stay.

title: There are many things to like about this hotel
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Generally downtrodden and a miserable atmosphere
review: As they say: location, location, location. This place is in a great part of NYC in the middle of Greenwich Village and within close proximity to many wonderful sights, restaurants, and parks, and especially the High Line.

title: Great little hotel
review: Hello,  Thank you for your review!  The Village truly is a magical place in New York, and we are excited to be a part of the ever changing landscape.  We look forward to your next stay with us!

title: Charming with a lot of character
review: We arrived early, so expected some issues at check-in, and to be fair they did try to accomodate, but the room was more of a stress-resistance test than a relaxing experience.  If you're offered the ground floor, do not take it.  Following protestation, we were moved upstairs to another room with a concrete wall and anti-pigeon spikes for a view.  At least this was quiet, though.  Breakfast was hastily consumed in a small windowless box, and then we got out of there into the city for the day.  The main issue really was the attitude of some of the staff, the unhelpfulness of one of the ladies on reception, and the downright sullen silence of the baggage porter just made us want to leave and never come back.  (We won't).  In summary, cannot recommend, but the location is good. …

title: Boutique Hotel with great location
review: This small hotel has staff so friendly you'd think you were in the Midwest. Everyone was very helpful and so nice. Right on Washington Square, it is a great location for everything. Just a block from the subway. The rooms are small, all with one queen bed, but well appointed. Not sure where one would put children - maybe a crib would fit?? They have nice Keurig coffee machines and good coffee. The breakfast is included; in the basement, the free selection is quite extensive (yoghurt, fruit, granola), and one can also order eggs, etc. for a fee. Again, very friendly service. We left our luggage there before check-in, and then they kept our luggage there after we checked out. They encouraged us to use them as a base, use the bathroom, get water, both before and after check-out,…

title: Family Owned Gem
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Nice Hotel in the Village
review: Excellent location right off Washington Square; small but well appointed rooms; underrated restaurant mostly frequented by locals. The staff is friendly and helpful.  If you are visiting NYU this is the place to stay.

title: Fantastic location, comfortable rooms, good service
review: Hello Mr. Maresca,  Thank you for the fantastic review!  We look forward to seeing you again, and wish the best of look to your child on their college applications.

title: Great location; Feel like a local
review: The WSH is in a central, lovely location in the Village, right on Washington Square Park. The rooms are small but recently renovated, and the service and staff are top notch. Would definitely recommend after 4 visits.

title: Perfectly sited hotel for NY
review: Hello J H,  Top notch service is what we aim for, and we are happy to know that we delivered on that for you.  Thank you for visiting, and for continuing to choose The Washington Square Hotel as your first choice when visiting New York.  We look forward to your next stay with us!

title: Close to Subway
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: A wonderful Hotel
review: Google doesnt seem to know all the subway stations. This hotel is literally around the corner from a station. Within walking distance of shops and restaurants. View of the Freedom Tower from end of the street. On the corner, you have Washington Park. Friendly staff and comfortable rooms. Only thing they need are recycle bins.

title: The hotel was lovely, quiet and clean.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.
review: Hello Dena,  Thank you for the superb review!  We appreciate your kind words, and your tip for recycling bins throughout the hotel.  We are always looking for ways to conserve and implement eco-friendly practices.  We look forward to seeing you again soon!

title: AMAZING LOCATION AND STAFF
review: I can not say enough about the staff and beautiful large, clean, and quiet room we were upgraded to. We love the location allowing us to walk to all the areas we enjoy in and around the Village. We can not recommend the Hotel enough. Thanks for a terrific stay.

title: Location + excellent staff = win
review: Hello Stephen,  Thank you for the wonderful review!  It warms us to know that you had such a terrific time with us, and we sincerely look forward to your next stay with us.  We hope to see you again soon!

title: Quiet and comfortable!
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Fabulous location and clean, quiet room
review: We were very happy with our stay. The staff is very helpful, knowledgable, and cheerful. Our room was very quiet and had everything we needed to make our stay great. The hotel provides easy access to 9/11 Memorial, Statue of Liberty, and NYU.

title: great place
review: Hello,  We sincerely appreciate your review of your stay with us.  We are always looking to improve the experience of our guests and feedback is crucial to let us know we are moving in the right direction.  We hope to see you again soon!

title: Easter vacation
review: This hotel is a clean, quiet place to stay in the heart of Greenwich Village. The location is unbeatable -- close to the subway and unlimited restaurants/shops. We walked to Gramercy, Little Italy, Chinatown, Soho, Nolita, the Seaport, and even Battery Park. The price is higher than the least expensive places in the area, but the lower priced options tend to be shared bathrooms and have lower quality appointments. Our room was great -- clean and fresh, comfortable bedding, good water pressure. Not exactly spacious, but definitely plenty of room for 3 adults/luggage in a room with 2 double beds. The cleaning staff was very good, and the front desk was helpful and pleasant. Charles was particularly great. For a hotel of this star level, they do a great job.

title: A nice little hotel in a great location
review: Hello Doctor,  Thank you very much for sharing your experience with us!  We are so pleased to know you enjoyed your stay with us, and that one of us earned special recognition in your review.  We greatly look forward to your next stay in New York!

title: Wonderful hotel in the heart of the west village
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Not great
review: Spent four nights in a superior twin room. On the second floor with a view of Washington Square Park.  I was concerned about noise being so close to street level but it was very quiet.  The staff were efficient, professional and friendly.  The location is fantastic, very close to major subway lines, great restaurants, shopping and we really enjoyed  being in the west village.

title: Beautiful West Village Hotel
review: Hello,  Thank you so much for the wonderful review!  We are thrilled to know you enjoyed your stay, and had such a fantastic experience.  We look forward to your next stay with us!

title: Second time also a charm
review: In any business, the reception received marks a first impression. Upon arrival, the front desk briefly welcomed us, gave us the room card, and then we took our luggage to the room up ourselves!  On several occasions, we asked information about directions or recommendations. The 2 women at the desk were 1) not helpful,  2) not friendly, 3) gave us the WRONG directions to a very local restaurant, 4) and when asked questions, several times they'd look at each other (for help in answering the question). They'd admit they're "not really sure," and would voice an "I think it's ...."  but did NOT make the attempts to find-out "for sure."  The complimentary breakfast was not what we expected. Bagels were stale. We went elsewhere.  The rooms small, but almost all NYC hotel rooms are. We…

title: We'll be back
review: Hello,  We sincerely apologize for the experience you had during your stay with us, and thank you for letting us know.  We are always looking to improve, and feedback is crucial for that process.  While we appreciate you found your room to be comfortable, your experience with our front desk was disappointing, and we will take steps to ensure that does not happen again.  We are also sorry you did not like the breakfast provided; the bread is served fresh every morning, so a stale bagel should not have been present.  First impressions are paramount, and we do hope to earn the chance to show you how great your stay with us can be.  I invite you to contact the hotel directly to discuss in greater detail your stay with us, and how we can make up for it.  Thank you for sharing your experience with us.

title: sink hole beds
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Perfectly located
review: Great hotel and superlative restaurant and bar--great location of course! but HORRIBLE BEDS with sink holes---Barely slept..........nowhere to hang anything---closet is large enough for one winter coat or a few clothes but NOT BOTH -- and for a room for two people, we had no where to hang coats. Clean and good quality sheets and towels.

title: Great location, tired rooms
review: Hello Michele,  We are so sorry you had an issue with your bed affecting your sleep, as well as with the size of your room.  We do have a variety of room types, depending on what you might want or need, and so some rooms are larger than others.  We hope you choose to stay with us again, and allow us to deliver the experience you expect.  We invite you to call the hotel directly to book with us, and we will be happy to find the right room type for you.  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us.

title: Undiscovered gem
review: Washington Square Hotel is situated in a perfect location for people wanting to explore Soho, Noho and Greenwich Village. There are 3 subway stations within very close proximity to the the hotel, making it easy to venture Uptown, Downtown and over to Brooklyn. The friendly, accomodating staff ensure a stay at this hotel is a pleasurable experience. We'll be returning to this affordable little gem in September. Loved it. Elaine & Ron.

title: Great location, not luxurious but nice
review: We stayed here over a weekend due to the proximity to who we were visiting.  The hotel lobby was nice when we entered and the location was great.  The hallway's (we were on the 5th floor) were VERY narrow (hard for 2 people to pass) and the rooms small (as most hotels are in NYC).  The decor is tired and the rooms dark.  We were disappointed that there were no comfortable places in the lobby to lounge or read the paper.  The continental breakfast that is included is minimal, but was fresh.  Great place to stay if you need to be close to anyone that is near Washington Square Park.

title: A fine downtown hotel
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Pictures are better than the actual Accommodations
review: We needed to be near NYU for one night, and the reviews for this hotel were good. For the purpose, its location could not be better, as it is at one corner of Washington Square Park.  My wife had to be at an early session of a conference, and the hotel was very accommodating; there was a room available(414), and they allowed me in at about 9:30 a.m., at no extra charge.  It had no view to speak of; I expect that the rooms with views had been occupied, and thus were not available yet. Not a problem.  The room is small, but not extraordinarily so at this price point.  Everything worked, there is a small closet and a bathroom. Furnishings have an art deco vibe. It was an extremely cold day, and I watched TV for a while, until it was time for me to leave.   There is a passage from…

title: Very nice experience
review: Hello Fred,  Thank you for the great review!  We greatly appreciate you taking the time to share your experience with us.  We hope to see you again soon!

title: Nice, small, quiet hotel
review: We were looking for a hotel near the area of NYU and we found this hotel for a very nice price and apparently with great accommodations based on the pictures and the reviews. We arrived, and to our dismay the rooms were quite small and not at all what we had seen. The rugs were disgusting, to the point that we did not take off ours shoes in the room. The amenities look cheap; I would be better off sleeping in my dorm room. Very disappointed with this place, I totally do not recommend staying here. There are far better hotels in New York for a better price.

title: Charming
review: This hotel has a great location. Rooms and hallways were small, but that's to be expected. The staff was exceptionally nice and friendly. The free breakfast was above average, including waiter service rather than a buffet.

title: Very good hotel that could easily be better
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Weekend Jaunt
review: Our room, among the largest in the hotel, was on an upper level. It was quiet, even with four windows that opened. The bathroom was huge by NYC standards, with a tremendous shower, two sinks and a window. The TV was substandard, but who watches much TV in New York? The lack of competition among hotels in the heart of Greenwich Village may explain why this very good property does not merit a rating of excellent. It really wouldn't take much -- training from the top down in attention to the smallest details, and a touch-up here and there to the interior design and amenities. Still, there is nothing that would prevent us from staying here again, as the location and accommodations are first-rate.

title: Great Weekend Stay
review: Hello,  We greatly appreciate you sharing your experience with us, as well your suggestions for improvement.  We are always looking for feedback to make your stay and experience as best as it can be.  We hope to see you again soon!

title: Quaint hotel in prime location!
review: We had a fantastic time at the Washington Square Hotel.  The rooms were perfect, with a lot of character.  The staff were so hospitable and always smiling, especially the doorman!  Everyone was very accommodating and helpful.  We had both the continental breakfast and a full breakfast in their restaurant.  Both were delicious.  I would highly recommend this hotel!

title: Fantastic!!
review: Hello Sophie,  Thank you for the amazing review.  "Perfect" is definitely a word we hope to hear from a guest,  and we are thrilled perfect describes your stay with us.  We greatly appreciate you recommending us!

title: Washington Square Hotel
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. title: Great Location
review: WSH is our favorite hotel in NYC. We have been staying here for years and we love everything about it. It is located in a great section of the city, with Washington Square Park right across the street. You have 100's of restaurants within walking distance. The subway is less than a block away. You won't find a better place to stay in NYC.

title: NYU Audition
review: Hello Walter,  Thank you so much for your loyalty over the years, we sincerely appreciate your continued patronage.  We look forward to providing you with the same level of service you have come to expect during your stays with us.

title: Vacation
review: This boutique hotel is in a great downtown location near the subway. There are many restaurants within walking distance and Washington Square Park is right outside the door. My room; cozy but had all the basics including free Wi-Fi! (this is huge in NYC). Also important, everything was clean and people were friendly. The only issue with my stay was that I was made to pay upon arrival rather than after. I have a debit MasterCard that I use as a true credit card but they didn't honor that and treated it as a debit card (which forced me to pay upfront). I agree that a reservation is a contract, but I also think that a guest should be able to pay after services are rendered satisfactory in any method they choose best for them.

title: Fantastic stay at WSH!
review: Hello,  We apologize for that initial issue upon check-in.  Unfortunately, with our system, debit cards have the potential to be charged twice when a pre-authorization is placed.  To eliminate that inconvenience, we have to process payment upon arrival, instead of converting the pre-authorization to a payment.  We are happy your stay with us was positive overall, and we look forward to improving your experience during your next stay!

title: Love WSH
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. title: They Treat You Like Family
review: The location of the hotel is wonderful, but the people are the major draw.  Everyone with whom we ever came into contact treated us like family.  Our room was lovely, and there is nothing about our experience that was anything less than perfect.  They went out of their way to assist in ways in which we didn't even know we needed assistance.  If there is a better hotel experience to be had, I am entirely unaware of what it would be.

title: Great place to stay.
review: Hello Sally,  Thank you for sharing your experience with us.  We are so happy to know that your stay with us was nothing short of perfect, and that you felt like family.  We sincerely hope to see you again soon, and look forward to matching your first experience with us!

title: Greenwich Village hotel
review: For a wonderful option to the hustle and bustle of Midtown's toney hotels, this Boutique gem on the edge of Washington Square in Greenwich Village is perfect. the staff could not be more friendly and accommodating, especially the Front Desk Staff  and housekeeping. Be sure to enjoy the delicious restaurant in the hotel called North Square.

title: Perfect
review: Hello Jay,  Thank you for the wonderful review!  We sincerely look forward to your next stay with us, and cannot wait to ensure it is just as perfect.

title: Great location and price
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. title: Very charming and delightful hotel.
review: We stayed for my daughter's audition at NYU. Great price, great location. The room was small but nice, clean, had everything you need. Hotel provided free wi-fi and breakfast. Staff was helpful with everything.

title: Perfect location, restful stay
review: Hello Stacy,  Thank you for the amazing review, we are thrilled your experience with us was great.  Best of luck to your daughter, and we hope to see you on move-in day!

title: A real gem in the Village
review: Charming hotel. Excellent decor. Very clean rooms. Excellent service. Terrific location. We had a wonderful experience and would be happy to return. The breakfast, which is complimentary, was very good; and the service was fine.

title: Iconic New York hotel.
review: Hello Geoffrey,  Thank you for the great review!  We aim for every guest to have a wonderful experience, and we are so happy to know we delivered.  We hope to see you again soon!

title: Highly recommended, great hotel and location
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Great location, excellent hotel
review: Next time we're in NYC we'll try and stay here again.  The WSH is in an excellent location for wandering around by foot. The staff are friendly and helpful. The room was spacious and the bathroom was clean - both room are bathroom were much bigger than other places we stayed in NYC.  Breakfast was great as you could take a few yogurts, fruit cups, some granola and a coffee and go enjoy it in the park right opposite the hotel.  It can get a bit noisy at night (on the street outside) but this is NYC where I'd imagine you'd hear this type of noise anywhere in the city. It wasn't enough to put us off. Would definitely go back. Great value for money.

title: Everything about this hotel was a pleasure!
review: Hello Greg,  Thank you so much for the review!  We are so happy you enjoyed your time with us, and found everything to your liking.  While the village is generally quiet by our location, occasionally there might be some minor noise from outside.  We do offer interior rooms as well, not facing the street, which will definitely offer a quieter stay if that is desired during your next trip to New York.  We look forward to your next stay with us!

title: Wonderful stay in the city
review: My family and I came into the city for a weekend of relaxation, good food and music. I chose this hotel primarily for its location and based on reviews. We were all very pleased! This is an older hotel which has been subtly updated to maintain its connection with its and the neighborhoods history. The beds are very comfortable and the bathroom is clean with nice amenities. The staff is very friendly and Ronnie at the front door is charming, gregarious and a wealth of info on the surrounding area. The complementary continental breakfast was an unexpected treat. The location can't be beat! Washington Square, jazz clubs, great restaurants, Greenwich village all a short walk. My new go-to hotel in NYC!

title: Perfect Location
review: Hello Greg and Kerry,  We sincerely appreciate you sharing the wonderful experience you had with us, as well as with the tripadvisor community.  To be your new go-to is an amazing compliment, and we hope to make each stay just as fantastic.  We hope to see you again soon!

title: Great location and good value hotel
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Tiny Rooms but Great Location
review: Well situated just off Washington Square and reasonably quiet. Good quality bed and decent bathroom well stocked with towels and stuff for bathing. Heating in room efficient and quiet. No noise from adjacent room. Coffee capsule machine in room. Staff and lobby helpful. Feels like a small hotel. Room rate includes free and good wifi and a buffet breakfast room, where the choice is reasonable. There is another room for breakfast with waiter service with much more choice, and is an extra cost. Easy walk to 5th Avenue and Broadway so situation is really good. Strongly recommended

title: Great Boutique Hotel
review: Hello,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review of your stay with us, and for strongly recommending us!  We look forward to your next reservation with us!

title: Perfect location
review: This hotel is perfect for those who are interested in staying near Washington Square Park and are not picky about room size. The continental breakfast is more than adequate and the location was perfect given that my meetings were mostly in the SoHo area. However, my room was barely big enough for one and while my bed was very comfortable, my male colleague told me that his feet stuck out of the end of his bed.   I would stay here again if the price is right, but I would hesitate to stay here if my husband is with me given the space issue.

title: Love Letter to The Washington Square Hotel
review: Hello,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us.  We are glad to know you found your room just right for your stay, but we definitely have rooms that can comfortably accommodate you and your husband.  Before making a reservation we invite you to contact us, and we will gladly walk you through the different room types we offer.  We hope to see you again soon!

title: Location is key
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. title: Good choice, no frills
review: Normally a hotel i could not afford. But got a good deal on a prepay close to my arrival , and i suspect the low price was also due to the fact that   Waverly place was a mess with construction. paid $210.  per night before tax.  So my review is from that perspective.  The staff is very friendly to  you, if  YOU  are friendly and polite. As i witnessed the desk man who was nothing  but nice to me,  Be very  short with a man who was very demanding . So... The hotel has an ideal location that is obvious. the neighborhood has a lot to offer and  quiet within reason .  So much to see and ton and tons of restaurants .  there were people on the street at all hours , so a bit of noise.  nothing bad.  The hotel offers breakfast included in the rate, which is  convenient.  the door man…

title: Another great stay!
review: Hello,  Thank you so much for the positive review!  The village truly is a magical place, and we are glad you love it as much as we do.  We apologize if you were unhappy with the size of your room, we do have a variety of room types available, and some do offer more space.  We invite you to call us at anytime if you have any questions regarding your next reservation with us.  We hope to see you again soon!

title: Great room renovations
review: This is a fine hotel if you do not expect anything fancy. It's a good choice with basic clean, rather small rooms. Everything seems a little dated, but it's working. It's a rather cheap hotel for NYC and the location is perfect. Don't book the cheapest room category ("superior with partial view") as the only view you'll have from their windows is a wall and there's almost no natural light coming in. Take a superior room with full view, they are only a bit more expensive and offer great views over the City.

title: Great location and friendly staff
review: Hello Major,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us.  We appreciate you highlighting the positives of your stay.  We are in the process of renovating many aspects of the hotel, and hopefully your next stay with us will feel a little more updated without sacrificing the historical charm of our property.  We wish you a happy new year!

title: Pleasant (small) rooms;  great location but lack of actual hospitality
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. title: Great value near Washington Square Park
review: Although I live and work locally, occasionally in connection with a business event, I stay at a NYC hotel, too (including last night). Do note that December hotel prices in NYC are sky-high (as they are in the summer, too) because of holiday events, so it's best to look away from midtown. Since I used to live in the West Village, I recalled the Washington Square Hotel and decided to book there. Their rates -- about $275 a night, including tax -- are very reasonable for NYC, and especially good at this time of year.   Pros:  ** Great location steps away from Washington Square Park. Subways (including different lines) are within a 5 minute walk; plenty of restaurants and shopping etc.  ** The room was very small (like a European hotel) but clean, well maintained and had everything…

title: Perfect location. Helpful and friendly staff.
review: This is a very nice and friendly New York City boutique hotel.  Your choice of an express breakfast or larger restaurant, all included.  The hallways are narrow and the rooms small, but it is what you expect in this type of hotel in NYC.

title: Delightful independent hotel
review: Hello,  Thank you for the 5-star review!  We do offer different room types, and some are quite a bit a larger than others.  Please call us when reserving for your next stay with us, we will be more than happy to explain all the options available!

title: Awesome location in the village! Wonderful staff! SMALL
review: Just stayed here this past weekend for my wife's birthday. Walking distance to everything we were looking to see. Included breakfast was nice. Clean simple rooms. Staff was very nice and knowledgeable.

title: Great little hotel
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. title: Awesome location
review: Stayed here last week room 329, excellent little hotel, staff great although they did forget to leave cups one day - however this was quickly remedied by the ladies on reception! Lovely and clean, comfortable bed, no noise at all, we loved our stay at the Washington Square Hotel!!

title: Convenient, clean and comfortable
review: Hello Sarah,  We sincerely appreciate you sharing your experience with us, and letting us know you had such a wonderful stay.  We apologize for the minor lapse in service, and we look forward to making your next stay better than before.  Please come back and see us soon!

title: A nice hotel in the big city
review: The best location to get all around town. Boutique Hotel with great breakfast on Washington Square. Rooms were small, but comfy. Staff was very helpful and their was always a taxi available. A good choice fitting our needs!

title: Great find
review: Hello Linda,  Thank you so much for the wonderful review!  We hope to see you again soon, and we aim to make your next stay even better!

title: Wonderful surprise in a great part of the city
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. title: Awesome Location Terrific Staff Great Neighborhood
review: We had an apartment in the Upper West Side for many years.  Now as visitors we were looking to stay somewhere close to the jazz clubs, shopping and restaurants in the Village.  The Washington Square Hotel is a wonderful property.  Rich in history, clean, nicely appointed rooms, and courteous service!  The bar was fabulous also.  We will definitely be back!

title: Modernized and retains character
review: Hello Irvine,  Thank you so much for the 5 star review!  We look forward to making your next stay just as fabulous!

title: Solid choice; great location
review: We couldn't have been more delighted. The room was small and no great view but... we didn't come to NYC to hang out in the room.   It''S a completely refurbished 100-year old property. Crisp, clean and with an ever so helpful smiling staff.  If you love to walk you won't find a better location to explore Greenwich Village or walk in the Lower East Side. And there's Washington Square. And when the weather's nice you'll find, buskers, chess players, sidewalk artists and the best of New York -- all right across the street.   Free continental breakfast and the coffee was excellent. And here's a tip: just one block down the street is a 24 hour restaurant on 8th Avenue. Also, that's where you can catch the subway to Mid Town. Finally, compared to other properties further uptown, the…

title: Very good hotel at the Washington Square
review: Hello Dexter,  We sincerely appreciate you taking the time to write such a great review, and for sharing your experience with us.  We hope you come back and see us again soon, we cannot wait to delight you once more!

title: OLD
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. title: Great Location
review: Rooms are roomy and nice but for the price the lobby and common areas need to be redone and cleaned up. Also check in was not on time. Front doorman is very nice and helpful. Qverpriced. Some hotel guests looked very seedy.

title: A gem in a wonderful neighborhood!
review: Hello Rita,  We are very sorry to hear that you felt your stay with us was overpriced, and the common areas in need of an upgrade.  Our property is historic, and exudes a certain charm and character that some are attracted to, and we apologize if it was not to your liking.  We appreciate you sharing that you found your room to be nice, and the staff helpful.  We are always looking for ways to improve, and we thank you for sharing your experience with us.

title: Getting worn out
review: I love staying here for the convenience to NYU, the Village, subway, etc., but the bonus is that they have the friendliest staff and I always feel at home here.  Will always stay here if my visit is predominantly centered south of midtown.

title: Do not be fooled by the nice video
review: Hello Inwardian,  Thank you so much for the kind, and heartfelt review.  We are so happy to know that you feel at home when you stay with us.  We are greatly looking forward to your next visit!

title: Very, very nice and eclectic.
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. title: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay
review: We were visiting our son who lives in a studio apartment near Washington Square.  This hotel was perfectly located and we were impressed with the whole experience.  The room was cozy, very clean, and the bed was very comfortable.  We slept very well.  The staff was helpful, and delightfully pleasant.  The complimentary breakfast was simple but filled our tummy's and didn't drain our wallet!  I would have liked to have a small frig to put leftovers from some of our meals in, but not a deal breaker.  We never had to wait for an elevator,  Every time we pushed the button it showed up.  We were on the 6th floor.  This is not a Luxury hotel... which we don't care for... so if you want a reasonably priced (for NYC), clean, quaint, and delightful place to stay then this is it.  We…

title: Very disappointing. Avoid this poorly run hotel.
review: Hello Cathy,  We appreciate you sharing your experience with us, we are so happy to know you enjoyed your stay.  Please come back and see us again soon!

title: A little gem in a great neighborhood
review: My husband and I stayed at the Washington Square Hotel last week for an anniversary trip.  The hotel surprised us with a bottle of champagne in our room.  The room was older but clean.  The staff was very attentive.  We would absolutely stay there again.

title: All Around Diamond
review: Hello Christy,  Thank you for the wonderful review!  Anniversaries are very special to us, and we are glad we were able to be a part of your special day.  We look forward to your next stay with us!

title: Brilliant location, nice staff
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Deja vu
review: We had a very enjoyable three nights at this hotel. The place itself is quite an old building and a bit dated but as a base for exploring the city it is very good and I would definitely stay there again. The room was perfectly good although I would recommend getting a room with a view as the one we had was a bit claustrophobic. However if you are not going to spend much time in the room during the day it's not a big deal.   Washington Square is seconds away and is lovely. There was always stuff going on - buskers etc - and it's nice to go for a stroll. When it's warm there is good shade too. Location wise it's within a mile of the Hudson River, the Highline and nearby West Village on one side. Less than a mile to East Village, union square/Gramercy area and Soho in the other…

title: Loud
review: Hello,  Thank you so much for the wonderful review of your stay with us.  We are happy to know that you enjoyed your stay with us enough to share your experience with the TripAdvisor community.  We look forward to your next stay with us!

title: Great location and the hotel has charm
review: Professional staff who were courteous, helpful and above all friendly; i personally could not have asked for more considering this was my first visit to this great city; the surrounding area to this hotel is beautiful, stunning and ideal for wherever you wish to visit in Manhattan; the rooms were fine, comfy, welcoming, and had the amenities of a gym, bar, restaurant at your disposal along with a continental breakfast which is included in the cost of the hotel.

title: Well situated hotel in fairly quiet area.
review: Hello,  We are so glad to have been a part of your first experience in New York, and we thank you for taking the time to share your feelings with us.  We aim to make your second trip just as special, and just as memorable!

title: Historic, Great location, Huge room
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. title: NY fore the first time with family
review: This is a historic hotel - former guests include Bob Dylan, Rolling Stones etc. It is sort of Art Deco. We were amazed by the size of the room for a NY hotel. Bathroom looked brand new. Continental breakfast was ample. Right near Washington Square Park which merits a walk thru. Just a block away from W 4th st. station where you could get trains to all areas. Will definitely stay there on our next trip to NY.

title: Good location, large room!
review: Hello,  Thank you for the amazing review!  We aim to make your next stay with us just as memorable.  Please come back and see us soon!

title: Quirky independent historic hotel
review: I have been to NY several times for business trips and had promised myself that I should give my family the experience to lie on the lawn in front of the Statue of Liberty. In this context, we booked the hotel on the recommendation of friends and we were not disappointed. Not a Hilton hotel, but a reasonable hotel in decent distance for the most part with OK room (double Queen bed, which was probably too little for four people), and please serviceminded staff and an OK break first buffet.

title: Lovely hotel
review: Hello,  We are so glad to hear we did not disappoint!  Thank you for choosing us for your family trip to New York.  We look forward to improving ourselves to make your next stay with us even better!

title: Superb Hotel
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. title: Lovely stay
review: Stayed for 2 nights at the beginning of October with my sisters.  From checking in to checking out, service was impeccable.  3 of us shared a room on the 1st floor and there was enough room for us all.  Could hardly hear any noise from outside.   The complementary toiletries were fabulous.  Even tried to buy them online when I got home but not available in the UK. Sadly I found out once home that I could have bought them a few blocks away from the hotel.   The Art Deco style of the hotel is lovely.  So much better than more expensive hotels.  The concierge on every morning was very charming and helpful.  The complementary breakfasts were good and the staff were very helpful in assisting one of my sisters who eats a gluten free diet with her choices.   Would not hesitate to…

title: It was nice and good location for lower manhattan
review: Hello Janice,  We sincerely appreciate you taking the time to write such a wonderful review of your stay with us.  We are so happy to know that you will recommend us, and look forward to your next stay!

title: 40th birthday celebration
review: We stayed here for 5 wonderful nights. The position is fabulous and we loved walking around the whole area as there is so much history and quirky places to see. It is around the corner from Washington Square Park where we listened to jazz and classical music being played and it is close to the subway as well as buses if you want to travel elsewhere. We paid extra for an executive room which was totally worth it as it was renovated and had plenty of space. Even though we heard a bit of noise at times it was quiet most of the time. We enjoyed the included breakfast in the restaurant as well as a nice dinner and drinks some afternoons. We had previously stayed in a top hotel in midtown but much prefer the atmosphere of this hotel as well as the area. We will certainly return on our…

title: Nice and Quiet
review: Hello,  We sincerely appreciate you sharing your experience with us, we are so happy to know you had such a wonderful time.  We hope to see you again many times in the future!

title: Wonderful location in the heart of Greenwich Village
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: A few days in New York City
review: A wonderful hotel in the heart of Greenwich village has a perfect location on the Square. We were college shopping in NYC and this spot gave us a chance to savor the NYU ambience and with subway stops just steps away we had access to everywhere else in the city. Our room was very clean and stocked. This hotel is a little old and dated but is quite charming and has a very European feel. The staff was friendly and very helpful. Thank you, Washington Square, we will return!

title: Great location
review: Hello,  Thank you for writing a wonderful review of your stay with us!  We are glad you found us to be charming, as well as friendly and helpful.  We hope to have you return as one of our university parents!

title: Great location great boutique hotel
review: We stayed at this hotel for our first ever trip to New York. The staff were helpful and polite. Our room was spotless and the bathroom well equipped. Breakfast was a buffet style in quite a small room, that would be my only reservation with this hotel, although on our last morning we were seated in the restaurant beneath the hotel because the hotel was fully booked which was fine. The hotel is just around the corner from a subway so attractions can easily be reached. Ideal hotel for a few days in NYC.

title: Great place to stay
review: Hello Susan,  We are so glad you enjoyed your first visit to New York with us, and consider it ideal for a vacation in New York.  We apologize if you were unaware of breakfast being available in our restaurant, we definitely try to inform all guests at check-in of our breakfast times and location.  We hope you come back to see us again soon, and hopefully enjoy breakfast in our restaurant for the entirety of your stay!

title: Fabulous Stay!!!!!
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Be careful who you book through.
review: This was a great hotel. The location is perfect. Near great bars, restaurants, the park, etc. The staff here is tremendous. I saw a couple reviews where people talked poorly about the staff. I cannot even fathom how that is even possible for anyone to have anything negative to say about these people.   We were greeted every single time we passed through the lobby. The doorman offered us unsolicited advice on some fun places to go.....which we thought was awesome. We didn't even have to ask:) They gave us a late checkout at no extra charge. The sweet lady who took care of our room made it look so nice and welcoming every time we returned. The maintenance man was so nice and friendly. Honestly, everyone there just exuded warmth and hospitality. But the cherry on top... One of the…

title: A New York Overnight stay
review: Hello Kelly,  We sincerely appreciate you taking the time to write a rave review, and sharing your experience with everyone.  We apologize for the heat in your room, the air conditioner/heater should have been completely functional, but we are glad to know that the staff responded accordingly, and made your stay comfortable.  We are looking forward to improving your experience during your next stay with us.  Please come back and see us soon!

title: Perfect home from home
review: I booked this hotel on 8/6/2016 for three nights 9/27/2016 through 9/30 through Trip Advisor. I was given a confirmation number and a price for the three nights. When my sister and I arrived at the hotel on 9/27 they had no reservation with that confirmation number and no booking under Trip Advisor. We were very confused and upset. However, The Washington  Square staff were wonderful, found a room and honored the price quoted by Trip Advisor which was less than the price that day. This is a great location with friendly efficient staff, around the corner from the station and breakfast daily. Rooms are a little small but that adds to the character. I will recommend this hotel but will not book through Trip Advisor.

title: Quaint hotel
review: Hello,  We are sorry to hear about the initial confusion when you arrived at the hotel.  A bad first experience is not easy to overcome, and can easily sour a vacation, but we are thrilled to know that we were able to accommodate you, and that you enjoyed your stay!  If you ever have any questions regarding a future reservation with us, we encourage you to contact the hotel directly, and we will help you in any way we can.

title: Great Base for NYU
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Favorite NY hotel!
review: This is a lovely hotel, staffed by warm and friendly people. The room was pretty small, but very comfortable, and a simple, but tasty continental breakfast included with your booking. If you are visiting NYU, this is the perfect base. My only complaint was an awful smell in our room that never went away! I did mention it to the front desk, and they told me that our floor was due for renovation.

title: In need of some TLC
review: Just returned from our fourth stay at Washington Square Hotel and it still exceeds our expectations! We love the friendly, helpful staff who always ask about our day and seem genuinely interested in hearing about our adventures in the city! The hotel is quaint and cozy with a very European feel. The rooms are on the small side, but the lighting is great, the beds are very comfortable, and the dressing table in the bedroom is perfect for doing hair and makeup. Light breakfast, including yogurt & granola, cut fruit, assorted bagels and muffins is included and the perfect way to start the day. A full service restaurant is also available. Located diagonally across from the beautiful Washington Square, this little gem is a haven from the hustle and bustle of New York. We sleep…

title: Great location, warm welcome, slept soundly.
review: Hello Kim,  Thank you very much for the glowing review!  We certainly try our best to be consistent, and we will always try to exceed your expectations.  We look forward to your next stay with us!

title: closest hotel next to NYU
review: Reading through other reviews here, much is said about room size but which for us was fine - perhaps smaller than we've seen elsewhere in the US but travelling from the UK, I've seen (and stayed in) much much smaller! And looking through the website, we were drawn to the charm this hotel must have exuded considering the guests it has welcomed over the years. Sadly, though, I've deliberately used the past tense here as, whilst the bedrooms & great bathrooms are clean & tidy the corridors and landings remain in a past age (and not a particularly nice past age!) with Artex swirls on the walls and day glow 70's carpets all well past their best. In fact none of the communal areas we saw were particularly inviting. Breakfast, on both days we stayed had rather surly staff in attendance…

title: Charming!
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood.
