Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Location and value
review: During a recent trip to New York, my friend and I decided to stay in Greenwich Village and found the Washington Square Hotel.  The staff were extremely friendly and were eager to help with suggestions for restaurants and things to do in the evening.  The hotel is charming!  The rooms are on the smaller side but very clean and the beds are SO comfortable.  It reminds me of a boutique hotel that you might find in Europe.  We will definitely stay here again.

title: Great Location with a Friendly Staff
review: Hello,  We greatly appreciate you taking the time to share the wonderful experience you had with us.  We look forward to being just as charming, and friendly during your next stay with us!

title: A simple and pleasant hotel in a good location
review: WSH is in a great location, on the NE corner of Washington Square Park.  Cool lobby (deco) and overall vibe. Concierge service that is uber helpful. Decent gym with a Cybex machine. Epic value for NYC. Breakfast included. Connected to a fine little bar and lounge.   Minuses: rooms run from small to tiny. No comfortable seating in room. (Just a tiny grade school chair. But that is all that would fit). Claustrophobic hallways that echo every conversation and door slam.   But I quibble. Overall a good experience and great value.

title: Enjoyed our stay
review: Hello Rick,  Thank you so much for the great review!  We are happy to know that you enjoyed your stay with us, and we look forward to your next visit.

title: Great location, ok hotel
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. title: Amazing!!!
review: Very good location, close to metro and a park. The hotel room was in good condition, the hall smelled a bit old. Smiley and friendly staff. Included breakfast is fair enough. I'd come back to this hotel.

title: Terrible room
review: Hello Bjorn,  Thank you for writing a positive review of your stay with us!  We are glad to know that you will be returning again.  We apologize if the hallway smelled old to you, August was extremely hot, and humid in New York and unfortunately that may have played a role in the situation.  We are most certainly looking forward to your next stay with us!

title: Wonderful Hotel and Great Location
review: I usually never leave reviews but I couldn't help myself with this one!!! The staff was incredibly welcoming and catered to our every single need all throughout our stay. Our room was big enough for my boyfriend and I, the view was great, and it was CLEAN! We honestly have no complaints about this hotel. The location was perfect for our needs. I would LOVE to come back again and stay longer!!! If you're looking for a hotel in New York...look no further!!! This is it!!

title: Charming hotel with hospitable, friendly staff....great place to stay!
review: Hello Sameen,  We sincerely appreciate you breaking your own rules, and sharing your experience with us!  We are so happy to know you loved your stay, and were moved to write a review.  We would love to have you come stay with us again!

title: The door is opened and a different world is there!
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. title: weekend stay
review: This hotel is a gem in the city.   The location is unbeatable because Washington Square is almost part of your room. The team at the hotel is lovely and always always trying to help and they do help a lot!  Again, a place to visit and stay and relax!

title: Great option - salty, indifferent staff
review: Hello,  We sincerely appreciate your positive review regarding your stay with us, as well as your experience with our staff.  We definitely try our best to help in any way we can, and we are glad to know that we were able to deliver an experience.

title: A bit of history, wonderful stay, wonderful location
review: great location walk to the attractions ofgreenwich village and easy walk to the whitney museum friendly and attentive staff clean room and very comfortable beds the subway is close by for longer distance exploration

title: charmless hotel
review: Hello Mike,  Thank you for the wonderful review!  We sincerely appreciate you sharing your experience with us.  Please come back and visit soon!

title: Lovely one night stay
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: If it was good enough for Bob Dylan........!
review: We stayed at this hotel for one night and were very comfortable.  We were 4 people in the room, and the beds were full size, the sheets were incredibly soft, the bathroom very large with 2 sinks and great water pressure.  There was a coffee maker (Keurig), we were able to watch the Olympics on tv, and we had a good time.  The staff were very kind, and there was a delicious complimentary breakfast where the staff brought the food offerings to your table in the downstairs restaurant.  Overall, a very lovely experience.  Definitely recommend.

title: Love this hotel!!
review: Hello Gabriella,  We are so happy you enjoyed your time with us!  Thank you so much for the kind review, we do hope you will come back and visit soon.

title: Sentimental Favorite
review: Located in Greenwich Village, this small art deco hotel is a home from home after a day's sightseeing in New York City. Washington Square Park is very close, as is New York University. The subway is only a few minutes' walk and a variety of eateries are also within a short walking distance.  Our hotel room was small but clean and the ensuite had a large shower area. The restaurant and bar are compact and intimately decorated. A continental style breakfast is included in the overall price, which makes a stay here very reasonable by NYC standards. An a-la-carte breakfast can be purchased but we found the inclusive breakfast to be quite sufficient.  The staff are attentive and friendly and a special thank you must go to Ronnie who provided us daily with a list of local attractions.…

title: Disappointing
review: Hello Millinger,  We greatly appreciate you sharing your experience with the TripAdvisor community,  it is fantastic that you enjoyed everything about your stay with us.  We look forward to your next visit!

title: Summer vacation
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: big room in the big city
review: Stay here twice in the summer, good location, breakfast buffet not so good. The rooms are small, the staff - some very helpful some seemed unhappy in their jobs, not sure why. would probably stay here again.

title: Charming boutique hotel
review: Modern boutique hotel in an awesome location in Manhattan. Had a great one night stay in this hotel.  Huge room for the city with the nicest shower I have ever had in a hotel.  The complimentary breakfast was limited and in a small space but well presented and offered take out bags for those on the go. Highly recommend.

title: Location! Location! Location!
review: Hello,  We sincerely appreciate you taking the time to share your experience with us!  We are glad to know that you enjoyed the breakfast included with your stay, however, we wanted to apologize if you were unaware that breakfast is also served in our restaurant, and not just in the lobby cafe.  We hope to see you again soon, and hopefully for more than one night!

title: Interesting place
review: This hotel is in an excellent location just off Washington Square Park. It has a lot of charm, and the staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are not large, but they are comfortable. Many New York hotels have very small bathrooms, but the ones in this hotel are normal sized. There is a free continental breakfast as well, and also free wifi. A good choice if you want a hotel in Greenwich Village.

title: Excellent location
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Amazing location, in the heart of the Village, attentive staff and great value for money!
review: Washington Square Hotel is maybe not the most up to date hotel in the city, but it is small enough to feel cozy, it has really helpful staff, nice bar, good breakfast and good pricing.  Rooms are not very large, and not all of them have great view, but they are all very clean and comfortable.  Greatest value of this hotel by far is its location; Washington square park is the very heart of New York city and living there while visiting is simply imperative. This hotel have one of the very best locations in the city if you want to feel the city (and you should).  I have been in New York many times, and stayed in this hotel (which is my very first choice when booking) few times (not always due to room avaliability).

title: Perfect for NYU visit
review: Hello,  Thank you so much for writing a wonderful review of your stay with us.  In a city with an abundance of options, we greatly appreciate being your first choice when planning a trip to New York, and we look forward to your continued patronage.  For your next stay with us, please let us know if you would like to request one of our larger rooms with a view, and we will do our best to make it happen!

title: Lovely hotel in great location
review: New York has that most amazing of properties, which is to do with the fact that, no matter when you go, and no matter how many new beds in town may have been added thanks to new hotels being built etc., it is always an expensive place to stay, particularly if you want to stay outside of touristy Times Square. I had been recommended this place by friends, and I love the Village and just generally Lower Manhattan (Lower East side, Chelsea, the Meatpacking district, SoHo, etc.), so I decided to give it a try for what was at the time very reasonable rates. I must say, the hotel's location is amazing, right on the same Washington Square where Bob Dylan used to go for inspiration, and on a very quiet, leafy street (for New York that is!). Staff were very friendly and always helpful,…

title: Jewel of a hotel in a great location
review: Hello Nomoss,  Thank you for writing a positive review of your stay with us.  We are glad to know that you found our staff attentive, and our property charming.  In a city with no shortage of options,  we thank you for choosing us, and continuing to choose us in the future.  We look forward to your next stay with us!

title: Nice but nothing special
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Lovely Boutique Hotel in Greenwich Village
review: Great location.  Room are quite small but not tiny.  Everything is very clean.  Nice amenities.  But hotel has no real personality.   It is just a place to sleep.  Eat the complementary breakfast in the restaurant and NOT in the hotel lobby.  Restaurant much nicer environment and wait staff extremely friendly and helpful.  Check in  and housekeeping service very friendly but slow.  We tried to check in at noon.  Told to come back at 3.  We came back at 5 and our room was still not ready.  First day we were here went out for 7 hours.  Came back to our room at 3.30.  Room had still not been made up.   We had paid extra for a queen bed.  They gave us a full and said they didn't have any queens available.  Didn't do anything to compensate us.

title: 40th wedding anniversary
review: Hello Susan,  We are very sorry to hear about the bad experience you had while staying with us.  We definitely try our best to have every room ready on time, and clearly we dropped the ball with you.  We would love to have the opportunity to show you that the experience you had was not typical.  If there is anything we can do to make up for what happened, please reach out to us, and we will be more than happy to take care of you.

title: Great Stay
review: Bordering the Park as it does helps give the hotel an ambience of quaint yet refined. The interior was warm and the front desk staff always friendly. Other reviewer have said rooms were small but ours seemed adequate with the queen bed. Our bed was a little hard but not too bad, and everything was quite clean. The bathroom was also reasonably sized. The continental breakfast, in room coffee, gym and bath amenities were also nice to have. We loved being able to walk around the neighborhood and park, and everything felt reasonably secure. The room we had was on the back of the hotel and very quiet too. We would recommend going to the restaurant for breakfast, as it seemed a tad more civil and friendly than the reception room off the lobby. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our stay,…

title: Average at best
review: Hello,  Thank you for the wonderful review, we are happy to know that you had a lovely stay with us!  We apologize you felt the mattress was a little hard, unfortunately new mattresses can sometimes be stiff.  We are definitely looking forward to your next stay with us, and we will be sure to guarantee a bed that is just right.  Come back and see us soon!

title: Weekend away
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Still a favorite
review: The hotel was small and the rooms were also small, but they were very clean and very well maintained. It has an amazing location just outside of Washington Square  Park in Greenwich Village. Overall a very good value for a New York City hotel. If you're looking for a quieter neighborhood to stay in this may be for you.

title: Charming boutique hotel in great location
review: Hello Ronald,  We greatly appreciate you sharing the positives of your stay with us, and with the Tripadvisor community.  We are sorry you felt your room was small, we do have a variety of room types to accommodate different wants/needs; for next time we will do our best to fulfill a request for a larger room.  We are looking forward to your next stay with us!

title: Perfect location for lovers of the Chelsea-Village area
review: I've been at this hotel before, and requested to be put here on a work trip. As always, the people at the front desk and in lobby are invariably warm, friendly, and helpful. I had a high floor room this time, with a nice extended view over the roofs of nearby low buildings, and it made me appreciate even more the openable windows...  as well as the great bedding, stylish lobby and rooms, coffee maker, free wi-fi and continental breakfast, and nicely tiled bathrooms. The Washington Square is in such a great location, and each time I return it makes me happy to be there. Here's an odd tip: if you are missing your home exercise, take the stairs! I always do once I don't have luggage, and quite enjoy it. Though the art deco elevators are nice too.

title: Excellent European style hotel in great location
review: Hello,  Thank you so much for the wonderful review, and for continuing to choose us when you stay in the city.  We cannot wait to see you again, and will strive to maintain the same level of service you have come to expect.

title: Old hotel with inexperienced staff
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Historically elegant and beautiful
review: This hotel is located across from Washington Square Park, which is convenient if have business in the area or at NYU.  The hotel is best described as old, rundown and with narrow staircases and maze like hallways.  The rooms are small and with outdated furniture, and a small tv that hangs near the ceiling.  Good customer service eludes the front desk staff, they were consistently rude at check in and check out.  I was charged a rate different than the room rate I reserved under, so definitely check your bill.  I checked out at 5:30 a.m. before going to the airport and when checking my bill, noticed that they charged me for the night that I was checked out for.  When I pointed that out, the front desk person indicated that technically I should be charged since it was the morning…

title: Good location and neigborhood
review: We stayed for 2 nights while visiting family in Manhattan.  It was quaint and well appointed. After a long day of trecking through the city seeing sites the shower was A-MA-ZING.  The only draw back is it is an old (yet beautifully maintained) building and not sound proofed well.  Our room came with windows facing street and sidewalk level so it was not quiet.  I would definitely stay at this hotel again however!! And probably will.

title: Nice hotel in a great location
review: Hello Toni,  Thank you so much for the positive review!  We apologize you felt your room was a bit noisy, unfortunately room assignments are always going to be based on availability, but we will definitely try to place you higher during your next stay with us.  Come back and see us again soon!

title: Wonderful hotel in a great area
review: My husband and I stayed at the Washington Square Hotel in April. We were in town for a memorial service.  It was in a good location.  Nice neighborhood. Continental breakfast was good.  Our room was small but it served our needs. Check in was slow as their was some confusion over the rate.  We got it figured out eventually.  It was reasonably priced for New York.

title: Good location; nice hotel with basic amenities
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Great hotel
review: This was my first time staying in East Village in NYC.  This hotel is in a great location-  near many stores, shops, eateries- easy access to the subway  There is a continental breakfast included which is good- fruit cups, tea, coffee, croissants and bagels, muffins.  The front desk service is a little uneven.  We arrived very late to check in and the desk clerk was outstanding- furnishing us with all kinds of aids (brochures, information).  The check out clerk was less than stellar . He claimed he could not print out my boarding pass as the "computer' was sluggish- although I waited about 45 minutes for my cab in the lobby.  The night before, the clerk was good enough to offer to print it out and directed me to an iiPad printer.  I should have taken advantage of his request at…

title: great location
review: My husband and I stayed at this cute little hotel on the recommendation of good friends who are from the city. We found the staff to be very helpful, the room and bed to be comfortable and the bathroom was roomy. The location in the village is so convenient and felt like home. Can't wait to come back for another visit!

title: Perfect location!
review: Hello Abbie,  Thank you so much for the kind review!  We aim to be even better the next time you stay with us.  We are very much looking forward to your next stay with us!

title: Bad Bed
review: I staid at the WSH for a week and had a very pleasant experience. The location is great, nice jazz clubs in the area. Hotel staff very helpful and friendly. The free breakfast is ok, if you just need a quick bite, but if you want something more elaborate you can use the hotel's restaurant and plenty of places in the area. Definitely recommend the place. Noise level of other guests was at times an issue, people being inconsiderate of others, but can't blame the hotel for that. Good experience!

title: Low key boutique hotel in excellent location
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Well-Located and Clean
review: I have just spent a week at the Washington Square Hotel and really enjoyed the stay. It was the first time I'd been to this part of NYC and the hotel was perfectly located to Washington Square Park, Greenwich Village and subway to anywhere in Manhattan and Brooklyn. The room was compact but very tidy and clean. Staff were helpful and friendly and breakfast included each morning more than enough to satisfy. I felt rather at home here and would stay again when next in New York.

title: Big disappointment.
review: Hello Louise,  Thank you so much for the wonderful review!  For you to feel at home is an amazing compliment, and we hope to ensure that you feel the same way each time you stay with us.  It would be our pleasure to have you come back and visit!

title: Perfect location for the village
review: The subway A train from the JFK Air Train drops you 1/2 block from the Hotel.  It only takes about 45 mins, and costs just $7.50 - greatly reducing transportation costs.  The Hotel is central to most things NYU and Greenwich Village-related.  The room was quite small, but very clean, and appointed with all the necessities.  The rate included a continental breakfast, well-stocked with quality fare, which mercifully stayed open until 11 AM.  The staff was helpful, and service-oriented.  I booked through TripAdvisor.com, and was traveling solo, and felt this influenced the location of my room away from the street, next to the elevator shaft.  Also, felt like I should have paid 15-20% less for what I got, but in NYC convenience apparently has its price.  Assuming I was not on too…

title: Very Cool Hotel!
review: Hello Randall,  Thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us.  We appreciate all feedback, and we do apologize you felt what you paid for was not 100% worth it.  We try to fulfill all requests if possible, and we will be sure to make note of your preferences.  We certainly hope you come back and see us again soon!

title: West Village Charmer
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Nice area, a regular hotel
review: Boutique hotel at Washington Square offers convenience, comfort and value. The rooms are small and clean. The staff is attentive. Our 7th room was quiet with partial view of the park. Defintely would return if I wanted to be in Lower manhattan. Our only issue was breakfast. A  quite acceptable continental breakfast is available two ways. First there is a self service location where you can sit and eat or take away. The other option is a cute dining room where you can be served the free continental breakfast or order al carte.We tried both. The dining room needs some staff management to make it a winner. Finally Babbo is less than 50 yards from the font door and Il Mulino and Minetta Tavern are both a 5 minute walk.

title: Still a great value hotel with history
review: Hello Charlie,  Thank you so much for the kind review! We would like to apologize you felt there were some lapses during the breakfast service, but we do appreciate you sharing as feedback is crucial for improvement.  We hope to see you again soon!

title: Excellent Location
review: I found reception staff to be helpful when I asked questions.The doorman is very welcoming and friendly. The room was small, clean and comfortable however you could hear other guests coming in at night and talking in general.  The hotel is located close to New York University, Washington Square and many good bars, cafes and restaurants. The hotel is not on a major road so gets little traffic noise. It is a beautiful area worth exploring for the architecture and ambience. It is also not far from the high-line, Hudson River walk and interesting surrounding districts. Close by (a couple of train stops away or walking if you like walking), is Union Square, Gramercy Park and East Village.  The hotel offers complimentary continental breakfast that was good, consisting of breads…

title: Fabulous 50
review: Hello Carri,  We greatly appreciate your positive review of your stay with us.  We do apologize for the confusion during breakfast, there is seating available in our restaurant, as the lobby space is intended for taking things on the go.  We hope to see you again soon, and we will definitely try to have a quieter room for you during your next stay.

title: Perfect for NYU parents
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: A Warm Welcome
review: We stayed in the hotel for 6 nights to help our son move out of campus and find a new place for the fall.  The location is the best for NYU parents. We noticed a few parents coming for graduation ceremony with their kids.   Very comfortable beds and clean bathroom.  Breakfast is good too but there are too many good eats close by you do not want to miss either.   The only  complaint is the check in process.  We arrived at 240pm and had to wait till exact 3pm to be checked in.  The front desk girl who helped us was not friendly either.

title: Extremely helpful
review: Hello,  We are so very sorry to hear your check-in experience was not the most pleasant.  We do our best to accommodate early arrivals, however, early check-in is always subject to availability.  We are glad to know that your time with us otherwise was pleasant, and positive.  We do hope to see you again soon!

title: Made my stay a real pleasure!
review: I had an emergency at home in January and needed a place to stay for a few days near home.  I have often passed the Washington Square Hotel and wondered what it is like.  It is certainly on an attractive corner of Waverly Place and Macdougal Street just across from famous Washington Square Park; the northwest corner where public executions took place in earlier centuries.  I decided this was just the place for me.  I had an inside room which looked out on an air shaft.  This was fine for me.  I just thought of Melville who has associations with the area and his character, Bartleby.  But if I were on vacation I would want to look out on either of the streets.  I liked my room and was quite comfortable.  I loved the lobby which has beautiful tile and wood work.  A copy of…

title: The Best of Greenwich Village
review: Hello John,  Thank you so much for the wonderful review!  We are thrilled you found the accommodations more than satisfactory.  We definitely hope to see you again soon!

title: Quaint with a flare and Amazing location
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Great value, great location, lovely place.
review: Amazing location. Hotel was closer to an inn. But the continental breakfast was very well organized, which Chobani yogurt, fruits, croissants, and different types of toasts and breads. Jams, nuttella, and various teas and coffees were included. The overall feeling of the hotel however was a little dark for an April evening or day, but I'm sure during the winter months, it would have been very charming. The washroom and toilet areas were super clean, and there was also a tea and coffee set in the bedroom. The size of the space was average, and much smaller than a commercial hotel, however much more than adequate as a boutique hotel. The choice of the hotel was made for me by an inviting institution, and was not the usual contemporary or modern hotel I would usually book, but am…

title: NYU Visit
review: Hello,  Thank you for taking the time to write a constructive review.  We are always looking for ways to improve, and so your feedback is crucial into making those changes a reality.  We apologize you felt the atmosphere was dark, and will work to ensure a brighter feeling for every month.  We are definitely aiming to change that B+ to an A+!  We hope to see you again soon.

title: Great little hidden treasure!
review: Hard to beat this value in this location.  The rooms and bathrooms are small, yes, but really, why do you need much space?  They are clean and the staff is very helpful and pleasant.  I will stay here again on my next visit to NYC.

title: Nice hotel, great staff
review: Hello Tripster,  We greatly appreciate your positive review, and hope we can make your next stay with us just as comfortable and enjoyable!

title: Not what I expected.
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Yeah.... No
review: I was a bit disappointed in the Washington Square Hotel - the pics on their website were charming.  I expected "more charming".  My first room was really small, I am thankful I said something to the front desk and was offered a larger room.    Continental breakfast is included.  Location is excellent for the Village and Washington Square/ NYU.   European travelers will feel right at home.

title: Fab hotel for a NY city break
review: Hello Margaret,  We are so sorry to hear you felt the website was not representative of the room you were initially given.  We are, however, glad to know that our front desk staff was responsive in taking care of the issue to your satisfaction.  We do offer a variety of room types, and take guest's requests very seriously.  We hope you choose to stay with us again, and please do not hesitate to let us know what you are looking for.  We will do our best to fulfill any request you might have.

title: Small but central
review: This hotel isn't "charming," it's just bad.  The rooms are just tiny (yes, yes, I know... NYC.... trust me, even for NYC they're tiny).  Furnishings are cheap.  Floor squeaks.  Hallways are claustrophobic.  Bathroom is miserable.  We stayed here because of its proximity to NYU, but learned our lesson - stay in a "real" hotel elsewhere in Manhattan, and leave some extra subway time to get to NYU.

title: Great Neighborhood Hotel-Close to Everything
review: We stayed here for 4 nights and had a really comfortable stay. We booked a deluxe queen room which I guess was slightly larger than the "small" rooms. We overlooked the street and at times it was noisy from the traffic but it didn't keep us awake - the bed was extremely comfortable! Breakfast consisted of fresh orange juice, tea, coffee, toast, bagels, pastries, fruit salad and cereals, which was fine for the few nights we were there - it was great to have breakfast included. The concierge are extremely helpful and get your day off to a great start by pointing you in the right direction! Location great for subway and bus and Washington Park is a great spot to catch the sun at the end of the day after walking around the city.

title: A hotel with character and soul.
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Location is Perfect
review: Washington Square Hotel is a hotel with history, character and soul.  It befits its location on the Northwest corner of Washington Sq Park in the village. The staff is friendly and knowlegeable. Easy subway access.Free Wi Fi and no attitude.  I'll be back.

title: Lovely hotel in great area
review: Hello Ed,  Thank you for taking the time to write a positive review of your stay with us.  We are happy to know that you found us friendly, and the hotel full of character and soul.  We definitely hope to see you again soon!

title: Friendly staff
review: Recently, I returned to the Washington Square Hotel.  I'm very glad I did.  Washington Square Hotel boasts an amazing location.  Not only is Washington Square right outside the door, but everywhere I wanted to go, West Village, East Village, Lower East Side, Chelsea, were just a few minutes walk.  Since the last time I visited the hotel, the breakfast service has improved a lot.  Currently, breakfast is offered in the North Square Restaurant.  One unfortunate element, the coffee is terrible!  However, there is a coffee maker in the room, and Stumptown is just around the corner. The room was very clean and comfortable.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  Overall, the place seems to be more homey and cheerful than in the past.

title: Perfect location
review: Hello Violet,  We are so glad to hear that we improved, and that you had a wonderful stay again.  We will do our best to keep up the good work, and hope to see you again soon!

title: Convenient and charming
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Extremely friendly staff.....
review: The location was great, right on the corner of Washington Square and convenient to NYU, New School, transportation, and restaurants galore, and the staff very helpful.  The room was quite pleasant and large enough, not always the situation at NYC hotels, and the price was reasonable.  An adequate continental breakfast was included in the restaurant downstairs.  I also ate dinner there one evening and was pleasantly surprised by the atmosphere and food.

title: Not good value for money
review: Hello Clifford,  We are so glad to hear you enjoyed your stay with us, and found your accommodations better than expected.  We hope to see you again soon, and hopefully we can be great again for you.  Thank you for the wonderful review!

title: Charming; great location
review: I stayed in this hotel on three Consecutive Business trips, with two other colleagues. The location of the Hotel is excellent, as it is accessible to Transport links, restaurants and shops etc.  On all three occasions the room was immacutely cleaned, the hotel staff were very friendly and approachable.  The Breakfast, which I paid for in addition was great.....very filling, no lunch required and it set me up for the day. I've forgotten the Concierge's name, but great....what a character,  very knowledgeable.  Thank you for a wonderful and personable stay.

title: Well run, clean, boutique-style hotel
review: Hello Anne,  We are so grateful for the kind words, and want to thank you for the wonderful review.  Consistency is a hallmark of truly great service, and it provides us great motivation to know that we have consistently ensured a positive experience for you.  We will do our best to make your fourth time with us just as great, if not better.  We look forward to your next stay with us!

title: Great location, wonderful hotel
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Great spot!
review: My husband and I spent 5 days here and found it to be a great hotel. It is centrally located and 1/2 block away from the subway station. The rooms are nice with plenty of clean towels, bathrobes and other amenities. They have a free continental breakfast with a very good supply of fresh fruit, pastries and cereal. We would definitely stay here again if we return to New York city.

title: Small, quaint and right next to Washington Square
review: Hello Kip,  Thank you so much for your kind words.  We are so happy to know that you and your husband had such a wonderful time, and would stay with us again.  We hope to see you again soon!

title: Functional and not much else
review: Awesome area right near Washington square park, clean and spacious rooms, friendly and accommodating staff! They have bath robes!  As an infrequent business traveler, the folks at WSH were easy to work with and very knowledgeable of the area.

title: What a lovely stay
review: Hello Bill,  We greatly appreciate your kind words, you were awesome too!  Hopefully, business or pleasure will bring you to New York again.  We are looking forward to your next stay with us!

title: Good place to stay in NYC
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood.
