title: A Decent Value
review: Small, family run hotel.  Breakfast is available.  Very helpful, pleasant staff.  Close to bus station and metro.  Useful place to stay if you want to get around NYC.  Right in Greenwich Village.  Shops and restaurants nearby.  Nice, central location.

title: Right in the Middle of the West Village
review: Hello Shantha,  Thank you so much for your kind review! Our location in the city is definitely unparalleled.  We appreciate you sharing the highlights of your stay with the tripadvisor community, and we hope to see you again soon.

title: Superb hotel
review: Nothing fancy, but a good location for travelers who want to be close to Greenwich Village.  The lobby staff is active, friendly, and helpful.  Room rate includes an acceptable continental breakfast in the adjoining cafe.

title: Greenwich Village Gem
review: Hello Jeff,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review of your stay with us.  We are always looking for ways to improve, and greatly appreciate your constructive words.  We would very much like to see you again in the future, and have the opportunity to show you our improvements.

title: Best hotel in NY!
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: A so-so experience
review: I have visited New York several times and can safely say this is the best hotel I have stayed in. It is great value for money in a fabulous location. Right next to W4 St subway stop you can get anywhere in the city easily. You are also in the middle of Greenwich Village so loads of good nightlife nearby. The staff are lovely here, so friendly and nothing is too much trouble for them. The rooms are small (but this is NY!) well maintained and very clean. The toiletries are from CO Bigelow, a lovely old fashioned pharmacy down the street. Breakfast is a tasty continental mix with bottomless coffee/tea. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting the city.

title: Great Place to stay, superb location!
review: Hello Nina,  Thank you so much for the kind review!  We are beyond grateful, and are happy you had such an amazing experience.  Please come back and see us soon!

title: Delightfully Bohemian Chic, Boutique Hotel
review: The location is in the Village and close to NYU. Great neighborhood across from Washington Square. The hotel room was very small, the furnishings were not an acceptable quality. The carpet was dirty and the furnishings were old and adequate, but not well maintained. The staff were friendly and helpful. I would probably not choose to stay there again, but it wasn't awful. OK for the price. The restaurant adjacent to the hotel (North Square) was superb and would recommend whether you stay at the hotel or not.

title: What more could you ask for?
review: Hello DC,  We are so sorry to hear about your stay with us.  We are always trying to improve, and always looking for ways to ensure an amazing time for all of our guests.  A so-so experience is definitely not something we strive for, and we will implement the necessary adjustments to make sure it does not happen again.  Thank you for writing about your stay with us, and hopefully we can have the opportunity to win you back.

title: East Village art deco gem within minutes of 5th Avenue and West 4th Street Subay
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: A total score!
review: We had the pleasure of staying three nights at the Washington Square Hotel in late February and would thoroughly recommend to travellers, business people or NYU Academics looking for a pleasant base to travel/commute from in East Greenwich Village. Taking the AirTrain and Subway from JFK we had a 5 minute walk from the subway exit to the front entrance of the hotel. We later found the exit on the corner of 6th and Waverly Place that was even closer. The hotel is a lovely old art deco hotel which somehow has been maintained/refurbished to not feel old at all, but rather "lived in". Reception were friendly, helpful and efficient and the security guy was full of great tips for things to see and do. As far as rooms go, ours was not big, but was roomy enough for a couple with three…

title: Location
review: Hello Trevor,  Thank you for highlighting the positives of your stay with us.  It is great that you found the front desk friendly, and the breakfast enjoyable.  Thank you as well for bringing the cold room to our attention, we are very sorry about that.  Every room is supposed to have an extra blanket in the closet, and we will make sure that is not overlooked in the future.

title: A great hotel
review: Anyone who thinks it's not possible to stay in a pleasant hotel in a prime location in the city and pay less than $200 a night with a lovely breakfast included, has now been proven wrong! In town for some college interviews with my son, I zeroed in on the hotels in closest proximity with a moderate price tag and positive enough reviews and we luckily landed here at Washington Square Hotel. Of course it's old, the hallways are oddly narrow, and the bathrooms are a bit ehh, but I assure you that you can expect to get a good nights sleep and to be greeted by a pleasant front desk staff to help orient you. It felt very old school in the best possible way and has an inviting entrance. You can walk across the street to Washington Square Park, Ben's pizza is a couple blocks down and…

title: Perfect location
review: Hello Gaby,  We greatly appreciate you writing about your stay with us.  While we are happy to hear that you found your stay lovely, and the front desk pleasant, we do apologize you felt the bathrooms were not up to par.  We do have rooms with renovated, modern bathrooms, and we will try our best to make sure that request is fulfilled when you next stay with us.

title: College Visit
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Great cozy stay where you feel like a treasured guest.
review: Very nice quaint and affordable hotel near NYU campus. Small enough to be personable but still nice. Definitely recommend to families visiting the university to get immersed in the immediate surrounding neighborhood. A very important piece of the decision making process for college. And helpful for a parent's comfort level.  Enjoy.

title: Super location, tiny room, excellent value, good breakfast
review: Hello Robyn,  Thank you for writing a positive review of your stay with us!  We are glad you found your stay to be enjoyable, and the environment to be family-friendly.  Should your child choose to attend NYU, come back and see us again!

title: Expensive but great quality
review: Many trips to NYC and this is now our go-to hotel.  Great price for the coziest stay with friendliest staff.  Ronny in the lobby is so very friendly and extremely helpful.  We will continue to return to this little hidden treasure on the campus of NYU.

title: Why stay near Times Square? Bob Dylan once lived here.
review: Hello,  Thank you so much for the glowing review!  We absolutely try our best to ensure every guest has an amazing experience during their stay, and it is beyond rewarding to know that we have delivered on that for you.  Your continued patronage is most appreciated!

title: Best lacation in town for the gay pride parade,and the village in general.
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Cozy spot for Greenwich Village stay
review: Very nice hotel in the best spot in the village. The parade goes a block north and a block west ,so you can get away from it ,recharge and go back for the rest, (Its about 5 hours). Washington square park always has something amusing going on. The hotel gives a free breakfast. Just a few blocks to the subway.

title: Did the trick
review: After years of spending every NYC visit in Midtown, our tickets to an off-Broadway play finally gave us the push we needed to stay in the Village. We booked the quad room (two doubles) for my wife, my daughter, and me, and planned our trip around the location. The room was tight for space, and the bathroom more so, but that's typical for New York. Best of all were the cheerful staff, who sent up a complimentary bottle of prosecco for my daughter's birthday (after inquiring about her age!) and never failed to greet us or to check to see if we needed any additional service. Complimentary breakfast is in a sit-down restaurant, but here too they were accommodating, preparing bagels, muffins, and orange juice to take back to our room.

title: Excellent location and service
review: Hello Mike,  Thank you so much for taking the time write a positive review of your stay with us.  We are thrilled you found the staff cheerful, and welcoming at all times.  We are also glad your breakfast experience was accommodating.  We definitely hope you choose to stay in the village again soon!

title: Ok but not the best
review: We stayed here so we'd be in walking distance of NYU and it did the trick.  We arrived a couple of nights after the blizzard and it was still pretty snowy.  Had to unload the suitcases so I could drive around the block and find the parking garage.  There were no bellman.  My son was able to find someone in the hotel to tell us what to do, but no one provided help.  We found that very strange and unwelcoming.  The hotel itself was fine, nothing fancy.  I did like the shower and the good towels.  I had trouble sleeping because the noises from either inside or outside were ongoing all night. I think I liked it more than my son though because I know how expensive NY hotels can be so this was a relative bargain.

title: Loved
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Great Location
review: Great hotel, excellent value and location. Good breakfast, lovely neighbourhood. Not sure how it can be so affordable in this neighbourhood. Nothing more to say really, just need to get to minimum character limit for tripadvisor. Quite annoying.

title: A value property in a great location
review: Hello Carrie,  Thank you so much for the kind review.  We love you too!  Come back and see us soon!

title: Second stay. Okay but not great.
review: Very friendly staff, especially the front desk. The rooms are not super modern, but have a certain charm. I loved the location close to NYU, the park, and great restaurants within walking distance. The staff at breakfast was not the most attentive. Because of that I would have preferred to be able to serve myself to save time.

title: Clean and Good Location
review: Hi Castle,  We are thrilled to hear you had such a positive experience with our front desk, and are happy you found the hotel charming.  We do apologize for the experience during breakfast.  A great start in the morning can set the tone for the rest of the day, and yours should have been positive.  We sincerely hope your next stay in the city will be with us, and we would very much like to improve upon your overall experience.

title: Nice enough place to stay
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Great Boutique Hotel
review: I typically go here for 7-10 days at a time.  WSH provides convenient access to the West Village area.  Plenty of things to do there, right next door to NYU, Babbo is across the street.  Goodwill store is around the corner. Convenience and drug stores only a block away.  I had a room with a window my last stay and never closed it the entire time I was there.  On the front of the hotel if you stand just right, you can see Washington Square Park. (Where the utilities companies recently were working and disturbed a few graves) - Read the curious lore of the park.

title: Fair and Square In Greenwich Village
review: We stayed at the Washington Square Hotel in late November.  This is a charming, European-like boutique hotel across the street from Washington Square Park. It's in a wonderful neighborhood in Greenwich Village. The rooms are comfortable and quiet.  The restaurant has great offerings for breakfast. The staff is friendly and accommodating. We will definitely stay here again.

title: Great Location
review: Thank you for taking the time to share such kind words about our hotel; it means a lot to know you enjoyed your stay, and had such a positive experience with us.  We are thrilled   to hear that you will be coming back, and look forward to seeing you again soon!

title: Great Greenwich location!
review: We were hitting town for a New Year's Eve concert and needed a hotel in close proximity to Webster Hall. From an online search this fit the bill. Although it was on the high end of what I was willing to pay. In the long run, the facility and it's location made it worthwhile.  The staff was welcoming and gracious and we were immediately comfortable in the setting.   The sleeping quarters were small, but served their purpose. We needed a clean, safe and comfortable place to sleep. We didn't come to the city to hang out in a hotel room and I doubt that many do.   The heat was easy to adjust to our comfort. Coming in to crash late at night, that was a necessity. As I began to melt into the mattress, I realized that the window mount air conditioner was still installed behind the…

title: Greenwich
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: I'll come back anyway
review: Spent 7 nights here on a business trip whilst my wife did shopping.  This hotel is not your usual chain hotel, and that's what makes it unique as well as very charming.  Lovely continental breakfast available at no charge or a full breakfast is available.  Staff all extremely helpful and freindly.  This is why when visiting New York it will be the first hotel I'll check for availability.  Love it!

title: Great location, friendly staff, mediocre rooms
review: The Washington Square Hotel is an old world hotel with a location so good I will return despite its flaws. The staff is first rate. You get a continental breakfast with some fairly dull fruit and pastries but genuine bagels. My room (a queen bed deluxe) was tiny, even by New York standards, and it was spare not luxurious, but as others have mentioned you’re not likely to be spending a lot of time in your room. Two problems kept my rating down at three stars. First, my room was quite noisy. There was not much traffic noise, but virtually no sound barrier between my room and the hall, and I heard the elevator and its discharge all night. Second, when I wanted to shower in the morning the water wouldn’t get hotter than lukewarm. (It was fine in the evening.) I can’t give four stars…

title: Conveniently situated small, comfortable hotel in NYC
review: This hotel is conveniently located in West Village, a wonderful area to walk to bars, restaurants, and shopping.  It is right on Washington Square and has a lovely entrance.  The rooms are average size but a bit old and bare.  If you plan on spending your time out of the room this is a perfect place to be situated, however don't expect much luxury.

title: Nice but gave away our room!
review: Washington Square Hotel, recommended to me by my business partner, is a small, Euro feeling hotel right next to Washington Square Park in the heart of the Village. It is a remarkably quiet street making for good sleeping. Entrance to the subway is at the end of the street. Rooms a small as befits a place you are supposed to be out of not in..Staff is friendly and helpful but not overly effusive, just what you want. The breakfast buffet is adequate to start the day; there is also full breakfast service but that seemed over the top considering the food offerings in the Village. It is located across the street from Babbo, Mario Batali's main restaurant (make reservations more than a month in advance). Great restaurants all around, and the Village Vanguard an 8 minute walk!

title: Terrific hotel
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Perfect Hotel
review: Stayed for 2 nights. Positive features: (1) good location in Greenwich Village close to subway and lots of restaurants/bars; Whitney Museum and High Line are a 15 minute walk; (2) the room and bathroom were very spacious compared with many NYC hotels; (3) very pleasant and helpful staff; (4) reasonable rate for NYC Christmas shopping season; (5) rate included continental breakfast--not typical for NYC. Negative features: none. Highly recommended if you want a traditional, older hotel away from the crowds in the Midtown-Time Square area.

title: Great hotel and in the middle of Greenwich village
review: Perfect hotel!  Perfect location. Very freindly staff. Great breackfast. Rooms are clean , renovated, feels like a high standart hotel. Best value for this price. Would defently recomend it and will come again next time I'll be in the city.

title: And I stay in a nice area
review: This was a great hotel, all of the staff were friendly and cheerful, the room was quite small but it was clean. The hotel was in the middle of everywhere so we went to all the usual places sometimes by train. Apart from breakfast there was no other meal but you could buy a meal at their restaurant quite cheaply, otherwise there were several diners about. In all if I was going back to New York I'd definitely stay here again.

title: Ideal location
review: I stayed at this hotel on a business trip. I stayed here for two days and had an excellent experience. The room comes with a continental breakfast that meets expectations. The location was excellent. The staff was very friendly. The rooms were a little bit small but in New York small isn't uncommon at a hotel.

title: Great price for a great location and super friendly vibe
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: We loved the location and the hotel
review: We found the washington square hotel by chance online, and thought the combination of location and price was pretty great (especially when compared with similarly priced hotels the majority of the reviews contained the word mouse quite frequently, that's a deal breaker). We could not have been happier with the Washington Square hotel- it was charming in its aesthetic, making me feel like we had stepped back in to the glorious days of art deco. All of the staff were so friendly, chatty and attentive. The room was clean and well equipped, on the small size but I never find that to be an issue, you don't really want to spend hours sitting in a hotel room when you've got Greenwich village to explore just outside. We were so sad to leave, and I would definitely book this hotel again…

title: Location
review: Trying to find a room in NYC is a daunting task.  With over 1000 hotels there are plenty of options.  I have stayed in the New York area only two times previously, once in New Jersey (had a good rate) and once in the Upper West Side (loved it).  I wanted to experience Lower Manhattan.  I needed two beds.  I did not want to pay a fortune, but I didn't want a dumpy place.  I was really hoping I didn't need to use a chain hotel.    Washington Square Hotel was mentioned in the forums as a possibility and after searching other options we chose to stay here.  I am so glad.  We loved the older character of the hotel, that was still well cared for and in good condition.  We loved the price.  We loved that it was right at Washington Park.  We loved that it was within walking distance of…

title: Great NYC location
review: This is hardly a 3 stars hotel. Small rooms. Old establisnment. Staff is usually nice. Room could be more clean. Breakfast is less than basic. Plates and forks are spotted and not clean. Location is great, in the middle of the village, close to blue note and village vanguard if you like jazz, and during weekends you can enjoy free performances in the square. Prices are not logical for this pit but this is new york...

title: Convenient and decent
review: Have stayed at Washington Square on several occasions on business in the city. It's location makes it easy to get uptown or downtown.  Proximity to NYC and Washington Square Park make it more of a neighborhood than a city.  Rooms are larger than a typical NYC hotel.  This is an older hotel and the decor brings back a great period.  Marble floors and staircase, early Hollywood themes make for interesting appeal.  Good amenities,  free continental breakfast and WiFi a plus.  Highly recommended.

title: Upscale Retro Chic
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: love this place
review: I love this historic hotel with the marble staircase and autographed photos of celebrities. It is upscale and high tech, yet cozy, quiet and comfortable. Great service and an excellent restaurant connected by an interior passageway. My favorite hotel in Greenwich Village.

title: Location location location - Heart of NYC
review: the room is very small, as usual in N Y, but everything else is great. it is cosy, the staff is very friendly and helpful. they have Ronny, a marvelous person. It was the second time I've stayed in this hotel. I don`t wanna stay in another hotel else in Manhattan

title: Two nights in New York
review: I was a female solo traveller to NYC and recently stayed 7 nights at this Hotel.  The deluxe room was comfy, clean, tidy and well equipped and with all the essentials needed.  I chose this Hotel due to wanting a 'Village' feel and it did not disappoint.  Close to absolutely everthing, including Washington Square Park (directly opposite), shops, restaurants, attractions, subways.  Very central and easy to get around.  The staff were happy, friendly and accommodated my every need.  Ronnie @ Concierge was simply the BEST without a doubt!  Breakfasts are included and I chose fruit to begin my day.  I would happily recommend this Hotel to anyone travelling to NYC and in particular wanting to stay away from the 'touristy' areas.  I will be back.

title: Will definitely come back
review: I booked the Hotel for a two night stay for my wife and I, we also invited our friends from Boston to join us, which they did and also booked the same two nights. We are so glad we chose this hotel, ideally placed in Greenwich Village.   First impressions, as we pulled up the exterior façade was pleasing and gave us an expectation that the hotel is quite grand, we were not disappointed! On arrival the doorman greeted us, the best greeting we have had from a doorman ever, very polite, joyful and a pleasant chap. Likewise the reception staff were very polite and pleasant. T he interior décor was classical and splendid. We were quickly checked in and in our room in minutes. On entering the room, the hotel staff exceeded our expectations by having not only a bottle of prosecco for…

title: Great location
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Sad
review: Picked this place due to its great location just off WSP in the West Village. Room was a decent size for NY and was clean and tidy. In room coffee machine was good and the staff were nice. We opted for the complimentary continental breakfast which was OK but not great - there is also a full service breakfast option at extra cost. Overall a decent choice for price vs. location. Loads of bars and restaurants in the surrounding streets too.

title: Greenwich Village Hotel
review: I'm going to try to be as objective as possible even though I was pretty mad my iPad was stolen after leaving my luggage with the hotel staff since I came before check-in time.   Pros:  Good location (near subway + across from Washington Square Park)  Room was very clean  Breakfast was sufficient- breads, cereals, fruit, coffee  Door man was nice.   Cons:  *iPad was stolen after leaving bags with staff   (I alerted the manager and she told me to fill out an incident form, then firmly told me "nothing is ever stolen out of the storage room" as if I was making a false accusation.. but she never said anything could be done about it.)  *There was a thermostat in my room but the heat didn't work.  *The bed is not attached to the wall- it's just on wheels- and one of our friends who…

title: If not because of location, no one should stay there
review: We use to have family that lived in the Village and used to visit many years ago.  We decided on our recent trip down to stay at the Washington Square Hotel.  It was perfect.  It's small but just enough.  Much to do in the Village and gets you out of the craziness of Times Square.  Will stay again.

title: Great location in easy going neighborhood and spacious room
review: Spent one night there because the hotel is right next to NYU where we had a reservation for campus visit.  Pro: 1. Location: if you need to be in NYU area, this is the most convenient one. If not for this reason, I'm not sure anyone would like to spend that kind of money to stay there -- even for a New York hotel.  Cons: 1. We arrived by using a Uber and another guest arrived via a Lincoln Town Car. Even though we had 2 big luggages, the doorman ignored us completely -- not even opened the door for us. Yes, New Yorkers are well-known to have "charters" but this is a bit too far for hotel doorman. 2. We reserved a room for two 'twin" beds. Was given a room with two "single" beds. When checking with the front desk, I was told that in the hotel industry: twin bed = single bed. If…

title: Good Location...but
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Fantastic location
review: This majestic old hotel is in a great location, near everything but that is where it ends.  I arrived a little early and was hoping to get a room early.  No chance.  The receptionist had no smile on her face and an attitude.  When I came back later, the staff were no more interested in helping me.  The hotel is old but tired.  The breakfast room when I was there was downstairs.  It was not inviting at all.  The continental breakfast was barely worth eating.    The gym was dark and old.  My room was adequate and the bathroom was excellent with 2 sinks and a nice counter.  My room was near the elevator and was noisy at night.

title: Once again - great!
review: We have stayed in a few areas of Manhattan but Greenwich Village is the best so far. Within walking distance, you have trendy East Village, the bars and restaurants of Bleecker Street, edgier SOHO, Hudson Street, live music bars, comedy clubs etc etc. Plus good subway links, attractive parks (Washington and Union Squares) and, of course, the charming Washington Square Hotel. We were met by the ebullient Ronnie, a fast-talking fount of local information and checked in by excellent reception staff. Everyone friendly and helpful. Rooms were small but fine. We had a room at the front and not as noisy as we expected. A good buffet breakfast included, special mention to the mini scone cake/biscuit. Would definitely stay again.

title: Great local charm
review: 3rd visit to this hotel, and once again it was great. The location is perfect, the staff are always welcoming & smiling, and the rooms, even though they are small, are most comfortable and clean. I can't wait for our 4th visit 

title: Great Hotel
review: The room was small but adequate with no view but very comfortable. Hotel restaurant and bar were very nice. Breakfast included was also adequate. The neighborhood and ability to walk or subway most places was especially appealing.

title: Washington Square Hotel---Perfect !
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Ideal location for Downtown
review: Very reasonable price for New York especially. My single Queen room was small, but very clean and well appointed. Close to Washington Square, and well within walking distance of the many jazz clubs in and around The Village...not to mention numerous bar/restaurants. The hotel lounge and dining is great too, with a great happy hour...Lamb sliders ? Delish ! Mixologist Anthony took very good care of me. $62 car [not cab] fare to JFK works very well. Subway transit right on the corner to get you anywhere in The Big Apple.

title: Great Hotel, Great Location
review: The hotel is an ideal location for Greenwich Village. Having seen previous reviews I requested a rom on a high floor. On arrival they could only put us on the 2nd floor but would move as higher up next day. Well there was no issue with noise even though at front of hotel above foyer. So next day we said we were happy to stay where we were and never regretted it.

title: Waiting to go back !
review: My wife and I stayed there recently and had booked a deluxe room with which we were very pleased. It offered us plenty of natural light through two large windows overlooking Waverly Place. The room was large, as was the bathroom and the bed was very comfy. There was very little noise intrusion from outside apart from dogs barking (we guess it might have come from the Dog Wash & Doggie Daycare round the corner?) and the usual bin emptying that you hear all around NYC. None was enough to put us off though! The breakfast was a continental-style breakfast but very adequate - there were options to purchase cooked breakfast but we were more than satisfied with the fresh fruit, yoghurt, cereals, toast, croissants and coffee each morning! The North Square restaurant offers a superb…

title: Greenwich Village Gem
review: The hotel is very simple..the rooms are basic but.. the location is SUPER ! I loved the area, it is very close to Soho and the Meatpacking.The stuff are very nice, especially the guy at the entrance who was very helpful to us .  Breakfast is OK, regular NYC breakfast..the dining room is very very tiny but if you dont have any table available there you can ask to go to their restaraunt and eat your berakfast there ( free of charge of course ). I definetly will go back

title: Great little hotel in a fantastic location
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Labor Day Weekend
review: We had a quiet room on the 6th floor, it was bliss, got to sleep all night long, not disturbed by anything... breakfast was great, gluten free options were available, coffee was good, staff were really friendly.  Reception were really helpful and a great bunch of characters.  Overall we both really liked this hotel and will definitely return as it is in such a great location, close to Bleecker Street and that wonderful area.

title: Great trip to New York City
review: Small rooms, with a big bed which was perfect for the only thing we needed the room for. The shower had strong water pressure, which we loved. The countertop in the main room was granite so I could leave my hair straightener heating up on it without any worries. Such a nice location. We couldn't have had a better time.

title: Nice hotel but poor service
review: This hotel is a gem on a quiet beautiful street in New York City!!  The staff was amazing.  Friendly and knowledgable of the area.  The rooms were cozy, quaint and clean.   My husband and I were in New York City last weekend to see the Global Citizen Festival in Central Park.  The hotel is a 15 minute subway ride downtown from Manhatten.  Our room was not ready when we got to New York (arrived around noon) but the staff checked in our bags for us.   I love the character of the hotel the minute I walked in the door. They were so helpful and told us how to get to the subway and which train to take.    We got back later at night, a different set of staff was there to check us in.  They were also extremely friendly.  They gave us directions to a wonderful restaurant.  Directions…

title: Nice
review: My friend and I stayed in this hotel for a week. The man we had for check-in was very good, very friendly and when he found out it was my friend's birthday he gave us VIP breakfast but when we wanted to use it, the other man at the reception made such a fuss about it. It is clear that the staff don't trust/respect each other.   The room itself was ok, small (NY size room!) and it was a bit smelly (damp smell) as the only little window we had was opening on the inside of the building.   The cleaning of the room was poor: only the towels were folded, doubt it was hoovered, the sink was not cleaned and even the rubbish was not taken out.   On the other hand, it is a very convenient location, close to the subway and Bleecker street but having unfriendly receptionists is a little…

title: Overnight
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Perfect anniversary experience
review: Was put up at the Washington Square Hotel by my employer and it was a fantastic stay -- almost wish it were my regular residence, it was a great commute.  The solo rooms at the WSH are truly meant for single travelers, the room is just the right size for one person, with great amenities -- like a Keurig and an iHome.  The room also came with free breakfast, which was great. It offered a great spread of basic breakfast goodies -- fruits, pastries, etc.

title: A week's holiday in New York
review: We celebrated our 43rd wedding anniversary at the Washington Square Hotel in Greenwich Village. It could not have been a nicer experience. The staff were very welcoming and treated us to an upgrade to the Penthouse. When we got there they had also sent up a bottle of champagne. The room was pristine, with views out three sides--including a great view of the Empire State Building. We can't wait to stay there again.

title: Clean but Tired
review: The hotel is in a perfect location to explore New York from. It's quiet (top floor was anyway) except for the air conditioning but that always hums where ever you are, clean and the staff were extremely friendly. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in New York if I'm ever lucky enough to go back. The only drawback was the breakfast rooms. Food was perfectly acceptable but very limited. I'd go out for breakfast next time. We had a great veiw of the Empire State Building.

title: All NYC rooms are small
review: First, I have to say, our room was clean. The bathroom has been renovated and it was spotless. The linens on the bed were crisp and new. The rest of the room and hotel interiors are very tired. The carpet and furniture in the room are old and need to be replaced. The colour scheme also needs freshening up. This hotel has such a great location and it should be a fabulous boutique hotel. Some serious money needs to be invested in this property. I hope someone sees the potential in this old gem.

title: Wonderful atmosphere in a great area of NY
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Cozy stay
review: Superbly situated near lots of music-bars and great restaurants. Love the atmosphere and the style of the hotel. Great european style breakfast. If you don't to be staying near Times Sq this is definitely a great place to be in NY - we have been there twice already and will definitly be staying there again next time.

title: Lovely lovation
review: Pleasant experience.Everyone was very helpful.Hotel is old but quaint.It is close to Washington square park right in the heart of Greenwich Village.There are a lot of university students as it is near NYU.

title: Warm and friendly staff in a fabulous location!
review: Booked this hotel quite last minute. Very reasonably priced and excellent location. Breakfast choice was good with options of free included breads and pastry or alternative menu, at additional cost. Loved the location just off Washington square giving excellent access to local sites. Small room but clean and you're hardly in the room anyway in such an amazing city !

title: Wonderful hotel!
review: Our room was upgraded to a newly refurbished king size suite. The room was clean,quiet and comfortable. Staff was helpful and accommodating; Breakfast  was plentiful, and the coffee was good. Overall a great stay!

title: Very good location
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: The perfect place to stay in NY
review: I must say I was disappointed with this hotel. In the pictures rooms looked very nice, but in reality hotel would have needed some renovation.  I stayed 8 nights in this hotel. Location was very good, near tube station, New York University area and Washington square park. Rooms were small and worn. Showers were horrible, they did not work properly, floor was wet afterwards every time. Breakfast was decent. Personnel gave advises only if you asked them.  Ronnie was superb and the best in the hotel!!

title: Sweet Prospect right at Washington Square Park
review: Firstly, all the staff are helpful, but Ronnie is an institution in his own right. He welcomes you as if this hotel is his own home and can intuit perfectly what will appeal to each person, so has excellent tips on where to go, what to see, great places to eat, best coffee etc. The location is perfect – very close to subways, buses, restaurants, jazz and comedy clubs, the park, street basketball, buskers, trendy neighbourhoods and NYU. The hotel is spotless and comfortable. Our room on the 8th floor was quiet and spacious. If you request a small fridge they’ll supply one (subject to availability). We booked and paid way in advance, so the cost was very reasonable and the buffet breakfast is a convenient inclusion. We’d definitely stay here again.

title: Convenient to NYU & Greenwhich Village
review: I was sent to New York on business and needed a hotel at the last minute.   All of the typical business hotels were booked due to the US Open and this one came up as an option.   That said, it's a very nice little hotel.  Let's get some stuff straight, this is New York.  Although there is tons of construction going on, all hotels seem to be at least 100 years old.  That said, this one is reasonably updated and comfortable  The halls are narrow, there is one elevator that is slightly pokey and there's a 'vibe'.    I had a King room, which consisted of two twin beds very close to each other.  There's a vanity with a couple of drawers, a closet with shelving, and a bathroom with quite a lot of counter space. There's a safe, a blow dryer and an iron/board.  So quite good.  If you're…

title: Taking my daughter to NYU
review: We were in New York for a family event. We were able to book rooms here. We were within walking distance to many venues in Greenwich village. There is a nice breakfast included but also an option to order breakfast. The rooms are small but nice. We had an issue with our first room but the staff was very accommodating and moved us. The staff was all helpful and friendly.

title: Great hotel in a great location
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: What a find
review: This was our 5th stay at this hotel.  It's the perfect base for exploring NYC and good value (for Manhattan!). Staff always provide great service and happy to help. We always ask for a room on a higher floor as it's less noisy. We'll definitely be returning again.....

title: Perfect location, comfortable rooms
review: Having stayed in the Washington Square hotel I would not stay anywhere else in NY. The hotel's location in the very heart of Greenwich Village cannot be bettered.  There are numerous first class restaurants close by and if you like jazz or blues then this is the place for you as there are some really good venues within 10 mins walking distance of the hotel.  The hotel staff could not be more helpful and the breakfast which was included in our room price was more than adequate - they even had a gluten free cereal.  The rooms a little tired and could do with refurbishment but the bed was comfortable and the bathroom was well equipped.  Although there was no fridge in the room when we asked for one they brought a fridge up to the room.  We were told that Bob Dillon and Joan Baez…

title: Greenwich Village wish you were here
review: Situated right at Washington Square Park, this is a comfortable and convenient home base for tourists and NYU parents alike. The staff is affable, though hardly effusive. My room was small, but still reasonably sized for NY standards. There's only one ice machine for the whole hotel, which wasn't ideal during the heat of summer, and no room service or in-room refrigerator for leftovers. Still, there's a restaurant downstairs, and the breakfast (included) was perfectly serviceable. I also stopped in to the bar for a drink with a friend, and was greatly pleased with the friendly waiter and relaxed atmosphere. Internet access was free and reasonably fast. It was, in short, a pleasant (if unremarkable) stay at a nice little place in an amazing location.

title: Destination for our recent NY stay
review: Great hotel in a perfect location for Greenwich Village and the subway. Stayed here in winter and summer and lets be honest - summer is better :-) The hotel staff are welcoming and nothing has every been too much trouble. I arrived a day earlier than I had booked for on my last trip, and they simply took it in their stride and sorted something out. I prefer room at the front of the hotel overlooking Washington Square - can always imagine the Dylan days when he stayed here. The surroundings were less lovely, but something of the atmosphere remains in the area. Just around the corner from New School and NYC campuses and of course all the wonderful streets of the village. Breakfast is either a service based start to the day, or a more hit and miss self service offering in the…

title: Lovely hotel, fantastic location!
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Perfect Location
review: My son and I stayed here for two nights in August while we were visiting colleges in the area. Washington Square Hotel is a walk across the park from NYU...it's a perfect location. The hotel itself is beautiful and clean. I thought our room was quite spacious for a New York City hotel. We were very comfortable. The staff is friendly and accommodating. I'd love to bring my whole family back...we will definitely stay here again!

title: Nice
review: The rooms may be a little small but lets be honest, when you're in Greenwich Village you're only sleeping and showering there anyway!  Perfectly located on the edge of Washington Square, where the trendy and good looking gather to just chill, play music and relax, and surrounded by some amazing places to eat drink makes this the ideal place from which to explore New York. We walked rather than take the subway as you see so much, thirty minutes will get you to the Empire State Building, straight up 5th Avenue, or 40 down Broadway to Battery Park and the Statue of Liberty. Book it now, you'll thank me...

title: Great hotel .... fabulous location
review: Lovely hotel.  Attractive, quiet, and comfortable room.  Really nice included breakfast with service if you eat in the hotel restaurant.   Friendly staff.  Great location next to Park.  Only problem was the towels were stained so check them.

title: Mixed bag
review: Stayed at the hotel for 3 nights. Excellent location in the middle of Greenwich Village. The lobby is nice and all the staff were fantastic. Very friendly, very helpful The rooms were ideal. Not too small. Comfortable bed, clean and tidy bathroom that looks like it has just been upgraded  My only complaints were that there was no fridge or mini bar in the room. It would have been a useful addition. The corridors were a bit shabby and definitely need a revamp soon  Would definitely stay there again

title: Super location friendly staff
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Great locations, wonderful restaurant
review: Right in the middle of Greenwich Village the location is just perfect. We felt very welcome. The room was small but clean and the bathroom really nice. The staff was very friendly and helpful  Breakfast was included with the possibility of purchasing extras.

title: nice hotel, great location
review: Probably the best location in the city -- if you like downtown. Half a block from Washington Square yet on relatively quiet Waverley Street. The rooms are small, but it's New York. But they are very clean. Reminds me of places in Paris with a little four person elevator. But the room was quiet. Great restaurant and across the street from famous Babbo. Great walking neighborhood. The staff was great and very welcoming and it's reasonable -- for New York. The one little disconcerting thing was that there appeared to be a homeless woman who lived in the hotel and sat in the small lobby. The staff knew her and were unfailingly kind to her. Perhaps she is a permanent tenant from before the hotel was renovated?  Perhaps New York is placing the homeless in hotels as stop-gap housing?…

title: VACATION
review: Rooms and bathrooms are good but a bit old Loction is great close to Tribeca, Soho, etc and actually not far from anythingin Manhattan; location is at the corner of the lively Washington square park, and close to the metro Breakfast is nice with penty of choice

title: A respite in a bustling area!
review: Couldn't be more complimentary. If you want a bargain priced for NYC, well located, friendly and accommodating staff this is the hotel for you. Extremely well appointed in ever popular Greenwich Village, near a subway station with several lines and many restaurants of diverse cuisines and reasonable prices.

title: Awesome  hotel
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Wonderful visit
review: Great  people  and  the  hotel  has  been  updated  tastefuly .  Staff  were  very  friendly  and  helpful  and  its  right  next  to  the  park  which  is  always  buzzing .  great  stay  ,  definitely  go  back  : Beautifully remodeled family hotel. Fantastic floor plan with high ceilings and crown molding,

title: stay here when you visit NY
review: My husband and I stayed her overnight for our 10th anniversary on July 3rd.  The hotel is beautiful and quaint. It reminds me of a boutique hotel.  As you know, space is tight in NYC but I thought they utilized the space efficiently. The room and bathroom were a good size and they provide C. O. Bigelow amenities.  We took advantage of the full breakfast as well and everything was good. The people were so friendly, especially Reggie Richardson at the front desk.  We were greeted immediately when we arrived and he made sure we were comfortable.  I think that we will definitely return.

title: Best Hotel in Town
review: We liked very much that they pay attention to details, for example extra bags for the waste basket, extra toilet paper, cups for the tea and coffee machine, the Keurig. We never had to ask for it. We also liked the breakfast and the restaurant service very much. Top of it all, we lost our boxers when they changed the linen but the maid returned them.   We enjoyed our stay a lot.  Hotel is centrally located in Greenwich Village and easily accessible.

title: Great Location, Clean, Good Staff
review: This hotel has it all- an ideal location in Greenwich Village, charming and well appointed rooms, a delicious breakfast that is included in the price and the most professional, engaging and caring staff I have ever encountered at a hotel anywhere. All this came at a very reasonable price for a NYC hotel- I did a lot of research and can attest to that! If you want a true New York experience and you want to feel cared for by attentive and friendly staff, stay here!

title: Back in the "Roaring Fifties and Sixties"
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: An Oasis
review: "Now you’re smiling out the window Of that crummy hotel over Washington Square”  In her song "Diamonds and Rust" Joan Baez remembers the time she spent with Bob Dylan in Room 305 back in 1964. I still fondly remember my first lengthy stay in 1956 at this hospitable place which was then known as the "Earle Hotel"; the rate was 4.80 Dollars per night and for an extra Dollar per week they put an ice box in your room. This year I returned with my wife to New York for a few days and I'm happy to report that after more than half a century the Washington Square Hotel is still as charming and the staff as friendly as before!

title: Exellent value in the heart of the city
review: Think of an oasis along side the hustle & bustle of the famous Washington Square Park. Treat yourself to a beautiful day. Shop, eat, or just wander the vibrant neighborhoods of SOHO and Greenwich Village nestled deep in NYC. After you've done all you can do return to that oasis. Rest, relax, have a drink and dine at the very pleasant accompanying restaurant North Square to celebrate the beautiful day.   ****If you are a steak lover go two blocks over have dinner at the Strip House.  One of top ten in NYC.   You will not forget it.

title: Home from home
review: This hotel was right next to Washington Square Park which is steps from The Village.  We love wandering though the neighborhood when we visit NYC, so this was perfect for us.  The doormen were super friendly, the rooms were clean, and breakfast was included (unheard of in NYC).  This is the perfect location for a real NYC tourist.  If you want to deal with the crowds and headaches of midtown/Times Square, go for it, but this is a wonderful gem of a hotel.  It's very close to the blue and orange subway lines, and the yellow line is nearby.  The price is also incredible at about $200 per night, it can't be beat!

title: Best Kept Secret in the Ciry
review: I always stay at this small, art deco hotel when I am in NYC.  Centrally situated in the University district along from Washington Square, close to several subway lines, it is easy to get around, with shops and restaurants all around.  My room this stay was the best yet - overlooking Waverly - yet still quiet.  The room has all the usual facilities, including free wifi, in-room safe, good-sized desk/dressing table, iron plus board and a small en suite bathroom.  Rooms here are not large by modern standards, but perfectly adequate and of course in a historic space.  Washington Square is great to walk around or just sit and listen to the jazz often played there, or to watch street performers.  Buzzing from early morning with joggers and dog-walkers, and then at lunchtimes with…

title: Wonderful stay
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Excellent short break in New York
review: We decided to spend three nights here to get a feel for the neighborhood and we were not disappointed. The hotel has a wonderful, welcoming staff that made us feel at home from beginning to end.   Upon arriving, we were treated by a wonderful doorman that pointed us toward the lounge for refreshments and told us a few great spots to hang out while we were waiting for our room to be prepared.   The room was clean and spacious. Even the bathroom was quite large and well appointed. Lovely surround shower made for a great experience after a long travel day into Manhattan.   On our way out the same doorman gave us alternate route directions that saved us time and difficulty when it came to the subway back to JFK.   Overall the visit was delightful and we will most definitely return…

title: Great boutique hotel
review: The hotel is amazing value, it is individual, classy and a fantastic location. The rooms are standard issue "small" for NY, but they are spotlessly clean and far more than functional. We travel to New York several times a year and normally stay with our son, but this time we travelled with friends and stayed at the Washington , it was a great choice, the location alone makes it stand out. Enjoy the hotel and enjoy the location.

title: Just book it!!!
review: Situated in the gorgeous Greenwich Village. Close to subways, quaint restaurants and pubs. My teenage son and I spent a week in this friendly hotel. Close to gorgeous park, So Ho, and Union Square Park in walking distance. Highly recommend it. Would definitely stay there again. We were given 15% discount on our next stay. Hope we are able to use it sooner rather than later.

title: Accommodating staff with great location
review: As I finish my last night stay(after a week), I must say that my visit here is THE BEST that I have had in many years in ANY hotel, in ANY part of the world. I was here for work and pleasure. My wife( her FIRST NYC visit btw) and I were treated like family. The cleanliness, service and attention to us was outstanding! The proximity and accessibility make this THE place to be. It's a classic boutique hotel devoid of the pretense of so called "luxury hotels". Great bar, breakfast,and other amenities await you. This will be my hotel of choice for ALL my NYC visits. As long as they are here, I'll be here!

title: Great location and friendly staff
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Washington square hotel.
review: We stayed in this hotel for 7 nights in June on holiday's. We really felt at home in the hotel as it is small and intimate. Having read the previous reviews on Tripadvisor I know exactly what to expect. For example the aircon is a window mounted unit and is a bit noisy but this was called out by another review so no surprises. Another good tip was to request a room on the upper floors. The location is superb and it was very easy to walk, bus or get the subway to any part of Manhattan. The breakfast is perfect start to the day. Compared to the modern crazy busy hotels uptown this hotel is an oasis of calm and peace. We loved it.

title: Very good hotel in a great area
review: The hotel is very charming.  The rooms are medium size which is good for NYC.  Amazing location - NYU and WS are a few steps away.  Very close to SOHO yet in a quiet part of washington square. I would definitely go back without hesitation.

title: Favorite place to stay in NYC
review: Service was attentive and we got lots of good advice from the doorman as well. Walked around the Village and visited some great little restaurants and Jazz clubs. Room, like most in NY, was small but clean comfortable and quiet.

title: Nice Little Hotel in the Middle of Activities
review: My family and I try to stay at the Washington Square Hotel every time we visit NYC.  We've been coming there for the past ten years and love it!  The location in Greenwich Village is wonderful, breakfast so convenient and delicious, and the people so nice and helpful.  The subway is just down the block, Babbo across the street, and with Washington Square Park and NYU right there, there are always people on the street making it a safe and comfortable neighborhood to explore by yourself or with friends.

title: Pleasant stay
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Charming and Great Location
review: The hotel is nicely situated to explore NY and enjoy the wonderful surroundings of Greenwich Village., from the park outside the door to a wonderful array of restaurants all around.  The room we had is probably a decent size for NY, but the decor is nothing special and frankly a little tired. The staff are all attentive and friendly and the the breakfast whilst not being amazing is more than adequate. Use the service side rather than the self service.

title: Great Hotel in Greenwich Village!
review: this could not have been a better hotel for a quick few days enjoying NYC.  the location is perfect for getting everywhere we were interested in going. the staff are incredibly helpful and friendly.  rooms are small and plain, but very nicely appointed and comfortable.  breakfast included along with wifi.

title: Excellent location!!!
review: My Mom and I spent 4 nights at this hotel - our room was on the 9th floor. You can't beat the location of this hotel - it's across from Washington Square, near NYU, near jazz clubs, cafes, and restaurants. Loved the bathrobes and the complimentary breakfast! Very friendly staff & 24/7 too!

title: Great place
review: This hotel is wonderful! My boyfriend and I stayed here in June for 4 nights. The location is excellent. We were close to parks, subways, union square and the hop on hop off bus stop. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The continental breakfast was great. We would definitely stay again. Highly recommend it!!!

title: A real home from home
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Boutique Hotel In Best Part Of NYC
review: We stayed here for 8 nights ending 3rd June and it was absolutely superb in every respect, All of the staff are really friendly and helpful, and Ronnie in the Lobby area is a mine of information and genuine support & fun.    The location is excellent, with loads of very nice bars, restaurants etc in easy walking distance, and great transport links. Truly faultless.

title: Good enough...
review: Small, cozy and comfortable this boutique hotel in the heart of the Village, just off Washington Square, provides a wonderful launching point for a NY neighborhood that is both active and quaint. There is a reason both Friends and Sex In The City chose this area to locate external shots of central characters' apartments. While I received dozens of restaurant recommendations from friends and associates of spots close to the hotel, I enjoyed ignoring them all. Instead, I just wandered up and down the streets and invariably bumped into the perfect place for lunch, an app, drinks or dinner. BaBBO, M. Batali's original NY outlet, is right across the street. But, for me, finding a $1/oyster and half-priced beer happy hour is absolute heaven. (Jeffrey's Grocery is one such place, about…

title: Fabulous
review: I opted for the Washington Square Hotel for two reasons - first was its proximity to the location we were shooting in, the second was The Marlton was full. So for me it was right location-wise, but it's a great location for anyone wanting to properly explore lower Manhattan - Greenwich Village, Soho etc. The hotel itself is in the northeast corner of the square - so you can't physically stay any closer if you wanted to!  So - onto the place itself. It's a nice enough hotel - with an art deco vibe that follows through to the rooms. Clean & tidy, with nice linen & quality bathroom vanity items. The room was big enough for a couple for a week, and had a better than average coffee making system, which was a welcome touch. The rate included breakfast, but due to an early start the…

title: Pleasant, but tired and rather smelly
review: We stayed here for 5 nights from 1st June. Hubby and I were staying as a treat for our 40th anniversary. Lovely surprise of a bottle of Cava in the room and a lovely message from the staff. Room very individual. Staff very friendly and helpful. Great comfy bed, very clean. Breakfast a bonus in NY. Superb location as well. Loads of bars and restaurants nearby. Metro just round the corner. What's not to like!

title: Okay Hotel - Nothing Special... Here's why.
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Excellent Hotel in Greenwich Village
review: Booked this hotel for an elderly couple who we were taking to NYC for their last trip to the city.  A trip to see the greatest hits the city has to offer before they can no longer get around and move.  The booking process: Months and months in advance we booked them a nice room which according to the hotel's website promised a city or washington square view.  When we called the hotel asking if they could make some special arrangements for the couple, they said they could not. That the hotel doesn't make special arrangements but maybe to call ahead 3-4 days in advance and see what could be done. Okay - Fine.   Fast forward to 3-4 days out and we called the hotel again to ask for a room with a view uptown or a view of the park and again they said they can't make special…

title: Another wonderful week spent at this NYC gem
review: Really enjoyed staying in the Washington Square Hotel! The rooms were great and not small at all. Top notch! Everything was in great shape and the staff were friendly and knowledgeable. I especially must point out and thank Ron who was so helpful and has a very infectious and positive attitude.

title: Excellent stay in an historical hotel in NYC's Perfect location
review: Once again a warm welcome and excellent facilities, we felt like old friends or indeed family making a return visit. This will be my 3rd stay at this Greenwich Village oasis. Ronnie was on form as ever and Jessica at front desk went over and above the call of duty when we had a major problem with our Amtrak booking to DC following that horrific derailment in Philly. She got us a refund from Amtrak and secured us 2 places on the Greyhound bus. The rest of the staff were also superbe and nothing is ever too much trouble for them. Do go visit - you won't be disappointed.

title: Pleasant location and warmful
review: This is our 5th time in this nice hotel,we stayed 8 nights.The ambience,the Art Deco,the general look take you to La Belle Epoque. The team are very friendly and helpfull,the breakfast is very good,the fruits are fresh and the service is perfect.The location is convenient to explore the village.

title: always  a  good  stay!
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Perfect Location in New York City
review: it  is  the  second  time  we  stay  at  this  hotel during  our  visit  to  New  York. close  to  Washington  Square , the  Village, etc. good restaurants , excellent  ambient Highly  recommended  to  stay  there . Staff  friendly

title: Excellent stay at a historic gem
review: Stayed here for 4 days recently. Check in was fine. I did not like the room allocated to me as it had no window just an opening on to a shaft and I was moved to another room at the end of a rather dingy corridor which had a window and was small but adequate. There were two Aircon machines the window one being old and rather noisy but both were efficient and a safe. The bathroom was also small but served its purpose. Shower in the bath as expected. The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet being located at the rear of the building. Wifi was disappointingly slow. Continental breakfast was fine and a full cooked breakfast was available in the restaurant which I did not use. Located right beside the Park this hotel is ideally located for exploration of the Village and all it's…

title: Small and expensive
review: Loads of history (Hemingway, Dylan, Baez, and more lived here at one time), very friendly and helpful staff, fresh continental breakfast with great coffee, good pastries and fruit etc., relatively spacious (for NYC) rooms with comfortable beds, around the corner from the subway, free wi fi, impeccably clean!  Near Greenwich Village, NYU, and on the corner of Washington Square.  What a great place to stay, especially if you are looking for something in a mid price range that is not a cookie cutter hotel.

title: Wow! What a great place!
review: I know New York hotels are small normally, but this room was tiny. I've been on cruise ships where the rooms were larger and for the price per night you got three meals.
