The hotel has no way to deal with parking other than to tell you there is a garage 3 blocks away. No valet parking or garage on premises. My room was adjacent to the elevator but it was relatively quiet except for foot traffic. The maid came to clean up at 4:30PM, I know because I was trying to take a quick nap before dinner.

title: Comfortable, high priced, right location
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Great Location
review: The exact location we wanted.  Next to Washington Square Park and Greenwich village.  Rooms were clean and well kept, bathrooms were clean, large showers and hot water.  Staff was very friendly and very helpful. I felt the hotel was average because of the price, I expected more at the high price.

title: A kind of a english hotel i New York
review: The hotel was in the perfect location for our trip.  Close to the subway and lots to do in the village.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The rooms were nice and bathroom adequate.  The one negative was that we kept losing connection to the internet.

title: Great location, nice hotel
review: In Greenwich village , by the Washington Square Park , an old fascioned hotel . Here Bob Dylan, Rolling Stones and Ernest Hemingway and many more have stayed. Greenwich village is still a lively place, with a lot of restaurants and bars.  The hotel just some hundred meters from the Subway, or to the Fifth avenue.  The rooms are quite small with narrow corridors, but friendly staff, and a good breakfast , but the best - a perfect location for exploring NY . We will sure stay there again.

title: A week in NYC
review: Two couples spent four nights at Washington Square Hotel for the 5 Boro, 40 mile bike ride.   The hotel rooms were small and had NO view.  There were rooms with views, but we did not go to NYC to look out of a window at the city.  Saved our money for great food.  The rooms were, however, very clean and comfortable.  Shower had the best water pressure I have had in a while.  A comfortable bed and hot shower is very important to a middle age guy after being on a bike for 40 miles!   The staff was very accommodating and helpful with check in, check out and advice of where to go and how to get there.  Without a doubt, the best part of the hotel is the location.  It is on Washington Square Park in the middle of the Village.  Since I never want to go to midtown or above, it was…

title: Excellent value for a perfect location.
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Week in NYC!
review: I don't like Midtown. I don't like big chain hotels. I'll sacrifice a little square footage to stay someplace with some personality, and Washington Square Hotel has it. I stayed here in February and I plan to come back with my son in May. The location is extremely convenient and I like the coziness of the hotel. It feels like you're really in a neighborhood, not a tourist trap. The staff was very helpful and I'm looking forward to visiting again.

title: Great hotel in great location
review: We have stayed at the Washington Square Hotel numerous times the past ten years.  We love the location in the West Village with proximity to numerous restaurants, many subway lines and fun shopping.  Continental breakfast is included with the room  or you can order from the menu in the restaurant which also serves lunch and dinner. The staff is friendly and helpful.

title: An Art Deco Gem, My Favorite Hotel in NYC!!!
review: Lovely hotel - rooms are spacious by New York standards, bathrooms clean and the continental breakfast is enough to get you started for the day.  Location is great, about a 5 minute walk to subway and right in the heart of the villages - loads of bars and restaurants in walking distance. Great spot

title: Funky boutique hotel
review: I cannot find any fault with this hotel, other than the smallish sized rooms which are typical of 90% of NYC hotel rooms.  The hotel is immaculate with the kind of character and ambiance that is unmatched.  The prices are reasonable, they give discounts to families of university students.  A lovely continental breakfast is also included.  Very comfortable beds and quiet location across the street from Washington Square Park and within a five minute walk to incredible restaurants of every price point make this hotel a win, win, win proposition!!!

title: Great location
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Central location
review: We stayed here for 5 nights just before Christmas.  Good -  Great location just off Washington Square, a short walk from the West Village with its brownstones, cafes and restaurants. The price.  We got a good deal which included a basic breakfast: hot drink, juice, fruit & bagels etc Coffee maker in the room with good coffee. Friendly concierge. Wintery roofscape with water towers on our first morning (and being able to see Washington Square if we craned our necks.) Knowing that Dylan & The Stones had stayed there!!  Not so good -  Room was very small, even for NYC. Decor was dark and depressing (apart from the lobby.) Mattress was very firm. The breakfast area was crowded and chaotic & the baked goods were not very fresh. Everything felt a little tired & there was nowhere to…

title: Super friendly in a great location
review: Cute boutique hotel with adequate amenities.  We had a room at the end of the hall.  There was one next to the elevator that I would not have wanted.  Keurig in the room and continental breakfast even when we left our bags at concierge (we were too early to check in).  We were invited to partake of breakfast before we went exploring.  Very thoughtful gesture.  Great location.  We had the window open and the guy practicing sax and trumpet in the area was a very New York touch.

title: Location can't be beat!
review: A very friendly, cosy spot in one of my favourite parts of New York. Staff was helpful and friendly. In the surrounding area you will find clubs, shopping, restaurants and everything else you need for the perfect New York holiday. I will definately stay here again.

title: Wonderful gem!
review: This charming hotel has a European feel to it. Our room was very small but serviceable with a modest breakfast offered in a dining area that was underwhelming because of the size and number of guests vying for seating space. The location, however, is outstanding and the staff bends over backwards to respond to your needs. You're close to Washington Square Park and other fabulous action in Greenwich Village. If you're a first time visitor to New York and you're a walker, know that each block offers restaurants, shops and more and you can safely explore numerous neighborhoods. Finally, there isn't really a place in the hotel to hang out in which didn't pose a problem until one hugely rainy day. All told, it's a great place to stay!

title: GREAT Greenwich Village Hotel- would stay here again!
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Felt like home
review: I was glad we chose this hotel. I would stay here again. Great style and the staff was all very friendly and helpful. Right on Washington Square Park- we were visiting NYU and this was a perfect place to be. Breakfast was just right- it was crowded around 8:30 but I was happy with it. Our room was just right, although there was some noise at night (friday) but it was very comfortable and clean. I would gladly stay here again. Right across from BABBO - didn't get to go there for dinner but if you make reservations you can get it- expensive but considered one of the best in NYC- Mario Batali. Will try next time!

title: Another home in NewYork.
review: I can honestly say that this hotel exceeded my expectations entirely. I have never been to New York, but have always anticipated going. Luckily, I was given that opportunity as a friend took me for my birthday. I did not know much about this hotel, but had seen a few pictures - looked fairly impressive, so I remained optimistic. But seeing it in person was a different story!! The lobby was so beautiful, with a bright atmosphere but a vintage style carved into the walls, it was so warming. The staff made the check-in process quick and easy, and were really vibrant and happy - a quality that everyone looks for. Our concierge was definitely on another level. He greeted us evertime we were in the lobby, he gave us the best shops and landmarks to see with detailed travel routes. He…

title: I would go back
review: This hotel has an amazing location in Greenwich village , just steps away from Washington Square Park , It is near several subway stations and, of course, NYU. If you are a parent visiting your student look no further. The room was not typical in size for NYC infact quite spascious and very clean. Breakfast at the North square restaurant was perfect.There were  some nice amenities in the room , wonderful bathrobes and excellent size and very clean bathroom . The  staff was very polite and extremely  friendly. At the front desk  Danilla  was very  helpful, kind and knowledgeable. Our room was on the 5th floor  and was quiet  . We  stayed 12 nights but wished we could have stayed longer.

title: Art Deco gem in the heart if Greenwich village
review: Quite small rooms, and I guess that the first floor's rooms might be a bit noisy, but after one night we got room from 8th floor. We had no problems with anything, the worst thing was when one morning we had to go to the full service breakfast (the buffet was full). It was like the buffet, but you had to wait for everything and ask sometimes from two different staff members to bring you coffee of cheese or bread, cause the same person couldn't do all the things and they maybe didn't communicate with each other. So that was the only time when we felt that their staff wasn't too eager to do their job or help customers. The people working at the reception were more talkative, smiling and always helped us. What I specially - as a vegetarian - enjoyed was that they didn't serve any…

title: It's ok....not quite worth the money
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Very Confusing experience
review: The hotel is alright, the rooms are very small considering I upgraded to a better room. The toilet constantly made noises throughout the night and there was a dripping sound elsewhere in the bathroom, but no leaking faucet. The TV was too high up and the sound wasn't great. The bed, however, was very comfortable. The location is good, close to the PATH train and subway. The WiFi cut out a few times which was inconvenient but wasn't the end of the world.

title: Great hotel
review: I am only giving the hotel a 3 because the staff were helpful but the hotel itself is more like a bed and breakfast. Small, a bit run down, lots of left, right two steps up, three steps down, through the door to reach the restaurant and the room.   Was booked to stayed three nights with breakfast , had my confirmation and stated my name and duration of stay on check in.    First night lots of weird sounding plumbing noises or maybe air condition , not sure what it was but lots of noises  from the bathroom and the floor upstairs, you can hear the foot steps and doors opening and closing.   Next morning went to have breakfast, no one explains with the system is. they ask you want this or that and if you want to order, which I did.  Next thing I got a $30 charge to my credit card.…

title: Quaint But Not Quiet
review: We stayed at this hotel whilst on a long weekend in New York. We had previously stayed up town and decided to go for one of the villages on our second trip and I'm so glad we did.   The location of this hotel is excellent if you like jazz bars, good resturants and a more local feel.   The hotel itself is nice and well kept. The rooms are small but have been modernised. It's clean and the staff were friendly.   Breakfast is average but the location has lots to offer for eating out.   We would definitely return to this hotel.

title: For Sound Sleepers Only
review: My husband and I recently "splurged" and stayed overnight in NYC. We usually head back to Long Island, but being our 25th anniversary, we wanted to celebrate. We chose Washington Square Hotel. Great location, cool history, friendly staff. Reasonable rate in a great neighborhood. Great bathroom. So what could go wrong? A jackhammer under our window at 7:45 am? Really? No fault of the hotel, but maybe a warning was in order.  Please be sure folks when you book a room in NYC, that there is not construction happening right where the hotel is. It can make or break your stay. I would recommend otherwise.

title: Quaint hotel walking distance to NYU, Soho, Chinatown
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: True to its heritage
review: After getting past the initial snarky clerk when I checked in and my room wasn't ready, the rest of my stay was fine. I guess I had one of the larger rooms, which was great. Our room was nice and large with a lovely bathroom. It was tucked behind the elevator which made me nervous, but it was never a problem. Ronnie the doorman was terrific. He was always friendly and helpful. Always smiling. The breakfast included in the stay left something to be desired. Most mornings it was jammed into a crowded small bar area where there were not enough tables and no room to mix your coffee if someone else was trying to get food. The only protein was yogurt which was disappointing. Hard boiled eggs, cheese, something else would have been nice.   The hotel was a short walk to my meeting…

title: Great location, good price, some drawbacks
review: After all these years, still a dump! Shower was lukewarm, never got hot or really even warm. Service personnel never fixed up the room even though the "Service Requested" tag was hanging on the door knob from 11AM onward.  And there is no proper chair -- the desk chair is a low-to-the-ground ottoman, or maybe footstool.  Forget about doing any desk work for an extended period. When I showed up I asked for a quiet room and was sent to a room pulsating with machine noise and hammering.  I was told that it was just during the day!  When I noted that I used my hotel room during the day, the agreed to move me to another, quieter room. OK, so is there anything at all I'd recommend about it? The location is good and the wifi works, although just well enough for email and basic web…

title: Cozy - No, Make That Small - Boutique Hotel
review: Excellent Greenwich Village location at the corner of Washington Square, right by NYU. PATH station for New Jersey almost adjacent, subway nearby. We got a very good price, by NYC standards. Helpful, cheerful staff; clean throughout. Hotel was a favorite with musicians playing local clubs, including jazz stars, Chuck Berry, Bob Dylan, Joan Baez, Bo Diddley. This is an older, fairly small facility, renovated in art deco style; layout is odd and rooms are small. Free wifi, plenty of outlets but no actual desk or chair - so not a place to get serious work done.  The included breakfast is fruit, yogurt, tea/coffee, orange juice, bagels and pastries - okay, but a lot of white flour and sugar. But since that's all included, a more substantial meal becomes relatively inexpensive; I…

title: A Great Visit!
review: Stayed at the Washington Square Hotel on business.  The location is excellent if you have business in the NYU or Greenwich Village area.  The staff was pleasant and my room was clean.   But the rooms are very small.  The mini desk area had only a padded ottoman, not a chair.  It would have been difficult to have a couple in the room I stayed in and the bed was super firm.  Even the corridors are exceptionally narrow, making it difficult for two people in winter coats to get by each other.  The Washington Square is probably fine for a night or two, but longer stays may induce stir craziness.

title: Great Location!
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Boutique Hotel
review: Our stay at The Washington Square Hotel was perfect. The hotel has an art deco theme and great location in Greenwich Village. We easily walked to all our destinations during our stay. With NYU just blocks away makes it a great hotel for visiting parents. The staff was wonderful and our room was clean and comfortable. Parking garage one block away, very convenient.

title: Great position, excellent staff great experience
review: Visited the Washington Square Hotel for a 6 night business trip. We initially chose this hotel because of the great location and it definitely has that going for it. However, after a full day of meetings the room doesn't have a comfortable chair to sit in and rock hard beds. The walls are paper thin and you can hear everything happening outside on the street from loud cars, honking and conversations. The room is clean and bright (we had 5 windows in our corner room) but everything is worn. The included continental breakfast is decent. Would I stay here again? Definitely love the area, but would look for other accommodations.

title: The real deal
review: I loved this historic hotel. No the rooms are not super glamorous but they are fine with all you need. I was upgraded to rm 903 and loved the room and the view The concierge is extremely friendly to everyone and happy to help with anything so are the reception staff. I was initially a bit put off by the tripadvisor rating but I had a great time and loved it. So easy to walk around all the village etc and surrounded by great restaurants, shops and interesting places Highly recommended

title: My home away from home (and I am a New Yorker)
review: Vintage New York - great location, style, and staff.  The rooms are very clean and perfectly appointed making the best use of a small NYC space.  Robes, makeup mirror, iron and board, umbrella, etc are all tucked away.  Although this may not appeal to some, I love being able to open a window for fresh air.  Breakfast was terrific. When you book, make sure to read the descriptions of room options carefully because some do not have windows to the outside. I reserved a deluxe queen that was supposed to have a full street or park view but actually looked out onto a brick wall although you could see the street from an angle. Next time I will call to get more information on specific rooms per floor.  Other than that, a classic hotel and will return.

title: Wonderfully accommodating
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: A fantastic hotel with great service!
review: I was supposed to stay at this property recently, however I came down with a virus and was unable to travel. I had paid for a non-refundable two-night stay and was concerned about losing my payment. When I called from the airport to explain my change of plans, not only were they warm and welcoming, but they honored my rate to be used at my next visit to NYC. I have heard it is lovely place to stay, but after having communicated with the staff, it is clear the staff are equally lovely. Looking forward to my first stay there...

title: Worth a Return Visit, Even with Hiccups
review: Arriving at this hotel rather late at night, after a long flight, the staff on reception were absolutely lovely! Lending us a multi plug when we'd forgotten ours, so we could charge our phones- gifting us with a bottle of champagne to celebrate our Honeymoon, and being available at all hours to help us. Truly fantastic service. The room was very large- even by New York standards- it had a large comfortable bed and a very clean bathroom.  We would certainly return, and would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the area! It's very close to the subway, so perfect for visitors.

title: Cute little hotel
review: Well-located for us to visit our NYU student.  Friendly and helpful staff, and well-priced.  A couple of hiccups:  The mattress in Room 812 needs to be replaced--the front desk was advised in great detail at check-out.  Also, the room was too hot, but that seems par for older buildings in winter in NYC.  Otherwise charming with a European feel.  With a rather good copy of Sargent's original version of "Madame X" greeting you in the lobby (the shoulder strap placement ...), it sets the tone for art and taste in this hotel.  Get that mattress changed and we'll be back, even though the rooms are far from cavernous.  This rating would have been higher, but for the mattress and in-room heat issues.

title: Good hotel with great staff
review: ...along a quiet alleyway off 8th avenue. I would pay more for a better room as the king size beds are huge! The hotel is clean, with helpful staff for directions and overall, offered a worthy stay for a reasonable price. highly recommend this hotel!

title: Character and charm
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Great hotel that's not touristy
review: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for nine days in late December. The location of the Washington Square Hotel is excellent if you want to be in the area near New York University and Washington Square. The room was comfortable though small, and all the amenities expected such as effective heating, an iron and ironing board, TV, coffee making facilities, and good internet access were provided, although we were aware that the rooms did not have a refrigerator since we had stayed there previously. We enjoyed the breakfast each morning (either buffet or full service) provided as part of the tariff. This hotel has character and its own charm. Ronnie, the concierge, is wonderful, constantly checking whether we needed information or help of any kind. We have always enjoyed staying here.

title: Great location, hotel, food and people
review: We love this spot Staying in the Village is way cooler than midtown. Very nice breakfast   Easy access to the subway on 6th Ave (one block away) or at Astor Place (five blocks)  Lots to do in the area and easy walk to SoHo

title: Excellent location, reasonable price
review: I stayed here with my fiance over New year's for six nights and loved it. Th rooms were just what we needed and kept us warm during the cold nights in New York of up to -4.  The free breakfast was the perfect way to start our day and kept us going long after we left for the day. The WiFi was also avgeat bonus and helped us announce our engagement to out families and friends. The people are very friendly and always willing to help, even if the concierge did accuse my girlfriend of being pregnant three times when she isn't!  Overall we would go back to this hotel in a heartbeat as the location is perfect at the bottom of fifth avenue and forces you discover other parts of Manhattan you wouldn't think of seeing if staying around times square.

title: Just as awesome second time around
review: I spent two nights at the Washington Square Hotel in a very small room on the second floor that overlooked the air shaft.   Pros: The hotel location is outstanding, in the middle of Greenwich Village and half a block from a subway stop. The lobby is pleasant. My room was clean and attractive and felt recently updated, and the bathroom was functional and relatively large. The bed was comfortable. There was no street noise in my room. The complimentary breakfast is fine. Wi-fi was free and reliable.   Cons: My room was tiny, even for NYC; the queen-sized bed essentially filled the room. It had no natural light. It was extremely overheated, and though the windows opened, there was no fresh air at the bottom of the air shaft, so I had to turn on the a/c (in November, on a very cold…

title: Beautiful old Hotel
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: A functional hotel in Washington square
review: This Hotel is over 100 years old but has been updated with many wonderful details, a perfect marriage between old and new.  I had the "Penthouse".  It was totally remodeled with a beautiful large bathroom, a seating area with a daybed and a sleeping area with a single bed, perfect for me.  You can see the Empire State Building changing colors at night from the windows, while you sip coffee or tea from the Keurig Coffee maker.  Everything is new and comfortable. The room price is quite good.  It is right at Washington Square which must be fun in the Summer, and very close to the NY University.  The subway is close by and there are many places to eat or walk to.  All in all, I didn't like the area as well as some others I have been staying at in NYC but the Washington Square Inn…

title: Location is the only positive!
review: Close to NYU. Easy checkin/checkout. The same friendly concierge. Breakfast was modest but adequate. King room was roomy enough if dated, but clean.  Gym small and equipped with ho-hum gear. Overall it was fine for a stay, but not something to write home about.

title: Room 603 at the Washington Square Hotel
review: Location is amazing if you love Greenwich Village, West village , Soho, Chelsea, Flatiron even East Village , all are within steps to 15 minute walk max. Unfortunately that is the only positive, we were a family of four, beds are way too small and as a previous reviewer wrote our AC was not working either, it was too hot to have a comfortable sleep in December! Unfortunately I only mentioned the AC problem upon checkout , so I never gave them an opportunity to fix the issue. Hopefully they can address these issues and also give the hotel some renovations. If your a couple good choice( make sure AC works) if  you are a family of four stay away.

title: Peaceful respite
review: Overall, we were happy with out five-night's stay.  We were up high enough in the hotel that the busy-ness of the elevator didn't bother us.  Our room was immediately adjacent to the elevator and it did not bother us at all.  We stayed Dec. 7-12 while the outdoor temps were in the 30s and 40s.  We had to leave our a/c on full bore all the time AND leave the bathroom window open a few inches to be comfortable.  Once we dialed in the right combination of daytime and nighttime windows-open inches, we were set!  Definitely a small room, but hey, it's New York!  We'd stay there again!

title: Great location, rooms are a little snug for the price
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Not a good place to sleep
review: Stayed here over a weekend on a return trip to the city.  Location can't be beat: right down the street from Wash Square Park, easy subway access and in the heart of NYU and Greenwich.  As others have mentioned, the rooms are pretty cozy and the rates are lofty, but probably on-par with other boutique hotels in the area.  The AC unit kept making robot noises all night long despite being turned off.    Complimentary breakfast was a nice touch even though we just grabbed and left.  Wifi sluggish as others have also mentioned.  Staff were incredibly friendly!

title: Why we are so in love with this hotel
review: This hotel has a great location ,thus the three stars. However they need new mattresses ! The rooms in NYC are small ,but this was coffin like. AC didn't work and I needed to open the window. Noisy guests kept me awake until after 1AM . Staying in the second floor was helpful as I was able to take the stairs up and down. Hotel staff was friendly but not helpful or attentive. Won't stay there again no matter how good the location might be !

title: Village gem
review: This hotel is an absolute treasure. When you walk in it is art deco all over the place. After staying in this boutique hotel so many times it is for us like "home coming". And that was already also our expierence when we visited the hotel for the first time. The doorman Ron, the receptionist Margareth and her collegues, Vicky, they all are very helpful. You feel home in this hotel because apart from real hospitality it is not such a big chain hotel. In fact the oldest, independent family owned hotel in New York. One of the highlights of this hotel is the bar. Open from 5 pm. Very tastfully designed like a Paris salon in the old days. The colourful tiles are real top class art. There is a choice of several rooms from rather small (but not too small) to the big and luxurious king…

title: Comfortable, friendly, great location- a bit on the cozy side.
review: I've stayed at this hotel twice now. Small, quaint, friendly. My first stay in a deluxe twin was nicer then in the superior twin because the bathroom was nicer. They were very helpful when I needed assistance. Location is great and away from the heavy tourist crowds. Great hotel for NYU parents or those looking to shop in SoHo area. Had trouble with wifi though. Complimentary light breakfast is good. Enjoyed eating dinner in the restaurant. Will be back!

title: Great Location
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Good location, good price.
review: Very nice hotel.  Rooms are very small but a bit larger than other New York hotels.  The hallways are laughably narrow, but again, typical for New York.  The staff is great and very helpful.  There is a nice free breakfast.   The best part is the location.  We were visiting our son at NYU and it was very convenient.  You are paying mostly for the location because the hotel itself probably isn't worth the price.

title: Fantastic location, music lover's paradise. Otherwise average.
review: This hotel is a good choice if you are looking for a clean, reasonably priced hotel in a good location.  The hotel room we had was quite small but perfectly adequate for us since we had no plans to spend much time in it.  Importantly for me, the room was very clean. Although at the front of the hotel, close to street level, the noise was not a problem for us though possibly if you are used to silence while sleeping you may be disturbed by sounds normal to a big, busy city such as New York. The free breakfast buffet was pretty basic: the usual cereal, toast, bagels, yogurt etc but an easy way to start the day.  The hotel is in a great location, very close to the subway and many great restaurants. For the price, this hotel is a great choice.  We will definitely stay here again.

title: Nice Little Hotel in Greenwich Village
review: If you want to be near the music scene, this is bang in the centre of it. Once the home of Bob Dylan (in its former incarnation as a flop house) and many other great artists, it's a music lover's dream.  It's right near some great restaurants and bars.  The rooms are not large or swanky. The service is good but not great (let down by the night receptionist who really couldn't give a toss whether I got my early car to the airport or not), the breakfast is nice but nothing to write home about.  Personally I'd stay here again but it's not everyone's bag.

title: Perfect location, great staff, lovely room A ****
review: The hotel staff is very friendly; the room was very clean and comfortable; the hotel was quaint and had the feel of history to it; and the location was excellent, just feet away from Washington Square Park. This is a nice little location far from the typical tourist crowds of midtown, but, with several subway lines within easy walking distance you can get up to the midtown sites very easily (or sites for pretty much all of New York City for that matter). There is a nice little lounge in the hotel and there is a restaurant should you feel like dining in.  Greenwich Village is a great area to explore with a mix of things to do and see, plus, you're also a short walk from the East Village, which is much improved since the 1980s but still has it's own quirky style and feel.  The…

title: A rabbit-warren of closet-sized rooms
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Back again, very happy again.
review: Check in took 45 minutes and it wasn't clear that we would get a room despite having a reservation. Requires walking up and down stairs to get to the lounge and even to go to another place on the same floor. Not for people with mobility issues (or claustrophobia)!

title: Bohemian area
review: This was our 2nd visit to the hotel, and once again we were very happy we chose it. Location is perfect, especially if you want to avoid the mid-town hustle & bustle. Our room was nice & comfortable, even though it was not as big as regular American rooms. Service was perfect, breakfast was nice, and front desk staff were friendly as can be. ...and the location, just steps from the Comedy Cellar, Jazz clubs, many cafes, restaurants, bars...walking distance to SoHo, TriBeCa, Unison Square...we will be back!

title: Inexpensive, good location, but would never go back
review: Nice alternative in case you don't want to stay at Times Square. Greenwich village is a great neighbourhood on Manhattan and since subway station is nearby, a great starting point to explore NYC. Small park with lots of activity (university area) almost in front of the hotel. Sufficient good restaurants close by, as well as grocery shop. Good value for money, nice breakfast with plenty of options & away from tourist masses at Times Square.

title: Charming, Quirky--But No Internet
review: Hotel is affordable and centrally located but as there are other hotels that meet that criteria I definitely won't come back. Poor service at the front desk, uncomfortable bed, nonfunctional bathroom for 2 people, dated decor and rooms. Highly recommend staying at the Marlton instead.

title: Good location for Greenwich Village
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Lovely Boutique Hotel in Prime Location
review: Location: great for seeing the lower end of Manhattan but quite a walk from Empire State, Times Square and Central Park. Lovely setting on corner of Washington Square and easy access to High Line. Direct subway link to JFK. Hotel: Very pleasant Art Deco design but a little run down in places. Small bar area which closed early in the evening leaving no public areas to sit in although reception/doorman did open it up for us to play cards. Breakfast served in bar but we had to use restaurant below as too busy. Typical cereal/breads served but service poor as so busy. Room: nice to have robes provided. Internal room (got a good price) but felt claustrophobic - no window or view of outside space. Quite small but adequate for a city stay. Liked the decor - again Art Deco theme.

title: Historic Greenwich Village
review: Wonderful location adjacent to Washington Square Park and within walking distance to all that Greenwich Village, the West Village, SoHo etc. have to offer.  We were even able to walk to The 9/11 Museum and Memorial which is about 1 3/4 mile, 35 minute, walk.  The hotel is very much in the European style with an art deco flair.  A very attentive and helpful front desk and doormen.  We stayed in a Queen Deluxe room on the 9th floor (fast and convenient elevators) and although the room is small it was very well appointed.  Extremely comfortable firm bed, good shower/bath, robes, blowdryer, iron, Keurig machine with coffee and tea, TV.  Perfect for sleeping and exploring the city. Another nice feature is a lounge area that has complimentary continental breakfast in the morning. …

title: Away from the hustle and bustle
review: located in the heart of the Village.  Walk to SOHO,NOHO, union square , Astor Place. And the Flatiron district. Close to legendary jazz and comedy clubs.  Doorman extremely helpfull. Be sure save Sunday for an entertaing day in the park. Blocks away from most subway lines.

title: Lovely hotel unless you are disabled
review: Excellent little hotel in Greenwich Village. Attentive staff and convenient location. The rooms are good and a buffet breakfast is included - so is free wifi by the way. The doorman was extremely helpful during the stay and had a detailed knowledge of the surrounding area.

title: Unbeatable Location
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Great location and service, however
review: When we first came to NY three trips before, we said even then that this hotel was they place to stay, despite us staying in Midtown then.  Three trips trying to save money later, we finally decided to pay what was necessary to stay here, and we're so glad we did.  As Greenwich Village is our favourite part of NY, the location is absolutely unbeatable for us, with so much within 10-15 minutes walk.  And being only 1 block from a main and central subway, you're never far from anywhere else.  As for the hotel itself, we were in a queen deluxe and I felt the bed was a bit too hard, but my wife said it was fine, so maybe it was me.  I also got fed up with the wifi logging out what seemed like every 30 minutes or so, but the signal was good.  We thought the breakfasts were very good,…

title: Does what it says on the packet...
review: This hotel has a superb location just by Washington Square Garden and close to the tube. The bellman gave us some great tips regarding locations to visit. He knows his city. The rooms are clean but small. Upgrading the air conditioners would be a good idea as they are noisy.  Free Wi-fi at the hotel which was nice.  The included continental breakfast was ok. Bagels, toast, scones, muffins, cereal, nutella, jam, some fruit choices, coffee and juice.   Unfortunately we got a room on the first floor turning towards Waverly pl. and with direct access to the reception. This meant a LOT of noise from the reception at night and some from the street. Knowing it is Manhatten noise is expected from the streets but the noise from reception/lobby was very annoying. This is also the reason I…

title: Great location, clean but dated
review: It's a hotel in a convenient location, it has small rooms and small bathrooms, ( it is New York ) the beds are comfortable, it is clean and the staff were efficient and functional. Seems expensive for what you get ( but it's New York ). The breakfast was included in the price,which is not really the norm, it was perfectly adequate ( so don't start being so demanding people....). I was a tourist in New York for three days... when in a city location, I come back to the hotel to sleep, wash, change clothes.... This hotel fits the bill, would I stay here again, yes, it's not glamorous, it's not swanky but it's what you get for $300 in New York. Had dinner in the restaurant which was pretty good and reasonable value, try it.

title: What a difference two decades makes...
review: We stayed here for our first stop as part of a Honeymoon your of NYC. We had noted in our booking that we were on out honeymoon and still the staff at check in and check out were no more than indifferent to us. The hotel is well located to explore Greenwich, Soho and NYU and an easy walk to some decent 5th Ave shopping. The gym is handy but dated and with only light free weights and only available from 6am-12am which means if you have jet lag issues at 4 am that isn't much help.  The rooms are fairly small, clean pretty dated styling but quiet and comfortable enough. The hotel isn't very expensive for NY and with the free continental breakfast it is decent value. With a friendlier / more attentive staff this hotel would be above average for its price point.

title: Good location but disappointing overall
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Good value in a great location
review: We stayed here as a couple for 14 nights, September 2014. The location is indeed great, close to Washington Square, lively NYU and the bars and restaurants of the West Village and 2 minutes from West 4th Street subway station. However, we felt we were paying over the odds for what we got, especially compared to European hotels. The definite impression is that the hotel has a fancy lobby and other public areas but somewhat basic rooms. We regret not asking for a better room, which was located internally on shafts within the building on the 2nd floor, so no views but brick wall. Also, near a door to the corridor, which was quite noisy at times. To be fair, the room had everything we needed in terms of iron, coffee and tea making facility, ice bucket, TV. WiFi was a bit slow.…

title: Great location in the village
review: We stayed at this hotel on the recommendation of  a friend.  It is ideally situated for all major attractions, most within 30 minutes walk.  It is very clean, the staff are very helpful, especially Ron the doorman who is very knowledgeable about the local area and very helpful.   a free breakfast is provided which is a bonus in New York, although not a great deal of choice it was enough to start you up for the day.  Only negative was the breakfast room was quite small and soon got crowded but worth putting up with it as it is an excellent hotel.

title: A Great Hotel in a Fantastic Location
review: We stayed 4 nights in September.  Visiting our son at NYU.  Really well located and price-wise met the bill for a comfortable hotel.  Buffet breakfast is fairly basic, but that shouldn't be the key influence.  You will love the location, price, room quality is fine, good and consistent wifi.  Wifi costs included- ie free.  Something Australian hotels need to come to terms with!   And did I say it is 15 metres from Washington square park?   Any spare moments ( and you won't have many of them as it is manhattan) can be whiled away people and dog watching in the park.

title: Great location!
review: I've just returned from my sixth visit to New York and stayed at the Washington Square Hotel.  Its the first hotel I would return to in the future. The location in Greenwich Village is great opposite Washington Square Park which is both colourful and a great place to watch talented artists at work. Ronnie at the hotel is an absolute gem, his knowledge and advice is just excellent, he is always smiling and brightens a rainy day. Great location, hotel and plenty of lovely restaurants etc nearby.  Great sized room too!

title: Great location
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Very low service
review: A comfortable and perfectly located hotel in Greenwich Village, I would definitely consider returning to this hotel next time I'm in New York. Good value for money by New York standards, but it's location is its biggest drawcard. The staff were efficient and helpful - we had an issue with some noisy pipes in our room, so they kindly moved us down the hall with no fuss.

title: A great place to stay in New York.
review: The hotel is located in a very nice neighborhood but thats where the compliments ends. The hotel serves a very limited included-breakfast. There is a buffet whit almost nothing and there is a full service breakfast. Also including very little, except very very bad service, that you get for free and every day. Not a very nice way to start your days on a vacation. There is also a dinner restaurant- North Square- the food is good but here the service is also very unfriendly and lacks every creativity to deal with people, guests. The frontdesk the same thing, according to the manager they run a bussines. That is truth, but unfortunately it is a bussines that has to deal with people. I advice them to go in to cattle. They also cant handle feedback but that was to be expected.

title: Great location in Greenwich
review: Excellent hotel, very friendly and a great location in Greenwich Village for exploring Manhattan. Rooms are not the largest but they're clean and well equipped. Breakfast is generous and freshly prepared.

title: My favourite hotel on our NYC holiday.
review: Stayed in NYC several times.  This is a great location.  The hotel is value for money although upgrading the air conditioners would be a good idea as they are noisy.  Our room was on the fifth floor at the back of the hotel so otherwise very quiet. The breakfast is adequate and paid for options are available if you feel the need.  All the staff were really helpful. Overall a great stay.

title: Village Digs
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Clean, Friendly, Historical Hotel
review: The coolest hotel in the coolest neighborhood in New York City. When you stay there, you are right in the middle of Greenwich Village. Catercorner from Washington Square Park, this boutique hotel once was the residence of one Bob Dylan in the early 1960's. The rooms are decent-sized, the basement restaurant/lounge is excellent and atmospheric, the staff is pleasant and helpful -- and location, location, location!!! Stay there if you can.

title: Great spot in Greenwich Village
review: Situated right next to Washington Square Park in the Village in NYC, this hotel was perfect for our 3-day stay. The price was under $500 for two nights, including a nice complimentary breakfast buffet (teenage son loves to eat!). Great neighborhood, great staff. We'd definitely come here again.

title: Small but very clean and nicely dressed rooms in an historic hotel.
review: This is a great location if you want to be in the Greenwich Village area. There is a convenient subway stop just around the corner for easy access to the rest of the city. We stayed pre and post wedding for a week. The staff was unfailingly nice and attentive. Our room was typical NYC small but large enough for our needs. The continental breakfast was surprisingly good. Be aware that you can eat the continental breakfast in the restaurant, where the staff can bring you what you want. A nice touch as the space for breakfast is small.  Another upside of the property were the two speedy elevators.  The only downsides I can report, are TV and amenities. This isn't a chain hotel so the TV, while a flat screen, didn't have HD and had only one ESPN. Ice is only available in the lobby.…

title: Very nice stay
review: Pluses and minuses to this place, but overall a hotel I would return to.  It was built in 1902 as the Hotel Earle.  The hotel is in the heart of Greenwich Village, and it purportedly has hosted the entire beat generation, including Bob Dylan.  Everything here is small; the lobby, restaurant, hallways, elevator and rooms.  The elevator can hold about 3 people with 2 people's luggage. If you dont breathe.  I dont think I've stayed in a hotel room quite as small as this.  The was no view, which I didnt learn until after my booking.  None.  Look out the window, brick wall.  If you want a view, make sure you ask for one, and you'll pay for it.  Our room came in at about $250.00.  That being said, it was decorated nicely, well-air conditioned, clean and cozy.  We didn't trip over each…

title: Don't tell
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Fantastic Location, Nice boutique hotel
review: Visiting for a long weekend. Nice to see parents dropping of kids to NYU . Welcoming reception and friendly lobby staff. Comfortable, clean room. Ok, rooms were smaller back then in 1906 when built. Very satisfying,included buffet breakfast.  Nice if you get a room with oblique view of Washington Square. A bit difficult to balance window cooling system with wall mounted ? heater fan unit overnight.  Perfect location. Plan to revisit but don't want to share the secret of this gem too widely.

title: NYC
review: This was the perfect location for hanging out around the village and NYU.  Staff was very friendly, doormen were very helpful, and our week long stay was great.  The rooms are a bit small and amenities a bit underwhelming, but simple and boutique is what we were looking for and what we got.  Great place.  I'd stay again.

title: WSH, Greewich Village
review: It was a nice time, however 3 of us in a very small room. was challenging.  We made the best of it.  the folks there were helpful, polite and friendly. They even let us stor our suitecases while we toured NYC all day for no fee. amazing!!

title: Had a great stay
review: + Nice breakfast included, good service, great location by the park and conveniently close to subway station, value for money. - Very loud air condition device in our room (518), had to be shut off in order to get some sleep, but then it got hot...

title: Good value, good location
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: This is a charming hotel.
review: We stayed here in a room overlooking Washington Square, with my partner and 2 year old daughter.  We were only really sleeping and washing here, but we did fill up with the buffet breakfast most mornings, and I had a sup of their beer range one night in the bar, some nice hoppy ones on draught.  You've the Subway half a block away, Greenwich village 2 blocks away, with a huge range of places to eat. As it's near NYU, there's more student price range pizzerias about, with some 18 inch pizza for about a tenner. We sat and ate in the square playground, watching our daughter and the squirrels running around...  The room we got was one step up from the basic room, with a queensized bed. It wasn't a huge price step up, and contrary to most of the info of Manhatten hotel rooms, was…

title: great find
review: The room was clean (you could eat off the bathroom floor) and the staff was friendly.  This was a great location in Greenwich Village.  I will definitely stay there again.  When I say this was a nice hotel, I don't mean "this was nice for New York."  I mean it was nice.

title: A Wonderful Stay at the Washington Square Hotel!
review: We  were looking for a quiet area centrally located in NY.  This hotel is just that, but aside, it seems to be in the heart of a neighborhood. The staff is great with an onsite restaurant for breakfast and easy access to the Metro.   The rooms are small but adequate with AC. While it may seem pricey, it is a good value for the price in the big Apple.  The charm of this hotel is in it's history as it has always been a hotel, even home to some famous folks. I would definitely stay there again

title: Loved it! Cozy and NYC are not something you usually find together!
review: Last week I stayed at the Washington Square Hotel for the third time, and I couldn’t recommend the place more highly. The location is fantastic, the staff professional and friendly, the beds afford a good night’s sleep and the breakfast offers all guests a wide range. The hotel is clean and comfortable, and (as we found this time, and my mother found last time) the view over Washington Square is inspiring. This time around I was travelling with my husband, his parents, his sister and brother in law, and the hotel proved a perfect base for all of us. If you’re going to NYC, stay at the Washington Square Hotel, you will love it!

title: NYC Fun at Washington Square
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: There is a lot to love about this hotel
review: Had a wonderful weekend and enjoyed the Washington Square Hotel.  Wonderful - trendy - hip.  Walk to everything in Soho, Village, etc.  Small rooms but very clean.  The staff were very friendly and helpful.  The bar had great drinks!

title: Overpriced, average accommodation
review: My husband and I spent a night in New York at the Washington Square Hotel. It was the first time in a very long time that we didn't end up staying at a big chain in Midtown like the Hyatt, Hilton or the Marriott and so the location in the heart of Greenwich Village was a pleasant change for us. Seriously, if your plans are centered around the Village and lower Manhattan, this hotel can't be beat for it's location, just steps away from Washington Square Park. The lobby and hallways are well decorated, welcoming and clean. The staff is friendly and accomodating, especially the bell staff. We had a Queen Room and it was a good size for an older building. The downside for me was the extremely hard mattress and the fact that the only chair in the room was a hard wooden desk chair.…

title: Location, Location
review: We stayed here during July '14. Staff were friendly and helpful. $250-$300 per night, and the rooms were extremely small, no minibar or laundry service, facilities are extremely outdated - aircon was very noisy - tv tiny, and cleaning of the rooms weren't acceptable.

title: Cozy, clean, perfect location
review: The best thing about this hotel is the location.  It is close to Washington Square, in the heart of West Village and NYU's campus.  It is a quaint hotel with some pluses and minuses.  On the plus side, other than location, the bed was comfortable, the rooms are decent tho small. The decor in the lobby is quaint.  On the down side, the staff is not overly friendly or helpful.  The bellman didn't help us to our room with our luggage - but we saved $10 on not having to tip! The front desk people are a little brusque and not overly welcoming. On making the reservation, we had asked for a room on a top floor but when we checked in, we were told it was not "possible" to make such a request. No big deal, just not what we'd been told. The free breakfast isn't really worth it - the space…

title: Pleasantly surprised
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Terrific customer service!
review: Based on the mixed reviews, and the fact that it was the cheapest hotel in the area, I wasn't expecting much.  I knew it would have smallish rooms (it's New York City) and expected it to be antiquated.  Sure, the room was on the small side (expected), but the decor and ambiance leaned more toward quaint than antiquated.  The window unit air conditioner did a fine job of cooling the room, the queen bed was comfortable (the other option I had was 2 twin beds), and the bathroom was simple, but clean.  The television was definitely too small, but I didn't spend much time in the room, so it wasn't an issue.  My room had a couple of windows, but they faced a sort of interior courtyard that really only served to bring natural light to the rooms. There are probably only a couple of…

title: Nice Greenwich location
review: If you are looking for a clean, efficient and friendly hotel in the middle of Greenwich Village, this is the perfect place.  The room was on the small side, but had all the amenities - good coffee, gym, robes, free wii-fi and central air.  The TV was small, but who needs a big TV when visiting NYC.  A great find - reasonable, excellent service and comfort...

title: Love it..
review: Its in Greenwich. You feel safe walking around. I walked to ground zero from the hotel. A nice hour walk and you can also walk along the river all the way downtown. Then you come back with line 2 or 3 to 14th street. A lot of nice restaurants around the hotel.  The room was clean but the shower grout needed a little refreshment. Its small. The air conditioning is loud but NY gets cool at night and you can open the windows and sleeps with NY city noises!  The elevator is very tiny-small. A large man a a tiny woman feel sqeezed. I was on the last 9th floor bringing me an empty elevator but I saw many other guest on other floors having to wait for the next. Its also walking distance to Washington square park. A mini Arc-de-Triumph with a fountain!  Free wifi.

title: NY Trip July 2014
review: Just left a much pricier, new Botique hotel ( at 10:30 pm) to come here. We love this location, and eat at the awesome restaurant across the street,  we obviously had an issue with the place we were at.. Toured the rooms here and packed up at the other place and came here.. Perfect location, nice rooms, roomy, nicely updated and great A/C... Reggie at the front desk was super helpful.. Will certainly be back...

title: Superb location, nice hotel
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Great location great staff
review: I spent the last three days at the Washington Square Hotel.  It is a very nice hotel, beautiful old, art deco in style.  The room was SMALL.  I had the deluxe double. It was really very nice, but oh so small.  The smallest I have had in NYC.  I didn't have any problems, but I am sure the staff would have taken care of them if I had them.  They were very pleasant.  I also had the continental breakfast and it was fine.  Pastries, yogurt, cereals, bagels, cheeses and the coffee was good.  Unlike some hotels in NYC, the wifi worked very well, although I had to provide the password every time, but it worked great, so that was not a problem.   The hotel is across the street from Babbo, a Mario Batali restaurant and the location is a stone's throw from Washington Square Park.  It is…

title: Great location, clean rooms friendly staff
review: We were recommended this hotel by one of the "locals", who is a friend of ours. So glad we decided not to stay in the tourist areas (which we didn't enjoy), where we stayed on our first visit to NYC. There is no comparison!!! This is a small hotel with character and history - a number of famous people have stayed here over the years.  The check in and check out was very quick, Reception staff very helpful especially the daytime concierge - can't recall his name - who asked us every day where we were going, did we need any help with directions etc. He gave me cardboard and tape to pack the prints I had bought, so they wouldn't get damaged. The staff serving breakfast are efficient and quick to seat and serve you. We upgraded to the full breakfast, which was excellent - many…

title: Convenient hotel for parents of NYU freshmen
review: Greenwich Village is the best neighborhood in NY in my opinion. The hotel has great staff, clean rooms and comfortable beds. I also appreciated the in room Keurig's, free wifi and adequate breakfast buffet. Quiet street allowed restful sleep!

title: Tiny outdated rooms
review: ...but expect to pay big buck$ during graduation week. And reserve well in advance.  Our bathroom was clean and the bed was comfortable. Breakfast beyond the lobby needs more fresh food options, otherwise quite nice.

title: Great Location and Amenities
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Nice hotel, perfect location.
review: If you're ready to give up the stress and press of uptown hotels and visit a less congested, more human scaled part of the the city this is where to stay.  Located directly across the street from Washington Square Park in the middle of Greenwich Village you can enjoy a quiet stay in what I think is the best part of NYC.  I asked for a rear facing upper floor room and it was extremely quiet.  Small, but clean the room was fine for someone like me who does not plan to spend my vacation in my room!  THe staff--especially Ronnie-- were super helpful and friendly with lots of suggestions on where to shop or eat in the area. Free continental breakfast and free wifi were great additions. The European clientele gave the hotel an international feel and its location and charm gave it more…

title: superb hotel, great location
review: This hotel had clean rooms, bedding, and excellent friendly service.  Joanna, the bartender at the cozy lobby bar was just a wonderful gal.  Pretty, friendly, and helpful.  The breakfast was great, off the menu or continental.  Lots of servers.  A nice family owned hotel.  I got the feeling that the employees liked working there.  Perfectly located within walking distance of everything in Greenwich Village.  Many, many, restaurants, bars, and shops.  I've paid twice the rate for the same size room in other parts of the city.  This is a good value!

title: Beautiful Hotel!!
review: This is my third stay at this wonderful art deco hotel, just a step away from Washington Square Park and in  the (relatively) quiet University area.  From Ronnie who greets you as you arrive - and I'm sure the place would fall down without him - through the friendly Reception staff, you are looked after wonderfully well.  The rooms are small but incredibly comfortable, with every use made of what space is available.  This time, I had a corner room high up, so a good view.  Beds are very comfortable, linens just that bit better than many places, towels fluffy.  In room safe large enough to take iPad but not laptop.  I can't imagine what complaint there can possibly be about breakfast here, which is included in the room rate - a wide choice, freshly squeezed juice, good coffee -…

title: European charm and character in a beautiful neighbourhood
review: The Good: I was very pleased over all with my stay. The hotel is beautiful and the staff is very friendly. It was within walking distance to most of NYC's best attractions.  And the price was pretty fair.  The Bad:  I didn't have a view of anything but a brick wall and I wish the halls were a little less creepy but you get what you pay for. Not sure if the parking deck located near by belongs to the hotel but the men working there were rude and total control freaks. Very un-service friendly.

title: Lovely little hotel, great area and cheap
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Very nice place at a cost
review: The location and area is great, rooms are fair clean and nice, deco is a change for the better, staff is friendly and helpful. But breakfast is unfortunately sub very sub standard. A little effort would be appreciated. It is not pretentious, a nice village place

title: Hotel with character, neighbourhood great
review: OK... It's NYC right? Just about everything is much higher priced. I do have to say that $384 per night (after taxes) is way on the high side.  So what is better than NYC???  .....  NYC on the company card! That's right!! The staff was friendly. The lobby was nice I was able to store my luggage with ease. The room was decorated nicely, albeit as is often the case in NYC, the room was very small Clean bathroom. Not perfect... a few chipped tiles... but really, if that is a deal breaker ... get a life  :-) I asked for a quiet room on high floor. I was not at all disappointed. 8th floor facing the back with a great view. The king sized bed was very comfortable for me. I have back issues and this one was just firm enough with a soft pillow top to be perfect. The breakfast was fine,…

title: Decent hotel in nice neighborhood
review: It was quite a relief to be in a hotel with charm and character, with art deco touches here and there. It's a jumble of corridors and ups and downs but we liked the individuality of it all. Location is just great, Greenwich Village is a wonderful place to stay, it feels like a real neighbourhood with so many dining options. It felt really safe there too. We found the hotel friendly enough and the breakfast buffet (included in the price) more than adequate. Although there were only two of us we 'splashed out' on a deluxe quad as we knew the room would be too small otherwise. Four in our room would have been a real squeeze but ours was great (having paid extra for the space, of course). It's not a cheap hotel but it's reasonable value when you start looking at general hotel rates…

title: Fabulous Location
review: Close to Washington Square. Away from the Times Square buzz. Great neighborhood. Good service. Rooms are small. Clean. But heavily overpriced. 400$ per night. Not worth it to be honest. Is the big apple really that pricy ?

title: Small Rooms, Big Price Tag
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Home away from home
review: I stayed for one night on a business trip, and if I had paid for the room out of my own pocket I would have insisted on a full refund and would have left for another hotel. Although the room was very clean, it was way too small for American standards, and this becomes particularly unacceptable when one factors in the expensive rates the hotel charges. The hotel did not even offer central air - my room featured a very old and broken window air conditioner, which made for a very uncomfrotable night's sleep. When checking out, I was never asked if I enjoyed my stay (I assume they have gotten tired of hearing about the issues with the size of ther rooms, etc.) and I found the staff to be of average friendliness and assistance and nothing more.
