Not sure why this place has so many…

title: Second trip to the WSH- no regrets
review: I stayed here for a week with my daughter while she participated in the Youth American Grand Prix and a second time during a summer visit to NYC.  Clean rooms and very friendly, helpful staff. Great onsite restaurant and breakfast.

title: Good value for New York City
review: This was my second stay - just as good as before - room very good if a bit small this time; but this is NYC so no complaints- service just right - and the best location - last time it was business at NYU, this time it was just leisure and where better than the Village with its laid back vibe, leafy square, and the W 4th st subway just around the corner to take you everywhere else

title: Very Good
review: Stayed for 3 nights in February 2014. I picked this hotel because of the convenient location. I usually stayed in mid-town area but the hotel rate in this period was so high over there.  This boutique hotel was quite nice and friendly. My room was at the back and has the view of the next building and the sky.  Room was of medium size and the bathroom was adequate, I didn't quite like the narrow zig zag corridor that leads to the room.  Decent free breakfast was served in the morning.

title: What a gem!!!!
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Brilliant!
review: Second  stay at this wonderful, charming art deco hotel and i can't wait to visit again. The rooms may be on the small side but have everything you could possibly want and hey some say small is beautiful. The staff are absolutely great and nothing is too much trouble for them, one receptionist even remembered me from 2 years ago and with all the thousands of people coming through their doors every day I'd say that was quite something. Ronnie the concierge/doorman is something else and in my opinion "the main man" always ready to go that extra mile for you and never without a smile and a way of making you feel extra special. A true credit to the hotel. Go try the WSH for yourself you will not be disappointed

title: Excellent location and friendly staff
review: My room was tiny but cosy. I LOVE this hotel... its perfectly located next to Washington Square, on the border of Soho and West Village. Lovely breakfast, wonderful staff. Its my favourite NYC hotel!!

title: Very Good Service
review: Location is probably one of the best in NYC. Area is plenty of character, very jazz and lively, with plenty of very good restaurants. Hotel is clean, rooms are not big but they are well equipped, staff is helpful and ready to give you all useful information you may need and breakfast is decent.

title: Classy and classic New York style in a small, friendly and safe boutique hotel.
review: We stayed in the hotel with my mother right before I moved in to the NYU dorms as a freshman. The staff was always friendly. The rooms were really small but considering that this is New York you can't really expect bigger rooms for this price. The hotel was clean and in a very good location right next to Washington square park and the west village.

title: Great hotel in a great location.
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Washington Square Hotel, NYC
review: Stayed here with family for one week in February 2014.   This is a fantastic hotel in a great location, right next to Washington Square park.   The bel man Ronnie was an absolute credit to the hotel. He was so friendly and chatty, and even saved us time and money by explaining the best ways to get to places and how to go about visiting the tourist attractions. A delight to see every day.  The room was basic but nothing special. However, we found that it was extremely hot. Even with the window open, with temperatures hitting -5 outside, it was absolutely boiling through the night and we had to have the AC on which resolved the matter. (Yes we double checked there was no heating on). This was an absolute mystery as our friends in another room didn't have this problem.  However, we…

title: Boutique hotel in a prime neighborhood
review: Great hotel in brilliant location for the nightlife of Greenwich Village - jazz within walking distance every night, Rooms reasonable size and bed very comfortable, hotel amenities very good with choice of full service or buffet breakfast. Staff very good and helpful

title: Comfortable Hotel, Amazing Location
review: This is perfect hotel in the Washington Square/NYU area. It offers a free breakfast (or, if you want a full menu and service, there’s a separate area in the restaurant for that).  The rooms are small but serviceable.  The bathrooms are fully functional (not always the case at even pricier hotels): we particularly appreciated the heaters near the tile floors because that meant, essentially, warm floors in the bathroom.  Another small, but crucial item: a slanted grab bar in the shower.  There’s complimentary wi-fi (the only small complaint is that one has input the passcode each time one begins a wi-fi session).  The location is wonderful, conveniently situated near any number of restaurants and eateries.  There’s a small gym.  No pool.

title: Awesome
review: After staying near Wall Street for our first trip to New York, we definitely wanted to feel much more part of things with our second visit.  For this reason we chose Washington Square Hotel, which didn't disappoint in terms of it's location, being close to loads of bars, restaurants and West 4th St subway station for quick and easy access uptown and downtown.  Positive points aside from location was that rooms were spotlessly clean, very comfortable and had access to free wi-fi, which as an overseas traveler is always a major plus.  The staff were very warm and welcoming in a very sincere way, without being pushy or in your face, with a genuine interest in your well being and New York experience.  The negatives are minor and would not deter me from staying again, but the hotel…

title: Great boutique; great location
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Great location. Small rooms
review: Terrific hotel for Greenwich Village - and accessible to everything else in NYC. Terrific breakfast buffet (included, as is WiFi). Helpful & friendly staff. Room was small, but clean & comfortable. No parking, but there's a garage not too far away.

title: Proximity to NYU and Village only merits
review: Located next to Washington square, near NYU and close to the West Village where you can find lots of good restaurants and bars. Small and fair rooms. small elevators and thick walls. Nice staff and quick service. Included Breakfast  is basic.

title: Great value with a lot of personality
review: In NYC for weekend to visit daughter at NYU. Normally, we stay in Tribeca/Soho (Hilton Garden Inn or Sheraton), but because of cold weather, we didn't want to walk the 15 minutes--which, when the weather is good, is delightful. Because of the time of year, we got a "good" rate, too-$225/night. "Peak" prices can exceed $400/night. As for this property--the only advantage again, is the location. Nothing closer. Right on WSP. 1 minute from dorms and NYU facilities. Beyond that, the hotel is old, no business center, slow elevator, and my floor (3rd) was under construction, as well. Room was OK--clean but small. Thermostat hard to control. Bathroom was tight--and it took a while to get hot water in the sink. Still, the staff was very helpful. Lounge and restaurant on site. Did not…

title: Highly recommend, great value, good location, nice rooms, big bathroom by NYC standards.
review: Neat place with a lot of personality in the Village area.  Right accross street from Washington Square.  Neat resturant on site.  Continental breakfast include with my rate that was just right amount of food and chocies.  Front desk staff is friendly and accommodating.

title: Great to be in the middle of history.
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Great location & the bellman is awesome!
review: Across from the Washington Park with many historical buildings and plaques, plus the Washington Mews.  Great location in a very nice neighborhood.  There is also a very good restaurant attached to the hotel--brunch was very good.

title: I will be back
review: Stayed here for a few days & the location was good- close to restaurants, transport & shopping. The Bellman was always happy, helpful & wisecracking - the best asset to the hotel! The rooms are not large nor fancy but they are decent & always clean. Would have been better if there was a bath but otherwise it was a lovely hotel in the heart of greenwich.

title: A great stay at a historic hotel with great service!
review: This hotel is tucked in a corner street of NYC. It is beautiful inside, very old romantic decorations. The breakfast was fabulous. We had 4 people in the room and the room was tight but manageable.  The shower was awesome. I think there double beds aren't true doubles. If you are very tall 6'0 or more your feet will hang off, this happened to my husband. The location was perfect for visiting NYU. It was pretty quite in the room but could have been more quite.

title: Another enjoyable visit to my favourite New York hotel.
review: We stayed at the WSH for six nights leading to the New Year, 2014.  The room was comfortable and quiet.  Everything worked, including the heating, hot water and appliances.  The breakfast was amazing, and service was to the tee.  A special Thank You to TERESE at the reception desk -  to be received and attended to from the heart, and always with a smile, made our stay!

title: Perfect Location
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Good getaway for NYE
review: This place was so convenient.  Located within a block or so from two different subway trains.  It is half a block to beautiful Washington Square Park perfect for early morning or evening walks.  The continental breakfast is more than enough but if you are want a more you can eat in their full service restaurant.  The room itself was very clean and very spacious.

title: Good value
review: We spent three nights in this hotel over the NYE period. It was very easy to find from the subway. The staff inside were all incredibly friendly and dealt with our queries very effectively. We particularly liked how easy it was to book a car to take us to JFK, and how much knowledge of the area all the staff had.  The rooms were a little smaller than we perhaps thought they might be, but were well equipped and had a good sized bed. The location on the edge of Washington square meant that it was very easy for us to get to to all the tourist sites (no more than 15-20 mins on the subway for anything below Central park). We didn't make use of the on-site gym, but it was available if we had wanted. Overall we would definitely consider staying there again if we needed a hotel in NYC.

title: A nice, low-key place to stay in a decidedly high-key town
review: For $220, with continental breakfast included, this hotel represents good value for the area. The decor is a bit dated, but has character, and  rooms are larger than some new ones in NY.  It is clean, a little too warm perhaps, and the beds are comfy. Windows can be opened, though on the park side let in quite a bit of noise. Apart from the location, near a useful subway, and walkable distance to both West and East villages, Soho, and Union Square, the other great feature of this hotel is the friendly helpful Staff. We will definitely stay here again. Before Christmas, we enjoyed the  festive looking exterior, and the lovely lit tree and Christmas activities in the park.

title: Great Location Very Comfortable
review: Yes, the rooms are small. Yes, you have to run the AC fan to drown out the constant roar of water in the old pipes. But you are not in New York to sleep or lounge around your room. The hotel is clean and comfortable, the staff is friendly and helpful, the free breakfast is edible. And you are in the middle of the greatest neighbrohood in NYC. Be sure to eat at Amelie's, down the street.

title: Would definitely stay here again
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Full of Character
review: We stayed for a week in early December and could not fault this hotel. The location is ideal for those who want to stay out of the hustle and bustle of the Times Square area yet still be central enough to access all the major attractions. There is a subway right around the corner and lots of good restaurants and cafes within walking distance.   The hotel was clean throughout and all of the team were friendly and helpful, the continental breakfast was a great start to our day and the free wifi was quick and easy to access. The superior twin room (2 single beds) was ideal for our budget, good shower pressure, plenty towels and the robes were a nice touch.  I would definitely choose this hotel again when returning to NYC.

title: Great for NYC
review: We stayed for 3 days in September before we cruised our of NYC to Canada. We wanted something a bit different, not Manhattan, for this our third trip to NYC and we loved the art deco decor and ambiance. Rooms are on the small side and a little more sympathy and help from the staff would have been appreciated when BA managed to lose my suitcase for the best part of our stay would have been appreciated, but hey this is New York - who expects sympathy?!! Great location for The Village and with the subway station only at the top of the street, easy to get around. We got a good deal booking and paying in advance - otherwise would have been pricey.

title: A fantastic stay
review: Have stayed several times now as it is near the West Village.  the rooms are adequate and larger than many other Manhattan hotels.  The breakfast is a basic continental breakfast, but do here is a reasonably priced breakfast menu.  A new touch is a Keurig in the room with an assortment of teas and coffee.

title: Great location if you're in the village
review: The service was exceptional. The staff bent over backwards to insure that we had anything and everything we needed. The room was immaculate, comfortable and made for a great night's sleep. We had come up to NYC to get married and stayed 11 nights here. Not only did they make us feel at home, but there was a note waiting for us when we entered the room the first time congratulating us and wishing us the best from the hotel staff. Top notch room, service, etc. I would GLADLY recommend this place to any and all of my friends and family!!

title: Some Good, Some Bad.
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Great location, expensive for what you get
review: My girlfriend and I stayed here for 6 nights, after staying for 5 nights in Midtown (at the Library Hotel).  We chose this hotel because of its location, away from the more touristy areas, and based o the reviews here.  The location was pretty good - near a couple of train lines, and within walking distance of a lot of fun restaurants that weren't midtown-priced, and had a more relaxed and genuine feel about them.  Spending time away from midtown was a welcome relief.  In terms of the accommodation, we stayed in one of the better/larger rooms, which was quite nice.  The hotel was clean and bright, and the maid service was very good.  Now - the thing that made this hotel a "do not go back" in my mind, was the restaurant.  We had breakfast included in our accommodation, and it was…

title: Nice City Hotel
review: I was giving a talk at the NYU Law School so looked for a nearby hotel.  The WSH was well reviewed by everyone who stayed there.  The staff was very friendly, although the front desk was not particularly warm or efficient.  The rooms are clean but very small.  The location is great but i thought a tad expensive for what one gets.

title: Good service, style, and location
review: Stayed for four nights . The hotel was prettily decorated outside with Christmas lights and the lobby had a nice style to it which all gave a good impression. However, the decoration and carpets in the tiny narrow corridors is dreadful - heavy artexed white walls and drab carpet tiles - we were concerned about what we might find in the room. We had a corner room( Deluxe on 8th floor) it had a slight view of the Square from both bedroom and bathroom, although it is rather necessary to keep the blinds down most times due to proximity of other buildings.  There was very little street noise and the room was an adequate size for a city hotel as with the bathroom. Decorated in the style of the hotel (a little drab for our taste) the room had good facilities  and service was prompt…

title: Wonderful Experience
review: Stayed here 3 nights, and we pretty much endorse others' positive comments. We liked the clubby oak walled look in the lobby. The lobby service was attentive and courteous. Our room, a 3rd floor queen with a view, was spacious by local standards. It looked out on the corner of Macdougal with a partial view of the park. There was a little street noise but not too disturbing. Breakfast was only adequate, might have liked a few more options.  We stayed in one of the newer rooms with the wall mounted heat/AC. This worked well during a cold week and was very quiet, although even at its lowest setting and with the original radiators turned off the room was sometimes oddly warm.  The hotel is a block from multiple subway lines, so easy to get to East or West sides of town. Wifi was…

title: NY visit
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Nice hotel, fantastic location
review: Excellent location in the "Village", rooms clean, staff friendly,very adequate continental breakfast, but rooms very small with one straight backed chair.  High scale restaurant on site, also fitness room available.Premium pricing.

title: Lovely little NY hotel
review: Stayed at WSH for three nights in the heat of summer.  Our room was clean, reasonably sized (for NYC) and air conditioned and was a great respite from the bustling city heat.  The staff are really friendly and helpful.  The hotel is a little dated but it does add to its charm. It's just a perfect little base from which you can explore the city. The location is fantastic too with plenty of amazing restaurants on the door step.  I would definitely recommend this hotel and I will stay again.

title: Great location
review: Stayed two nights to visit a grandson at NYU... wonderful location, very close to a subway stop, NYU, Washington Square and Soho shopping. Room was smallish but perfectly adequate; beds and linens were uber comfortable. Staff was top notch; North Square restaurant in the hotel is fabulous.

title: Older but Nicer
review: Great location. Close to everything right in the heart of Manhattan.  A nice neighbourhood too, we enyoued just walking around in the warm evenings of september.  Good breakfast - coffee and New York Times.

title: My Favorite Place
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Excellent!
review: Just returned from a recent stay at this great art deco, family run hotel in the West Village. You can't beat the location; and it was as charming and comfortable as my first stay there 4 yrs. ago. The breakfast, included in the rate, is the best I've seen-not just rolls and coffee, but cereal; fruit; bagels, pastries; and you can order extras if you like_eggs, etc for a small fee. And, they even have gluten free bread, which was a real plus for me! Staff is extremely helpful and pleasant. An excellent restaurant is on the premises as well. Rooms are small, but cozy and comfortable. It does not have every amenity of the fancy hotels, but feels like home. And the rates are reasonable. I love it there.

title: Location, Charm, and Quiet!
review: I liked the location of the hotel, the fact that you could get food without leaving the hotel. Rooms were quiet, comfortable, good shower pressure, plenty of hot water. A quiet a/c machine. Loved it  Staff were very helpful, pleasant and made sure we were well taken care of. The design of the hotel is great! Really interesting and a gem in a great location - walking distance from Soho, Meatpacking etc

title: quaint art deco, great value in the village
review: Dear Jennifer h, Thank you for your review! So good to hear you enjoyed your stay and our superb location. On behalf of the team at WSH, I would like to personally thank you for your business, and look forward to the next time to have you as our guest. Sincerely, Agnes B.

title: Excellent location, very friendly staff
review: No noise, no fuss, the most polite staff, and great little continental breakfast included. The stay was easy as it should be. The building is old and charming with an Art Deco theme. The rooms are small, as to be expected, but all of your basic needs are covered an then some. If you're a travel diva - don't stay here because the simplicity of this hotel will turn you off. If you're someone who is all about location, surrouding businesses, and friendly people as a trade off for high end shampoos and 3 different shower options, then stay here... it's great!

title: Superb in every way!
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Washington Square Hotel
review: I stayed here for one week with my son, we had a wonderful time. The hotel couldn't have been better for us in terms of location, comfort and hospitality. The location is superb. In the heart of Greenwich Village, near to the equally attractive West Village, The Meatpacking District and The Hudson River. All accessible on foot whilst taking in the ambience of these delightful areas, maybe stopping for a coffee a long the way and just watching the world go by. The Washington Square Park is a great place to relax too after a hectic day seeing the big sites, just chilling out and sitting with the locals is just as thrilling. I was worried that the size of the room might be too small (after reading previous reviews) for the two of us bearing in mind we were mother and grown-up son.…

title: European feeling
review: Dear SuseyG,  Thank you for the positive feedback! It's really great to hear that you and your son enjoyed your stay. Our location is ideal for every sort of activity and I'm happy to hear you were able to experience it all. Our staff works very hard every day to ensure the best guest experience. We greatly appreciate the kudos! I would like to personally thank you for your business, and look forward to the next time to have you as our guest. Sincerely, Agnes B.

title: Delightful find
review: Great service from front desk. Clean, great breakfast and fantastic location. Rooms a little tired - nothing a lick of paint would fix. Also would benefit from double glazed windows for external sound protection.

title: excellent
review: Great location - just steps form NYU and everything in Greenwich VIllage. Rooms were on the small side, typical of New York City. Definitely not your cookie cutter chain hotel - a lot of character and a European feel to the hotel. Nice continental breakfast in the morning included in the hotel charge. Also free internet - a rarity in New York CIty hotels. Front desk staff friendly and helpful.

title: Great Location!
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Great Value
review: Best location right on the corner of Washington Square! Friendly staff & clean & comfy rooms! Great value! Highlight was my morning coffee in the square feeding the squirrels nuts! They come up & take them from your hand! Would stay there again in heartbeat!

title: Great location
review: The hotel area is my favorite! Out of the crowded annoying uptown! There are great stores and restaurants around, the Washington Square right on the corner is a super plus!   The hotel stucture is great, confortable and clean. My mom and I stayed in the Quad Room, I would be happier with a better Continental Breakfast, but that wasn't a problem at all!   I had a small problem regarding a Gray Line payment with a recepcionist but as soon as I realized the hotel did not hesitated to refund me.

title: Excellent value!
review: This is a friendly hotel in Greenwich Village. The whole area is a delight. The hotel is charming and elegant on the ground floor. The doorman is the best in New York - so helpful. The Front Desk staff were extremely helpful. Our room was on the 7th floor and, like all hotels in New York we have stayed in . - a little small and equipped at a slightly lower standard than comparable rated hotels outside the city. The bed was comfortable but the walls between rooms thin. The breakfast was good value .

title: Great stay
review: I stayed here in a deluxe king room facing west on the 8th floor. The doorman was exceptionally helpful (Shelby) and the front desk staff  were very friendly and willing. Continental breakfast included was a plus. It was worth paying for waiter service (very reasonable) as opposed to rather stingy buffet. Still, you can toast your own bread.  Food was good and roaming waiters with fruit bowls and big bread board.  Air conditioning was window unit but worked perfectly and switched by the bed, so no getting up in the night if you got too cold. My room was really quiet and at bedtime I just closed the window and turned on the a/c unit. Room was clean and tidy. Not big or luxurious, and no room service, but SO much nicer than a midtown "luxury" hotel I stayed in on my last visit and…

title: Great Small Hotel at a Great Location!
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Good location and service
review: The location is perfect. Of course, if you wanna enjoy west village, greenwich village and east village. The subway is near and the lovely Washington Square is on the corner. But what about the hotel? Ii's a small and charming place, with a very spacious room (for manhattan standards), nicely decorated (ckassic art deco style!), a real comfy bathroom, very good breakfast included and a really nice and helpful staff. Ronnie the Bellman is great! What else? Stay there. You'll love it. Like i did. Washignton Square hotel is my home in Manhattan from now on.

title: art deco in downtown nyc
review: The hotel is perfectly located in the middle of Greenwich village, around the corner from a wonderfull lively park and NYU. Helpfull staff. Breakfast is included in the room price, coffee, orange juice, choice of bread/bagels/pastries, fresh fruit. Interior looks better on the pictures than in reality. Corridors are old fashioned, but the room was refurbished, clean and quiet. Subway around the corner.

title: Good location and affordable quality in NYC
review: I have stayed at this hotel on previous visits to NYC and love it.  A classic art deco hotel, with pleasant lobby, friendly helpful Desk staff - and of course Ronnie the Bellman - lounge area and a superb restaurant.  A really excellent breakfast is included in the room price - coffee, orange juice, choice of bread/bagels/pastries, fresh fruit and cereal included; if you wish to have a cooked breakfast, there is a menu and it costs extra.  Evening meal in the North Side Cafe, whilst beautifully cooked, is quite pricey and you can find far cheaper alternatives around the Washington Square area if you don't want to move far.  Lunch in the North Side is also available.  Rooms are not large but certainly adequate, with spotlessly clean bathroom, large comfortable beds, a desk area,…

title: best base for downtown activities
review: We decided to try this hotel at the recommendation from a family member who's stayed there several times and liked it.  At the time we booked the rates seemed to be relatively reasonable ($286/night before 15% taxes - including continental breakfast – kind of an acceptable mid-range price for NYC hotels).  Location was certainly convenient, at the leafy northwest corner of Washington Square and a couple blocks to the subway.  Check in was smooth and the staff was courteous and efficient, also mindful of our request for a higher floor (standard superior rooms have no view so higher up is a way to get more natural light).  We looked at a lower floor room as at first the higher floor one was not quite ready - it was on the 3rd floor facing a wall - so waited a bit and had 809,…

title: We loved the location
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Excellent value, Great location, Fantastic helpful staff!
review: If there are any parents with New York University students for kids, then this is the hotel for you.  It won't break the budget (by NYC standards), it's really close to NYU, and everyone is so friendly with welcoming advice, that you will feel comforted and sane.  Of course, this hotel is also good for every body else!  It's what hotels used to be like in "the old days" when people cared and there was real personal attention.  Maybe because it is small and it isn't a chain, and it's been around for a very long time, but I would always choose to stay here.  Our room was rather small, but apart from that, we couldn't fault our experience.  It is quaint, characterful, and in a wonderful location.

title: Great Hotel
review: This place is great value in a very expensive city.  The location is excellent, the rooms are nice, beds comfortable, the place is clean and the staff are really fantastic.  I will definitely come back again.

title: Great location
review: I have been to NYC many times and stayed at many different hotels. This trip, September 2013, I stayed at the WSH for the first time. What a great experience! Friendly and extremely helpful staff (the woman who cleans the rooms even asked me what time I would like my room made up). The location is wonderful - right by Washington Square Park as well as 6th Avenue and 8th Street in the heart of Greenwich Village, right by a major subway stop with multiple train lines, lots of restaurants and stores (including  two 24/7 drug stores just steps from the hotel and health food markets within 2 blocks). My room (one of the larger ones - room 802) was LARGE, quiet, fully equipped and beautifully Deco - desk, vanity, Keurig coffee maker, hair blower, iron and board, in-room safe, great…

title: Everything about this hotel was perfect
review: This was our first visit to New York and WSH was a great place to stay, easy to get to other areas of NY - the subway not far away.  The Washington Square across the road was great to wander through and watch people playing chess and the squirrels scampering around. The WSH room was quiet even though we had a front corner room, we slept very well and didn't hear the outside world. We loved the decor of our room "Marilyn Monroe" style and fitted with the area it is located in.  The continental breakfast was lovely and all that was required to kick off a busy day in NY.  We would recommend staying here.

title: A gem in New York
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: My Favourite Hotel
review: This hotel is on the corner of Washington Square and only 5 minutes walk from Bleeker Street and the nearest subway station.  The hotel is old, but has recently been refurbished and the rooms are clean and comfortable.  The breakfast is continental but is enough to set you up for the day.  The staff are very friendly and helpful.  I recommend this hotel as a change from staying in a chain hotel in Time Square.

title: Location
review: This was my 2nd stay here and I came back because it's so good.  The location couldn't be better, the rooms are quiet, you have the buzz of Washington Square on the doorstep, and a short walk to the subway to go uptown.    I had a fabulous room on the corner and overlooking the park.  It's well worth paying a little extra for a room with external windows.    The staff are so friendly, especially the doormen, who can't do enough for you.   The continental breakfast is perfectly adequate and as a vegan I was delighted that they had soya milk!  If you are looking for a change from the usual chain hotels, this hotel is perfect and beautiful with its 20s/30s art deco style.  I strongly recommend WSH!

title: Not a chain hotel
review: WSH is great spot to launch from and easy to get to all the sights. Lovely to be able to stroll through Washington square with a coffee in the morning.  Our room was comfortable and we loved the decor and style of the hotel itself! The staff was helpful and friendly. We were celebrating an anniversary, and were recommended some great places to eat. We had a great long weekend, wouldn't hesitate to recommend this place! We will stay here again.

title: Location, location, location...
review: Two of us stayed at this hotel for three nights this July. I chose the hotel pretty much for the location and also for being a small quirky hotel, with pretty good reviews. I would have been able to get a chain hotel room by Times Square for less money. Our small room was in the end of a hallway. We had no view from the window, mostly the brick wall of the next building, but my husband chose a quiet room instead of a view. He was happy with the quietness. We didn't stay long enough in the hotel room anyhow to be bothered by that. There is lots to see in NYC. The room was pleasantly furnished and decorated. The air-conditioner must have been good enough, since the NYC weather was very hot and humid, but we were comfortable in the room. We had complimentary wifi and complimentary…

title: A Village Hotel
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Good old hotel with a great location
review: Room - Queen Deluxe. Being a solo traveler, the room was more than big enough. Bed was comfortable, room always clean, bathroom newley renovated, clean and spacious. Special mention to Housekeeping for noticing i enjoyed the coffee and always left me extra coffee pods and also the extra towels. Was much appreciated.  Staff - Friendly, helpful and attentive. Special mention to Ronnie the doorman. A lovely man and a wealth of knowledge. Was very helpful. The hotel barmans Apple Martinis - Seriously delish and just enough kick. Was fun to chat with as well.  Breakfast - A simple complimentary selection of Fruits, Yogurts, Bagels, Croissants, Juice and Coffee. Was enough to fuel up on if you're not a big eater or you just want a quick bite before heading out for the day. If you want…

title: Best location for NYU and SOHO
review: This 100 year old hotel is located just off of Washington Square in Greenwich Village.  While the rooms are somewhat small (this is New York City after all) they are clean and the bathrooms are renovated.  I stayed in the larger room which was more than adequate.  I stayed in a smaller room with two queen beds and it was somewhat cramped.  But you stay here because when you step out the front door you are in one of the nicest residential areas of the city and close to all the action in Greenwich Village.

title: Reliable value in a great location
review: this hotel has an amazing location just steps away from Washington Square Park.  It is near several subway stops, Prince and Spring Streets (fabulous shopping), and, of course, NYU.  If you are a parent visiting your student look no further.  the North End Restaurant has very good dining and probably the best breakfasts we've had (check out the challah French toast).  The rooms are typical in size for NYC, and very clean.  There are some nice amenities in the room such as an umbrella and wonderful bathrobes.  The staff is friendly, and a special shout out to Kwesi, at the front desk who is helpful, kind and knowledgeable.  Our room was on the Macdougal Street side was quiet the 5 nights we stayed.

title: Great place to stay
review: I have stayed at the WSH multiple times.  I cannot think of a better location for New York.  The Hotel is at the corner of Washington Square Park.  There is the energy of NYU students, the restaurants of Greenwich Village in walking distance as well at the Subway.  Not flashy, but clean and comfortable.  I must admit that I reluctantly endorse this place, I am actually grateful that most do not know of the place and it is easier to get reservations.  The window air conditioners might be considered noisy to some.

title: Ronnie - not my cup of tea
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Very nice hotel
review: I'll try not to focus my review on the doorman but...............  Lots of people love Ronnie the doorman (always there to help out and steer you in the right direction) but  2 tips - not everybody wants your input and when you do 'help' don't treat the person like an imbecile (after all they are the customer). Rant finished.  Rooms great especially the ones on the front with 2 double beds. Breakfast is good but go for the self service. Although the room is better in the table service area the waiters really don't want to be there and struggle to make polite grunts.  Why very good overall rating - service in the bar and at reception was great, fantastic location and delivered above expectation for a manhattan hotel

title: Ideal hotel for parents of NYU & New School students
review: An excellent location if you want to be anywhere in Greenwich Village. The hotel is lovely, with lots of interesting decor, tilework, and photos of movie stars from past decades. It was very clean and quiet. The staff were less than friendly, but that was the only downside. There is a place on the first floor that serves food though it is not included in the price. Overall a good experience.

title: Lovely
review: Just spent 3 nights at the Washington Square Hotel in August.  My daughter is a freshman at Parson's school of design.    The hotel location is ideal; just a five block walk from the main buildings and her dorm.  Really enjoyed staying at the hotel.  Doorman was super friendly.  Loved the location.  Room was perfect.   Had a quick glass of wine in the cozy bar.  Will recommend the hotel to friends.

title: Always a good experience
review: First time in New York and my boyfriend and I were very happy with our decision to stay in the quiet Greenwich Village area. This hotel has so much character and charm, we will definitely be coming back to stay here.The room was perfect for what we needed; a clean, cozy, space to relax and get a good night sleep.   A short walk to the subway,and other landmark attractions and plenty of great food options around.   If you stay here, you won't regret it. Great value for money and a memorable accomodation.

title: Friendly place
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Sweet Home Greenwich Village
review: Nice, authentic area of New York near lively park. Personnel very friendly and helpful. Rooms are small (typical of NY ?).--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

title: Nice quiet area
review: I have to agree with what has already been positively written about this hotel. The location is as good as it gets for music venue lovers. All types of jazz/blues/rock joints around. The famous park is a stone throw away and the 6th Ave subway is not even a two minute walk.   The staff were always on the ball and willing to assist in any way. The hotel comes with restaurant/bar and small gym plus tablets for internet use. The room was small as expected but in fine shape. The window looked straight into a brick wall but there certainly was no street noise to be bothered with. The halls were quite narrow and somewhat bland but unless one wished to hang in the hallway or haul furniture, it really doesn't matter.  The price was what is to be expected for NY. For all the hotel's…

title: Great history, nice property and friendly staff
review: What a surprise to stay at this nice hotel in a quiet neighborhood! Last time I was in NYC I stayed in a hotel close to time square and was happy to sleep at the 17th floor, because of the noise. No need at the WSH we stayed at the 3rd floor but it was  quiet and relaxed. We loved the ambiance. The breakfast was good, only not to many tables to sit on in the morning. Next time I'll come back at your hotel!

title: Clean and cozy in nice area of Manhattan
review: My husband and I recently stayed at the Washington Square Hotel and thoroughly enjoyed our experience.  When we arrived on a Saturday about 6:00 p.m., they did not have the king deluxe room we reserved available (there was a problem with the bathroom).  They offered us a queen room for the night with the promise to move us to the king room the next day.  My husband asked if they could move us to an executive king because of the inconvenience and while they had none of those available, they offered to move us to the penthouse level for the last two nights of our stay.  We had the grand tour -- from the smallish queen room that looked out on an airshaft to a nice sized king room with a view to the penthouse level -- a huge room with windows on three sides and a view of the Empire…

title: Perfect Location for a weekend in NYC!
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Intimate
review: My 17 yr. old daughter and I stayed at WSH for 4 nights. It was a perfect location for us to walk, take the subway (1 blk. away) or catch a cab. The staff was VERY friendly and helpful! Our room/bathroom  was a good size for the 2 of us. It was very quiet. We really enjoyed the WS park across the street to sit and have a snack. The only problem i found was that the small room was overcrowded so we went to Caffe Reggio down the street which was AWESOME!! I would definatly stay here again!

title: A Cozy Gem in a Great Neighborhood
review: This was my third trip to NYC, and not a fan of large hotels, I was delighted to find this little gem in my favourite part of the city.  The owners have thought of everything. Despite the compact room (which I expected and find signature NY), everything was there literally at your fingertips, including fluffy robes and a thoughtful umbrella. The room was spotless, the bed comfortable and the vanity 'desk' with wi/fi appreciated. The air conditioning was blissful in the heat wave that week, my internal room on the eighth floor pin-drip quiet and the mostly French guests gave it an international feel. The service was delightful. Ronnie was particularly helpful. On my last day I was hoping to grab a cappuccino before leaving for the airport. Ronnie co-ordinated the driver so I…

title: Location, style and helpful
review: My daughter and I spent 6 nights here in July during the worst heat spell in history with most days mid to upper 90's (one day at 100 degrees) in addition to being very humid. Not my favorite weather, but we were very happy with this hotel!  We were given a room on the first floor which meant we never had to use an elevator, yay!  Our room, 128, was up a few steps and down a hallway in what seemed to be a newer section of the hotel?  In any event, the room was completely modernized in a Hollywood theme with framed photos of Hollywood stars on the walls.  My biggest concern in the terrible heat was whether the air conditioning would work well and I am happy to report that the Mitsubishi wall mounted, modern unit worked like a charm.  It was not as noisy as a window unit and…

title: Wonderful stay, good location
review: I loved staying here.  We found the hotel after venturing on the subway from JFKairport.  It was easy to find and immediately we felt like we had arrived in the neighbourhood, amongst real New Yorkers.  The hotel staff, especially Ronnie,were great with helping us to decide where to go and how to get there.  The hotel itself is quite old and that gives it soul.  It's very 1930s and our room was small, yet perfectly put together.  Good shower, and good coffee machine, comfy beds.  We had breakfast at hotel sometimes, just for speed, and it was always good.  It's the location and ease of getting around which made our stay fabulous,

title: Hotel review
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Outstanding location
review: We were very pleased with hotel, small room  but very adequate,no view.We stayed 4 nights, very comfortable for a NY visit. Staff attentive an pleasant. Breakfast room small but food was great. Excellent location.

title: Faultless small hotel
review: Hotel has a fantastic location and very friendly helpful staff.  Room a fashioned but fine. Only minus was the noisy air -conditioner which had to go off at night no matter how hot. Could take breakfast out!

title: Washington Square Hotel
review: Have just stayed here and I have to say it is the friendliest hotel in New York that we have stayed in.  Only small by ny standards but the staff are great and very helpful. The location is great right on the corner of Washington square park which is full of people and lots of different things going on.  Rooms are fine with coffee and tea machines in the rooms and free wifi. Buffet Breakfast included as well.  Beds very comfy, in room 914 anyway! Loads of restaurants in the area and the bus and subway very close as well. Highly recommended and a hotel with personality!

title: July
review: Great hotel ... wonderful staff ... fabulous location. Nice rooms, quiet. Nice continental breakfast. Nice amenities in bathroom. Very clean. Helpful staff goes out of their way to help you out. Great!

title: European feel
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Great service, great location, tiny room
review: If you are looking for an off the beaten feel of an older hotel in Paris or Rome, look no further - the WSH has it, right down to the tiny elevator! Feel of the 1940's, though the rooms have been nicely updated without the modern flash, i.e. tiled bathroom, radiators and wall lines still in tact. Continental breakfast is great, provided in highly rated restaurant, which enables one to order from a regular menu if you need/want more than the basic fare provided. (Great coffee, too!) In heart of Greenich Village where cafe's and tiny restaurants abound, just blocks from great shopping of SOHO. If you're not used to a little city noise, perhaps ask for a higher floor - but otherwise don't worry, windows extra thick so most of the noise if muted or muffled anyhow.

title: Wonderful, Affordable Art Deco Gem Near NYU
review: Wonderful small hotel on the corner of Washington Square Park and in the heart of New York University.  Has been around more than 100 years! The service is great and the staff informative and friendly. One staff particularly could help with everything from getting a cab to the history of the art work in the lobby.  The continental breakfast included was quite good and very convenient. My only complaint is that the rooms are tiny, dark, and down narrow hallways.  Perhaps this is the price you pay for this type of charm in a New York hotel. I would recommend staying here if you want the ambience of Greenwich Village and are spending most of your time in NYC downtown.

title: So-So.......
review: Small but very clean and well appointed rooms, a five minute walk from NYU. We booked for $180 per night prepaid rate.  We were very pleased at the little touches such as a full sized umbrella in the closet, ironing board, robes and a small safe.  A delicious continental breakfast is included with fresh fruit salad, fresh rolls, toast, and bagels along with coffee, tea, or juice.  Last but not least was the warm service who couldn't do enough to make your stay enjoyable!!!  Will definitely be staying there again.

title: Unbeatable location
review: Our second time staying at this hotel, and find a great neighborhood feel in this location. This time we were given a room (double queen) on the corner of the 2nd floor facing front.  I am used to city noise but if this is a problem for you, stay away from the front rooms.  The rooms are clean, but one of our bedspreads (white of all things) had a gross stain of some sort on the corner.  I found the bed to be somewhat uncomfortable,as a mattress on a platform is not a satisfactory option for me. I did get an okay nights sleep each night so what can I say... The bathroom was large with 2 frosted windows with double vanities, but your ventilation was to open the windows and not have any privacy or leave them down and not have any ventilation.  The bathtub drain was very slow…

title: Perfect location
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: A great location and good quality
review: Amazing location, close to several subway stations, 24 drugstore on the corner. Service was nice and respectful. Free breakfast and wi-if. A/C was very loud. Had a great stay. A great place to be, especially for couples, lots of restaurants in the area. In Greenwich, blocks from soho, Chelsea, meat packing, east village.

title: Fantastic location with some problems.
review: I stayed here for a business trip and found this hotel to fit the bill exactly. It was very well located, the staff were helpful and the room was comfortable and quiet. Yes, the room was small, but I wasn't entertaining in there, just sleeping. The doorman was super nice and very helpful. It was close to the subway. it was expensive by normal standards, but by NY standards, it was actually quite affordable compared to others. I would definitely recommend it to others.

title: European style hotel in NYC
review: I will first start off by saying that this hotel is in the perfect location. I love the village area and if you do too then by all means stay here. With that being said here is the downside, the rooms are crazy small. I know, I know it's Manhattan it's to be expected which I was expecting but I didn't expect it to be that small. Then there is the issue with the bed, king size bed ( who doesn't love that) but it was like sleeping on a cement block, I actually had to use the pillows as some sort of cushioning and got zero sleep that night because of the bed being that hard. The room itself is very very clean which is a plus. The bathroom was small but clean so who can complain about that. I really wanted to love this hotel and make it my go-to place when I stay in the village…

title: Not worth the money
review: Danni0713, Thank you for your recent review of our property. We really appreciate your comments.  We are a historic building and many of our rooms are smaller than those in newly constructed hotels. I am disappointed to hear about the uncomfortable bed. Many of our mattresses are new and could account for the hardness you experienced. I am sorry you had a sleepless night. I would like to apologize for not meeting your expectations and do hope you give us another chance. Please contact me directly should you decide to try our property again. Sincerely,  Agnes Bukala

title: Adequate at Best...
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Excellent location for sightseeing and restaurants
review: We stayed here for graduation at NYU for four nights in May. The location is the best asset this hotel has. And a wonderful security/bellman/greeter during the weekdays. This hotel is just adequate. It is clean but needs updating. The front desk was nice but not overly helpful. The  rooms are very small but the bed is very comfortable with nice linens. We just didn't get a warm, fuzzy feeling in this hotel. We went to breakfast 10 minutes before closing time and the lady who greeted us was obviously not pleased with our timing. No smile from any employee cleaning up the breakfast area. We didn't go back. The breakfast choices are not great, so we didn't go back. Probably won't ever stay here again. Expensive considering what you get.

title: Locked out...
review: This a great hotel with an art deco feel and ambience.  Rooms are small but the location more than makes up for that.  A cold buffet breakfast is included which is unusual in New York. Friendly staff who were very welcoming and helpful.  Less than five minutes walk to subway stations making it a great base for sight seeing and shopping.  Loads of great restaurants and clubs also just minutes walk away along with The Blue Note Jazz club.

title: Very nice, but a bit pricey
review: Stayed here a couple of years ago. The service was good, but our room key failed to work when we returned to the hotel at about 2 a.m. They put us in a noisy room downstairs near reception until our room was unlocked the next morning. We were only staying one night. Our stay was refunded. I realize this wouldn't be a normal stay, but the experience was little to be desired. The hotel is otherwise beautiful and convenient.

title: Perfect location, helpful staff, clean rooms & fair price - that's a win!
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Washington Square Hotel
review: If you want to feel like you are part of the neighborhood, try the Washington Square Hotel. Just steps off the park tucked away on a quiet street is this little gem. What this boutique hotel lacks in room and elevator size, it easily makes up for in charm, location and personal service. We stayed in a two twin bed room on the 5th floor facing the street and we never heard a peep - either from the other rooms or the street below. The room was small but clean and comfortable.  From printing our boarding passes to arranging for a car service (at less than the cost of a cab), Tiffany and Reggie at the front desk were efficient, courteous and always ready with advice and suggestions. The doorman Ronnie was a total hoot. He sent us all around the neighborhood and every one of his…

title: Quite hotel, ultimate location!!
review: This is a FABULOUS little hotel. The staff here are FANTASTIC. Great bar staff and Ronnie is the font of all knowledge concerning the area. Staff make you feel so welcome and you can have a real laugh with them. We were a group of women celebrating our 50th's and we could not have asked for a better place. Highly recommended. Big love to the Washington Square Hotel. Rooms are smallish but how much time do you spend in the room. Great place to chill and take in the sights of NYC

title: Great Art Deco Hotel
review: We did not hear any noise for six nights in Manhattan!  Is that even possible? Great room, good breakfast and close to everything. And for a nice price.  We will go back... The staff was helpful and funny as well!

title: Great location near Washington Square Park!
review: We stayed at this hotel in early May 2013 and were very satisfied with everything that it had to offer. We aren't hard people to please but we expect cleanliness, courteous service and a few extras are always welcome. Washington Square Hotel met our criteria for all of the above.   Our room was small but sufficient space to move around since, presumably, most are only in their rooms to sleep. It was clean with some basics that made it more enjoyable (coffee maker, ironing board and safe). Breakfast is included, although it's very basic (bagels/toast, fruit, yogurt, cereal).  Overall, we wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel.

title: Washington square hotel NY
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Charming and very good location
review: We were on the second floor and this was supposed to be non smoking however there was a smoke smell in the corridor etc although not in the room so suggest you look into this. Obviously for non smokers a complete non smoking policy would be good but realise you have to accommodate the few smokers around I suppose although in the main in Europe they are very separated if at all.

title: Simple retreat in the village
review: The hotel is located in downtown Manhattan where its calm and not crowded. Its very easy to reach all the things to do and see in Manhattan due to how close it is to walk to different subway stations. The hotel is just great, we have visited it several times and are charmed and impressed every time. The staff is friendly and helpful and the rooms are quiet and clean but rather small (as in most city hotels in the world). Dont expect great views through the windows, though  but when you just walk out from the hotel your eyes meet lovely, exciting Washington Square Park and as said midtown (or downtown) Manhattan is just a few subways stations away ! Breakfast is so New Yorkish  !!!   Bagels, fruit salad, perfect coffee and juice, you chose either self-service or waiter-service as…

title: Lovely location
review: The Washington Square Hotel has a great location near NYU, and just off Washington Square Park. It is a short walk to all the famous-name village streets, and multiple good restaurants and foodie-shops. The area is convenient to the subway, but walking is the way to see the city. It took us 20-30 minutes to walk to the discount TKTS window on Broadway, and about the same to get to MSG for a hockey game. The hotel is small, clean, and has a very friendly staff who greet you whenever you come or go. There is a small restaurant where breakfast buffet/menu is served, and a a bar area off the lobby, but this is not a lobby to linger in. There is only one elevator in this hotel, so at times it is a bit of a wait to get downstairs.  Our room was large and bright, with a very nice…

title: Ok but to great
review: Art Deco hotel near Washington Square. Close to metro. 10 minute walk to meat packing district. Nice to have breakfast included. Bagels, bread, pain au chocolate, cereal, coffee, juice, fruit. Either buffet or served to you. Same food either way. Fancy coffee machine in the rooms. Take out cups in room and at breakfast. Lifts, ice machine. No fridge. We just had a basic double but it was good size, shower over bath, nice toiletries, drying line. Very happy with room. Robes and safe in wardrobe. All the concierges were polite and helpful. Ronnie being the most famous. He loves Agatha Christie and Midsummer. Reception staff helpful. They took a parcel delivery for me. Two iPads in lobby so you can check in and print boarding passes. Overall recommend.

title: Godd stay
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Great location and comfortable stay
review: Washington Square Hotel is a great choice for those who look for a confortable stay. I stayed here for two nights and was quite happy. The rooms are small but I didn't have any problems with it. Very good staff and a great location!!!!

title: A marvelous hotel in the European style
review: We stayed for 7 nights in this hotel. Our room was not on the side of the street, which helped a lot to reduce the noise. The room was very clean and suited all our needs. Bathroom was great, also very clean and a good shower. The location is fantastic, located in/near lovely neighbourhoods in greenwich/soho. Also near the metro station. Buffet breakfast is continental, i.e. not very elaborate but sufficient and they have great fresh fruit and toasted bagels. For a little extra money you can get additional breakfast dishes which are very(!) tasty. In short, would not hesitate to stay here again.

title: Comfortable stay in NYC
review: Let me say first that the reviewers bothered because their rooms are small miss the point, which is that this is an old-fashioned, European-style hotel. Your room is not to hide in, spend the day in, eat dinner in. Your room is to sleep in, make love in, shower in. Otherwise, it's assumed you're out and about, walking in Washington Square Park, or writing postcards from a bistro table while sipping on a real espresso. This is a marvelously upgraded hotel - and one of the few I've stayed in where the Internet always works. Beautiful location - easy to catch he subway or a cab, Washington Square Park just steps away. And unlike many of the hotels in New York, the staff are well-trained, kind, and thoughtful. I was so very happy staying here. I really felt like I'd stepped into the…

title: Washington Square Hotel
review: I stayed in this hotel for a business trip in April 2013. My room was a small one but it was enough for one person. The room was very clean and the building is well maintained. The lobby is tastefully decorated so are the rooms. I only wish there were a study table in the room, at least  a small one. The wi-fi works well in the room and they placed two ipads in the lobby for the guests. The breakfast was great and the coffee in the room is a high quality selection. I think there should be more signs showing where the breakfast room is.

title: Good but ...
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Which NYC do you want to be in?
review: Stayed three nights.  The location is really excellent - adjacent to Washington Square and easy access to Chelsea and Soho.  The room was clean, modern, and a good size.  The only negative about the room was loud air con.  Room housekeeping: waited until 5pm one day and then very poor job.  Staff mixed – some excellent; others ‘grumpy’ and one at Reception simply rude.  I had asked for a 1 hour extension on check out when I checked in.  That was fine.  On the check out day I literally lost track of time.  15 mins after the ‘agreed’ check out time, someone from the front desk called and was particularly aggressive about leaving the room.  As it turned out, when I came down to Reception and spoke to another person, they basically said “Don’t worry.  We would normally give at least…

title: Location location location
review: There are bigger and flashier hotels uptown and midtown i am sure, but if you want to be in the most interesting part of NYC, close to the eclectic mix of retail, food, and residential - from the charm of the West Village to vibrant Soho, Little Italy and TriBeCa, with Chelsea and Gramercy just a stones throw - this reasonably priced hotel is the answer.  I dont want luxury when away, just cleanliness, security and comfort and I got all three here. The deluxe room - with a window - is great for 1 and ok for 2, though not a lot of cupboard space.  The beds are clean and comfortable, the recently refurbished bathroom provides very acceptable facilities. Add to that free wifi, a decent if not overwhelming breakfast, a good in house restaurant, lots of attention from a great staff…

title: Average hotel in good location
review: RAKAustralia, Thank you for your positive comments regarding your recent stay. Yes, our neighborhood offers a different New York experience and I'm very happy you has a great time exploring it. Also, thank you for the great review of our accommodations.  I would like to personally thank you for your business and hope to see you on your next trip to New York City! Sincerely,  Agnes B.

title: Feels like home
review: Fantastic hotel in one of NYC best locations. Wonderful washington square just outside, soho, restaurants, shops right outside. Really nice rooms with everything you need, clean and cozy. We had a fantastic stay!!

title: A Little Noisy but Great Location and Doorman
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Location, location
review: I was going to give this hotel a bad rating after a noisy night, but, in the morning, the doorman redeemed it.  When my son and I entered the lobby, he recognized right away that we were there to tour NYU.  Before we even asked, he made sure our bags were checked and sent us off in a cheerful mood.  When we returned after the tour, he greeted us, and again without being asked, showed us the restrooms and got our bags.    I think this hotel is the closest to NYU: right across Washington Square Park.
