title: Good hotel, perfect location
review: In Greenwich Village right off Washington Square Park giving the Hotel its name and reason to be liked but besides this great location the room  we had was too small for comfort...no armchair..While clean and well appointed, it was dark and with an uneasy thermostat. The reception staff was friendly and helpful besides the gate keeper to the bar who seemed bothered to let us in 30 mn before closure. Dining here can be nice however surprised to be served by such lovely but young and inexperienced personnel. As for breakfast, included , plan on cleaning your own table first... I would return here here asking for a more comfortable room....if the price was right!

title: a neighborhood place
review: We stayed with a family of 6 in this hotel during Easter vacation 2013. For New York standards this hotel is very good value for your money. Lots of previous comments say that the rooms are very small, but I've seen much worse. In fact you're very comfortable, space enough for the two large luggages and a well equiped bathroom. Only tyhe cleaning of the rooms could have been better. Breakfast is included, wich is also a very positive thing in the US. In the lobby, you will certainly meet Ronny, an incredible person who's always there to help you with all kinds of usefull information, discount coupons and tips and tricks to enjoy your New York visit the most. And another big plus is the location. At only 100 meter you have the B, D, M, F, A, B and C lines of the metro. Most of…

title: Great location
review: this old village hotel is not for all. small rooms and hallways. well appointed and clean. right off the Washington Sq. park so in the heart of Greenwich Village...near all sorts of restaurants, high end to some of the best Pizza, anywhere. Around the Block from Blue Note for Jazz or a host of blues/rock/country music halls on Bleeker St....price point off season is very reasonable but remember , these are smaller rooms, no gyms...neat lobby bar and has more of a pension feel to it... i like it especially for a a night out or two in the "village".

title: Great location, hotel a bit tired
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Location and a warm welcome
review: This is a good hotel, the location is excellent for Greenwich village - great restaurants - and 'reasonably' priced for New York, but it seemed a bit tired and in need of a make over. Narrow corridors

title: Very Neat Place To stay
review: The location is perfect, as everyone points out. My room was small, but that goes with the location. However, everything you could want was in it, including an iron and ironing board. The wifi was included in the price, and because it was my first stay, the staff kindly gave me vouchers for the waiter service breakfast, which was also excellent.

title: Stay for the location
review: I stayed here while attending a conference. It is a beautiful little hotel, The staff is very warm and friendly, They also have an excellent restaurant and bar. The location is wonderful. Rooms tend to be on the small size, but it is new York. Theonly negative thing I have to say about the hotel is that the bed was very unconfortable and lumpy. I would stay here again though

title: A trip down memory lane...
review: The location is fantastic and the price is reasonable for NYC.  Great shopping and dining all within walking distance.  Room and especially the bathroom small, but to be expected for NYC.  Most importantly, everything was clean and the bed was comfortable.  Only complaint was temperature control was off.  The room was really hot and the only way I could cool it down was to put on the air conditioner which was odd given the temperature outside.  Staff generally friendly.  Breakfast is included, but terrible.  The area is too small to accommodate guests, tables were piled high with dirty dishes, coffee was bad, and the food selection was poor.  As long as you plan to get breakfast somewhere else, I would recommend.

title: gone off
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Good hotel in a very good location
review: We used to stay often but had not been back in a few years. The air conditioner in the room was noisy and on its last legs. We called for a room change. They said "bring down your luggage and they would see what they could do". Strange not to offer a hand. Their was no apology about the  room . They gave us an upgrade to a bigger room that was very nice. This older hotel had a separate heating and cooling system. The radiators were turned to high and we finally got them shut off. The  air conditioner did not work we were to exhausted to move again and  by the afternoon with the window open it finally cooled down. The rooms  had  no mini bars and only an ice machine on the main floor. I would not recommend going until they do an upgrade

title: Birthday Treat
review: Dear Mark O, Thank you for taking the time to post your review. I would like to apologize for not meeting your expectations during your recent stay. It is disappointing to read reviews such as yours. It is customary to assist guests whenever possible. Certainly, we strive to make room changes seamless to ensure the experience. I am very sorry that we failed in this regard.  We are a historic building and are constantly updating our rooms and amenities to provide a comfortable and pleasant stay. Although our rooms do not have minibars, we have mini-fridges on demand, free of charge. All rooms have their own heating/cooling systems. The heat can be adjusted in each room by the guest at any time. Although some of our rooms have standard air conditioning units, we are in the process of updating these units in all rooms.  Once again, I sincerely apologize for these inconveniences, and would welcome another opportunity to have you as our guest. Please contact me directly to book your next trip. Sincerely,  A. Bukala abukala@wshotel.com

title: Perfect location !!!!
review: I stayed five nights with my teenage son at WSH on the fifth floor in a bright room. The rooms are kind of small, but ok to be in NYC. Continental breakfast is included in the price. We felt we got good value for what we paid. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. The location is great. Just short walks from SoHo and West Village were there are many good restaurants and expensive stores. I will definitely consider staying there again.

title: art deco style in nyc
review: I decided to surprise my partner with a 50th Birthday treat to NY and wanted a quiet hotel. The hotel is next to a beautiful park where we fed the squirrels nuts and watched the street performers. The area is quiet within the hustle and bustle that is NY. This is an Art deco hotel, pretty to look at. They have decent sized rooms, with maid service everyday. All the staff are friendly and happy to help with any questions you have. The inclusive continental breakfast was a rare find in NY and one reason I booked the hotel as most are Room Only. Either buffet or waited service is offered. Mostly toast, pastires cereal and hot/cold beverages but adequate for our needs and set us up for some very long days sight seeing. Would I stay here agian? Most definately, loved it.

title: Hotel to go back to
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Needs updating!
review: it is not a very elegant or perfekt NY hotel. But it's nice, clean and cosy place you always like to return to. Very nice breakfast (included in the room price!) and perfect location. A hotel with some nice history and personnality.

title: Entirely reasonable, but nothing exciting.
review: Chose this hotel for its proximity to NYU but was disappointed. At nearly $300 a night, I expected at least a sink and faucet in the bathroom without rust stains. Both need to be replaced ASAP. Very small bathroom with old tile - toilet next to shower, have barely room to get inside the stall. Bedroom walls are scuffed and in need of repainting.   On the good side, breakfast is included (rare in NYC) and the hotel restaurant for dinner was a lovely cozy space with well- presented menu items. The adjoining bar area was very busy on a weeknight and also looked warm and cozy on a cold night.

title: lovely location
review: Thank you for your recent review of our property.  I'm sorry about the state of your room and thank you for bringing this to our attention. Because of the issues addressed in your comments, we have gone through inspecting all rooms and making repairs where needed. Thank you for bringing this to our attention.  The North Square and Lounge is an exceptional restaurant and I'm happy you had great experience. I hope you will give us another chance to be of service to you, and I will do my personal best to make sure your next stay is outstanding. Best Regards, Agnes Bukala

title: Perfect Location Across From Our Favorite Park!
review: There's really nothing exciting about this hotel. Yes, there is a lot of "charm" or "character" in that it is a small and windy combination of two prewar buildings, and the lobby is nicely decorated. But beyond that, there's nothing to write home about. Everything works just fine. As I said, the rooms and bathrooms are small, but on par with other NYC hotels. All the rooms I've stayed in have bathtubs and great shower pressure, so that's a plus. And they now have Japanese style HVAC systems that are very pleasant - not sure why the giant window AC units are still in the windows though.   What brings the score down here is in the details. The linens are on the rougher side of acceptable, and there are some (probably non-body fluid) stains. The towels are thin and scratchy. So…

title: Depends on the room
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: New Year in New York
review: In general the hotel is nice. The location could not be better. But be sure to ask for a room that has a window to the exterior and not just to the interior shaft. Also check the room to make sure that the temperature is suitable. Some of the rooms (515 for instance) are like a sauna in the winter even if you open the window and turn off the radiator.

title: Brilliant!
review: My friends and I always stay at the Washington square hotel when in New York. We love it. Very friendly staff in this Art deco hotel. Nice comfortable rooms decorated in the Art deco style with excellent beds. A small bar just off the lobby which does a very lovely iced tea. We like it because its in Greenwich village, with all it's lovely small boutique shops, where you can get some really good buys, as well as a variety of small bars and eatery's. It's within walking distance to the Blue note jazz club, where we always go for New year's eve when in New York. Although you can go anytime of year. Easy to get a cab straight from the front door up to Manhattan for the big shops and attractions.

title: Wonderful location, ok rooms
review: My wife and I stayed for four nights in February to celebrate my 50th birthday and the courtesy and friendliness of the staff was a key factor in making it such a great trip, especially concierge Ronnie who is a real asset - from his warm greeting every morning to his top tips on off the beaten path places to see and eat. Great breakfasts, internet access in the lobby for those who dont go on holiday with their gizmos. Rooms small by US standards but hey, who goes to New York to spend time in a hotel room. Big enough, well appointed and most importantly very clean - the fabulous view of the park was a bonus. Location in the Village is great with access to subway at end of the street. Also great value for Manhattan. Couldn't fault it in any way and if we are lucky enough to visit…

title: Great Service, Lots of Character
review: We stayed at the hotel for a few days in September. The Village is my favorite area in New York City, and the hotel couldn't be more ideally located - right next to the lively Washington Square Park! The hotel is old and has a lot of history, which makes it very charming.   The rooms are small, but since we only use the room for sleeping, this was really not an issue. However, the rooms (both the room itself and the bathroom) could have been cleaner, and it seemed that the housekeeping had really cut some corners there. I understand that there is only a limited amount of time to clean every room, but it is the management's responsibility to ensure that the cleaners can do their job properly. There was hair (!) in the bathroom, and the room itself was generally not too clean,…

title: Friendly, boutique type hotel in the Village
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: New York beacme so close to me because of my stay at Washington Square Hotel, NYC
review: Very nice rooms, more Euro in size. Remodeled hotel is very nice, quiet and very convenient to not only locations in the Village but easy to access mid-town as well. Very good small, intimate restaurant with an excellent chef.

title: Good location in University area - rooms adequate, welcome and service good.
review: i stayed in WSH for a week from 29th January this year. Although hotel rooms are small, corridor smaller, my stay was great essentially because of its location and the pleasing personality of its staff. Whenever I needed anything a phone call was enough, housekeeping was great  so are the staff doing the housekeeping on a personal touch. The breakfast was good but lacked variety; the serving staff appeared more mechanical though they never faltered on their duty. Some front desk were unimaginatively supportive, responsive and caring. Washington Square is just opposite to the hotel and its a heaven for all morning walkers and joggers. The Empire State and Ground zero are within walking distance. Being in the heart of Manhattan, shops, restaurants, cinema halls are very close too.…

title: Great nights stay...
review: Located right at the corner of Washington Square, the hotel is well located to enjoy the more low-brow delights of NYC. Close to The Village, China Town and at the bottom of 5th Avenue one can venture north or south to enjoy the city. The rooms are adequate - not particulary well decorated and storage space is very limited - more suited to the overnight stay rather than a week or a few days. The breakfast is good and food plentiful - although morning table service varied between courteous and surly over the few days we were there. The concierge is a gem - always smiling, helpful and knowledgeable. Front desk also helpful and efficient. The downstairs bar, which you find by going through a rabbit warren of corridors and stairs (or by going outside and round the corner) is very…

title: back for a 2nd visit ..
review: My girlfriend and I live on Long Island and we frequent the city pretty often. We decided to get a hotel room for the night. The location of the hotel is superb. Right in the West Village and walking distance to bars, restaurants, subway, NYU, and Washington Square Park right across the street. We opted to drive into the city that day since we knew we were staying overnight. FYI--DO NOT PAY TO PARK IN THE PARKING GARAGE! I was all set to pay to park when i realized that there was tons of street parking. Theres no parking during the week tho, but on saturdays and sundays theres no charge to park on the street. The hotel was very clean, our room was not noisy at all, and the overall size of the room was very comfortable and enjoyable. They had free WiFi, and a restaurant and bar…

title: Bring your earplugs!
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: A clean, reasonably-priced place to stay in NYC
review: The good: Convenient if you need to be at NYU, with friendly and professional service, a perfectly fine room which was spotlessly clean (and large by New York City standards), and a Continental breakfast included in the room rate.  The bad: So much street noise, mostly from people shouting and carrying on outside well into the wee hours, that although I got up and put my earplugs in, I could still hear it. Even my husband, who normally doesn't notice ANYTHING, remarked that it was too noisy and that he'd been awakened by the racket. Noise from garbage or construction trucks in the morning was also very audible. The windows are woefully deficient in soundproofing qualities.  The conclusion: Expect  noise, particularly drunken college students (I assume) outside the hotel, to make…

title: Brief Reunion Premiere
review: This is a boutique-style hotel in The Village, close to NYU and Washington Square Park. The neighborhood is fun and safe. We stayed one night on a Thursday. The temps were below 20 degrees Fahrenheit outside, so there were very few people walking around nearby. The hotel seemed clean, as well as the room, which was small, but adequate for two people with a one-night stay. The continental breakfast consisted of fruit, yogurt, bagels (toaster was nearby), other breakfast breads, cold cereal, coffee, juice, milk. Checking in and out was quick, and the doorman was friendly and helpful. The hotel was close to a music venue we were going to so the location was just perfect.

title: Charm, Comfort, Location
review: Arrived Saturday January 19 and had a drink in the Bar.  The staff were excellent.  Very cheerful and helpful.  The room was clean and comfortable.  We felt very safe and relaxed while in the Hotel.  Sunday morning we went down to the restaurant for breakfast which was very good and reasonable.  There is a large park directly across the street.  We were down for my brother in laws premiere "Brief Reunion".  He was the Director of Photography for the film.

title: Old School hotel in Greenwich Village
review: Every year I travel to NYC for a week for work.  Instead of staying in the dreadful conference hotel in midtown, I chose to stay at Washington Square Hotel because of it's location, charm, and friendly staff.    I just returned from the annual trip and am more impressed with this hotel than ever.  The wonderful doorman Ronnie always remembers us and is great about giving everyone helpful advice on where to eat, transportation, etc.  The front desk staff couldn't be more helpful or responsive.  Their gym was closed for renovation during this visit, but they gave us passes to the NY Sports Club located two blocks away which made for a great outing!  If you are looking for a swanky modern hotel that features all the latest amenties, this isn't for you (try the Hudson).  If you are…

title: Perfect location and charming vibe!
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Golden Girl of Greenwich
review: My partner and I stayed for 5 nights over Christmas and really enjoyed the experience. The hotel has an old school New York feel and the staff are really helpful. The doorman during the day in particular is lovely, knowledgable and welcoming. The rooms are a little small but it is New York, and the bed was really comfortable. We had a room on the third floor and found it to be quiet. Breakfast was great, and as other reviews have said, the best thing of all is the perfect location!

title: Be careful! Fraudulent charge in my credit card after my stay!
review: Stayed here for one night on business.  I struggled a little with my rating; the WSH is quite a storied establishment with a good dose of deco-esque charm, which I love. The guys in the lobby and front desk are quite a fun, quirky and relaxed sort and the intimacy of the place is such that even the guests appear to open up with each other.   All in all, it has a certain ambiance and character that can only come with time and experience. It's a wry old dame and it ain't changin' for nobody. This is a highly subjective notion, however, and for the sake of objectivity I had to dock one point from the four-point rating I wanted to give.  My room felt fairly dingy. The fittings were worn and I was situated right next to the elevator, meaning every so often a small earthquake would…

title: Great place to stay in NYC
review: I wouldn't recommend this hotel for anything. Location is great but rooms are very basic and not really clean. But overall I am really disappointed because they are not honest and after my stay I found an extra charge in my credit card... How?? Well when I contacted the hotel they just said that charged 150 usd as we 'smoked' in the room, which is truly and 100% a false statement. There if we didn't smoke and they are saying that we did and that they had to clean the room for the smell means they're lying and they're stealing my money. How bad is that? And how do I prove they're wrong if I am back in Ireland? Taking the advantage of a situation to get money from your customers is the worst you can do. Have this people heard about customer satisfaction and retention? Sure not. …

title: A gem in the Village
review: I was in the City for a conference at NYU. It was located literally two minutes from the hotel so the location was great. Also the subway is a block away. Our room was large by New York standards. The bed was very comfortable but I rated down one notch because the room was actually too hot and we had to crack the bathroom window. Nice bathroom. We enjoyed having two sinks since I was with a friend. I loved the art deco touches. Another plus was the continental breakfast included in the price. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. One night we ate at the restaurant and it was very good. There was no view in our room which I find typical of hotels in NYC but our friends on a floor higher up had an excellent view of the Empire State Building. I would definitely stay at this…

title: Gem in NYC
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Ok but nothing to be thrilled about
review: 4 nights in this 9 storey classy, art deco style, hotel (with opening windows) fulfilled all expectations. Clean, comfy; excellent restaurant attached; delightful staff; great location. Complicated pricing no doubt reflects views from bedrooms....we had part view of city and park plus flats across road. photos, unusually, don't do justice to warm cosy interiors.....perfect for freezing conditions in January.

title: Convenient, clean, comfortable
review: The room was ok, but the bedding disappointing, such a price hotel should add mattress pad and have eiderdown rather than synthetic quilt, the reception arranged for softer pillows upon our request. We really appreciated to be able to open the window and the quite quiet area. The bathroom cleanliness deserves some attention. The receptionists were nice but it took them ages to hand us out our boarding passes, the concierges were kind. The complimentary breakfast is not mentioned when you check in, so you have to ask them where it's served, the waiters are not service oriented at all. This hotel really takes advantage of its good location but could improve quite a few things to be perfect such as indoor building maintenance. This hotel won the 2012 Trip Advisor reward, travelers…

title: an atmospheric hotel
review: Nice little hotel, well situated (near Gray line bus stop, subway, restaurants, shops) and lovely Washington square in Greenwich village (it reminded me of England). Continental buffet breakfast in basement. Very small bedroom with window opening on a dark brick wall and no sky view but good bed, modern bathroom, well equipped. Served its purposed as we were out all day. Will go back.

title: We had a plesant sty
review: an untypical smallish hotel with good ambiance, though our room was pretty small. staff are welcoming and efficient, though aged 77 I do not like being patronised with 'young man' by a doorman (who also loaded one of someone else's suitcases into our cab in error). quite good complementary continental breakfast in a crowded dining room. overall a good visit and we will return.

title: Great hotel in Greenwich
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Historic Charm, Modern Amenities
review: We just spent 4 nights at this hotel & loved it. So handy to subway, restaurants, walking around Greenwich & shopping in Soho. Staff are great, especially Ronnie who helped us every day with great advice. Rooms are not huge but we found that there was enough space. Would highly recommend staying at this hotel.

title: Great little hotel near Washington Square Park NYC
review: I love the Art-Deco flair of this 110 year old hotel in the heart of Greenwich village. Right across from Washington Square Park, the location allows you safe and easy access to the city on foot. The rooms are comfortable and modern. Sunday brunch at the Washington Square Hotel restaurant is fantastic--once you decide on this hotel, book early--it fills up fast.

title: Excellent hotel in a perfect location
review: This was a quaint litle hotel in a great location, right opposite Washington Square Park. Subway stop one minutes walk away, lots of little restaurants and shops close by, and a great neighbourhood just to stroll around. Our room was only tiny, and unfortunately had only a view of the brick wall of the building next door. The bathrooms had obviosuly just been renovated and were reasonably spacious and modern. The bed was really comy with great bedlinen. The super freiendly concierge, Ronny was always on hand with great tips of where to go and how to get there, even gave us a sample of his famous chilli sauce to bring home to Australia. The small breakfast is a nice touch if you just want something simple to get you started. Would definately stay there again.

title: Perfect location and friendly service.
review: I stayed here in December 2012 and thought it was perfect. Washington Square Park is literally at your doorstep and there's a subway station just down the street. It is also close to the famous John's Pizza and a Grays Papaya so you can try some real New York food. I liked the eclectic feel of the hotel. It had a boutique look about it and the little corridors to the rooms made it feel more homey than the big hotel chains but i did have some trouble maneuvering my suitcase through the hallways when other people were trying to get past. Also they only have 1 elevator and it's really slow; it didn't bother me that much because we were only on the 2nd floor so took the stairs (which were hard to find!) most of the time.  The included breakfast was good; bagels, toast, fruit and…

title: The real New York experience
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: superb location, lovely hotel, this is what you need!!!
review: Just returned from a 4 night break with three other couples, hotel very warm and welcoming, rooms clean & comfortable, great location, staff cannot do enough for you, even checked and printed our return flights, we will be back, what a find!!!!

title: You'll love Washington Square Hotel
review: was surprised to find a lovely size room after hearing horror stories about NY hotels.  this was a decent size, and had a really good bathroom too! We found some really great and reasonably priced restaurants nearby.  Hotel is brilliantly located for subway and getting around. Hope to stay there again in future

title: Great location
review: Washington Square Hotel is a fantastic hotel. Great location in Greenwich Village - very close to George Washington Square, Little Italy, Soho and the 9/11 Memorial. We used the hop on/hop off bus and the bus stop was near to the hotel so we could get on and go virtually anywhere in Manhattan. The room was lovely - We requested a 'high' floor and got a 7th floor room with side view of the park. Not large but very clean and adequate.  The staff were fantastic and the bonus of a continental breakfast every morning was great. There is also a bar/restaurant in the basement which is great. Our stay was fantastic and I would definitely return to this hotel.

title: Fabulous place to stay
review: A wonderful location, Its not 5 star luxury but has a campy quality to it which is appealing  Very friendly staff and clean, sizeable rooms.  Across the street from Babbo which is excellent if you can get a table.  Would recommend if you want to be in the area.

title: Love this Hotel
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: great location and friendly helpful staff
review: I really enjoyed this hotel but it is not for everybody! My room was small but nice and very clean. I spend very little time in the room. The staff is excellent and the location is sublime. Just walk out the door and soak it up...NYC..the village....Washington Square is right there for all the entertainment and people watching. Fantastic restaurants in the hotel and in the area. Doorman is awesome and really knows what he is talking about when asked for advise. Staying here is part of a great NYC experience. Not fancy but just right for fun and convenience.

title: A NYC treasure
review: This warm friendly hotel is in a great location.  My room was small but very comfortable.  The staff are friendly and helpful and went out of their way to make my stay so enjoyable.  The restaurant, lounge and bar are cosy and comfortable and the food is excellent - fresh, tasty, beautifully prepared and presented.

title: Best little Cubby Hole in NY!
review: This hotel is a treasure. In a fantastic area in NYC. On the doorstep you have many great cafes and bars, and of course the square. The great McDougal and Blecker Steets are a couple of mins walk. Subway is only 1 min away with connections to downtown, midtown, Brooklyn and the crosstown E train to the JFK connection. Walking distance to union sq and east village. Very friendly and helpful staff, especially Ronnie the ever smiling concierge who is an open book of excellent information. The rooms are clean and comfortable, not huge but this hotel really is all about the fantastic location and staff.

title: Neighborhood ambience
review: If you want cozy and quaint and don't need tons of space this is your place.  I love to stay here when I am in NY for work.  It is one block from the subway that takes you to and from Penn Station.  There is lots to do and see in the area - Great restaurants in the hotel and across the street.  The Belman is sensational and makes your stay perfect.  The restaurant in the hotel is great - Northface.  Good for every meal!

title: Awesome hotel, great location
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Great staff and great position in Greenwich Village
review: I booked this hotel from reviews on trip advisor and also Agoda and it turned out to be so nice the hotel was in a great location near really nice restaurants diagonally across the road from a lovely park and close to the underground transport system which was a great way to get around New York.   We were fortunate to meet one of the owners and he was so nice and down to earth and gave us a lot of advice about the local area. The room was great and so clean and the doorman was amazing so positive and happy all the time. I would highly recommend this hotel as I am a very fussy person and I was so happy with my choice and would definitly stay here again.

title: WSH stepped up to the plate
review: We booked this hotel after a recommendation in the Telegraph.  Looking at the hotel's website it looks very swishy.  The reception is very nice, but your heart sinks when you get to the corridors outside the bedrooms.  Artexing gone mad and very basic, but the rooms themselves, although small are adequate and much nicer than the corridors lead you to believe.   All the staff are very good, especially the "greeters" who always welcome you back and are helpful and have a cheerful word.  The standard of cleaning of the rooms we found to be very good. We booked bed and breakfast, but watch out as this only covers you for a continental and you have to pay extra for cooked.  Having said that there is a very nice fresh fruit salad served, nice juice and good pastries and bagels so you…

title: Great little hotel- happy memories
review: My wife and I have stayed at the Washington Square Hotel at least a couple of dozen times over the years and now consider it our 'New York home'. The location within the Village is a huge plus, but the other key attraction is the attitude of the majority of the staff. Ronnie, the concierge, is always there with a greeting and a tip regarding places to see or to find good food (eg 'Grano' on Washington Ave and W10th). He has become a West Village 'legend' over the years. We were in the hotel last week as Sandy caused havoc in many parts of the city. The lights went out on Monday evening and the hotel, as well as the rest of lower Manhattan remained without power for the rest of the week. We were amazed by the positive attitude shown by every member of the hotel staff during that…

title: The best staff ever
review: We stayed here in October for 5 days with a group of friends. It's a quaint boutique hotel, in a very lovely location. The room was quite small, with no view, with not much light. We were not bothered though, as the whole staff were friendly and welcoming and gave us a great start to NYC. Good towels and bathrobes, a good coffee maker, TV and hairdryer were in the room. The bathroom wasn't particularly fancy but had a great shower and was spotless, as was the rest of the room. Our friends were facing the park side of the hotel, with big windows and said it was noisy- what do you expect in the city that never sleeps?! We had a very peaceful stay in a wonderfully comfortable bed. The room was very well equipped and anything we didn't have was easily obtained from Reception.…

title: Loved this hotel!
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Review Washington Square Hotel
review: I stayed at this hotel for four nights on a work trip and was very pleased with it. For NYC, the rooms were a decent size. I asked for a quiet one, and that meant the windows (which actually open, which I love) were onto an air shaft--but I prefer that in NYC to the street noise. I'm sure some windows have very nice views, and especially on the highest floor the view must be really great.  The lobby is stylish, and there's always someone at the door as well as desk, who gives you a warm hello when you walk in. The housekeeper on my floor was really nice too--the whole staff just seems friendly and outgoing and welcoming. Good towels and bathrobes, a coffee maker in the room, a reasonably good continental breakfast comes with it in the morning.  I loved the location, down by NYU…

title: "A little gem"
review: The room was small but adequate for my requirements. The desk staff were helpful and check in and out went smoothly. They offered help with transport at the end of my stay and stored my luggage after checkout. The lobby staff were friendly, offering help but it was limited and superficial. After arriving at the hotel by taxi, there was no assistance with entering the hotel with my baggage; there were several steps to climb. I was assisted to the lift with my baggage from the desk (maybe 20 feet) but then left to get to my room by myself. I had difficulty in finding my room as I had been lead to a lift that was not appropriate to my room location. Make sure that you check on where the breakfast is being served. I was advised that it was served off the lobby. However this space…

title: Good hotel. Excellent location.
review: I visited New York in September and stayed here. It's a boutique hotel that is very quaint. The doorman was ever so friendly and helpful (better than the counter staff). I stayed on the fifth floor but it was still quite noisy at night. This did not worry me as it is New York - what do you expect! I loved that I could walk around the West Village and Soho and Greenwich Village. I had my last 3 days here when I returned to New York after a trip to Boston - previously I stayed uptown in the Theatre District nearTimes Square for 9 days. I wanted to get out of the hustle and bustle and this area was divine for that! Great little shops to buy more unusual gear, a lot of little restaurants and cafes to choose from. Very near The Magnolia Bakery! They were very good here too as I was…

title: Cozy = Tiny
review: Lovely hotel situated away from the frenzy of central New York, but close enough for convenience. Rooms are well-appointed and are of the size to be expected in a hotel of its age and location. Very good breakfast which may be taken in the small self-service area, or downstairs in the restaurant. The latter provides a far more pleasant experience. Staff are friendly and helpful, giving sound advice for visitors to the city. Restaurants and bars situated just across Washington Square are worth a visit. Would recommend.

title: Lost and found delivered!
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Impressive
review: I accidentally left my expensive Bose headphones and a pair of binoculars in the hotel safe. After I flew home, I called the hotel and spoke to the head of housekeeping (I think it was Valerie). She was very nice, took my name and number and the details of my stay, and said she'd look into it. Naturally I didn't think I would ever hear from them again, but in less than an hour Valerie called back with the good news that my items had been retrieved from the safe. The hotel staff called me again later to get an updated mailing address, and today I received an expertly packaged box, with my items neatly bubble-wrapped. That's terrific service. The hotel is in an ideal location for those wanting to enjoy the hot spots of Lower Manhattan and avoid the massive towers and crowds of…

title: Great location and customer service, with a vintage flair
review: Nice hotel, friendly concierge who greeted us every morning on way to breakfast with big smile and good sense of humour.  Breakfast has been good each day and plenty to eat and drink. At the end of each day we returned and room was clean, tidy with fresh towels and toiletries.   Hotel appears dated on first view but actually very comfortable.

title: Good value
review: My hubby and i stayed here for 2 nights on business. We requested early check-in due to a grueling flight and despite a very busy weekend, the hotel got us in a little early. It was walking distance to amazing restaurants and cafes, and NYU.  The restaurant downstairs, North Square, is good for brekkie and lunch, and the modern updates of the rooms did not compromise the vintage flair of the rooms.  Rodney, the doorman/concierge/bellman and all-around nice guy, was a joy, and really symbolizes the heart and soul of the place.  He showed us a slide show in the lobby of all the stars who have visited and it was pretty neat.  Our only beef is that because our room faced the street and was on the second floor, it was VERY loud, especially on Monday night (trash collection....yeesh).…

title: Dirty - go somewhere else
review: Have stayed here several times when in NYC. Rooms are small but comfortable. Staff is professional and very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is included .This hotel is located very close to NYU  and wonderful restaurants and shops.

title: Privately Owned Hotels Represent the Best Values
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Home away from home
review: My wife, daughter and I stayed at this privately owned hotel in the heart of Greenwich Village in mid-September.  All of the staff at the front desk, the concierge, and the restaurant staff went out of their way to ensure that we had a wonderful visit.  The sit down breakfast with table service is which is included in the nightly rate is quite unusual from our experience.  We jokingly asked the front desk staff on our departure to suggest something we could complain about as we couldn't think of anything.  Our experience with hotels suggests that privately owned hotels try harder as the owners' reputations are on the line.  This hotel represents great value in NY!

title: Great Location & Friendly Staff
review: We loved Washington Square! The location is wonderful and the friendly staff were so welcoming and accommodating. The hotel is old, but there is something comforting about feeling like you're staying at your grandmother's house. We had the privilege of staying two extra nights after a seven night stay due to cancelled flights. The room we had for the week was large and light filled with a huge bathroom overlooking the park. We had different rooms the other two nights that weren't quite so nice. The air conditioner rattled all night in the first and the second one was so small that it was claustrophobic. But, we were just happy to have a safe place to stay after being sent back to the city not once, but twice. And the staff welcomed back with open arms. We will definitely go back…

title: Washington square hotel NY
review: I wanted to base our trip out of the West Village/Greenwich Village area, and at half the price of most other NY hotels in mid-September, this one fit the bill.   Pros: The lobby is beautiful and felt luxurious, the staff always greeted us with a smile, and the free breakfast was perfect for our appetites, with cereal, yogurt, fresh fruit, bagels, and even chocolate croissants available along with coffee, tea and orange juice. The room was always clean and the free wifi was reliable and fast.   Cons: We were prepared for a small room, but our Double Superior room was really tiny! We made it work with some creative storage solutions. The bigger issue for us was the lack of natural light due to not having an outside facing window. It did allow us to sleep in well, but it was a…

title: good
review: We stayed here at the end of June 2012 .The location is excellent with subways and restaurants within very very easy walking distance ,The best eatery's are around McDougall & Bleaker st's.   DO NOT USE The hotels own restaurant ,over priced under cooked  small portions , staff are rude        lazy and unfriendly,  and these are the same staff that serve the breakfast.  The rest of the staff seem ok   although the guy on the front door is a bit over friendly OTT. Yes the rooms are small  and the air con is noisy but the beds are comfortable. would we stay here again ?  yes great location.

title: Washington Square Hotel
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Excellent
review: overall a very good experience.    The rooms are small, but clean and efficient.  The staff is most friendly and helpful.  Usually stay in Midtown East but love the  West Village location.  Would definately stay there again.

title: Very pleasant
review: I only spent one night here so it may not be the most thorough review, but I can't find anything negative to say about the Washington Square Hotel. The room was spacious, modern, comfortable, and clean. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. There is air conditioning and free wifi, as well as a continental breakfast (nothing spectacular, just the usual yogurt, fruit, cereal, bagels, etc.). The location is great, just a few minute walk to the W4 St. Subway station, as well as the West Village, Washington Square Park, etc. The hotel definitely isn't cheap, which I suppose is a slight negative, but I do think you get what you pay for when it comes to NY hotels.

title: My New Favorite Hotel in NYC
review: It was a very Good Stay at The Hotel. Breakfast was excellent, we will be there again. The nearby Washington Square Park allows to relax, at bleecker street there was good food and StuffIt. Very nice.

title: These are closets, not rooms.
review: I had heard about the Washington Square Hotel for years, but this was the first time my wife and I stayed there. What a pleasant experience it was! I'm reluctant to say too much good about it because I don't want it to be sold out next time we try to stay there. Top to bottom, start to finish, the hotel is beautifully run, tastefully decorated and renovated, perfectly located. It's across the street from one of the most interesting and relaxing parks I've seen, Washington Square. The staff at the hotel is on top of everything, friendly and helpful. The room we had was perfect: comfortable, quite, enough room for us. The elevator service was superb, the breakfasts were excellent, and access to subways was a one block walk. Staying in The Village is now our favorite location,…

title: nice location.
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Don't go for the room for four!
review: Great location, directly on washington square, very friendly and lively neighbourhood. But the rooms are very very small with tiny closets. My room was gloomy and the window opens to a one square meter shaft and you can't even see a glimpse of the sky so you have no idea whether it's sunny or cloudy. The breakfast is very basic and poor. This hotel is too expensive for the quality it offers.

title: Nice place. Great Location
review: Great reception staff and the complimentary breakfast was reasonable. Fabulous location by the park. BUT The room for four minuscule, the bathroom teeny and the beds smaller than I have ever slept in.. Well I say sleep.. Impossible to sleep because of: Plastic under sheet All night trash collection Early morning renovation of room opposite (sand/varnish floor) And did I say about the miniature beds??? Maybe ok if you have a king size bed for two.. But avoid the room for four (I tried to change rooms and was told all rooms for four people the same)

title: Will be suggesting this hotel to all of our friends traveling to NYC
review: I stayed here on the 2nd of August for 3 nights. The location is great, near Washington Square, with the subway nearby. The receptionist at the hotel was very cordial and quick.  The room was clean as was the bathroom.  Price/quality for New York standards is good. Breakfast served was fresh everyday with pastries, bagels, fresh fruit, toast, juice and coffee. The only negative aspect was the noisy airconditioning. I will definitely come back.

title: Excellent location in NYC
review: We have just spent 6 nights at Washington Square Hotel in New York.  From when we arrived the staff were very friendly and accommodating.   The place is situated in an ideal location if you want to be out of the hectic parts of NYC. A stones throw away from Washington Square, a beautiful park to be around in Summer. It is around the corner from a main subway station making it easy to get uptown or downtown. And close to restaurants and great shopping areas.   Price was very reasonable and complimentary breakfast as well as free wifi were nice extras.    Unless you want to be in the thick of the action, you won't be disappointed with this place. Not 5 star luxury, but clean friendly and effortless.

title: Great proximity to NYU.
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Best place to stay in NYC
review: We stayed at this hotel because it was the closest one to the NYU campus.  We also got a reasonable rate with our NYU discount.  The check in went very smoothly.  The rooms were very small.  The bathroom was average with mold in the grout and chips in the bathtub.  The room really needed to have the walls painted.  The pillows on the bed were very hard.  The windows look out directly onto other neighboring buildings so if you want to open the shade you will have no privacy.  Continental breakfast was included downstairs in their restaurant.  It was very mediocre.  Housekeeping had not been to our room at 5:00 pm.  Unless you need to be right on NYU's campus, NY has many other hotels from which to choose.

title: Worth it.
review: While our apartment was undergoing renovation, we moved into the Washington Square Hotel for four nights. Every aspect of our stay at the intimate, Art Deco hotel was excellent. From the minute we saw the romantic lampposts on either side of the stairway that leads to its entrance, we knew this landmark hotel would be indicative of NYC rather than a could-be-anywhere-in-the-world property. To start with, it's right across the street from Washington Square Park, which is the heart of the Village, and the famous Washington Arch. This charming hotel is a find -- right in the middle of an upscale residential neighborhood. Although it's a century-old building, nothing about it feels tired. It's stylish and unpretentious. The continental breakfast in the hotel's restaurant was lovely,…

title: Superb staff
review: We had a fabulous experience at the Washington Square Hotel.  We had a very large room (executive king) that had everything we needed.  The bathroom was large, with an enormous shower.  The room felt newly decorated.  We were on the 7th floor, so heard very little from the street and nothing from other rooms.  The staff was uniformly helpful, especially the concierge/bellmen.  The location in Greenwich Village was easily accessible by cab from LaGuardia (less than $35 each way), and the subway stop was just around the corner.  In the neighbourhood there is lots of choice of places to eat, with even a good blues club (Terra Blues) within walking distance.  We felt very safe in our neighbourhood, no matter the time of day.  The included continental breakfast was good, but could do…

title: In the heart of a Village, good value for money
review: Great location, nicely kept rooms and attentive and friendly staff! When I reported to the front desk that the bathtub drain was very slow, they were apologetic and had it fixed within an hour. The room was on the small side but still quite comfortable, clean, and well appointed. We could hear street music from outside our windows, but I never heard our neighbors. The breakfast included in the room rate was basic and the dining room was a bit cramped, but we visited the restaurant/lounge one night and had great service. There's also a very small gym located on the premises.

title: Very nice, cozy hotel in Greenwich Village
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: A Jem in the Village
review: I spent five days in NYC recently and made a good choice when selecting the Washington Square Hotel! It is perfectly situated half a block from Washington Square, and less than a block to the subway. The rooms are not large but are well appointed with European-style beds (double means two twins, squished together) and a VERY large bathroom with a shower big enough for a family! The front desk staff are courteous and helpful. The restaurant is excellent--friendly service, and reasonably priced for NYC. I opted for the full service breakfast every day, and wasn't disappointed.   I was somewhat concerned about noise simply because it was NYC, but the room was completely silent! There were guests on both sides of me but I didn't hear a peep from the other rooms, or from the outside.…

title: Would stay again
review: I recently stayed at the Washington Square Hotel for a two-day business trip.  I was in a deluxe queen room.  For the location and price this is an excellent value.  The rooms are small, but heck, this is NYC.  And, while they are small, they have everything you really need.  After all, for the most part, I was only in the room to sleep.  Pros:  Fantastic location, close to great food/bars, close to the subway, room is servicable and works for what I needed it for, free Internet, super close to where my meetings were being held at NYU, continental breakfast.  Cons: the bed was a little too firm for my taste and was uncomfortable, while the continental breakfast is a plus, it is very basic and almost too crowded.   Overall, I would say here again.  While the room wasn't as swanky…

title: Great location, friendly staff, nifty little restaurant.
review: Very clean, great location, quiet, friendly and helpful staff. Loved the decor. The beds were very comfy. Continental breakfast needs a little more though, maybe eggs and bacon or sausage. Can't beat the price for NYC!

title: Funky hotel in fantastic neighborhood, close to many subways
review: A friend and I decided to treat ourselves as a kind of thirtieth birthday present and New York seemed like a wonderful kind of treat. We haphazardly googled hotels in New York and found this wonderful little gem. The rooms may be small and quite basic but they are clean, quiet and a little funky. The location is superb and so central that we were able to travel all over with no difficulty and more often than not walked from the hotel to the areas of interest. It was safe too. The staff were helpful and friendly and the concierge was always at hand to point us in the right direction or give us some useful local advice. We ate in the restaurant on one of the evenings, which also has a separate entrance on the street and serves walk in public too. The food was delicious and again…

title: Great location close to everything!
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Highly Recommended
review: This hotel is situated right on the edge of Washington Square in Greenwich Village so its art deco style fits right in with the arty area in which it's located.  Lovely room, had everything you could need for what is usually a shortish stay - we stayed for 4 nights and found it really quiet to sleep in despite NY being the city that never sleeps!  The continental breakfast is great and has a really good choice - muffins are lovely!  Staff (especially the door staff) are really helpful.  All in all a great place to stay!

title: one night in NYC
review: I recently traveled to NYC as a single female traveling solo. I was, of course, first and foremost concerned about my safety. Im the type of traveler who researches and researches until it feels right... That was Washington Square Hotel to me. I made my reservation through their website and was able to save $ by prepaying. I felt the room was reasonably priced considering NYC standards.   The hotel is located across the street from Washington Square Park, whch I found to be lovely.   The staff was phenominal. Always willing to help if needed. Arranged shuttle service to the airport. I even was able to go on the rooftop to take some photographs.   The complimentary breakfast was standard but nice.   The room was a bit small but I really didnt spend any time in the room other to…

title: I expected better
review: I needed a hotel for just one night and was looking for a nice hotel that didn't break the bank.  The hotel's location is within a few steps of Washington Square which is a small but beautiful park near Greenwich. Once inside, the front desk area is quite dark and confined, and I was glad there wasn't a crowd waiting to check in.  The staff were helpful with general tourist questions.  I did find, however, that my room required at least 7 stairs to the next level, and lugging a heavy suitcase was an issue.  The bellman seemed to be somewhere else.  I was in room 128.  The room had 2 double beds, but the sq. ft. of the room was small.  The pillows were extra plump and the bed, itself, was very comfortable, but the duvets were extremely heavy and I ended up taking mine off the bed…

title: So convenient
review: I was quite looking forward to staying at the Washington Square Hotel.  However, I found it to be a disappointment.  The location is very pleasant – on tree-lined Waverly Place, just a few yards from Washington Square in Greenwich Village.  It may very possibly be the same hotel that Joan Baez mentioned in her song “Diamonds and Rust.”  The hotel notes coyly that “Bob and Joan” stayed there.  It is also right across the street from Babbo Restaurant, but if you don’t have dinner reservations there by now you are unlikely to get them in your lifetime.  Although the lobby was chaos when we arrived in mid afternoon, check-in was smooth.  Unfortunately, the woman who checked us in was as pleasant as the desk staff got during our one-day stay.  By the time I checked out they were…

title: Good Hotel, Perfect Location
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Wonderful Stay In Greenwich Village
review: Helpful staff, Good Continental breakfast, Rooms ok, Location Perfect. Wie will come Again. Stayed in May 2011

title: Don't understand why so many raves....
review: My wife and I had a wonderful stay at the Washington Square Hotel. If you are looking to stay in Greenwich Village I would highly recommend. The Art Deco design is well done, nice clean accommodations, friendly helpful staff and great location. The hotel layout is a little quirky with its heavy hallway doors.  The continental breakfast is nice touch.  Dined in the hotel restaurant for dinner one night and it was very good.

title: Excellent
review: I needed to be near an event, and this hotel's location was perfect.  With all the excellent reviews here on TA, I wasn't really concerned about the lack of viable alternatives in the area.  So I spent 2 nights here, flabbergasted at the poor quality of the accommodations versus the amount I was paying, and then checked out and went back uptown to the Michelangelo, where not only was the room LESS expensive, but it is at least 2 -3 stars better in rating category. (See my review for it.)     The lobby, while small, confers its limited charm through its beautiful deco tiles and artwork.  The small, cosy bar off the lobby, where some nice snacks can be ordered to go with drinks, closes early!  This is just ridiculous for a hotel, IMO!  And you certainly don't want to bring company…

title: Great Stay!
review: Wonderful place to stop over for a few drinks.  Great service, beautiful rooms.  Will be back next time i'm over this way.

title: Location, location, location-- and a very nice hotel!
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: So friendly
review: My husband and I stayed here this past weekend and found it to be clean, comfortable and convenient!  We booked the executive king room and it was HUGE.  I heard that the standard rooms are small and share bathrooms, so make sure you know what you are booking.   Our room was on the 7th floor, just off the elevator. Surprisingly quiet and despite the extreme heat wave, the TWO air conditioner units kept it cool.  A/C had remotes, so you didn't have to leave the bed to change the room temperature, either!   The bed was comfy, plenty of pillows with a sparkling white duvet cover.  Alarm clocks on both bedsides that included an iPod charger.  Room came with a Keurig coffee maker and supplies were re-stocked daily.  Safe, iron, ironing board and hair dryer in the closet.  Had the…

title: Nice hotel, good breakfast, friendly staff
review: Spend 5 nights at this hotel early June. Had a quad room on first floor. What a fantastic stay, beds were soooo comfy, room was clean and well appointed. The added bonus of a breakfast chucked in the rate was much better than expected, and the location was just the best... so near to fab restaurants, bars and shopping yet with a feeling of being away from it all. Above all, the service and friendliness of the staff was brilliant, they certainly knew their stuff. The concierge Ronny is a gem, bending over backwards to help out or offer advice on anything you wanted to know or do. Will certainly visit again and would recommend to anyone who wants a special experience of NYC

title: Great Value for Money in the heart of the village
review: The room was so beautifully decorated, and the bathroom was very clean with all amenities nicely arranged. We asked for a higher floor, park view room and the view was as nice as possible for the area. The complimentary breakfast was great and everything was tasty and fresh. The staff was very friendly and went out of their was to find a charger for my disposable cell phone. However, I was not happy with the area, Greenwich village was not what we expected.

title: Very nice hotel
review: Great Value for Money in the heart of the village. Easy access to everything and although the affordable rooms are small they are good for what you need.

title: Excellent hotel and best value for money
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Excellent hotel
review: My parents have just returned from their trip to this hotel and were extremely happy with everything from start to finish. The staff were remarkably friendly and helpful, and there was a very personable feel. The food was great and the hotel was very clean. Location was perfect also. They came to stay off the back of a recommendation, and will be passing on recommendations to others. Thank you from them for a wonderful experience.

title: Friendly hotel
review: We recently stayed two nights here.  The location was great.  We were within a few blocks of two subway lines.  We wanted to hear jazz, and the Village Vanguard and the Blue Note were easy walking distance, a few blocks.  Lots of good restaurants to choose from.  Had a great Italian dinner at Morandi, 211 Waverly Place.  The rooms are small but very comfortable.  The breakfast was great - fresh fruit, orange juice, croissants, bagels, etc.  The area was safe and right next to Washington Square which was a nice oasis of green.  They have a service to the airport that was only a few dollars more than a taxi and was very reliable, comfortable and friendly.  The price was excellent for NY.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: Excellent low priced boutique hotel; fantastic location, clean and friendly
review: staff were friendly and welcoming and hotel was in perfect location for us. There is subway very close and a great selection of bars and restaurants within walking distance in a very safe area.

title: Everything you need
review: Dear Shirley V, Thank you for taking the time to post your review. We are happy you were able to experience our great neighborhood. Your nice comment will be shared with all the staff. Please visit us again when traveling to NYC! Best Regards, Agnes

title: New York gem
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Great choice
review: Would recommend the Washington Square Hotel to anyone looking for a well managed and well appointed hotel in an excellent area of New York. Right on the corner of Washington Square Gardens with easy access to main streets into main tourist areas and subways.  Rooms very small and claustrophobic but this is what you expect in New York.  Expensive at $150 a night with an adequate breakfast.  Friendly helpful staff.  Excellent but expensive restaurant in basement.  Would certainly use it again.

title: excellent value for the price, good location, nice breakfast
review: We loved the location with easy access to all areas.  The staff were friendly & helpful.  Rooms are small but clean  with very comfy beds & linens.  Great that you can open the window for fresh air.

title: Loud but lovely location
review: The location, near Greenwich Village and NYU, merely a block away from the subway, was great. I was by myself on business so my queen superior room size was quite adequate [I would have chosen a double, but they were all booked], and I was pleasantly surprised at how big the bathroom was. Free wifi worked all the time was a big plus, as well as small extras like plush cotton bathrobes and keurig coffee machine that included herbal tea. The staff was friendly and helpful. Last but not least, the free breakfast was much appreciated.

title: Disappointed
review: MaggieAnton, Thank you for your great review! I am very happy to hear you enjoyed your stay and the many complimentary amenities. Should business or pleasure ever bring you back to NYC, the staff at the WSH welcomes you back! Sincerely, Agnes B.

title: Best kept secret in lower Manhattan  Great value for money
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Lovely Greenwich Village Hotel
review: I shouldnt be writing this as its my well kept little secret..  This is a great value for money hotel  Its not a five star experience but the rooms are bigger than most in NYC and quite adequate for a short stay, long weekend etc   What makes it is the amoshpere, friendly staff two restaurants and bars and amazing location opposite Washington Square and close to literally scores of restaurants and bars, clubs etc and a block away from the metro for going quickly uptown

title: 1st time in the Village
