review: First time my wife and I stayed at this was hotel was in 2010, and our experience was so positive that when we went back to NYC in May 2012, we decided to stay at Washing Square Hotel again. Nice and spacy rooms, if you pay a few dollars more you get a view to the Square, room cleaning excellent and very friendly staff. In the hotel basement you have the North Square restaurant, a delightful restaurant whether you're having breakfast, lunch or dinner. There's also a nice bar just behind the reception. The location is perfect for exploring lower Manhattan where you'll find many interesting places and areas, wiuth an abundance of small cafes, restaurants and shops of every kind. Just a short walk to the NY Metro which brings you "anywhere" in no time. Much better than hailing a…

title: Great European style boutique hotel
review: During past visits to the city,  I've always stayed in the theatre district, as seeing shows is the major reason I go to NY. This time I decided to stay a bit further downtown to experience a different neighborhood. I chose WSH because I liked the deco style and prices were reasonable for a Memorial Day weekend. I have a mixed review of the hotel. Decor is nice, hotel is clean, but rooms are _very_small, even for NYC. The continental breakfast is truly minimal...and the toaster malfunctioned and burned a slice of bread to a crisp my first morning. Coffeemaker in my room stopped working the second day, and the ceiling of the shower began leaking on the morning I checked out. Staff were friendly, and the young woman at the front desk was gracious enough to use her computer to…

title: Great Location
review: I stayed for 3 nights & loved the WSH.  We had a deluxe exterior twin which, tho cozy, was comfy, impeccably clean, efficiently furnished, with a nicely updated bathroom.  Like Italy, they even offer complimentary continental breakfast...all for a very reasonable price by NYC standards.  Great location too.  Only prob, our AC unit loudly cycled on & off all night which was quite annoying.  We did not need it after 1st night, but would have spoken to the helpful & friendly desk for a change of room had it been necessary.  Stay here!  I will next time.

title: Comfortable, nice art, great location
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Super location!
review: Excellent location, best hotel for the price in the neighborhood. Rooms are comfortable and quiet. Interesting tile art around the lobby and public places. Decent, if overpriced restaurant, but lots more to choose from in the neighborhood. Ideal place to stay for events at NYU.

title: No complaints!
review: Since our daughter has been attending NYU, this is the spot we have stayed to visit her. We have stayed near Times Square in the past. This is by far so much better. The hotel is clean w/nice little breakfast. Reminded of us of the hotels we stayed when visiting Paris, Rome, and London. Small, clean, tucked in convenient little neighborhoods. Has small exercise room w/2 treadmills and weights.   Love the neighborhoods and Washington Square Park. You step out the motel door and the world is at your feet. Washington Square Park is be far, my favorite city park anywhere. There are two dog parks, multiple musician, pigeon feeders who have names for all the birds they feed, chess and backgammon gamers. A great place to have a picnic lunch and people watch!  It's a great neighborhood…

title: Value and Location excellent
review: Third stay here.  Location is great.  Breakfast included in adjacent restaurant is very good.  Nice neighborhood.  Rooms are small but very clean.  Will stay again!

title: Good choice for downtown
review: Now the third stay at this hotel. The Greenwich and West Village areas are by far the most appealing in NY if you want to cruise restaurants and get amongst locals and away from Times Square tourists. THe subway is close for visits north and south. The Wash Square Park on a sunny day is entertainment in itself just watching all the music and performance and the crazy people who parade there. And the dogs with their owners. It has a gym with basic equipment but subway stairs are a good workout you can't avoid. Breakfast is suppled and good. Remember that when you are in New York if you just want to 'hang out' in your room and call that an experience, you are missing the point. You sleep in it, you wash and get changed for the next day. These rooms suffice for this purpose - I…

title: Just the ticket
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Second time just as nice as the first
review: Let me first say that when I visit NYC with the family, we usually stay in the Elysee, Giraffe, or Casablanca.  This time I went to the city on my own as I wanted to see some museums, libraries, and sports stuff that would bore my family.  As i wanted to stay in the Village, I decided to give WSH a shot.  It's a great location, right on the park, and a block from the subway.  The staff was nice.  The room was clean and very very very small.  Just right for one person, but iffy for any more.  The small window had a nice view of a brick wall.  There is a continental breakfast included, but it is very sparse and not of any great quality.  However, if you have some coffee, oj, and a bagel, you probably have had a $20 breakfast by NYC standards.  :)  If your plans are to be out of…

title: Great hospitality!
review: Last visit here was in July 2010.  This time we arrived in NYC on 4/29 at 9:00 AM.  Dropped our luggage off at the hotel for storage and were invited to go to the hotel's restraurant and have some of the free continental breakfast which was great since I ate breakfast at about 3:30 AM and was hungry.  We were promptly served large bowls of fruit, juice and coffee and then bagels and muffins.  Had to run to NJ for the day and arrived back at the hotel at about 10 PM.  We went to our room which was an executive king on the second floor in the front of the hotel right next to the elevator.  I thought the elevator might have been noisy, but I never heard it.  The streets did get noisy around 2 AM when the garbage guys came through, but we remedied that by keeping the air conditioner…

title: Just as good the second time round!
review: From 24 to 29th of April my mother and I stayed at the Washington Square Hotel to discover NY. What a great cosy hotel in the friendly Village. Coffee and Tea in the room, healthy breakfast and very friendly staff. I'm going to recommend it to my friends!

title: Good value, charming character, location, breakfast!
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Great Vacation Spot!
review: We liked this place - we had a quiet room (307) and weren't bothered by our neighbors, and we appreciated the breakfast being included in the room price and enjoyed the fruit, pastries, yogurt, and cereal being offered sometimes in the quirky little bar and sometimes just off the lobby (and until 11 a.m., another plus!).  We also had coffee in the room. The decor wasn't cookie-cutter, with real old wood, photos of old-time movie stars, and many pleasing custom touches.  The price was quite competitive, and the location was perfect for us - just across from Washington Square in the West Village, in a good walkable area near plenty of places to eat (Babbo is right across the street).  Very helpful service, very clean, and of course, the room is small - this is New York, folks.

title: Home from home
review: I've been to NYC a couple times but this was my first stay in Greenwich Village.  I had a wonderful time.  Everyone on the staff here was friendly and helpful.  The room was clean and pleasant.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: Good things come in small packages
review: Our room was on the 9th floor and looked out onto the street with Washington Square visible to the left.  We don't like air conditioning so just kept the window open and were not bothered by noise - possibly because we were tired after very busy days in New York.  Our room was a bit small, but very comfortable and with a good shower.  (don't choose 715 - it looks onto an interior wall!) The staff were friendly and helpful and internet availability was perfect after a problem on the first day.  Breakfast was a large bowl of fresh fruit, juice, cofee/tea, bagels, muffins and scones.  Delicious!  The greeter Ronnie was wonderful -  always ready with directions and tips of what to see and where to eat.  We really missed him at the weekend!  We  enjoyed our stay there very much and…

title: Great location, great little hotel
review: The room size is adequate for this wonderful gem, right in the heart of Greenwich Village. The staff are helpful, room was quite and clean, though a touch overheated. Staff were really helpful in many ways, and the valet was really helpful in helping us find our way around this massive island of Manhattan. But really, you don't have to go far to find yourself immersed in the New York scene. There are great shops all around, bars and restaurants, though the restaurant that is attached to the  hotel - The North Square is hard to beat for fabulous food and great service.

title: Creepy place with claustrophobic rooms
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Lovely, considerate service
review: This place charges way too much for very small, claustrophobic rooms.  The room I had did not even have a real window.  The walls are paper thin.  I was woken up at midnight by the person in the next room taking a shower.  It sounded like a jet engine flying past when the water rushed past my room.  To make matters worse, the air conditioning (which you must leave on because else you will have no air to breathe at all) made noise all night long. Thank God I only had to spend one night here!  Now that I am home, I am finding little bites all over my body.  I hope I did not bring home any bed bugs from that place.

title: Old World Charm
review: We arrived in New York on a Sunday afternoon, just as my partner was coming down with acute tonsillitis. The hotel staff were very helpful and considerate and even found an excellent company of medical practitioners (called 'sickday') that make house calls (yes, on Sundays!) and he was treated right away by a very competent and caring medical practitioner.. It wasn't the best NY trip we've ever had, but if you've got to be ill in a New York hotel, definitely stay here!

title: An almost perfect hotel
review: My brother and I always book this hotel in THE VILLAGE. it is absolutely charming. The old elevators; nice restaurant. It is close to the BLUE NOTE if you like to hear great (world.class) jazz. No mindless high rise for me, thanks.  Enjoy!

title: Hate to give away this secret
review: The Washington Square Hotel is a charming little inn across the street from Washington Square Park, right in the heart of the Village. It's impeccably maintained, with a pretty little lobby and well-appointed, if tiny, rooms.The room was quiet and featured an amazingly comfortable bed. It's definitely a good value for the money. Continental breakfast is included, and in New York City, that represents a substantial savings. The staff is very friendly and helpful.  There is no business center, so if you need a boarding pass printed, you'll have to ask the front desk, but they make up for it by offering free wi-fi. There is a small restaurant and bar off the main lobby, but in our three day stay we never saw it open. Instead, we were directed downstairs to a very nice…

title: Washington Square Hotel (West Village) in the Spring
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: More than 2 nights?  Upgrade your room.
review: It's always an adventure and fun to drive into Manhattan, especially in the rain. Particularly true, when you place your trust into a GPS rather than rely on long-term memory.  The GPS took us from NJ through Staten Island to Brookly and over the Brooklyn Bridge rather than under through the Holland Tunnel (long-term memory).  So we save a half-hour on traffic and drove through 3 of the 5 boroughs only to find a street fair along Waverly Place in front of the hotel.  So, we found our intended parking garage two blocks away and jettisoned the SUV to the street smart guy who was happy to park it deep and forget about for a few days.  Only two blocks and we had packed light so we strolled over with suitcases through the food vendors and artists along Waverly.  Hotel staff happily…

title: Nice enough room; substandard service
review: All the reviews about a great value and amazing location are true.  We had the cheapest room, a Superior Double, which was more than adequate.  Immaculate, and loved the vanity.  Really didn't need anything else and we will book it again.  Still, if you need to be there more than two nights I'd suggest upgrading to a room with either more space, OR MORE IMPORTANTLY, a window looking out over the street.  I needed to checkout or have some daylight shining in by then.

title: Nice hotel
review: The room is very big, and fairly nice. The bathroom is lovely. The staff in the breakfast room ignored us for 30 minutes while chattering amongst themselves.

title: Everything perfect
review: Very nice European style hotel with a good breakfast included.  A great value.  Great location and nice service.

title: Fantastic location, clean and comfortable. Great find!
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Great Hotel, Great location
review: We've just returned from a 4 day stay at the Washington Square Hotel and cannot sing its praises enough. The location is simply excellent. As first-timers in NYC it was great to stay in an area as laid back and lovely as Greenwich/West Village. You are a stone's throw away from endless bars, restaurants and of course the beautiful Washington Square park but still within walking distance or a cab/subway ride to the major sights. We actually walked the entire length of 5th Avenue from just outside the hotel, which was a great way to see New York by foot.   In terms of facilities, the room price included a continental breakfast which consisted of fruit, bagels, croissants, biscuits and muffins, plus yoghurt and cereal. We only ate the breakfast twice as we were spoiled by numerous…

title: Friendly hotel, shame about the chaotic breakfasts
review: I have stayed at this hotel more than 5 times during the last few years. If you want to be part of the West Village, I know of no better choice. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are typical NY-size. The entire facility is clean. There's a lot going on in this unique, central area, and the Washington Square Hotel makes you feel like part of the neighborhood.

title: Why stay in midtown when the best of Manhattan's music, food and style is across the street from Washington Square Park.
review: We stayed here for nearly a week at the beginning of March and had an excellent stay.  Never having been to New York before, we chose the Washington Square on the recommendation of a friend and am pleased to say that it was a very comfortable stay. Our room, 718, was on the corner, almost overlooking the Square, on the front elevation. It wasn't a large room, but it was comfortable, clean and with the facilities one would expect.  However, the street outside can get noisy in the night, with refuse trucks collecting in the small hours. On one night, the City decided to mend the road opposite the hotel. Jack-hammers at 11:30pm until 2:30am is not something I was expecting. Not the hotel's fault, though, and the desk clerk did go and speak with the workforce on our behalf and offer…

title: A nice, comfy hotel.
review: Stay here period! Forget the big name chains in Manhattan and get away from the masses in midtown. Head downtown and have fun while in NYC. Situated close to SoHo in the West Village (the best neighborhood in NYC) blocks from the most music venues you will ever find. This hotel is the best value while still maintaining a fun, hip vibe you will find.

title: Excellent Choice
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Our home in New York City
review: Washington Square is a great choice.  The room was a good size and very clean. I got an excellent night's sleep on their comfortable King bed. My only criticism would be the continental breakfast.  It was adequate, but lacking in variety and seating - although it is possible to take your breakfast to go.  I found the hotel restaurant "North Square" to be a much better choice for breakfast.  I was stunned by the delicious breakfast I got for a very modest price.  9.00 for 3 eggs, delicious breads, chicken sausage, fruit salad, coffee and juice  - All Included!

title: Great (and cheap!) stay in NYC
review: My husband and I have stayed at the Washington Square Hotel for many years.  We go to NYC on business (and stay for pleasure) three times a year and usually stay for 10 days.  We love the Washington Square.  Great location, great staff, and a lovely restaurant.  No room service, but breakfast is served downstairs.  Clean and quiet.  Not trendy, but perfectly suited for adults.

title: Great Hotel, Perfect Location
review: My wife and I debated for hours on where to stay during our first trip to New York City and we settled on the Washington Square Hotel in Greenwich Village.  The thought of staying right in Time Square didn't appeal to us as we like to stay clear of tourist traps for our hotels.  This hotel had incredibly friendly and helpful staff, notably Rodney who works as a doorman/concierge/need-anything man in the lobby.  He let us know where the good restaurants were, transit information and even his best chicken recipe!  As for the room itself, the Deluxe King Room (6th floor) was incredibly clean, spacious (even by NYC standards) and very comfortable.  Wall-mounted plasma, ipod/iphone alarm dock and charger, king bed, great vanity, robes, safe and all the usual amenities for $225/night.…

title: Washington Square Hotel - great place for a week-end
review: Wonderful hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful (Thank you Ronnie and Nick). From the hotel it's easy to walk up 5th Ave or grab a cab anywhere. The subway is half a block away.  The restaurant and bar/lounge had good food and a relaxing atmosphere. The room was small but clean and neat and the rates reasonable. It was a great find and I will stay there again.

title: Superior to the chain hotels
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Great Location
review: We have just got back from spending 4 nights at the Washington Square Hotel.  It is the second visit after a gap of 9 years and it was a pleasure to return.  Rooms have been refurbished but the hotel has not lost its charm and the staff all proved helpful and very friendly. We dined in their North Square Restaurant twice at night and also for lunch before leaving; the quality and presentation of the food was excellent and the service efficient and friendly. Having stayed in skyscraper chain hotels coming to the Washington Square is a pleasure. Rooms are well equiped including 'pod' coffee machines however one small room for improvement would be good sized bath sheets in place of towels. This hotel will however be our first choice when next revisiting NewYork.

title: Hotel in Heart of Manhattan
review: Overall a good experience. An ideal location in a quiet neighborhood, close to subway near a fabulous, hip section of Greenwich Village. The air-conditioners aren't the best in the room and make too much noise. The reception staff wasn't the greatest although the doorman and bellboys were terrific. The room was clean, although a little small, bed comfortable, tv too high on the wall.

title: Great Location
review: The Washington Square Hotel in Manhattan is a quaint (small) hotel in a period building across from the famous Washington Square park that was highlighted in the movie "Searching for Bobby Fischer".  You can play chess with the local chess sharks.  You pay them a nominal fee and they beat you but teach at the same time.  Our chess playing 10 year old daughter had the adventure of playing with "Jack" for $5.00 right under a sign that said, "playing games for money is strictly prohibited in this park".  But she enjoyed herself thoroughly.  The old gentleman was so nice and played quite a few games and gave her many suggestions.    The hotel is beautifully renovated and architecturally interesting.  The service, linens, food were just great.  We would absolutely go back.

title: Excellent for the cost
review: Although well kept and everything works, everything about this hotel is small and cramped. The service varies from rude to very professional, depending on the person depending on who is working the front desk. The location, however, is excellent as it is 1 block from the subway lines west of 5th Avenue and about 3 blocks from the subway lines on Broadway, close to the park and many restaurants etc in the West Village.

title: Comfort and security in the Big Apple
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Perfect Location
review: We will return to Hotel Washington Square, as we love the area of the village. The big park there is filled with activity, chess games, students, dog walkers and squirrels. So much within walking distance: clubs, restos, shopping, neighborhoods and good times.  Staff is so friendly and helpful, especially with transportation questions. True comfort, good sleep and excellent service with an old world artistic feel.

title: We will return.
review: we stayed at this hotel on December 2nd for 5 nights with Virgin Holidays. We paid for a deluxe room which from the website seems the only difference between that and superb room was you were given a view of something. We arrived after a horrendous trip through JFK. Apparently they were short staffed and we queued through security for well over two hours, just stood in lines of people. My husband is a diabetic and began to feel seriously ill. When we arrived at the hotel we were just grateful to be there at last. The room was big. I was surprised as people here had commented the rooms were tiny. But I was really disappointed that the window faced a brick wall. Now really I had no right to complain here as we never said anything but after the traumatic JFK experience we were…

title: Perfect location for great village weekend!
review: We stayed for 8 nights over Xmas and could not be happier with the location, exactly what we wanted walking distance to tribeca and all the restaurants, cafes and coffee houses. cute shops and squirrels everywhere. lived as much as we could like a local walking everywhere from alphabet city, SoHo, meat packers to even wall street. made the short subway trip to the more tourist spots like central part and Broadway but came back to the area every night to eat. Oh how i wish i could live there. breakfasts where usual cereals, eggs, yoghurt, fruits etc rooms where small but I dont get why people complain about small rooms as your on holiday and its basically only a bed you need anyway and in a heritage building what do you expect they can not knock walls down? If you want a big room…

title: washinton square hotel recommended
review: A plus with one minus.  Saturday PM "concierge" less than helpful and actually unhelpful when getting a cab.  Feet were not happy to be told to walk a block in the slush and party shoes to get a cab at 7pm!  All other staff at all levels were excellent!

title: Lovely location with a comfortable charm...
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Bed Bugs for a three star hotel
review: This hotel was recommended to us by a friend, and it was lovely. We chose a small room, as we figured we'd be out and about so much it wouldn't matter, and it was fine; in fact I think the cosiness made it more special and intimate for a couple anyway. The lobby was delightful and the concierge was so friendly and full of well-intended personality. We really liked him, and he made us feel happy and welcome. The Uni graduation was happening the week we were there and everything was purple and there were proud families everywhere, which was kinda sweet to be around. We were able to walk to all the things we wanted to see in Soho and the Village, and all the very best comedy stores are just around the corner. We laughed more in our 3 days here than we've laughed in our whole lives,…

title: Great hotel,great location!
review: After paying 350 dollars a night for a deluxe queen, I was moved to a standard double because of the horrible bed with the mattress that dipped in the middle. They still charged me for the deluxe queen. After moving between rooms 2 times and still ended up with a poor bed, I decided to give up and put up with it... until I realised I was bitten by bed bugs a day later.  Breakfast was very average with cold food.

title: Great location
review: Freindly cosy hotel located in Greenwich. Quiet spacious rooms, cosy wine bar and award winning restaurant. Staff exceptionally friendly, especially the doorman.They dont make you feel like just another tourist. Breakfast included in our package,and I was able to order boiled eggs cooked to perfection each morning at an extra cost of $2 !! We will definetly be making this our base in NYC when next we visit.

title: Good hotel, great location
review: Firts time in NY and we sayed in this hotel for 7 nights. Smal room, but clean and cozy. Metro at "the next corner" and walking distance to everything. Near Greenwich Village and Meatdistrict, lots of restaurants .... Jazz clubs ..... Short terms, Great location and nice hotel.

title: A Perfect Get Away Hotel!
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Great hotel for $250 a night
review: If you are tired of those big hotel chains and want personal attention the Washington Square Hotel is for you! It is in a perfect location that allows you to walk everywhere...or just across the street to one of New York's best parks. If you want a 5 star dinner, Babbo is right across the street!  I celebrated my birthday during our stay and the staff upgraded my room and left a great bottle of champagne. It was a great get away, and this hotel was a big part of it.

title: best location in the city, nice hotel, reasonable price
review: Stayed here for 4 nights over Canadian Thanksgiving weekend. Room was very nice, clean and modern. Heard no noise at all from halls or street, but we were on 6th floor. The included breakfast and coffee was a nice treat.   Great location located across from Washington Square Park and just west of Greenwich Village. Staff was friendly and helpful to navigate the subways.  Would defintely come back!

title: Two thumbs up!
review: We live a block away and use the hotel a lot for our guests.  We had two rooms over Christmas.  Center of the Village is the best location.  Easy subway to Times Sq or anywhere else – but you don’t need to go far for the best of the city.   Hotel has lot’s of character.  Staff is always nice, rooms always clean, free coffee in room, free wifi, free really good breakfast.  For the city it is also very quiet.   Because of Christmas we could have stayed at the W for the same price but our guests stayed at Wash SQ before, enjoyed it and just wanted to stay there.   Rooms are small but you should not be spending much time inside anyway – there is too much to do.  Five minutes to east and west village (as if Greenwich was not enough) ten minutes to Tribeca, Soho & Nolita, Union…

title: Still loving it!
review: We spent a week in December at the W.S.H. and loved every minute of our stay. The location has been way mentioned in other reviews, in a word just great. The hotel is well maintained with a charming lobby and our room was indeed a big surprise: we feared a phone booth sized one but ours was more than adequate for two persons, I'd say even largish for NY's standards and very clean. It was also pretty quiet, we didn't need to use earplugs (absolutely essential for a good sleep in other parts of the city, e.g. Theater District). The continental breakfast included was rich and tasty and we could choose to have it buffet-style or served at the table. A very big plus are the desk and lobby staff: very professional and always genuinely nice. We'd definitely recommend this hotel, it's…

title: Great location
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Location, Location, Location
review: We spent 4 days in December at this hotel and loved it. It was  our 3rd trip to NYC and we had stayed in Times square and in one of the Hiltons, but although this place is no where near as grand, it more than makes up for it with its charm and location. The village is the place to be to experience the real New York, literally hundreds of bars, diners, restaurants etc... to suit every taste and budget.

title: Perfect hotel in NYC
review: Stayed for 4 nights at the beginning of December on our second trip to NY.  Chose this hotel due to its location and generally positive reviews.  Ronnie the concierge (well, professional meeter and greeter more like) gave us a great welcome and lots of useful tips during our stay, although at times was a little over exhuberant.  Our room was on the first floor facing the back and not as small as we feared, plenty of space for two people, spotlessly clean although no view, quite dark and really really hot!  Pleased to have fluffy robes, free wi fi and tea/coffee facilities in the room.  Its unusual to get any kind of breakfast included in a hotel stay in NY so the inclusion of cereals, yoghurt, pastries, fruit and bagels was most welcome and more than adequate.  The interior of…

title: Very Comfortable at Affordable Prices
review: Love this hotel. Perfect location, reasonable rates, great staff...and a quite all right continental breakfast included!

title: Great Stay
review: This boutique is everything that it says it is. Wife and I stayed here for 4 nights in mid-November. The location is great - ideally situated for the underground railway giving access to anywhere in Manhattan; near a lot of very good restaurants as well as cheap fast food places. The hotel itself is a little old but retains old world charm. The staff are friendly and welcoming. The rooms are small (what do you expect in New York if you don't want to pay an arm and a leg!) but clean and adequate. We found them quiet although wondered whether the air conditioning would be a bit noisy in summer.We found the bar, where you could sit and have a quiet drink then order and eat your food from the hotel restaurant, the perfect way to finish the day. We have no hesitation in recommending…

title: Location, location, location - and friendliness
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Great Location - Great People !
review: New York is notorious for expensive hotels, so it`s a joy to find one that meets most criteria, at an affordable price. And in a great spot, on the corner of the lively Washington Square, with chess players, dogs, elegant bag ladies and everything else. Easy access to the metro, and lots of interesting sights within walking distance.  One of the things that made us fall in love with the hotel, was the extreme friendliness of all the staff. Big smiles, real interest in us and willingness to help is something that is definitely not found everywhere, especially not in big city hotels. The restaurant serves lovely food at night, and the breakfast is good and copious. The rooms are on the smallish side, but it works for couples and good friends. Nicely outfitted, and kept clean and…

title: Affordable hotel in a great location
review: Dear ithaca96, Thank you for your positive feedback! We are happy you enjoyed your stay at the Washington Square Hotel and took advantage of the many great attractions in the Greenwich Village. I will share your review with the rest of my team at the WSH and North Square Restaurant. Congratulations on getting a reservation at Babbo on such short notice! We look forward to your next visit. Sincerely, Agnes

title: Great location!
review: Excellent location and so much more personal than the Midtown/Uptown alternatives. Everything was as described on the website. Staff were universally friendly and helpful. The inclusive continental breakfast was a useful bonus. Thanks for a great stay !

title: just good enough
review: Dear marcomillenium, Thank you for sharing your great review! I'm happy our location and our staff made for a great stay. Yes, our complimentary continental breakfast is a great way to start your day! We hope to welcome you back in the near future. Sincerely, Agnes

title: Great staff, crappy rooms
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Mixed Resukts
review: I stayed here because its so close to NYU (like 2 mins top walking distance). The front staff personnel was EXTREMELY helpful before and during my stay (Thanks again, Maggie), providing above and beyond service. When I arrived very early (9:30am), they were able to find me a room and check me in well before check-in. Margaret provided excellent recommendations for lunch and dinner- she even went door-to-door to find me a private room for dinner! The bellhop was extremely pleasant and helpful as well. BUT, I was on the first floor, and the noise from the street was unbearable. The unsightly and unplugged AC unit in the window prohibited me from closing the window, and the shades didn't keep the light out. There was construction at midnight, which kept me up. I might as well have…

title: Perfect location, old world charm
review: Dear Kat B, Thank you for your review! Your review will be shared with Maggie and the rest of our team that made your stay so enjoyable. With so much to do in the area, they are indeed a great resource! I'm sorry read about your bad experience with the room.  The area around the hotel is lively, but I apologize that the noise made your stay unpleasant. When booking in the future, please make sure to request a room on a higher floor. We hope your next experience with our rooms is a better one! Sincerely, Agnes

title: Great value hotel in a good location
review: The Hotel is ideally located in the Soho/GV area. The hotel's public areas are  spotless and well maintaiend  as are the rooms. No bug issues here. We had a room with two double beds, and unfortunately one was well beyonf its usefull lifespan...think sliding out onto the floor from a sagging bed. They must have failed to put soud-deadening materila in the ceiling...noise all the time when someone is above you. Very small rooms, especially for 3 people (self, wife, daughter). They have employees in lobby that appear to be bellhops, but they don't assist with luggage and are not very helpful in answering questions. They tell you to go ask the front desk. Front desk personell generally pleasant, except for one emplyee who did not really like being intererupted with questions. Have…

title: Great location, very comfortable stay.
review: Dear Traveler468, Thank you for your feedback. I am sorry to read about your mixed experience.  I would like to assure you that all matters raised are being dealt with to ensure that this kind of experience is never repeated. We hope that you will give us a second chance and if you decide to book again, please contact me directly. Sincerely, Agnes

title: A fantastic hotel, a good price and a brilliant location.
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Make you feel like family
review: We booked this hotel after a recomendation from a friend. It was everything we hoped and more. I spent ages looking at rates and with the advance booking discount this was a bargain. It was clean, well maintained and the staff couldn't have been friendlier. The Hotel is in a great location in what felt like a very safe area and we can't wait to go back.

title: Best staff in town
review: We've stayed here a few times over the past 18 months as our daughter started attending school nearby.  The staff is very friendly and helpful.  It's an ideal location in Greenwich Village.  Rooms are always clean.  Historic building with lots of charm. Continental breakfast is a great convenience with great coffee.  Nice to have restaurant there as well if you want a bigger breakfast or any other meals and it also has a bar.  We moved our daughter in this year during the weekend of the hurricane.  Washington Square Hotel offered free sandwiches and soup both Sat. and Sun. as many businesses had closed.

title: Just as good as we remembered
review: From the moment we walked in (travel weary and crumpled!), we were treated like royalty.  Every person on the staff at this hotel provided the best service we've received in years.  The location is great, close to the park, the subway, good restaurants and pubs.  Special mention for "Curry Kitchen" round the block for excellent Indian food.  Thanks also to Ronnie for his upbeat, helpful local knowledge and the potato cakes recipe.

title: Location Location!
review: First stayed at the Washington in 2003 and decided to go back this trip...so glad we did! Although the rooms are small, they are very comfortable and clean. Free breakfast are a bonus although there are so many great restuarants nearby you are spoiled for choice.  Great location with two Subway stations within easy walking distance.  Washington Sq Gardens are also on your doorstep and on a sunny day a great place just to 'hang out' especially if the guy is playing his grand piano - how he gets it there on a daily basis we didnt discover! Staff are friendly and helpful with information, recommendations and arranging taxis etc for you. Would certainly recommend as a great palce to stay,

title: Great location
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Fantastic value and location
review: I've stayed at this hotel a number of times over the space of the last five years. To sum it up, it's a reasonably priced Manhattan hotel in a wonderful location.  The plus points for this location as opposed to elsewhere on the island are that it's quiet on a night, unlike most other hotel locations on the island particularly midtown around the Times Square area. The area is great for decent bars and restaurants on an evening. The village is a much nicer place to be than midtown for nearly everything.  If it's your first visit you'll want to see Times Square, the Empire State and the like, which isn't a problem, there's a subway entrance on the corner of the same block. Decent shopping is available a short walk away on Broadway and in Soho.  The hotel itself is very pleasant,…

title: comfortable, clean & great location
review: So happy with our choice to stay at Washington Square Hotel. It's only a couple of blocks from multitudes of restaurants, and one block from the subway. The neighbourhood was quiet and safe. The free buffet breakfast was a bonus. Would definitely come back.

title: Unpretentious inexpensive
review: This was a last minute crash pad for me.  The room was small, but spotlessly clean, had a great mattress and linens. Toiletries and a coffee/tea maker are in the room. Continental breakfast was included. To top it off, I was on the top floor and had a view.  I have been in some small hotel rooms in NYC and this one was small, but you do not have to be a contortionist to move around the room.  There is an abundance of restaurants and entertainment within walking distance.

title: Perfect Location for Authentic NYC Experience
review: Excellent position, clean, excellent staff could not fault anything will certainly stay there again, wanted to take Ronnie home

title: "Inexpensive" typical non-chain NYC Hotel
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Great Location - Feel of a B&B
review: New York City hotel rooms are small.  Unless you get a suite, it doesn't matter if you pay $650 or $250 night.  Of course, "usually" the more you pay the more amenities are available at the hotel.  The Washington Square Hotel is one of those non-chain hotels that can be found on many streets in NYC and which can be a real find or a real disaster.  I consider the WSH a find.  It was recommended to me by the company I was visiting in the area when all other hotels, even the "economy" brands were asking $550+ for one night.  As noted, the room was small, but updated and clean.  The bathroom was fine for one or two persons.  The only downside was in an effort to keep it very clean, it had a faint smell of bleach which must be used to keep the old style tile floor clean.  There was a…

title: Lovely hotel, great location, friendly staff
review: A great location just off Washington Square. Room was small with twin beds that were suitable for children. We are not big or tall - but our feet hung over the end of the matress. We found the mattresses uncomfortable and after 5 nights ended up with sore backs. Small bathroom with liitle counter space. Hotel reminded us of several Euro pensions we have stayed at. Continental breakfast basic and provided within the room rate. Monotonous after day 3 but other places to eat nearby. we booked at the hotel website and prepaid for best rate. Staff were great except for one lady at front desk who fankly could care less we about us. That put a damper on asking for further assistance. We would pay more to stay elsewhere in a larger full service hotel next time in the theatre district or…

title: Stay for location and staff
review: Situated in my favourite area of NYC, close to great restaurants and shops.  Washington Square Park is an experience everyone should have, full of crazy, lively activity day and night, there is always something to see there.  The hotel rooms are small but that's New York and once you get used to it, it's fine.  It was more luxurious than I expected with bath robes, coffee machine, and the usual little soaps in the bathroom.  The bed was lovely and comfortable and all the amenities you could want are there.  Breakfast was included which was a buffet so you can fill up.  Very clean hotel, friendly staff and great location, what more could you want?

title: Best NY experiance bar none!
review: We spent 4 nights there clean rooms, not that big but nice view of the park.Aircon drove us nuts as very noisy but you get that!!Spent a small fortune in the bar downstairs as barman ultra friendly and very intimate bar ,whenever NY overpowered me I would just go and sit in the park to chillout..aaaahhhhh.also restaurant was good.

title: I think this will be my NYC hotel from now on
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: A little gem in Greenwich!
review: I can't say enough about the location of the hotel. Right near Washington Square Park, great restaurants/bars & shopping. What more could you ask for? It has a neighborhood feel instead of a touristy feel which I enjoy.   Otto (one of Mario Batali's restaurants) is right around the corner. It's not only delicious but very reasonably priced.  Bars like the Four Faced Liar & Slaughtered Lamb on 6th & Fat Black P****cat on 3rd are all great neighborhood bars.   Shopping is only a handful of blocks away on Broadway!  The hotel is clean with decent size rooms & bathrooms. I have nothing negative to say about this hotel. I loved it and will definitely return.

title: Dont want to go back
review: Stayed here for 4 nights after being recommended by a friend. Great location, mins to the subway and easy to get from Newark Int. Airport via Air Train and NJ Transit. We were told that rooms were small so went for Executive double. Worth the money and included continental breakfast. Food was excellent (especially the rack of lamb at dinner in their own restaurant) but lots of other restaurants close by if you want to get out and explore locally. Would recommend a vegetarian restaurant called GOBO on 6th Avenue - minutes from the hotel. Wonderful food and menu items out of the ordinary for sure! No complaints about the hotel at all, very clean and comfortable and quiet at night. Very helpful staff in all areas. Will return for sure.

title: Perfect Greenwich location, friendly people, can't wait to return
review: We booked the hotel for a july stay for my daughter's NYU orientation.  The location is wonderful. next to Washington square park: wonderful to be in the Village. I thoroughly enjoyed walking all over lower manhattan. FOr me though  The only thing the hotel has going for it is the location: The rooms are TINY even by New York standards.  The decor is old, drab and tired. No room service, though in New York that isnt a problem.  Free Wifi. The hallway from the elevator to our room was so narrow that you had to walk single file: 2 people couldn't fit;  seems like a fire hazard to me.  Kind of a depressing place inside after you leave the lobby.  The staff were friendly, and responded to requests in a reasonable time.  The toilet water didnt fill properly and it kept happening…

title: Favorite place to stay in NYC
review: During a six night stay in the first week of September we found the WS Hotel to be the best possible base from which to explore New York. The hotel offers a very good price/quality balance in expensive New York. The king room we stayed in on the 8th floor was large enough by NY standards and had a nice view. Good bathroom, good bed, good housekeeping. Excellent table service at breakfast giving us a good start to the day. Located on a corner of Washington Park, a haven of friendliness and impromptu live music by people hooking up, playing guitars and singing. The subway is a two minute walk away, hooking you up with the A,B,C,D,E,F lines, 4 stops to Times Square in the North, and 4 stops to WTC in the South. In Greenwich Village and nearby Soho, you can spend a week and never be…

title: Clean hotel with art deco style
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Wonderful as expected
review: I booked this for 5 nights because I was looking for a reasonably-priced hotel in the village area that hadn't had any reports about bed bugs. Previously we've chosen to stay in midtown hotels but were looking for something a bit more relaxed and I was so glad that I found this hotel.   Washington Square itself is a lovely park/public area with dog-walkers, guys playing chess, joggers, birds, squirrels, pushchairs, low key musicians. Walking through it was a very pleasant way to begin and end the day.  Hotel staff were friendly and helpful throughout. Decor was generally very good and had a bit of quirky character in the hallways. Our room was small (but I've stayed in smaller), and the view from our window was uninspiring (but I was prepared for that after deciding to book…

title: Good, Central and Safe
review: I have always wanted to stay at the WSH but never could get a reservation (sold out).  Finally after our trip to New Orleans was cancelled due to Tropical Storm Lee we decided to spend our anniversary in NYC just like past years (at the last minute).  The WSH did not disappoint.  It was everything and more I thought it would be. Clean, spacious, umbrella, bathrobes and a safe, etc. in your closet.  Staff was extremely friendly, got a free upgrade by mentioning I was a friend on Facebook and the coffee/muffins in the morning sure did the trick.  Special shout out to Ron the doorman, he is an extremely friendly and wonderful man.   This is the perfect location for us and the price was more PERFECT!   P.S. I'm not including pics because they are the same wonderful shots others have…

title: Always our first choice in Manhattan
review: Was first trip to NYC, so relied on Trip Advisor reviews to pick hotel.  Was happy with the hotel overall.  Shocked at how small the hotel rooms were - but that has more to do with living in the Middle East where the hotel rooms are always very expansive.    Bathroom and room were clean and the location of this place is perfect.  My only complaint was that the airconditioner rattled all night long, and when I was there it was quite warm!  The air conditioner would just turn off randomly  as well.

title: Great hotel! Fabulous location!
review: We flew in five hours early to beat Hurricane Irene and start a week long stay in New York.  We were able to check in at 7:45 in the morning - a blessing after getting up at 3 a.m.  The queen room was spacious and clean and even had a view of the park.  Everybody on staff is friendly and helpful.  And you can not beat the location - near the Village, the park, the subway.  This is a great little hotel - we plan our trips to New York based on whether or not we can get a reservation at this property.

title: WSH great value and location.
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Fun had by all!
review: Stayed for 5 days in August 2011. Room was good, I hear they can be hit n miss. But the location, value and service were faultless, would stay again.

title: Friendly hotel in an excellent location
review: Two of my college girlfriends and I stayed here August 5-7.  The hotel has king, two doubles or two twin rooms.  I will say the rooms are your standard NYC room, meaning on the smaller size and definitely not your big chain hotel size room.  We had a King room and a room with tow doubles.  The king had much more room than the queen, even room for a pack and play if you needed to place one in the room.  The king room als had a "makeup" table with a lit mirror in front of it.  The double room had something similar.  Our double had two closets one for hanging clothes and the other had the safe and shelves.  I will say that the shower in our double was too powerful.  It was good for washing my thick hair, but not for sensitive skin areas.  There was always plenty of hot water and…

title: Quiet location, super friendly staff !
review: Having never been to NYC before, I was unsure where to stay. I wanted to be able to get around the city easily but be based in a quieter area. This hotel gives that. The local area is great; plenty of good restaurants and coffee shops, easy walking distance to many interesting places in the Village, and very close to metro stations which give access to a number of different lines. The room was small, but very comfortable and the bathroom had a tub and shower which is unusual in a hotel of this size. Breakfast was included which was great, although if you're looking for the archetypal American breakfast cross Sixth Avenue to the Waverley Diner. There is a Starbucks at the end of the block; perfect for buying a coffee in the morning before sitting in Washington Square Park. The…

title: Great Hotel well located
review: We originally chose this hotel because it was in a quiet  area..off 6th Ave and next to Washuington Sq.(green area)...and it was close to where our daughter lives. This was our second stay this year.( they offer a discount for prepayment) The rooms are exceptionally clean and well furnished and the beds comfortable. However, the staff is what makes this hotel shine! Up at 4am to catch a flight, at the hotel by 9 and they offered welcomed us with an extra continental breakfast and immediate check-in. Ronnie, the doorman, has an infectious smile and greeting to go with it...and is quick to offer suggestions on sites, walks etc. For a small hotel that welcomes you like family it can't be beat !

title: Fab little hotel in a fab location!
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: decent hotel, great neighborhoud
review: We stayed here for 5 nights in June and we loved it. Having not visited NY before I was quite shocked initially when I saw the prices of hotels so I decided to do my research. After searching through numerous hotels and locations (and of course reading many reviews on TA!) I opted for the Washington Square and we were not disappointed. I booked it through the hotel's website as it was alot cheaper than going through other web sites.  The location is great, loads of bars, restaurants & shops. It is well located to get to mid town and downtown, we walked everywhere but there are subway stops nearby. There is a great restaurant close to the hotel called Cafe Asean, the food is fantastic and very reasonably priced.  The breakfast is good, we had continental included and you can then…

title: Lovely location but...
review: Clean and decent room, a bit small but I understand this is normal for NY. Breakfast is ok, not luxerious The neighborhoud is really great, lots of restaurants, close to the subway and an easy walk to downtown Manhattan

title: Great location away from all the tourist hotels uptown
review: The location is ideal, just across from the square and near shops and restaurants. The rooms are what you expect in NYC -- small but with everything you need. The only negative experience happened when we had the front desk make reservations for us at the hotel restaurant.... After walking down the block to get to the restaurant (we had to use the outside entrance because of needing a handicapped entrance) the restaurant had no record of our reservation and were unable to serve us. In all it's a nice place but totally unsuitable for anyone traveling with physical challenges. No wheelchair entrances, many stairs, poor access. That's not unusual for boutique hotels but you'd think in today's world these things would get more attention,

title: Great Value...will be back!
review: We stayed here in December and had a great break. The location of the hotel is second to none. It is just by the square and very close to the great bars and eateries of Greenwich village. It is far enough away from the tourist traps uptown but close enough to explore Manhattan by foot. The room we had was at the back, it wasn't the biggest of rooms but was clean and very warm. The bathroom was nice as was the shower and the bed was very comfortable. The hotel bar was great and relaxing. The breakfast was basic but good. We would stay here again if and when we return to New York.

title: Great Location, but Disappointing Hotel
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Loved the location,the hotel and the staff
review: The location CANNOT be beat, right in the heart of Washington Square. However, this hotel leaves much to be desired. I got there and there was NO shower curtain, just an annoyance when you are traveling for work to have to call about this. Also, the A/C is a window unit and really doesn't work. I am not someone who even uses A/C that often, but when it is 95 in NYC, you need it. Further, it was clear this used to be a smoking room and still smells heavily of stale smoke.  It might be OK in the winter, but will not be staying here again. I was sad, since it is close to my NY office and I really wanted this place to rock!

title: great place, I will be back!
review: We arrived very late, but we had a great welcome from the staff on the reception desk.  The location was everything we wanted, we could walk to many places and we walked a lot!!!  The hotel is also also close to 2 subway stations and we used them a lot too. Our room was clean and comfortable.  We enjoyed our breakfast every day.  The dining room sometimes got crowded, but the hotel staff usually manage this well.  We had a great time and will be back!!!

title: Fab hotel in Manhattan
review: Great area to live at, next to NY University campus and Washington Square. nice staff free wifi. I got a big room, nice view, big bathroom. Very comfortable bed. Clean.  The breakfast was not very good, I stayed here for a bit more than a week and skipped breakfast all days except for 2....

title: Comfortable, charming, and congenial hotel
review: We arrived at the front desk at 11am which was still some hours before the 1500 check in time but the woman at the front desk was kind enough to give us our room. The room was on the second floor and although this meant no skyline view, it was still a nice room - and big, and clean.  Continental breakfast in the small but charming cafe s no-fill, no-fuss which is how we wanted it. Just across the road is the lovely Washington Square Park which is lovely in a hot summer day. And its proximity to 5th Avenue allowed us to walk to Empire State Building and all the nice, quirky places in between.  Shame we were only staying overnight but would definitely come back to this hotel next time we are in New York.

title: Great location and to see locals in their habitat!
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Perfect hotel for our many visits to Manhatten
review: Location provided quiet evening, options for entertainment, eating and people watching!  European in environment, i.e., appeared to have a number of foreign travelers.  Rooms are small by chain-type hotels but charming.  Everything worked in the work.  They had just made available new instant coffee machines...from expresso to regular!  Would stay here again on next visit to NYC...nice to visit Times Square but great to stay in the Village.

title: Great hotel at a very central location
review: My friend and I love staying at the Washington Square Hotel.  We love being in this part of Manhatten and across the street from the park, within walking distance of great restaurants and shopping.  The rooms are small but considering the amenities, most of all the cost, who cares.  The staff is always helpful, the look of the place cheers me.  It makes for a terrific New York experience.

title: Perfect location, nice hotel
review: The Washington Square Hotel is a wonderful hotel to stay in if you want to visit all the main attractions of Manhattan. I stayed here with my mother and sister. We had a very large room that was comfortable and had a view at the Washington Square. This is rare for a hotel in Manhattan, even more so considering the very reasonable price we paid for the stay.  The hotel is situated in a quiet street, so absolutely no noise at night, we enjoyed some quality sleeping time! The people at the lobby are helpful, and there is a great bellboy who knows his way around the village.  Skip the breakfast, just head into the streets next to the hotel for some great places to eat. Would definitely stay here again without a doubt.

title: Good location but hotel needs TLC
review: This will be my go-to place in NYC in the future - okay, rooms were small, view was of the wall, but that's to be expected - and who goes there to hang out in the room, anyway? One obnoxiously noisy pair of guests, but that was not the hotel's fault.

title: Adorable hotel in fabulous location
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Easy location, clean Manhattan room. May return next trip.
review: The Washington Square Hotel is a great little hotel right on Washington Square in Greenwich Village.  It has a wonderful bar and delicious food at its restaurant.  The staff are all friendly and you are within walking distance of some of NYC's most fun neighborhoods.

title: great hotel - fantastic location
review: Pro's: simple to find by car, subway, foot or cab; super helpful bellstaff, clean rooms (they use cotton blankets that were freshly laundered, so we did not need to immediately throw off a filthy bedcover), comfy bed in a decent sized room, locker for laptop while they held our bags, continental b-fast, easy walk into west village & other neighborhoods.  Con's: standard Manhattan list; tight hallways & elevator; pay to park in a nearby garage.

title: Fabulous location
review: we stayed five nights at the WSH and found it to be everything it promised. the rooms were clean and comfortable, they were not huge but then having read other reviews whinging about them we were very happy with the size. the room we had faced the street but it was not noisy, we slept with the window open most nights. the staff, particularly ronnie on the front door were very helpfull. the location is superb, you can walk to soho, chelsea, west village and there is a subway around the corner, restaurants and bars are everywhere. would definately recommend.

title: A decent place
review: Communal areas are stunning with many original features, location is fabulous, but rest of hotel is in dire need of a refurb! Room safe never worked for our entire stay of 5 nights despite telling reception on several occasions. The window blinds are all frayed and very tatty, the window curtains are for show only so do not close!! The carpet was very shabby. Such a shame as this hotel could be absolutely fabulous - it just needs a little TLC

title: Unbelievable - and disappointing
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Excellent Stay
review: Having stayed at the Washington square Hotel, we could not believe it when they put us in room 125 on the ground floor right next to the reception and in the corridor that lead to the breakfast room and restaurant. the noise was unbearable on the stone floor, all the people coming in throughout the night 3am, 4am, 5am and then the porter who came on around 6am, turned on his radio - which was the last straw.  The Washington Square hotel should not use rooms 125 and 124 unless they put a door between reception and these rooms and carpet on the floor.  Also the rooms are tiny, but with a big price tag.... the bathroom was a joke, I could sit on the toilet wash my feet in the bath and wash my hands in the sink!  what a disgrace, we will not be staying here again.

title: Great Hotel & Great Location!!
review: We only stayed here one night, I wish we had stayed longer.  Great staff, cozy, clean rooms, and fantastic location right next to Washington Square park.  If I get the opportunity to go back to New York I will definately stay in this hotel again.

title: Management made good on booking mix up
review: I love this hotel and always recommend it -  location and price is always good each time I have stayed, plus great celebrity spots at breakfast!!

title: Good place to listen to steam pipes .
review: I had booked four nights at this property as I have stayed here before and had a very good experience.  I called the day of my arrival and the receptionist said they did not have me due until the next day and they were fully booked for that evening.  Despite my e-mail confirmation stating my arrival date, the receptionist could do nothing. I asked to speak with the manager and she very kindly offered to book me at a near by hotel, which I gladly accepted.  The next day I checked into the WSH and the manager comped me full breakfast for my remaining days.   This is excellent service and I will return to this hotel in the future.

title: Lovely friendly hotel ,excellent  location
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Helpful staff and good value
review: We really liked this hotel - we did  our research on Tripadvisor . We arrived to a warm welcome - room was not ready but our luggage was whisked away . After a look around we were delighted with the location and when we arrived back, our room was ready. We were disappointed that our room was right next to the lift and were going  ask to be moved -but it proved not be a problem at all. The break fast was good & free ! It was extremely cold in New York during our trip and we found The Washington Square so cozy with lovely helpful staff!

title: liberal use of mirrors can only hide so much: think small
review: The hotel is art deco charming. Ronnie at the front door serves as security, doorman and concierge.  He gave us helpful dining and activitiy suggestions and really understood our needs.  The front desk staff was helpful as well.   Our rooms were quiet for sleeping at our request. We did not face the street.   The hotel was kept very clean.
