The staff were nice, although there was a bit of confusion when we booked and they nearly canceled  our booking due to the fact we hadnt paid in full, even though we werent told to pay in full when we first called to book. All in all a nice stay in a fantastic city.

title: Great for NYU
review: This hotel is a beautiful little gem in the Greenwich Village area of NYC.  Greenwich Village is fabulous and within walking distance to everything.  I stayed here for 5 nights for a conference and was within 8-10 blocks to my destination on Broadway St. between 12th and 13th St.   My initial room (#407) was in the back with a view of a construction site.  I changed to room # 617 with a gorgeous view of Waverly St.  The rooms are on the smaller side, but have everything you need.  The bathrooms are very clean, the beds are very soft and comfortable, and if you upgrade like I did, you can have web access in your room.  The staff is usually very nice and there is free breakfast in the restaurant where you can actually sit down and enjoy coffee.  You can order off the menu for…

title: One of our favorites in NY
review: There are other interesting hotels in Greenwish Village, but if you have to be at NYU, this is the best bet.  The hotel is funky, but rhe room very clean, bed comfortable and, like most NYC rooms, tiny.  As another reviewer said, they are doing major work on an adjacent building - not the hotel's fault, but it was very noisy during the day.   If you are coming for an NYU related event, make reservations WAAAAY in advance (3, 4 or even 6 months), as they book up quickly for those periods.

title: Perfect Village Location
review: We've stayed here for a week every June for several years, due to some work we do near NYU.  It's a favorite of ours because of the small, intimate ambiance, the proximity to the park, smaller crowds than mid-town, and excellent service.  If you can get rates that are reasonable by booking way ahead, it's a great value.  On the downside, the rooms are NYC-small.  Also, during our recent visit, the building behind the hotel was being renovated and there was a lot of construction noise at times.  This looks like it could be going on for awhile.  This is not the Washington Square Hotel's fault, but could be a concern if you plan on spending a lot of time in the room and are located in the back.  If you stay here, be sure to walk around the block alongside the restaurant and check…

title: fantastic
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Neat place to stay!
review: We staid 9 nights in a deluxe renovated room, on the 8th level. everything was perfect. you join any undergrount line from 100 to 500m from the door. the front desk is so helpfull, all the staff is sympathetic. the breakfast, included, is simple but excellent. you can order extras for your breakfast. the restaurant and lounge bar serve excellent food also.

title: I checked out the next day
review: What a neat place to stay. Yes, the room and bathroom are small but it IS Manhattan! The hotel had an Art Deco/old movie star theme. The room had new furnishings, new carpet, fresh paint. The linens were fresh and new. The beds comfy. The bathroom was small but very clean. There were not bugs, street noise, etc. that others may have seen/heard.  The included continental breakfast was great! We had juice, coffee, a bowl of fruit each, and a basket of bagels, muffins, and scones that were delivered to our table. We could have had yogurt and cereal as well. It was definitely a nice touch. Although we didn't eat there, Babbo is right across the street.  A very nice hotel. The front desk was helpful too.

title: Great area, comfortable hotel, pity about the noise
review: The Washing Square - Greenwich Village.  I booked 5 nights in the Washington Square Hotel. Never again.  I had found a new hotel within 1 hour.  We stayed the night only  Hostel came to mind. I hated it - we paid 250 dollars a night - rip off.  I vaule this hotel as a 90 dollar a night at the most.  The rooms were not bad, clean.  But the hall ways and reception left room for massive improvement. The staff didn't fill me with confidence.  Breakfast - there was a big queue waiting for the next people to sit down.  We wouldn't queue I'd rather pay and get seated right away so I can't comment on that.  We booked in the Crabtree Metropolitain on Lexinton and got 1st class accomodation ( king room) for 9 dollars more. If you want a bigger room ask for the King. It was 15 mintuers…

title: Nice hotel in great area
review: We enjoyed the situation of this hotel which is near Greenwich Village and away from the main tourist drag.  Our de luxe room was fine with two excellent double beds, plenty of storage space and a decent bathroom with good shower.  Breakfast was not exciting but good enough with fruit salad, and a bread basket with bagels and muffins.  Cereal was also provided on request.  Fresh orange juice and coffee were very good.  On our first evening we dined in the hotel restaurant which was excellent and very convenient after a long flight (we booked a table on arrival - the restaurant is usually busy).  There are lots of good restaurants within 10-15 minutes walk of the hotel - it's a good idea to book, especially at the weekend.  The real downside for us was the problem of noise…

title: Great stay
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Excellent little hotel
review: We stayed at the WSH for 5 nights in early April. The staff were friendly, the room big with a good sized bathroom. It's an excellent base for getting all over Manhatten and over to Brooklyn (close to the A, C and E subway on West 4th). I would certainly recommend it. But make sure you pay the extra and get a Deluxe room rather than a Superior, it's certainly worth the extra.

title: Very disappointing
review: Just got back from a weeks stay. Hotel was comfortable and staff very helpful. Food in the bar  was great and the service second to none. Good location with subway and restaurants very close. Would stay there again.

title: what a bug ridden,anti smoking rip off joint!
review: We had planned to stay for 5 days but left after 2.  The hotel is nicely affordable, but I guess you get what you pay for.  Room was small and dank, facing a wall.  There was insanely loud construction going on starting at 8 in the morning right outside our room -- did not make for a pleasant vacation experience.  We found the staff to be unhelpful; for instance when we arrived no one helped us with our bags, when we discussed changing rooms we were met with indifference.  This is one of the few hotels in the Village area, which is why we picked it.  But overall quite a disappointment.

title: Highly recommandable
review: The Washington Square hotel is an overpriced DIVE.  They banned smoking in this hotel, yet the rooms are FILTHY, and the room I had had BUGS in it -- and even with the bugs and filth, they expect people to go out in the cold to smoke?!  Ha!!!  All the rooms I saw were the size of closets.  So for a TINY, BUG INFESTED room where you are not free to smoke a cigarette, you get the honor of paying over $300.00 per night.  It is a FLEA BAG HOTEL...LITERALLY.  Don't stay there.  (By the way, we did smoke cigarettes in their non-smoking room, in their non-smoking hotel, regardless of their new rule, which was put into place just when I made my reservation, but they didn't bother to tell me until I arrived to check in! We were too tired and cold to look for another hotel, so we checked…

title: Value for money in Greenwich Village at the WSH
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Great Location. Quirky Decor. Great Value. Lovely Breakfast
review: I always, but always, when in NYC stay at the WSH. Its strengths are its location (good for NYU and transportation), its relative cheapness (for NYC), its small scale and mainly helpful staff. The drawback is the size of the rooms. The restaurant is ok for breakfast  (included is the basic but extras cost) but pricey for lunch and dinners. The jazz brunch is fun. Overall, it is recommended.

title: lovey hotel in a fab area
review: Loved this hotel with its friendly staff, quirky decor and adequate sized rooms (inc. large bathroom with separate toilet).  We overlooked the service area and there were rooms opposite which wasn't great but we were hardly ever in the room (jet lag was getting us up at 5am) so it didn't matter.  Breakfast was generous and fresh - great start to the day.  Great location among the student bars, comedy clubs and restaurants and halfway between the north and south tourist attractions so easy to walk everywhere from the Hotel.

title: Perfect place to stay
review: Stayed at the hotel for 4 nioghts, were inroom 809 and could see the empire state building from the room which was fantastic. Breakfasts were lovely, fresh fruit, yogurt, juice. Only draw back, was no tea of coffee facilities in the room ,las as we were wking very early  around 4 am to 6am would have loves a cuppa, instead it was a quick change and down to starbucks at the end of the block for a take out. Otherwise no fault as the subway wasa a block away and it was a 10 min walk to greenwich. Would ue=se the hotel again

title: Great value for money + great location
review: Just back from a week's stay with a girlfriend - what a gem of a place, fantastic location, very clean room, friendly helpful staff, agree with all the comments made by other reviewers.  Great to just walk downstairs for breakfast (ample for us, loved starting the day with healthy fruit and yogurt, orange juice, bagels, and all included in the price). Never had to queue or wait for service. We had a delux room on 2nd floor with partial view of the Square. My only criticism is that the room decor is rather drab, though had just be renovated (don't think much of their interior designer, if they had one...dull browns and beige - more colour please, but that's just my personal taste)  Lovely fluffy bathrobes and lots of towels and toileries. Tip - if you can use the stairs that lead…

title: Trying to put a good face on it
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Great Place to stay in new york!
review: I stayed at the Washington Square Hotel on Feb. 12, 2008.  I chose it for its proximity to NYU law school (block and a half away).  I paid $220 + taxes, which included breakfast.  The hotel did the best it could in an old building.  My room was small, just big enough for a double bed with 3-4' of space on three sides.  The bathroom was small enough that when I put the bathmat on the floor, it was like wall-to-wall carpeting.  But the room and bathroom were both very clean, and I heard no street noise.  (I was in room 329, and the window faced a courtyard or alley, I couldn't tell which.)  I heard the shower in the room above me once, but otherwise did not hear any noise from nearby rooms.  The room was very thoughtfully outfitted.  The bed was comfortable and clean, there was…

title: Great hotel
review: We stayed at this hotel over new years for 6 nights and it was exactly what you needed to have a great trip to new york!  Fisrtly our flight was delayed on the way over and we got stuck in Fiji and had to cancel our first night with only 24hrs notice with which they were very accomodating and didnt charge us for which was appreciated.The people at the front desk were lovely, very helpfull and freindly!  Breakfast included in the room was good and aparently not very common for new york, so if you want to start your day without trekking around looking for somewhere to eat its great! Thr rooms werent anything fancy but we hardly spent ANY time in them and when we did the room wasa clean, bed comfy, tv had a million stations and the bathroom was a decent size too - i would reccomend…

title: Great Hotel, great location!!
review: Great little hotel in Greenwich Village.  Reasonably priced (for New York), good location, very good breakfast included in the room fee.  Only complaint was getting a room next to the lift but at least that wasn't working between midnight and 7am.

title: Great location, mixed stay...
review: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights over New Years 2007-08 and had a great stay.  I was in one of the room son the third floor which has been refurbished and feel a good job has been done on the refurb.  The room actually felt quite spacious, with a large bed and smaller separate bathroom.  The room looked exactly like the hotel photos that you can see.  The location is fantastic - Washington Square across the road, an entrance to the W4th St subway station at the other end of the block and only a couple of blocks to walk to Bleeker Street.  The staff were very helpful both in just checking in and out as well as with any questions that I had.  The included breakfast at the restaurant was a great way to get the day started, with usually juice/coffee, a bowl of fruit salad and a…

title: Well Priced, Great location, No Troubles!
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Pros and Cons. Charming but .......
review: This hotel was in a word fantastic and made our holiday.  From the moment of arrival we where welcomed by a cheery chap who opened the door and gave us a happy holidays shout!  The room was not huge by any means but it was clean tidy and compact. It wasn't too small though dont think that... It depends I guess on what you are looking for. I loved the touch of having bath robes for each of us and an umbarella for our use during our stay.   We arrived also to find that brekfast was included with our room rate... which was a welcome surprise as when we booked with expedia we understood it was not. The breakfasts where of a continental style served by proffessional team of hispanic waitors all dressed in black. They just hit the spot with me and I have no complaints. They also…

title: Great small hotel
review: I stayed at the Washington Square Hotel two weeks before Christmas when hotel prices are at their highest in N.Y. My niece recommended this hotel for its relatively reasonable rates (remember this is NY), great location and really charming atmosphere. I'm in the city a lot and I don't like large, impersonal hotels. This boutique hotel was perfect. However:  Cons:   Street noise was bad and we were on the top floor. The room air conditioner could not be turned on (this was December) and the only way to cool the over-heated room was to open the windows. (This is typical of city apts. but not hotels.) The recycling truck crashed below at 2 a.m. but I took a sleeping pill and slept well the rest of the night. There's always an answer!  The pillows are like bricks (a previous…

title: Very cozy hotel!
review: Booked the hotel through Trailfinders as it is one of their recommended hotels. Although you see the rooms quoted as being small, ours was plenty big enough (although we did book a deluxe room). Lovely bathroom with 'condiments' amply provided. We were expecting a mediocre breakfast as it was included, but were pleasantly surprised. We had an evening meal in the North Square restaurant which was delicious. Not too far to walk to a choice of metro stations - and an easy walk to the shopping area of Greenwich Village. The Olive Tree is a short walk and also a nice place to eat and while-away an evening. We'd book again.

title: Great Hotel, great location
review: We just returned from a stay at the Washington Square Hotel and had a wonderful experience.  Because we were a family of four on a budget we were able to book a renovated quad room which provided ample space and a very nice, clean bathroom.  The staff including the breakfast crew were always smiling and very helpful and made us feel welcome in a big, busy city.  Highly recommended!

title: Excellent
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Excellent
review: I just come back from NY were I stayed at the WSH and it was great : the staff very nice and usufull, the hotel is confortable and very well located with a lot restaurants and jazz bars at walk distance, I'll definitly stay there again  next time I'll be in NY

title: Great Hotel
review: We stayed on 5th floor for 5 nights in November 07.Our room was compact but big enough for our needs.Room was clean & comfy, furnished to high standard & had 2 windows.bathroom clean with a great powerful hot shower.Staff were polite & helpful especially Doorman who greeted us daily like old friends.Location is superb with subway station & counless restaurants/bars & shops on the doorstep.We walked most places including ground zero & empire state which although quite long walks there was intersting stuff & shops etc on route.Hotel arranged car to JKK which was much better than cab & only$5 more.Will definately stay here next time in NY.Recommended to friends & family.

title: Wonderful stay
review: This hotel was a real gem in New York City. I had read in earlier reviews that the rooms were small but found them to be comfortable and perfectly adequate (after all who wants to spend much time in their room in New York City!)  The staff were friendly and helpful and the hotel was situated in a quiet area in Greenwich Village directly across from Washington Square Park, a hangout for the many students around the area.  The subway and a drug store were just around the corner (provisions of water etc. and transport links) and there were always plenty of cabs passing by.  Complimentary breakfast was included in the room price but extra items e.g. omelette, pancakes etc. could be ordered for a few dollars extra. Restaurant was very popular with the locals (which is always a good…

title: A great find in the Village!
review: Hotel is in lovely, quiet area yet only one block from major subway station. You are also near 24 hour drugstore, coffee, restaurants and bus lines. Cabs run down street often. Our room was fairly large, by NY standards, and comfortable. It was a little dark, no view, but that's OK if it's quiet. Our main complaint is tiny one --  the (free) breakfast area was so tight that you felt overwhelmed if a loud,annoying person happened to be braying at the next table. We plan to come back to NY and stay here again, no question.

title: Great location, try to stay on upper floors....
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Excellent Establishment in Greenwich Village
review: What a great location, stayed off Times Sq last time in New York and Greenwich is so much better.   Staff were friendly (with the exception of the Breakfast staff) and we had no problems changing the room after a disastrous first night. We stayed for 4 nights. The first night we stayed in Rm 209 which I would avoid unless you intend being awake by 6am due to the laundry noise from downstairs and the building site next door. We were moved to the top floor for the next three nights and it was plain sailing from there.   Rooms are small but clean, but when in NYC you shouldn't be in any hotel room for longer than it takes to get a good nights sleep.   Less then a block from the Subway and within 2 minutes walk of some great bars and restaurants. Try Galanga for the best Thai food…

title: A little find
review: Myself my husband and our two children aged 17 and 11 stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in Oct 07. I had read reviews which said the rooms were very small, one person even said the rooms and the corridors bordered on being dirty. I have to say whilst yes the room was small the hotel was anything but dirty. I stayed in the Sheraton Manhattan two years ago which was twice the price and was plain grotty.   The room was small but adaquete with two queen beds - if you were tidy and hung up your clothes and packed away your shopping each night size was not an issue. The room was on the 8th floor and was very bright and comfortable. It was unseasonably warm when we were there and the a/c was very quiet and effective. I have read on other reviews about noisy a/c'S in the hotel but this…

title: Great hotel, great location
review: Walsall, West Mids-11th October 2007.  We stayed here for 5 nights, our first time in NYC, we would really recommend this hotel for lots of reasons:-  Located in Greenwich Village giving easy access to downtown & midtown Manhattan. Staff are very helpful, willing to book excursions and cars. Doormen very ammenable, giving advice on the local area and hailing cabs.Our room was  not ready on arrival but we were immediately offered complimentary cocktails in the bar to pass the time.  Hotel is not huge but has been re-furbished, complimentary breakfast is a good start to the day, we ate in the hotel several times and food was a very good standard at  a reasonable cost. Our room  was compact and although kitted out with all the 'little extras', bath robes, shower gels etc, was…

title: Great staff, nice hotel and the best location
review: Manhattan is a very expensive place to stay so relatively speaking, the Washington Square hotel is a 'bargain' - even though 4 nights there cost over £500!  The location can't be beaten - right opposite Washington Square which is a great, safe place to hang out at weekends listening to the buskers.  There's also a subway station literally two minutes away and a 24 hour drug store.  The staff are really friendly and helpful and the door staff can give you great tips for places to eat.  The free breakfast of a toasted bagel and fresh fruit is also great for those days when you've had your fill of American sized breakfasts!  The rooms are small by American standards but we had no complaints - who goes to New York to stay in their hotel room anyway? I will definitely be staying here…

title: Great Hotel, Great Location
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Clean, quiet, friendly...and a great location
review: We booked this hotel mostly because of the location and we were a little nervous because of certain reviews on this site.  We did take the advice in other reviews and booked a Delux room.  We were not at all disapointed.  The staff were very friendly, always greeting us and offering help and assistance whenever we needed it.  The rooms we did not consider small, they were spotless and modern.  Complimentary smellies, good quality towels and lovely robes.  The complimentary breakfast (given that most hotels these days are room only) was excellent, fresh fruit salad, lovely muffin/bagel basket, endless fresh coffee and endless freshly squeezed orange juice.  And fortunately we never had to que on the stairs to get a table.  The location is what originally sold us on this hotel and…

title: Excellent Value for Money
review: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights (Aug. 20-23) with a friend, and we were both pleased with everything we received.  The room we got was a twin, as promised.  Although the room was small, it was spotlessly clean, and its location on the 8th floor provided peace & quiet.  The daily breakfast was adequate and was included in the price of the room.  The desk staff was helpful during check-in and check-out, and always had a friendly greeting whenever we passed by on our way in or out.  The best feature of this hotel is its location in Greenwich Village, overlooking Washington Square.  It places you smack dab in the middle of the cool areas of lower Manhattan (the East & West Villages, Chelsea, Soho and the Lower East Side), which are all within easy walking distance.  The 6th…

title: Pleasant enough hotel
review: We were expecting a small room and we got one.  However, it was very functional, had everything we wanted, including a hair dryer, TV, iron and ironing board.  The room was very clean, with good quality towels, changed daily and complimentary tolietries.  The hotel is in an excellent location with a subway station just 200 yards away and many good bars and restaurants nearby.   The front desk staff were friendly and helpful, despite what some other reports have stated.  One downside was the complimentary breakfast.  No matter what time we went for breakfast, we had to queue on the stairs while we waited for someone to come and show us to a table.  Then when we finally got a table, the service was slow and somewhat lacking.  The one day we decided to order something cooked, at an…

title: O.K. place to stay
review: I agree with OKCowgirl on most of the points. Further:  1) Ask for a room facing MacDougall St. I was on the 2nd floor in a deluxe room and heard absolutely nothing.   2) The bed and pillows in the deluxe room were great.   3) I thought the breakfast was fine. I was surprised to have a bowl of fresh fruit. The bagels and muffin were soft.   4) Turn right onto Waverly Place and there is a Duane Reade 24hr pharmacy. Note the subway station next door.

title: Get what you pay for
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Good Hotel in Greenwich Village
review: I` ve stayed before & like the location & price. This time the room was gloomy and the air con so loud. The breakfast staff were just awful. Not a smile or thank you between them all. We ate breakfast elsewhee after the second day. But it was booked for it`s location and because it was suppose to have Art Deco features (not fab) - you get what you pay for, however we wil  probably go elsewhere next time we visit NY.

title: A Plus from our whole group
review: I was attending a conference at NYU and stayed at the Washington Square Hotel.  Overall, it was not a bad stay and I would stay again in order to be close to NYU.    However, here are some observations to help you decide:  - Some of the bellmen were WONDERFUL in giving reccommendations, subway tips, etc! - Elevators, hallways and rooms were very small! - window A/C units - there is a "light switch" to turn it on! - Nice little bar and helpful bartenders - My room did not look over the street, so it was quiet.  Some colleagues had street facing rooms and they said it was really loud at night (garbage trucks, etc) - Shower curtain was hung too high and stuck to me in the shower - i ended up leaving it open because water got everywhere anyway! - Front desk will give you a nice map…

title: I highly recommend this hotel
review: We also have a glowing review for this hotel.  We had 4 women stay in one room.  Got the deluxe (over the superior) and had ample room for four sets of luggage plus all the shopping purchases.  We had a corner room, 221, that had a view of the square and windows on two sides.  Our bathroom was roomy and had two sinks.  The room had two double beds, a long table vanity, one sitting chair, chest of drawers, and a 3 nighttables, everyone had their own space.  The beds in the deluxe room were dreamy, soft top mattress with fluffy white comforters.  The a/c was one wall unit but monitored itself on and off and seemed to keep up fine in July weather.  Very convenient to subways and restaurants.  The staff was friendly, and helpful, from front desk to security and doormen.  It was nice…

title: Wonderful place to stay
review: What a great hotel for $235/night in such an expensive city. We arrived early, they stored our bags no problem and based upon recommendations here  we requested a deluxe room on an upper floor. Upon our return, we were given exactly that on that on the top floor. It was plenty spacious, super clean, had a nice bathroom, windows on either side of the room, one with a view of the park. The room had been recently renovated and looked just like the picture on their website. We were right next to the elevator but never heard it. The AC, a window unit, was new, worked fine and wasn’t particularly noisy. We didn’t visit the bar, but did enjoy the nice complimentary continental breakfast of fresh fruit, juice, coffee, muffins and bagels (yes, no cream cheese) in the pleasant restaurant.…

title: Pleasant Surprise
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: location
review: My wife and I have just returned from a long weekend trip in NYC and the Washington Square Hotel was a wonderful experience. From the staff to the room and to the friendly and always helpful lobby security I would not hesitate to stay here in the future. After reading several negative reviews we was frankly a bit skeptical, but after arriving our doubts were set at ease. The rooms are plenty big enough...the most pleasanr surprise afeter reading how small the rooms were. We have stayed at a boutigue hotel in London UK in the past and the rooms there were much smaler than the WSH. Being in the village and close to NYU, Little Italy, Chinatown, and the subway stations at either W 4th St or Union Square is also a plus. You can also walk 2 blocks west on W 4th st to Joe's Coffee…

title: overall great experience
review: The main reason to stay at this hotel is the location.  If you are interested in the West Village or the NYU campus, it is one of the only choices and actually a pretty good choice at that.  Makes you feel part of the true NY neighborhood of Washington Square Park.  With the small rooms and breakfast included, you are reminded of an older European hotel.  I have stayed there several times and will go back.

title: Nice breakfast and good location, but poor rooms and rude staff
review: To anyone who has never stayed in New York city please be advised hotel Rooms are small unless you are staying in a 5 star paying the big bucks!! However if you are looking for clean and good value for your money than the Washington Square hotel maybe for you. This hotel is not in the tourist area ie: Times Square , Broadway. You would not find a hotel in that area as nice for the price. This hotel is in a great location if you are interested in staying in Greenwich Village and would like to be near Soho , Little Italy, China town , Canal street and more. There are great patios where you will be sitting with locals where the food is good and much better priced. The subway is around the corner and there is always a cab.  We stayed for 3 nights and will not hesitate to go back. 1.…

title: Location, location, location
review: I will give WSH its due--the breakfast was great and the security man was excellent--friendly and attentive.  After that and the location, not much I can say to recommend this hotel.  I booked and confirmed (two days prior) a room with one queen-sized bed.  When I checked in and went to the room, it had two double beds.  I went back to the front desk and the clerk told me that they were queen beds, which obviously was not true.  Then they tried to appease me and told me that this room with two double beds was an "upgrade" that I should be happy.  I told them that since we were planning to only sleep in one bed, this was actually a downgrade for me.  In response to my concerns, another staff member literally said to me that there were "plenty of hotels in NY" and to go find…

title: Not for me
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Beyond expectation
review: The location is great, as is the pricing. After that, there's not much to recommend the property. The rooms were small, but I expected it would be so for the price. I was trying to view it as a edgy, village experience, but mostly it felt dingy and not clean (dirty would be overstating it).  The room color was drab, the window AC unit noisy and inefficient. The single elevator carried the trash and the guests. You get the idea. When I strategize how to get into and out of the shower without bare feet, it's not a place where I'll return.

title: great location, unwelcoming staff
review: Was recommended this hotel and used Tripadvisor to research it a bit more - all the positives (and only a minor one or two of the negatives) all held true. Room was very large by New York Hotel standards, comp breakfast was a surprise joy, and staff were a mix of 'couldn't be nicer' and usual New York/look after yourself, we just let is slide. Location is second to none. Bar served great cocktails (though it's a bit of a pokey bar, it's best to move further afield!)  Negatives? Okay the grumpy night staff and the teeny tiny closet, but that's all that's stopping me give it 10 out of 10.

title: Hated this hotel
review: You couldn't beat the location -- quiet street right in the Village. No other area we'd rather be in. As previously mentioned though, rooms were tiny. We stayed for a week (Christmas time) - first room we were given had no windows and no space to move around. Felt claustrophobic so we moved to a larger room with 2 windows. Much better...  Front desk people just had no interest in making us feel we were welcome. They would just chat with each other mostly.  Still we weren't there for the hotel and it was a great holiday watching jazz, eating great food, etc.

title: Stay here time and time again
review: We have one more day to stay at this hotel and we are counting the hours. It's not just that the room is tiny, we can't understand how they can expect twopeople to stay here for 3 nights in a room with three drawers only. There's a card chair to sit in but it's also being used currently to hang our jackets. The closet is small as well. The staff is perfuntory and rather inattentive with exception of a security man in lobby. He seems to double as a bell boy but a bell boy who only shows you where the elevator is and then you're on your own! i'd rather stay at a Motel 6. The front desk people seem inept. We booked a limo one evening for a Saturday. The next morning there was no record of this reservation. I asked for a sewing kit and was told by woman clerk to go to the drugstore.…

title: Great location, characterful hotel
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Wouldn't stay anywhere else
review: We stayed at the WSH in mid-February 2007 and really enjoyed our stay there. The location is brilliant - really near to loads of great cafes, restaurants and shops - and has much more character than the rather soulless hotels in midtown.   We booked a deluxe room which had obviously been fairly recently refurbished in an art deco style and which was a reasonable size. It also came with a view of the Park and of Babbo's across the road! My only niggle with the room was that the radiator was tiny and it was a little cold. We did manage however to obtain extra blankets.  The bar staff were very sweet - we hadn't tried bourbon before so the barman let us try a sample of the most popular for free and suggested that we might like also to try a Manhattan. Other staff were friendly…

title: Cozy hotel, great location
review: New York is expensive, so you really need to save cash where you can. Yes, the rooms are tiny, but there is so much to do in the village, you're not in the room that much. This place is in an excellent location, so close to the subway that you would never have to take a pricey taxi. The staff was super friendly and helpful. I really wouldn't stay anywhere else. I even had my mother stay here once and she loved it too.

title: great Hotel.
review: We stayed at this hotel for three nights. I was attending a conference at NYU and my wife was doing art business. We travel to New York a lot. My wife is an artist and her gallery representation is in Chelsea, and her father, a New York City native, lives in midtown. We spend almost all of our time downtown and are constantly looking for good places to stay in the Village, SoHo, or Chelsea, and thought we would give this one a try, given my business at NYU.   I have to say that this was my favorite place to stay downtown so far, for the money (I think we ended paying about 250 a night--it would be more between Labor Day and New Year's, I imagine. But you can spend that much in NYC and end up in a dump, and as we all know, star ratings for NYC hotels mean nothing--you have to…

title: Great Village location, character and price!
review: I was recommended to stay at this hotel by one of my mates in London. This hotel is great, nice and cosy and very relaxed. The staff are all really friendly and really liked the Ambience. For the price and the location of this hotel you cannot beat it! Make sure you book a deluxe room as the others are not so cool. I have been back several times now and always stay at the Washington Square which I find is one of the best hotels I have stayed in for location and value for money. ANYONE FROM THE UK STAY HERE!

title: Fantastic Locatation, Great Interior...
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Location, Location, Location
review: Whilst this hotel is in a fantastic location and is generally a great place to stay, I did find some of the front desk staff rather sullen and unwelcoming. Only 2 of the 6 or so staff were actually friendly.  Make sure you book a deluxe room with a view otherwise you'll end up with a brick wall outside your window making the room very hot and the noise of the ac unit unbearable.  Other than that....highly recommended!

title: Clean, great location
review: I expected much more from this hotel. It is true that there is nothing around for a similar price and the location is fantastic if you wnat to stay in the village, but that´s it.  I paid 220 USD , plus taxes, for a room no bigger than a bathroom. To open the door I had to move the suitcases because there was not place for the suitcases. The wardrobe was about one square meter, or less.  The air conditioning unit was not fixed properly so the cool air came into the room.    The room was very noisy ( you can hear the street noises even in 9th floor ) and the pipes in the bathroom make funny noises all the time  Staff: very unfriendly. They never helped us with our questions or with our luggage. the last day they forgot to ring the limousine to get to the airport ( a service that…

title: Great location!
review: Half the price of other NYC hotels if you book ahead of time, right in the middle of cultural and interesting things to do and see, no frills hotel, impeccably clean, spotless bathroom and linen, safe, friendly enough as I don't aim to befriend the staff, 6$ cab ride from Javits, 7$ from madison area, same for trendy tribeka shopping, diners, shops, street vendors... and right across the street from washington square.  only complaint: horrible pillows.

title: Convenient location, good value
review: This hotel was in a fantastic location right in the middle of Greenwich Village... The staff was nice, the bar was cool, and the hotel was walking distance of great nightlife and restaurants.  You definitely are paying for location, the room was tiny (but clean) and non-descript...

title: Fab hotel - but don't drink here!
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Highly recommended
review: We stayed at the WSH for 5 nights in mid Feb.  The room was great - although there was something mad going on with the heating in the bathroom and the room was like 1000 degrees, even with the aircon on!! (slightly odd in the middle of a snow storm, but reception weren't bothered about wasting energy)  The location of this hotel is great - right in the village.  So much nicer down here than up in dull midtown.  Great restaurants and bars are on the doorstep - which is a very good thing, as we found that the bar staff in both the cafe on the first floor and downstairs bar were APPALLING!!  (Except one girl who ran the cafe on a Thursday evening - she was friendly and helpful!).  The staff NEVER smile and frequently ignore guests and walk away from them while taking their order. …

title: Great Little Hotel!
review: We've just returned from a 3-night stay at the Washington Square Hotel and really liked it. We had a deluxe room which was beautifully decorated, and I really appreciated the robes and the fact an umbrella had been provided in the room for us! The windows showed a fantastic view of WS itself, although I was a little disappointed the 'curtains' were just for show and didn't close (there are regular and blackout blinds as well). Breakfast is served until 11 am, which is perfect for us, and was fruit salad and bagels/muffins although there was no cream cheese, which I would have appreciated.  The area around the hotel is fantastic, really bohemian with loads to look at and fab bars and restaurants. Try Quantum Leap for cheap and healthy food if you're a veggie, Chumley's for great…

title: Location great; service appalling
review: This is a nice little hotel....great location, right on Washington Square, 2 blocks from the heart of West Village, same street as the most historic residential real estate left in Manhattan today, walking distance from Soho. Gorgeous foyer, staff is what you'd expect in most NYC hotels, efficient within their capabilities, rooms are modest and quite small, but adequate. Not adequate for a long stay with lots of shopping however! I've stayed there twice, once with company, and another time on my own, in a single bed room. That room was a little sparse i must say, but it suited my purpose at the time, and it was available. Nice little restaurant in the basement. If you sit over by the street window, you could have a direct view across to Washington Square Park and watch life go…

title: Gem in the village
review: Our maid was wonderfully welcoming, and most of the security guards were friendly enough; but the reception and wait staff made our experience at the WSH less than acceptable.  By the end of our 11 night stay, we felt that:  - every time we entered the lobby we were aliens and not paying guests (but for two security guards who greeted all visitors warmly, the security and reception personnel all stared and eyeballed);  - the reception staff were gruff;  - wait staff serving continental breakfast (included in room price) had their minds on anything but service, treating guests like cattle; and  - included breakfast is adequate, but unsatisfying and predictable after a couple of sittings.  The location is, however, outstanding; and the property seems well maintained.  Rooms are…

title: Great Hotel!!!
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: wonderful location, but pricey
review: I stayed for two nights at the end of January 2007 and found this property to be delightful. After reading through most of the reviews here, I followed one travellers advice and when I booked, I requested a Deluxe room several floors up in the Annex.  Also, I booked directly through to Hotel website.  I have been told that hotels will pay attention to how the reservation was booked and show preference to those who do NOT use a reservation service.   Upon checking in, I was guided to my room by a hotel employee and was delighted to find it clean and properly stocked with everything promised.  It did take me until the next day to figure out the nightlight in the bathroom, though.  The shower was sparkling clean and the water was easily adjusted - hot water plentiful.  The water…

title: Funky but not very functional
review: I stayed at Washington Square Hotel for 5 nights at the beginning of January, and I agree with most of the other reviews: the location is its main attraction, and I really recommend it if you want to be in a less touristic but much more interesting area as the Village, that's lively, beautiful and with a wonderful choice of restaurants, bars and music venues at walking distance. Also, the hotel it's close to the subway, so you can reach any part of NY very easily.  But the hotel itself costs a bit too much for what it offers. The decor and atmosphere are nice, and the staff is helpful, but go for the deluxe rooms, as I understand that they are bigger than the one we've been given, that was small even for NY standards, with an extremely tiny cupboard (no way to unpack your…

title: Very small room with a surprise
review: I stayed at the Washington Square Hotel in early December, 2006.  I liked the funky decor and didn't mind the "European"-style (i.e. amazingly tiny) room, and the location can't be beat if you want to explore the Village, MPD and downtown.  The price was not bad, either, and the room was very clean.  However, if you stay at this hotel I strongly advise that you request a room not facing MacDougal Street.  The rooms all have AC/heating units in the windows, rather than built into the walls, which means that it's impossible to close the windows against the street noise, which can be considerable on that busy street.  (Due in part to the fact that Mario Battali's popular Babbo restaurant is located about twenty yards away.)  I got basically no sleep on the night I was there, due to…

title: Good value for NYC
review: My first floor room had an air conditioner stuffed in the only window and was extremely small. The surprise, a family of COCKROACHES scurrying around. The management did give us a second floor room on night two but it was also very small. Smaller than most Manhattan rooms. The only reason that I did not rate this property as "terrible" is that the location is wonderfful. My recommendation is to see the room first, upgrade to a deluxe, and stay off the lower floor. However, I won't return.

title: Great Hotel!!!
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Deluxe Room Recommended
review: My boyfriend & I stayed at the WS hotel in early December & could not fault the hotel. The staff were friendly & helpful, the breakfast of fruit, bagels & tea/coffee was great & the internet access was very handy. You could either use the wireless internet in the lobby or use the internet in your room using cables supplied...of course you do need your own laptop. The hotel is located in Greenwich Village which is a funky / retro area to explore.  We stayed in a deluxe double room however I would suggest to get a queen deluxe double room. The double room was smaller then most average European hotel rooms however we still really enjoyed our stay AND we had 4 large suitcases!  I booked this hotel via their website (which I found to be the best deal at the time when I booked in June…

title: fairly priced, good location in the Villiage
review: We stayed  here for 6 nights in Sept. The check in staff asked us to wait 20mins when we arrived  "because you are staying a longer period I'd like you to have a nice room". We were allocated a room overlooking Washington Square park at the front of the hotel. The room was a Deluxe and I would recommend this as the room seemed quite big especially for NYC. It had a smallish bathroom but it was OK. The only thing I will say is I am not a big fan of the pinkish colour of the rooms but I am not too serious about it as a fault! The rate includes a breakfast consisting of juice, fruit, muffins and tea/coffee in the attractive cafe downstairs. The breakfast is served by staff. I thought this was a particular value of staying here as unless you are a big eater, it was enough to keep me…

title: A Pleasant Stay
review: Very friendly place makes all the difference. Clean, older hotel with enough charm to see it through.

title: Fantastic hotel, highly recommended
review: The Washington Square Hotel is a pleasant departure from the overpriced midtown hotels. Get a deluxe room in the annex and you will be more than happy with your experience. Little amenities like bath robes, night lights, iron, hair dryer and full size umbrella just to name a few. Top that off with a more than adequate free continental breakfast and a quiet Village location and you have a very pleasant stay in NYC.

title: Very nice hotel......
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Washington Square great stay
review: Enjoyed my stay at this hotel which was in a great location.  The room size was small but very clean and quiet. The bathroom was also very clean, updated, and maximized the usage of space.  My only negative with the room was with the pillows, which were not very comfortable.  However, the bedding and linens were quite comfortable.  We also enjoyed dessert in the restaurant which was superb and enjoyed the continental breakfast in the morning. I found the hotel staff to be very accomodating and friendly. I would definately recommend this hotel to family and friends.

title: Great price, great location, friendly staff
review: We stayed at the Washington Square for two nights.  The employees were friendly and helpful as soon as we arrived.  The room was clean and nicely decorated.  We only had 1 issue - the air conditioner would not come on and the temp in the room was a little humid on one day of our stay.  Location is great - in the heart of Greenwhich Village and 1 block from a subway station.

title: Amazing Hotel
review: I just finished my second stay at the Wash. Square Hotel and it was great, once again. Yes, the rooms are small, but that's NYC. However, the rooms are clean, well-styled, and the beds are comfortable. Secondly, the price and location are hard to beat. I stayed for three nights for $205 a night, before tax, in a lovely and easily accessible part of the city where I felt safe wandering around late at night discovering new places. Thirdly, the staff is wonderful, as they are all helpful and welcoming. I can't comment on the continental breakfast that they serve because I didn't eat there in the morning due to my work schedule. Sure, it's fun to find new places in which to stay in NYC, but I like this hotel and would be happy to stay there again.

title: Very Nice Hotel
review: We were slightly worried about staying at this hotel as some of the reviews are not all that great however this hotel is amazing!   Okay, the rooms are tiny, the hallways are tiny but the beds are so good and the view from our room was great (Empire State Building). The hotel is really close to everything in New York City and most places are only a $6 cab fare (we walked most places).   The doorman was fantastic as was the North Square food (Breakfast was average but the dinners are to die for - we ate there 4 nights out of 7).  Would stay here again and recommend to anyone.

title: Wonderful Washington Square
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Nothing special
review: We were so lucky with this hotel, the location was fantastic, five minutes from Greenwich Village, two minutes from subway, two minutes from 5th Ave, we absolutely loved the location, if was a wonderful retreat after a hard days shopping/sightseeing to wander through the park and chill out.  We stayed in a third floor annexe deluxe room which was more than ample. queen size bed, small bath, powerful shower, more than sufficient towels which is unuusal in hotels, and it was peaceful and after walking uptown where a lot of the other hotels are absolutely amazed at how quiet the hotel was.  The desk staff were really friendly and one guy even printed us off some bars to visit and cinema times.  For what we wanted ie a room to get some kip and a bit of rest between sightseeing and…

title: Little problem in the Big Apple
review: Location is convenient if you want to stay in the West Village, but other than the decent location the hotel really isn't that great.  Rooms are pretty small (but that's to be expected in most Manhattan hotels) and had a 2 star hotel type of vibe goin' on.  $250 doesn't get you much in Manhattan unfortunately.

title: Great location, nice upgraded rooms
review: My husband and I stayed at the Washington Square Hotel for three days during the hottest days of 2006, but the hotel was cool and comfortable in every way. The front desk clerks were AWESOME (and we dealt with them at many different times of day and night); the maids were very friendly and helpful; the bellmen helped us with our bags, getting a taxi, and finding shops and clubs nearby; the staff in the restaurant at breakfast were very professional and took our order quickly, in spite of the fact that the restaurant was full.  The bar downstairs was closed for renovations (a fact that almost caused us to go to a different hotel), but the lobby bar is lovely and there were still loads of places to go in the neighborhood.  The hotel atmosphere, in the heart of Greenwich Village, …

title: Cute doesn't count!
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Delightful little place, great location
review: So called deluxe queen room was tiny with closet space for a mouse (a large mouse, anyway) and a toilet that flooded the bathroom when I wasn't looking.  Charming otherwise and nice staff, but not enough to overcome the rest or justify $220/nite.

title: A Perfect Gem
review: Just checked out of WSH.  What a great place.  I had one of the deluxe rooms on the ninth floor.  It was very small but the double bed was extremely comfortable and the room was newly rennovated and very well appointed. Being in NYC I wasn't expecting spacious accomodation.  My only complaint about the room was that I had a view of a brick wall.  But since I was hardly in the room except for sleeping it really wasn't that big of a deal.   Location, Location, Location.  This hotel is in one of my favourite places in NYC.  Located in the heart of Greenich Village on Washtington Square Park, you are close to all the action and many subways.  There are great bars and resturants in the area and dinner at the hotel is excellent as well.  Continental breakfast is included in the rate…

title: Washington Square Deal!
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: A very good choice
review: As a visiting Brit I've stayed in far too many hotels in Manhattan - from the midtown big ones, to the Chelsea, The Paramount and many more. For value for money, location and quite generous size rooms - get one of the recently renovated ones - this is a great place. Friendly staff, great comp breakfasts and spot bang between Soho, The Village and Broadway all at the bottom of 5th. If you are visiting mainly for tourist spots or the uptown galleries I'd stay midtown and save on the cabs, otherwise if you want to get away from the tourist traps and hang out with the locals this is a great area and hotel. Oh and it's a REALLY good price as well.

title: Very disappointed
review: Washington Square Hotel is very well situated in Greenwich Village.  There is alot of "ambiance" without the "crowdyness" of Time Square.  Around the hotel, there is the beautiful park and many little shops and restaurants. At the hotel, peoples at the front desk are very nice and helpful.  You feel in security because there is always a doorman.  The rooms are small but that is what we expected.  Small is ok because we dont stay in the room when we visit New York.  The room are very clean and the bed are comfortable and I think that is the most important.  If there is a place they could upgrade, it is for the continental breakfast...  it is poor.  We got a fruit salad, some bagels and muffin with jam.  You can have cheese for your bagel but they don't offer it, we had to ask for…

title: Perfect little bolthole
review: We stayed at this hotel because of its location - near my daughter's dorm.  The room was not what I booked (I booked a deluxe).  It was tiny, no chair, and the bed was small as well.  Also, our window looked out on an airshaft which only added to the claustrophobic feeling.  The t.v. didn't function properly. The shower curtain was inadequate.  Worse than all this, the staff was not helpful and bordering on rude.  When we were trying to check in (with an online confirmation) they had to process it somehow and kept telling us to sit down.  We would have, but all of the seating in the lobby was occupied.  When we were snowed in and needed an extra night's stay we were told they would call us back in 10 minutes (and they didn't).  The heat in the room could not be regulated except…

title: Just book the right class of room
review: First of all, the rooms are really quite small and don't have a lot of storage space. Every guidebook, hotel website, review etc, mentions this. So don't have unreasonable expectations. Who wants to spend all their time in their room anyway? This is a wonderful little hotel. It has real character. The location, right off Washington Square in the heart of Greenwich Village is perfect. You are less than 2 minutes from the subway. One of the best Italian restaurants in New York is opposite, and the food in the hotel restaurant itself is excellent. The free breakfast is more than adequate for most people - juice, tea or coffee, muffins, bagels and fresh fruit. The beds are extremely comfortable (I stayed in a deluxe room so can't vouch for 'superior' rooms) and the bathroom, though…

title: it was ok for the price
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Tried to steal money from my credit card
review: 2 nights over new years eve weekend...third floor.  the window would not fully close, so lots of fresh air.  bathroom looked like it was brand new but the shower curtain was a pain -need curved curtain rod or shower door.   room small, no chair! little room for storage...bed was very comfortable.  hallways need to be redone, very tired.  the exercise room is a joke.  continental breakfast is included- juice, coffee, fruit, mini muffins and bagel halves.  good location as others have said.  if you are visiting your kid at nyu i would say stay here.  if not, you can probably do a lot better for a bit more money.

title: Great location, lots of character!!
review: ok, this hotel was not the greatest thing i have ever seen and was a bit overpriced, but it was comfy enough, and in a great location. i payed by credit card for the first night, as we didnt know how long we were staying but we ended up staying four, and paying each day for the room instead of in a lump sum at the end of the stay (we paid around £80 a night)- i suppose this meant they had plenty of opportunities to make a copy of my card numbers. when i got back to the uk i had an urgent letter from my bank telling me that that money had attempted to be taken from my card on 3 occasions (amounting to about £1000) and giving the exact LOCAL time of the attempts- all of them being around 3 or 4 in the morning. for some reason, barclays had been able to spot that there was some…

title: Very Nice Hotel
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Awful
review: Stayed here for one night, first weekend of December. This hotel sits right at the NE corner of Washinhgton Square Park, just about at the NYU campus.  The hotel is an older boutique style hotel with much character and charm.  We booked months in advance for $210 a night, Christmas season. After reading previous reviews, I realized some of the rooms had been renovated, so I made sure I was getting a renovated room. The room was small, but very nice and comfortable, new wallpaper, furnishings, bathroom, etc.  No view, but that was fine.  This room is fine for 2 people.  I can only speak for the renovated room, the lobby and the lounge.  The lobby was also very nice, and neatly decorated. The lounge at the lobby level was small, but warm and cozy and fine to have a quick drink in.…

title: Location, Location - stop moaning people!
review: My husband and I had only one request when we booked a room here. We wanted a quiet room. We were given a room on the ground floor, which I was reluctant to accept, but the staff member insisted it would be quiet. I did not sleep at all throughout the night. The walls were paper-thin and there was a very, very loud party going on all night. Once the party settled down at around sunrise, I was then kept up by morning street noises. I packed up and left at 6:30 am because I could not take it any longer. It was miserable. Also, the quality of the room was not much better than "flophouse." The mattress had a plastic feel, the carpet was ancient and institutional looking, the towels felt like cardboard, and there was not one pleasant or comfortable touch in the whole room.

title: Horrible hotel, horrible staff
review: I stayed in the washington Square hotel for 7 nights. I was never disturbed by noise and the room was always clean. The rooms here are small but every travel guide and website tells you to expect this - you don't go to NY to sit in your room. The bathroom too is adequate. I personally prefer the fact that this hotel does not have doormen, bell hops etc as if i wanted all of that I would stay at a luxury hotel that costs a lot more and this hotel never claims to be that. It isn't 'dated' it is a period building.  The location is simply perfect - two subways covering 4 different lines just a block away and easy walking distance to Soho, east Village etc - all in all a great stay!

title: Nice little hotel
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Great location, great value!
review: This is a really nice hotel in a great location.  It's a short subway ride to battery park or central park, and it is right across the street from the exxtremely family-friendly Washington Square park. We stayed at this hotel with our two children (age 3 and 5) and having a park across the street wtih pleasant, accessible playgrounds was a real plus.  We also splurged on the newly rennovated rooms, and that was money well spent.  We were in New York with several of our family members, and the unrennovated rooms were adquate, but nothing special.  Also, we had a corner room--it was spatious.  My sister's family had a much smaller room, and the four of them were quite cramped.  The hotel has character--winding hallways, a slow old elevator.  The staff was wonderful. Very…

title: Great Location
review: I've stayed in all kinds of whacky hotels in NYC over the past twenty years of visits, always trying to keep below $200/night, and the WS hits the mark for location and value.   Beside my most recent visit I originally tried the hotel in 2003.  At that time the experience was marred only by the lack of non-smoking rooms--which they have since changed.  This hotel is very popular with European visitors.  Yes, the connecting hallways and stairs have that typical New York rat-warren quality--narrow passages with weird level changes, strange doors and unpleasant smells.  But the rooms are fine.  This time I had a standard "single" (twin bed), which was about the size of a small bedroom in my house, with a bathroom attached.  On my previous visit I had a queen room which was quite…

title: Fabulous find!
review: Stayed for four night.  We also stayed 2 nites at The Essex and 2 nites at Hotel QT to experience different areas.  If you need a room for other than sleep, the WSH may not work for you as the rooms are quite small.  If you want to be in the middle of action and close to subway stops, then you have found the right hotel.  I love the history, and if you read the list of celebritys who have found their way to this hotel--you will feel like you are part of an elite club!  I would stay again without a second's hesitation.  BTW--the other two hotels did not have that much more space than WSH.

title: Great deal and great location
review: We stayed 11 nights at this hotel and loved it. Although the rooms are really small, they are clean & well presented. The staff at the hotel were always on hand to answer any questions and very friendly.  Basic breakfast included which is handy. The location was wonderful, right in the heart of The Village. Highly recommend and would definitely stay there again.

title: Great
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born. Famous for its bohemian past, head to Washington Square Park to get a feel for this diverse and energetic neighborhood. You’ll find NYU students, street performers, skateboarders, kids frolicking in the fountain, and locals relaxing and playing chess. Stroll the streets to discover a mix of majestic town homes and hidden bars and restaurants that give this neighborhood an old-school residential feel. When the sun goes down, check out one of the famous jazz or comedy clubs that still packs them in every night.

title: Great hotel right in the heart of Greenwich
review: For the price, location, service and room...brilliant value. Stayed at 3 different hotels during my visit to New York (the Trump ...expensive, and the Larchmont ...budget) This was our mid price hotel and my boyfriends fave! Lovely room with decent size bathroom (nicer than Trump!) and really helpful friendly staff. No room service which would have been nice, and I didnt get to try the massage ...but the lobby is really nice and we had a renovated room with queen bed. Tv was a bit high on the wall but not really a problem as we were out all the time exploring the great location/!  would definately stay again.

title: Location, location, location
review: This hotel is great for it's location only a short walk to Bleeker St and all the roads running off it for brilliant restaurants. Some of the rooms can be small - it better to pay the extra and go for the 'Deluxe' rooms and if possible ask for a corner room - or one facing the street. We had an internal room last time which was very quiet but also small and dark. But when your in New York it's not really about how much time you spend in your hotel room. The beds are comfy and have crisp white sheets. The breakfast is also very good value. I've returned to this hotel twice - it is really all about location but the accomodation is worth the money too!

title: Best locaton in NYC!!!!!
review: Commonly known as “the Village” to New Yorkers, it was here in Greenwich Village that both 1960’s counter culture and the LGBT movement were born.
